Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but traffic was horrible.”
Reviews.Author: jett137
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, service was good but getting to this hotel by car is a total nightmare due to streets closed off and ongoing construction for World Trade Center site. Overlooks the site so it is interesting but driving car to this hotel was so bad that I would never do it again. And I am a NYC native who learned to drive in mid-town Manhattan. Room was nice but nothing special. Clean as can be and front desk was accommodating when asked for late check out. Parking the car was $55 per 24 hour period which is standard for lower Manhattan. Great location to walk to South Street Seaport and very nice restaurants and pubs. Continental breakfast was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip needs!”
Reviews.Author: 4EddyB
Reviews.Content: I had 9 other fire fighters with me to see the 9/11 site. We used the valet service, gym, pool, and business center during our stay. I stayed in the Jr. suite with two others and it was perfect. I would recommend if your activities are within walking distance to take the T to the hotel to avoid the valet charge.

Reviews.Title: “nice location if you have business in the local area”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Even with the traffic and tourists circling the Ground Zero construction site, this is a good location if you have business meetings on the west side of Wall St or anywhere around the World Trade financial area. Many of the floors have been recently renovated, so the hotel is clean and nice overall. Note that there really is not a lot around the hotel - at least not as much as you would find farther north upwards into midtown. That said, the hotel is connected via a subway entrance only a half block away. Definitely a great place to stay in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: ishamble
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited New York March 30th weekend. The service we received from staff was great!! They attended to our needs attentively. I was surprised that the room we had on the 48th floor wasnt anything spectacular. The view however of the bridge was nice. If I had to stay there again - I would!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Manahattan Millenium”
Reviews.Author: gmmmgp9
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and very friendly staff- Modern and clean and big room for Manhattan. Hotel is convenient to downtown, and easy subway access. Lots of construction of the new buildings at the World Trade site did make getting around a bit tricky, and the first night we were lulled to sleep by the sound of jackhammers- but not too bad. My only complaint is lack of free WiFi anywhere in the hotel. I mean really? You have to go the attached Starbucks for the WiFi. Seems silly at this point in time- particularly since half of the city has free zones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelertwo
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Millenium Hilton - second time there. Amazing view, sparkling clean room of generous size, lovely pool, location convenient to public transportation of all sorts. The only negative is that the restaurant at the hotel was somewhat overpriced, and there are no other restaurants in the immediate viscinity - at least not in the evening. Other than that, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: spindoc
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire and decided to pay less and stay downtown instead. On arrival it is next to ground zero and is close to a few subway stops, so excellent in terms of getting around the city by subway. The lobby was small and the welcome was quite abrupt. Being a Hilton Gold card member, the Hilton hotels tend to be very welcoming. Not here. No there is no executive lounge, no they couldn't give me an upgrade to my room and no mention of breakfast. They really didn't care about their own loyalty program. The room was of a good size and reasonably decorated. One of the phones in the room didn't work and seemed like the handset was broken. The toilet was more reminiscent of the 80s. The concierge was friendly when he was available, but after 7pm, there was no trace of him again. So you were left to fend for yourself. It was a shame as I was looking forward to staying at this hotel, but they weren't keen on affording any courtesies to anyone who came in on the cheap. More a case of get them in and get them out.

Reviews.Title: “Largest rooms in New York!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: With the subway system out the front door this is a great hotel and a must stay. Embrace the subway you will love new York! Beds are perfect, windows from top to bottom and full wall looking out on the world trade center it's amazing and a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...surprising view from higher floors”
Reviews.Author: Revfan
Reviews.Content: During my recent business trip to NYC I wasn't able to get a discounted room at my usual hotel and opted to stay at the Millennium since the people organizing the meeting had reserved a block of rooms. The rate was reasonable and the hotel couldn't have been more convenient for a meeting in Lower Manhattan. There's an A-C-E Metro stop right outside, so taking the Metro from Penn Station after our Acela ride was a piece of cake. My husband accompanied me and the room was a decent size for a mid priced Manhattan hotel. Plenty of room for two people. It was clean and the bed and bedding werwe comfortable. We had some problems with the heat/AC unit so the temp was a bit hard to control, but it wasn't a huge issue. The room phone in the bedroom did not work, but the one in the bathroom did. This was only a slight problem when I had to go to the front desk to request a late checkout (which the front desk immediately obliged with no difficulty) vs. calling down there. When my husband opened the curtain to look out the window, he was a bit shocked, never having seen the WTC site up close. A bit disturbing at first to think about what happened right outside the door, we had a bird's eye view of the beehive of activity down there as they work to re-create the area. Construction noise was not a problem at all. Despite the small issues, this was a great place to stay, and getting around was extremely easy. There are plenty of places to find meals or a beverage or something to do or see. My husband even rented a bike and had a nice ride on the Hudson while I was at my meeting. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed with stunning views...”
Reviews.Author: SED916
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at this hotel and found the room to be extremely comfortable. We found check-in to be quick and easy and the location is great for downtown/financial district, but if you want the more touristy areas (ie. Times Square/Uptown) i would maybe consider another hotel. We required this location and when we wanted to go Uptown we had no problem getting a cab with help from the hotel doormen. The views are really the selling point here, with stunning views of Ground Zero (now called 9/11 Memorial Site) you find yourself just watching the workman and being amazed at the scale of the project. I am a very light sleeper, yet the construction noise didn't bother me at all and we were on the 20th floor. Lots of drawer space but quite a small wardrobe, while the bathroom was clean and a good size with really nice toiletries. We didn't use either the bar or restaurant during our stay but found a great bakery across the street for a fresh, cheap breakfast. Would love to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mancini22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a trip to the states. While in New York we stayed at the Millenium Hilton and loved it. Our room overlooked the WTC site and the view in every direction was awesome. The staff were friendly, the hotel and rooms were clean and everything was convenient considering we are from Australia and had no car. We walked just about everywhere including Wall street to see the bull, Batery Park to catch the ferry to Liberty Island, Times Square and of course the 911 Memorial and visitor centre. When we go back to NY we will stay at the Millenium again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Not Up To Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: SKim323
Reviews.Content: I am by no means an expert in Hilton Hotels. I have stayed at 3 in 3 different states. However, I do travel extensively and would consider myself somewhat experienced when it comes to hotels. The reasons I can't give the Millenium Hilton higher marks are as follows: Front Desk Staff: This was the one highlight I had. The staff at the front desk and the supporting staff were great. Very friendly and they had my requests on record and happily fulfilled them. Pool and Gym: a rare find in this city, the pool and gym are great by all standards. If this is important then you can't go with this hotel. Rooms: The room was clean but felt "dark". You can't expect any hotel to have rooms of any great size so I wouldn't take points off for that. Concierge Lounge: as a frequent traveler, I depend greatly on the concierge lounge. This hotel doesn't have one! To me this is a huge deal breaker. Restaurants: The restaurant was good. The staff is very friendly and helpful. However, the "bar" is right by the elevators. I was traveling with my family and I didn't really care for the atmosphere for my kids. Location: Great. I can't say much about that. Overall: If I was traveling alone I may have given it an extra point but I was with my family. I did not want to stay there with my kids. Hilton hotels and staff are great but the layout of the entrance didn't make it very kid friendly. There is nothing I enjoy more than to relax in the concierge lounge of a hotel after a long day of work but this hotel doesn't have one. It is truly a shame.

Reviews.Title: “My downtown New York home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RoseTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel on business trips for almost 20 years now. Let's say we have the pre and post 9/11 NY (and world) and this is clearly reflected at this hotel. So just ask for a room facing the back if you want to avoid the ground zero contruction noise and you will be fine. Beautiful view if you get a window towards Brooklyn bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ciderjack25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Millennium this past weekend for a night out in the city. We did not stay in the hotel very much but enjoyed the time we were there. The hotel is in a great location. We drove to a parking deck in NJ near the PATH train and took the train in from there. I say this because if you are a Jersey person the train station at Harrison on the PATH line has a great safe parking deck that will cost you $11 for 12 hour instead of the $60 the hotel charges. The hotel is a quick walk from the PATH station and a ton of subway lines. We saw a play had dinner, hung out at a few bars in the village and had a wonderful bed a few minutes away in the Hilton. The view was amazing. We were right above the eastern edge of the World Trade Center site. I was worried that there would be noise from construction but there was nothing but that great view of the site, memorial and NYC skyline. We stayed on a Saturday in mid march, reserved on the Hilton website and paid a $189 AAA rate. With tax it came to about 220. The room was pretty small but the bed was so very comfortable. No complaints what so ever. We were given the option to pay $20 more when we reserved for a room away from the WTC site. I was tempted but glad I didn't. As I said there was no noise and I would have missed the view.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views”
Reviews.Author: VIAboytes
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, while it is a cruel reminder of 9/11 it is great to see this hotel open again! It is convenient to everything Wall Street!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, modern hotel, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: iluvztravel
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed at this Hilton on a business trip. The location is close to shopping, and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. We didn't try the hotel restaurant, but the lobby bar was fine. The rooms were modern, clean and spacious, the bed was very comfortable, and there was a flat screen television. The desk had an ergonomic chair, which I appreciated. The only thing missing (sigh) was a comfortable arm chair for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Normal luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: leadpntchp
Reviews.Content: The Good: Nice location, close to work. Walking distance of a lot (I'm from Syr, kinda like LA - no one walks). View of WTC awesome. Room clean, nice lobby. Food a bit expensive but still reasonable and very good. Indoor pool nice, fitness room a true fitness room. The Bad: One of the smallest rooms I've ever been in. HDTV without HDTV channels. No free wi-fi/internet (same with most luxury hotels). Continental Breakfast, drinks very expensive. The Ugly: Room itself way too expensive for me (Business trip) for limited amenities. Could not program the thermostat whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Essaghir
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times. Let me tell you I am in hospitality business, and this hotel hits all the standards from the first to the last impression. I always enjoy my stay there where it’s for business or leisure. Excellent Service at the reception, excellent service during dinner and breakfast, and excellent concierge. Without even mentioning the view from the rooms, this hotel is the best in NYC I WILL BE BACK :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect visit with 4 teenagers for St Patricks day weekend.”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: I wanted go treat my children and their friend for a weekend visit to the city for Saint Patricks day but knew that I in no way wanted to be surrounded by all of the drunks at night that were also celebrating the weekend which is why I chose this hotel for our stay. During the day the area is vibrant, alive and bustling with energy, in the evening, it was peaceful and quiet, which after reading other reviewers comments, I was surprised to find. We could not hear any construction noises in either the suite or the regular room that we booked. Another reason for my booking was the indoor pool which was a delight for my children, as well as the close proximity to the 9/11 memorial, which we visited. But back to the pool. It was a delight. My children and their friend got a kick out of being able to swim in NYC while also being able to view the city buildings and the pool was a perfect temperature. The gentleman they had on hand was courteous, always with a smile and very helpful but never intruding, which I appreciated. I was traveling with another adult who had been one of the firefighters during 9/11 on the scene and I was worried that it might be too much for him to take in, while this was his first visit back to the site since 9/11 but he too found the surroundings of the hotel to be serene and peaceful. The location is perfect if you are also wanting to have quick access to uptown, as the R train is only steps outside of the main entrance. The hotel staff was friendly, and while you knew they were there to help, they were never overly in your face, which I truly appreciated for this trip. If you are looking for a good value in the city, while being able to stay away from all the hustle and bustle of the city in the city I would recommend this hotel. Although I will state that while I did have one suite and one regular room, the regular room felt more roomy than the suite, but I did appreciate having the sitting area while the girls were busy in the bathroom applying make up or chatting in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: bobsmith3849
Reviews.Content: Generally fine - a little expensive as the rooms are a little tired, but service what you expect from hilton - spoke to concierge a number of times, very helpful. Front desk fine, nice reception and good facilities, including pool. We were in a Junior suite, which was well kept and had a great view. My biggest complaint is wifi. it is quite ridiculous to charge guest who pay £££ per night £15 per day for wifi, when i can go to starbucks and spend $2 on a coffee and get it free.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room, interesting views, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Incurable_Romantic
Reviews.Content: Had a recent weekend visit to the Millenium Hilton, which is directly across the street from the 9/11 site and memorial. Convenient to Wall Street and to ferries to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, etc. The hotel was there on 9/11/01 and has of course been refurbished and modernized, and is generally fairly well-appointed. It is by no means a 5-star hotel, but the room and bed are comfortable. Our primary complaint is that contrary to our experience at other Hiltons, the service was surprisingly poor. For example, when we returned tired from a Broadway show on Saturday night just after 11:00 pm, we were told at the front desk that the hotel restaurant had closed but that room service was available until midnight. We decided that rather than head out to dinner, we'd opt for room service, returned to our room, and ordered. We were told that contrary to the menu in the room and the menu on the TV, every single item we requested (2 meals, 2 appetizers, and a bottle of wine) were not available. We were told that only a very limited menu was available after 11:00, again contrary to the menu and front desk. We ordered a few mediocre items from the very limited list we were verbally offered; we were charged over $90 for what should have cost $40 or so. We called to complain to the night manager, who did return the call but offered no apology or explanation, except to say that there is NOT a limited menu after 11:00--contrary to what we had just been told by her staff. We were not comped or offered any accommodation. We would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Susan14587
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 Nights in December 2010 with my fiance and was very impresssed. The hotel is very modern and our room was lovely, clean and spacious and very comfortable. We were overlooking ground zero and on a high floor, we didn't experience any noise, perhaps because we were up so high. We found all of the staff to be pleasant and accomodating. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel but the bar looked nice. While a lot of people stay in Midtown we liked the location of this hotel and would certainly return. There was plenty of reasonably priced delis in the area as well as some nice bars and also Century 21 Department Store attached. There were also a few subway stations within walking distance and the subway was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Wall Street location”
Reviews.Author: wi_light_sleepers
Reviews.Content: I was in NY for a very brief business trip. I got in late, but had a great quiet room to relax in. Very close to my meeting. Staff very friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but impossible to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: I know, I know, I should have know it better... since my last stay at the Millenium not much changed. The level of noise due to the WTC construction site is the same, has just changed in the `tone`- last time it was the 24h/7d drilling and hammering , now it is the 24h/7d all type of noise. Dont get me wrong, the location is superb and the view on the WTC construction site priceless, but it comes at a price that there is no way of thinking of having a good night sleep, specially if you get one of the front facing rooms. I tried it again, hoped that the level of noise got acceptable, this is not the case. Not going back until the whole construction site is done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and such a lovely, comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: Mamahippy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a particularly harrowing business meeting and the night before another one. It was an oasis. The room is just so lovely, and I love having the view of the World Trade Center construction site - gives me hope! The bed is really comfortable (as is the armchair). A nice large flat screen TV! And the bathroom and toiletries were very refreshing. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nassau City, New Providence, The Bahamas
Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: Derek R
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I booked this hotel because it was very reasonably priced (by New York standards) and because it was in a good location. I was blown away by the quality of the services and the quality of the accommodations. The room was spectacular. The Guest Service Attendant who checked me in (Arturo I think--I hope I got that right) was, in a word, outstanding. When I checked in the room wasn't quite ready so he recommended I leave my bags with the bellman while I trot out to the Century 21 next door to do a bit of shopping. When I returned, the room was ready, the keys were handed to me, and he sent me up the room (on the 42nd floor). Three minutes later the luggage followed. The room had views from heaven. Just beautiful. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was pretty nice. The toiletries were a brand that I had never seen before, but they were wonderful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was A 5*.... Is Now A 3* (Hope they turn it around soon)”
Reviews.Author: kpatrickryan
Reviews.Content: Have visited before (last time was Sept. 2006) and loved the hotel @ that time. This time? Room is aging, wasn't as clean as it should be. Room service just so-so. Worst of all is that the staff is not as friendly and helpful. There were a couple minor technical problems but those can happen anywhere and aren't worth mentioning. I hope improvements are made, as this property is in a terrific location and deserves to be top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend in New York!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent our one year anniversary at the Millenium Hilton and I must say I was amazed by the kindness and friendliness of the Front Office staff!!!! We received a very nice upgrade to a beautiful corner room on the 32nd floor, with just an amazing view of the World Trade Center and New York City. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The check-in and check-out was no problem, the room was clean and in good condition. The location is just perfect, the subway station is right in front of the hotel. We had dinner very close by the hotel, which was a bit expensive but very good. You can find everything that you need right around the corner. In overal, we both had an amazing weekend in New York City and the price to value ratio for this type of room and location was amazing. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Marion C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on an impromptu trip to New York. My son and I had been a few weeks earlier (and stayed at another hotel) but we enjoyed the city so much that my husband and I decided to go. Millenium Hilton was a wonderful surprise. The room was stupendous, with breathtaking views of both rivers. The staff was incrediblem with such an eye for detail. I love this place. The price we got online was very reasonable for such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 diamond?”
Reviews.Author: frogbog
Reviews.Content: My stay last night at this property was disappointing. I've stayed here several times and I agreed with the hotels 4 diamond designation however not this time. The room was not particularly clean, the heating system was broken, and I realized as I was getting in the shower that there was no shampoo. Bottom line is this property is a solid 3 diamond but calling it a 4 diamond is s stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but nickels and dimes”
Reviews.Author: GoodLifeinCary
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nicely appointed and comfortable hotel in the Financial District. As other reviewers have noted, it oversees Ground Zero and the WTC memorial. But compared to other Hilton properties in NYC, including less expensive brands, it is only average. Virtually all of my travel is for work, so I don't worry too much about room rates, or other sundry expenses associated with my travel. However, Hilton has always found it is sound business policy to charge for internet access at its more expensive properties. I've never quite understood it, and this hotel is no exception. While the cost for access is a pittance compared to the room rate, it is what I consider to be nickel and diming the business traveler. I do have a choice of hotels when I travel so little things like this wind up influencing my decision as to where to stay. For my part, I did ask to have the internet connection fee waived, but the manager said no. That seems like a pennywise and pound-foolish decision, but that's life. I'm quite certain that Hilton does not care about an individual traveler's view, rather it is concerned about views of all travelers at the macro level. I do have three more trips booked in March and none are at Hilton properties, but that is merely coincidence. Moving forward I'll avoid Hilton intentionally.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe wait til the Freedom Tower is finished before staying for pleasure?”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing location right next door to Ground Zero and if you are in to construction then you could watch this all day and all night! But noisy, as you'd expect, and quite a way away from Times Square. Quite small in terms of lobby / bar and lots of suits from the financial district. More of a business than tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hilton Hotel that does not perform- was fabulous now don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Raffiella11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three times many years ago when it was brilliant. Everyone very friendly, professional and helpful. Breakfast extremely good - good choice, efficient waiers, used to call in for lunch for calamari's and australian charndonnay - great. On our recent visit the hilton had totally changed. Now the reception staff very cold/not welcoming. The suite was dull/dated/depressing, bed hard, but good pillows, wrong layout of the suite, too hot could not sleep. Only redeeming feature was the fabulous view looking down on the World Trade Centre site. Sitting watching the rebuilding of this site fascinating - 3000 men working 24 hours a day. Fabulous at night as the site is eluminated, never draw the curtains. Bathroom also dull and depressing, bath made for midgets too low, naff freebies. The breakfast extremely sparse, lacked imagination and choice, the fruit juices very watery, no flavour. Hot dishes weird choice of small sausages, scambled eggs and disgusting looking over cooked bacon - they had a strange thing of taking hot dishes away for a while. The waiters are old, worn out, not interested and not professional, everything too much trouble, takes ages for coffee/fruit juice to appear. If you do not sit where they tell you, they will then ignore you until the manager appears and not at all interested in looking after guests. The downstairs bar at the side of reception had great staff very professional, attentive and service brilliant. Why can't they be this effecient for breakfast They have two Conceirge guys, one is brilliant, very calm, the other is totally stressed out of his brains all day. Glad to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Base”
Reviews.Author: Jaatmaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Memorial Day weekend. Corner Jr. Suite on 38th floor. Great view!! Great Location! Not far from Battery Park & Train/Subway stations. Ground Zero is just across the street. Didn't try the food, but the bar was excellent. Be careful with the mini-bar. If you move the stuff around in the frig, it tells the front desk you used it. We called and they were happy to adjust our bill. We are HH members so our internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: GoodFood88
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Millenium a lot a few years ago. It is right on the A-C-E lines and was easy to get around to the meetings I needed to do in Lower Manhattan and Brooklyn.The staff has always been helpful and cheerful and the hotel has always been clean and pleasant to stay in. This trip the staff was not as cheerful, nor as helpful. This is aimed soley at a couple of the doormen who I had to open and hold the door for (they were not moving carts or had their hands full, they just stood waiting for me to get the door for them). Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay, as always. I knocked a star off the review because it is fairly difficult to get around the hotel with the construction, which will continue for a long time. The best rooms in the place, for me, are the Junior Suites. I think the ones facing the city (uptown) are the best. If you get a high one, you get a better view. The view down to the WTC site is sobering, and the view uptown is exciting. I have had regular rooms, which are ok and even one bigger suite with a full living room, but I still prefer the Junior Suite the best. if you are not running back and forth to midtown or beyond, the Millenium is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a business stay.”
Reviews.Author: EMG311
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located for my business needs but I would not necessarily suggest it to a tourist. There are better options in the neighborhood for those visiting NYC. The rooms are quite narrow, but long, and the Jr. Suite has a small but separate living space so there is some room to spread out. Beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. The business center is convenient and easy to use (with someone there to help) and the restaurant is pretty good as well. Location cant be beat for the subway, Century 21, Wall Street and all downtown attractions. If I were not on a business budget, I would say this was overpriced for what you get (300+ per night, no internet or meals.) Overall a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Keith L
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was nice, it is NOT worth what they ask for. The beds were not as comfortable as they claim, They charge for items you did not use, such as $7 bottles of water! Yes SEVEN dollars!!! They do not even offer free internet for your $200 a night! Don't stay here... IT'S JUST NOT WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay quite average”
Reviews.Author: Siena5687
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice spot, i have a very nice view, but the furniture is falling apart. The bathroom mirrors have cracks in them and are broken off in places, also the beds are not comfy and the couches are falling apart. Also the hotel was completly covered in mirrors from floor to wall, and not to mention the pool was very cold about 70 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view and the bed”
Reviews.Author: Missrach91
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing special but the the staff was very helpfull. the view of the new freedom tower and grown zero was eye opening. the bed was like sleeping on a cloud which was brill after a long day of shopping and sight seeing. The area was quite on a night except for a bit of construction noise. Great location will stay there agen

Reviews.Title: “Your credit info will be stolen”
Reviews.Author: Dottie_M55
Reviews.Content: Sent my son here for a stress free weekend only to have his credit info stolen. The view may be great but when the front desk clerk tells you this happens all the time something is wrong. No response back from security or the CEO - guess they don't care. Is the view worth you losing your identity?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nothing special, just average, but view bumps it to four stars”
Reviews.Author: bhoppy
Reviews.Content: Everything was okay, no complaints except my usual (for hotels in this price range) regarding no free wi-fi, but nothing was special, not he rooms, not the food, not the staff that barely seemed to notice you unless you were standing in front of them. But, as noted in other reviews, be sure to ask for a room overlooking the rebuilding of the World Trade Center and this view alone makes the hotel worth it and special.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fabulous site for a weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: burnthill
Reviews.Content: Great deal. Went for oysters down the street at PJ Clark's within minutes of arrival. It was a momentous experience looking out the window of our corner junior suite. Windows on both sides; the new tower in front of our room; the memory pools below. At first I wept. Then we went on to thoroughly enjoy. The room was great! and a very fair deal for the weekend. My only negative comment...the drat elevator noise that awakened me...a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Lobb
Reviews.Content: If I ever return to NYC I would stay here again. The rooms were clean and beds VERY comfy! The toilet freebies were nice too. The hotel staff were very friendly but avoid the restaurant- pricey!!! The location is great too and right next to 9/11 site. Just a word of warning the cranes and building works on the site start up around 6am, and you hear a constant buzz but I was so tired after a day in the city I slept right through it. The subway is nearby and your in the city centre within 15 mins. Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honest O
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Millenium Hilton in December for 5 nights and I cannot praise it enough. My partner has some medical difficulties and the hotel bent over backwards to assist me in making our stay stress free. The room was spotless, the hotel were very friendly and efficient from the moment we arrived. NYC hotels generally are very small but at Millenium Hilton you get so much value for money, the rooms are alot bigger than most hotels. There is a subway station right outside the hotel which takes you directly into Times Square. There is also a little deli across the road from the hotel (behind the church) that do a lovely breakfast. I also left my earrings at the hotel which were very very expensive and when I called the hotel I was told that they had been found along with a pen and a hair clip (thats how thouroughly clean the hotel were!!) and had kept them safe for me.... GREAT SERVICE! I travel alot for business and for leisure and this was one of my favourite trips, i would definatley 100% stay at Millenium Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiccager
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here and both times I had a great experience. So easy to access and the view is unbelievable. The train is just there, next to the main entrance. The noise is not that annoying and the most beautiful thing is the sun hitting the buildings just in front of it and making spectacular colors. Some reports on bedbugs scared me as bugs scare me to death but the room was very clean so, in the end, I let it go and had a great night sleep

Reviews.Title: “Flagship Hilton”
Reviews.Author: David I
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is very good. Fairly large rooms for New York, Probably the best location in the financial district, and a very good staff in my opinion. it's not cheap, but nothing in this area is. I do have two observations that seem strange. first of all, I guess it is just Hilton in general, but this hotel is arguably one of their flagship hotels in North America, and there is NO executive lounge ! I find that odd for a hotel that can routinely cost you $500/nt. The second observation is that they do not sell alcohol in the restaurant on the 3rd floor, only wine. What? I guess that doesnt matter as much since there are great restaurants right around the corner. Hotels are somewhat limited in the financial district, if you don't mind taking a cab, I would recommend staying in mid-town, you have a lot more choices. The noise is going down from the WTC, it actually stops from about midnight to 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Benefits at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Shanu400001
Reviews.Content: The positives far outweigh the negatives. Great location, attractive room rates and a comfortable stay even for lengthy duration makes the overall package a good deal. If you have work in Downtown, this is a good place to stay. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well equipped though can be more spacious. At times mobile connectivity was a problem. Did not face any of the noise issues that I had heard about even though my room was facing Ground Zero construction activity. The staff was cordial and professional, helping whenever asked. However they didn't go out of their way with any small details that go into making a stay memorable. Nor did I find them eager to provide suggestions on anything for a first timer in New York. Maybe it's just me but I expected better hospitality especially since I stayed there for 5 nights so long enough for hotel staff to get familiar.

Reviews.Title: “The view, the view, the view!”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay at this property ever since I saw it for the first time in 2000, but never had an opportunity. If you are traveling for business to lower Manhattan/Wall Street, the location is awesome and close to all the main office buildings. But .. the real story is the view of Ground Zero. I was on the 47th floor and had the best view in town of the reconstruction effort ; the new One World Trade center tower and the memorial fountains. I honestly could have spent all day looking out the window. Some other reviewers mentioned the noise; I suspect they are no longer working 24/7 since I heard no noise at all at night (or even during the day - I assume this was because I was 47 stories up) I found the staff to be very friendly and willing to help! The gym room is small, but well equipped. There are two reasons I am not giving 5 stars to this hotel. The first is the Internet at 15$/day. In this day and age, I find that exaggerated. Secondly, the rooms are starting to show their age. There are not in bad shape at all and was very happy with my room, but I'm thinking a refurb will be needed in 2-4 years at most. There were some items in my bathroom that were showing some age. This was a minor issue though. If back in lower Manhattan, I would stay here again and am happy that this hotel, where I had wanted to stay in for so long met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Get a suite, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite, which was a one-bed room apartment with a corner view on the 30th floor. This was a great hotel, with helpful people if you're a tourist. Nearby there are many good restaurants, and the swimming pool is ok. It has the weirdest Finnish sauna i've ever seen, one where you can't throw water on the stove. That's like a restaurant where it's forbidden to eat! We would happily come back if there's business in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Corner room with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: BO777
Reviews.Content: Nice corner room (junior suite), a magnificent view. Ok breakfast and service. Weekends a good price quality ratio

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location”
Reviews.Author: Masood K
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel . The view of ground zero is just fabulous. There are plenty of rooms with that view so ask for it at the reception . I would expect a wider spread of breakfast for a hotel of this caliber . Friendly staff . Highly recommended to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the city, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: alanadi25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on the 53rd floor at this hotel, as a treat on our 3 month USA holiday. The room and view of the 9/11 memorial was fantastic. The hotel, even for a standard room is quite pricey. So I feel if you have the bucks, it's a nice stay, but there are other places in the city for a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great position”
Reviews.Author: charlie113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011. We stayed two night at Times Square before our cruise to Bermuda and them at this hotel for two night afterwards. The hotel was great, the room overlooked Ground Zero with views of the Hudson river too. The staff were efficient and professional but I can't actually say they were friendly but maybe it is just the 'New York way' as the staff at the other hotel were much the same. It was our first time in New York and we really loved it so we will definitely be back again and I we will probably stay at the Millenium Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Millie0702
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Hilton for two nights beginning 1/20/2012. My sister was there on business and I was there for fun with her! The hotel was clean and the staff was super friendly. Let me say again... "Super" friendly! The two elevators was a little a confusing to me but I only made that mistake once. The room was adequately sized with an over priced mini bar, but aren't they all. The sheets smelled clean and the room was cleaned every day. The staff seemed anxious and excited to help anyway from offering advice, hailing a cab or even find additional creamers in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for business trip & shopping”
Reviews.Author: hotels310
Reviews.Content: Millennium hilton is very nice hotel, strategically located opposite to WTC site and close to most of the business centers. Rooms are very spacious and have a good view of Manhattan skyline. Room has all the amenities you may require for a week business trip. I will highly recommend poeple to go for this value for money accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “The Launching Pad”
Reviews.Author: BosoxKen
Reviews.Content: What I love about this hotel is that it is perfectly located to launch your NYC adventures. Essentially, every subway line you need to see Manhattan is available within a 4 block radius, including the NQRW which is quite literally out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Ideal Location, Large Rooms, Above Subway Station!”
Reviews.Author: GuapoBumsies
Reviews.Content: If you need to be around Wall St. or the Soho, Greenwich Village areas, this hotel is modern, trendy, right next to the subway!! within walking distance of battery park and the south st. pier complex, decent restaurant options around, try to get the highest floor "corner" rooms w/ spectacular views of both east & hudson rivers!! Staff is a little cold but concierge good and hotel modern and updated!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but very thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Stanl5
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at this hotel was good. The staff is extremely friendly, the room clean, and the location was convienent. The only downside is the rooms here have very thin walls. I could hear the guy next door everytime he used the bathroom and everytime he talked on his phone. Which wouldn't have been so bad except he woke me up almost every morning talking loudly on his phone. Also you cannot control the temperature of the room which is always a pet peeve of mine. I tend to like it cooler when I sleep but I couldn't turn the fan on or set the thermostat. It stayed around 71 degrees most nights which is too warm for me. But if stuff like that doesn't bother you then this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Bawa S
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business trip. This is one of the best hilton properties in New York. Room size if good considering the avg new york hotel room size. Very nice views, i was on 52nd floor. Very convenient to Financial District / Brooklyn.

Reviews.Title: “millenium hilton december 2011”
Reviews.Author: jencalew
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my friend to celebrate her 40th birthday and we were not disappointed. This was our second stay in the hotel and we were in a junior suite on the 54th floor (special thanks to the manager). Our suite was clean,spacious and had the comfiest beds we have ever slept in.We left the drapes open the whole time during our 6 day stay not to miss a thing!! We found ALL staff to be friendly,pleasant and most obliging. On our last day Jerry came up to our room to collect our luggage and gave us such an interesting and real account on the atrocities on 9/11. Thanks Jerry-you are a gem! The hotel is ideally situated in the financial district, we like it here as it is less busy than uptown and it seems safer also. The subway is literally outside the hotel and we purchased the 7 day unlimited travel ticket for $29. Total bargain and a great way of traveliing around.the city. We did not eat in the hotel but we had a drink in the bar which was always busy but with a nice atmosphere. We frequented the Stage Door deli which was just outside the hotel and to the right....great food,great service at very good prices.. Try the cheesecake!! Next door to the hotel is a starbucks and across the road is the infamous Century 21 store. A must for bargain hunters!! All in all a fantastic holiday and a fantastic hotel...We will retuirn again!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD SOLID HOTEL, SUITES ARE NOT SUITES THOUGH. ROOM WITH A WALL BED ON ONE SIDE, SMALL COUCH AND DESK ON THE OTHER.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel7765
Reviews.Content: Good hotel stayed during christmas 2011 on the 47th floor, two "suites" one for us one for older kids. Suites are not suites, save your money and book a room there is very little difference. View is amazing! Staff is just doing their job kind of thing, bellmen superb! Our family gave it a SEVEN out of TEN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the favorite hotels in NY”
Reviews.Author: lhooq19
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton a few times over the years and have stayed at other hotels around NYC but I keep going back to this location. The rooms are quite spacious for New York and the views from the corner rooms are amazing! It's right across the street from ground zero and next to Century 21 department store. The subway entrance is practically next to the front door--it's the Cortland street stop on the R line. A few months ago, the stop was closed in the opposite direction (going downtown) but I was pleasantly surprised to see that it's now open in both directions so just another bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clinical, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: AussieinCHC
Reviews.Content: Large group hotel with unfriendly staff. Staff are extremely busy and every guest is just another number. Hotel has a great location however and rates are very competitive. Rooms are are rather small.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: work2travel
Reviews.Content: Having been to NYC before, I wanted to be away from the business of Times Square this time. I must say that I absolutely loved the location. Walking distance to shops (Century 21 is practically right downstairs!) and other spots like the World Trade Center Memorial Site, Wall Street/Financial District, South Street Seaport/Fulton, Battery Park, City Hall, Chinatown/Little Italy, etc. Rooms were very modern and comfortable, with great city views. We could see the Hudson in one direction and the East River the other. But be sure to pop up to the 55th Floor to see the views from there. Wow. Pool area was quite nice, not to mention rare in Manhattan. Staff were great and so helpful. I did not encounter anyone who was rude, from the front desk staff to security; I am not sure where those comments in other reviews are coming from as I certainly did not experience it. Access to metro right outside and other lines just down the street, and of course taxis were always readily available. If you're looking to experience New York City from a different perspective, I can't recommend this hotel enough. I'd certainly stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: luthgicap
Reviews.Content: We were happy to return to this hotel again after our last visit in 2005. Once again our room was spotlessly clean with excellent beds! Despite arriving very early we were given the keys to our room on the 25th floor which allowed us to shower and hit the city earlier than planned. We were also allowed to keep our room until 3pm on check out day at no extra cost! Only fault we would like changed is the early bar closure at midnight, this is suppose to be the city that never sleeps.............

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: swimmom20878
Reviews.Content: Husband, 15-year old daughter and I stayed at Hilton Millennium during Christmas week. We took Amtrak from D.C. And hotel was an easy subway ride from Penn Station. Our room wasn't ready so we dropped off luggage to concierge and headed over to 9/11 Memorial. Highly recommended but don't forget to order passes in advance. Returned to hotel and checked into gorgeous corner room on 47th floor. WOW! Unbelievable views of the city from 2 walls of windows. Our room was clean and gorgeous with every amenity we could have hoped for. Nice TV and club chair with side table created a comfy seating area. Bed was fabulous! The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Front desk and concierge, and special shout out to Joseph who went above and beyond to help us plan trip to Ellis Island. We had breakfast one morning at the restaurant with the buffet. Delicious food but pricey. The pool and locker room are beautiful too. The location of hotel was spectacular! Easy access to South Street Seaport, Brooklyn, Times Square and theater district, Ellis Island, TriBeCa, Penn Station, and 9/11 memorial is right across the street, also Century 21, awesome shopping, is right next door. I highly recommend Hilton Millennium, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the view, eat somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: East_coast55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for two days on business. I had two windows and it was all I could do to tear myself away from the fantastic view. The room was clean and confortable. The only downside was the restaurant. Being on business, I wasn't able to get out and unfortunately ended up eating here twice. It just wasn't very good, and event though it was a hotel restaurant- I did expect more. But- Oh that view.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: cjsmithnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on a weekend trip into NYC. The hotel is directly across from ground zero and as we were visiting the memorial I figured it would be a good location. The rooms are clean, bright and nice - our only complaint was it seemed a little on the cramped side (we were on the 51st floor and had a great view as well- with no street noise). Bathroom was adequate and toiletries were good. Sheets were good thread count and the bed and pillows were nice. We ate at the in-hotel restaurant Church and Dey (see separate review) - food was adequate for a hotel restaurant but they seem to have strange rules regarding items from the bar. The bar in the lobby is also adequate for a hotel facility- we had the pleasure of meeting Richard the barman- very professional and helpful, he was clearly the best staff member of our visit. Public bathrooms on the ground floor need A LOT of attention- I understand they are in New York, but their condition and odor were really unacceptable, especially in a Hilton Hotel. Our package included parking- it would be $55 if billed separately and you have 24 hours to get your car back out- the rates after the 24 hour period will certainly encourage you to get your car out on time. Room service breakfast was delivered exactly on time, but was $60 (including tip) for two glasses of orange juice, 2 glasses of water, 3 croissants with butter and jam and a pot of coffee. Obviously a business hotel! We would most likely stay again if we were in this area of Manhattan, but would also have to get a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Room type wasn't available easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: barbaraal
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday dec 17 with my husband and daughter. Took one hour to book it with certificate on hilton 800 number. They were able to book and advised I had a junior suite. Upon arrival at about 6p I was asked if we would like a rollaway for our daughter. I asked why when my room had a sleeper sofa. They say no it doesn't you have a regular king room. I then spent over 30 minutes with Hilton honors on the phone but nothing could be done! I had a small room and they said rollaway would be delivered. It wasn't there for over one hour. We had to call for it again. Breakfast is not very good and no one unless on an expense report would give them $27 a person. No way no how parking is &55 overnight with no in and out privileges. When I checked out it took almost 40 minutes to gt it. I am a born manhattanite and this was just too long and crazy! Being downtown on weekend is busier than it use o be and subway is very onvenient. We were able to get around easily. The fireman's memorial is very emotional and worth the visit. Lines start early or the 911 memorial but they do give away free tickets each day. Good stay but neighborhood helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but furnishing is a bit old.”
Reviews.Author: LOIWY
Reviews.Content: The locations is great if ur visiting downtown. Subways (E and R lines) are just underneath. The furnishings are a bit old and air-cond and/or heater are super noisy at room 5001.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, great service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SparkleTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September 2011 for one week during a business/pleasure trip. Even though our business was not in the Financial District, we liked this location away from the crowds and its overall convenience to the subway, ferries and Brooklyn. We were totally wowed by the view over the WTC construction, 9/11 memorial and the Hudson River from our room on the 35th floor. By NYC standards, the room was large, further enhanced by the huge plate glass window that provided tons of light and a greater sense of space. We really enjoyed our room and the super convenience of the hotel to all modes of public transportation and ease of walking into Tribecca, Chinatown, SoHo and beyond. I'm not usually a fan of Hiltons, but this is one is remarkable. On top of the great room and stupendous views, the service was that of a top tier, five-star hotel....maybe even better--no attitude. We found all of the staff to be helpful, friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable. A real plus. We never ate in the restaurants or used the bars--it's NYC! Everything you need is right outside the hotel. But, we did enjoy the pool and sauna one morning. There is also a nice looking fitness room, but we never used it since we were on foot so much of each day. We liked the hotel so much we came back in December for four days during the holidays with our 15-yr-old son who was equally enthralled with the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great rooms! WONDERFUL EMPLOYEES”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfan050
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GREAT! It is so close to the World Trade Center, Wall Street and the subway lines. The views were to die for! We had 4 people in our room and we had plenty of space. I thought it would be small, but was very impressed that we had plenty of room, and the bed... Can I buy one to have in my own home???? I never slept better! The staff was beyond amazing, our housekeeper (I didn't get her name, and want to kick myself, but I was on the 35th floor) did everything to make sure we were comfortable... extra coffee? no problem. Extra towels? here you go... extra....:? Always with a smile! We stayed out late every night, and were fondly welcomed back by Paul at the front with a HUGE smile! Made me feel like I was family. Concierge in the morning knew what I wanted before I had a chance to ask. WOW! Didn't try many of the other ammenities, the pool, spa, bar, etc... but I have no doubt they were beyond spectactular! I can't wait to go back...!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sara271084
Reviews.Content: We visited New York in October for my 27th birthday which was a suprise from my other half. We said in the Millenium Hilton Hotel and can not believe how fantastic our room is. We were on the 44th floor in room 4405 and the view looked over where the original 2 twin towers were once stood. This was our first visit and found it very easy to move from this hotel which was classed as Down towm up to the mid town area and uptown area. We were not too far from Battery Park and Brooklyn bridge. We found that the hotels were better priced here and you got more for your money. From JFK it cost us in cab fare around 45 dollar + tip and back to JFK around 70 dollars. Took about an hour but traffic just seemed to be bonkers over there (all the time too)

Reviews.Title: “New York stay 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireUkAlison
Reviews.Content: Good location for Battery park and Financial district. Our room looked straight out onto ground zero. Modern clean hotel with modern comfortable rooms. Our door key failed to work one night and the staff were most helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - won't blow you away.”
Reviews.Author: hendrixdisney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 3-4 days almost monthly in 2011. Location is great. Easy subway access to multiple lines. Rooms are decent size and clean. Can spend a lot of time waiting for the elevator during busy times. WTC construction will wake you up. I have learned to ask for ear plugs. Otherwise you will be awake by 7AM. Room service food is excellent! Very expensive but excellent. I recommend the Club and Chesse Cake. Pool is great for swimming laps, but not a pool for kids to swim in. Exercise room is great. everything you need for a good work out. Staff is friendly but not really looking to go the extra mile. Mostly a business traveler environment. Great views of WTC site, Manhatten, Brooklyn Bridge. If you need a hotel in the financial district, this is a great choice. Rooms are pricey, but it's NY.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlipFlopnFly
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the beginning of December thru priceline.com for a one night stay on Monday, December 26th. 4 Star Hotel for $150 !! Directly across the street from the WTC. Love Love Love Priceline for hotels. Only problem with Priceline is you get what you're given (as my Mom used to say). So a family of 4 can end up with a great room and a king size bed. You can call the hotel right away and they can try to accommodate you, which is what I did but I was told that I can only make that request when I get there on the 26th. So at check in we were advised that there were no doubles available BUT the nice gentleman UPGRADED us to a junior sweet (no pun intended) for no extra charge!!! Fantastic view from the 39th floor looking down into the infinity pools and the hubbub of construction. So kids had a pull-out couch in a separate part of the room and the adults enjoyed the view in the king-sized bed!! Room was immaculate, fully stocked and totally comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ahk13d
Reviews.Content: The location, service, views, restaurant, and friendliness are the best I've seen in a hotel. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Get better service at a one star b&b”
Reviews.Author: JSJUK
Reviews.Content: Absolute horrific customer service on arrival. Had to carry my own bags to my room. Rooms look slightly dated. No toiletries as they had run out. Incredible told to go buy some at CVS. The only plus is great concierge. Front desk and manager don't care less when you complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Ellyb1
Reviews.Content: Flew in to town late afternoon for an office Xmas party and had to leave first thing the following morning, so I was here for less than 24 hours. However, this is a stunning hotel. The staff were fantastic and drew me a map to walk to the bar where I was to meet my colleagues. I stayed on the top floor (55) and had a fabulous view. The room was modern and had a large LCD TV on the wall. Really nice bathroom with the little extras one expects from a Hilton. Check websites for specials as I got this for a real bargain during Chistmas week.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: IonaHelen
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Millenium Hilton (Dec 8th to Dec 13th). This was our second stay at the hotel following our last trip in Dec 2009. My friend contacted the hotel prior to our recent stay to advise the staff that we were returning and it was my 40th birthday on the 12th. As a result, we were upgraded to a junior suite, room 5402. This suite is situated only one floor from the top of the hotel. I can't describe how breathtaking the views were. The suite was just sheer luxury; we had our own wee living room area and a massive bedroom with windows covering the front and side wall in their entirety. We never once shut the curtains as we didn't want to miss a thing with the views. We couldn't believe how much the WTC has changed in 2 years. It's just astounding!! I cannot understand the comments made about the noise coming from the construction sites as neither this time nor the last time when we stayed were we disturbed by noise. The staff were just simply wonderful and so helpful. Even on our last day, a lovely porter called Jerry spent time with my friend and I explaining the proposed layout of the WTC. I honestly couldn't praise this hotel and the staff enough. Thank you for making our trip and my birthday so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I often stay at this hotel - (Business and personal) Reasons are : 1. Its location is ideal for downtown access (especially Union Square - south of 23rd St) 2. Rates are among the best for a hotel in Manhatten 3. Arturo on the front desk is simply a star ! this man has been immense and great assistance on every stay. 4. Walking distance to Wall Street/Subway

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient - Comfortable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Zeus69
Reviews.Content: A great hotel as close to ‘Ground Zero’ as you can find.. The rooms were well appointed although seemed to lack suitable sound insulation from. The foyer bar was always busy, but a quick lift ride to the 3rd floor found the Cocktail Bar and restaurant which always had spare seats and table. The restaurant menu was limited and could do with changing over the course of a couple of days. All staff were very friendly and typical of the quality of staff that you normally find in Hilton Hotels. Another enjoyable stay with Hilton :-)

Reviews.Title: “New Yorkers are HELPFUL!”
Reviews.Author: PKSayre
Reviews.Content: Took my 85-year-old parents to see the Big Apple for the first time, and this hotel did not disappoint. In spite of the fact I had made one of our reservations for the wrong night, Oscar found us two very nice adjoining rooms on the 22nd floor with a great view of the World Trade Center site and the Hudson River and gave us a very reasonable rate. Everywhere we went, within the hotel and outside to the sites, New Yorkers were so helpful and wonderful and treated my elderly parents so special. We all loved this hotel, so convenient to the ferry to Ellis Island/Lady Liberty, and not a bad cab ride from Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. The hotel was clean and lovely and there was absolutely no noise. Thank you, New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: silvirub
Reviews.Content: The location is near the subway, shops, restaurants. I even found a very inexpensive (by NYC standards) hairdresser just across the street. Service was neither good nor bad. I feel like no one really went out of their way to please the guests. Just doing their jobs kind of thing. Small lobby so at very busy times, it got very cramped and crowded. The view of Ground Zero construction is right outside the entrance so it is a spectacular sight. All in all, just mediocre. Not too memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you find a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Lozio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is after all good and its views are fantastic. Of course there are views also on Ground Zero, which can disturb someone. Rooms are not super but they are ok with no shadow. All the light coming in the rooms makes visible every spot of dust. The underground is just there. If you like Downtown this is a good place to stay. Too visible security people at the entrance can gives you mixed sensations.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dlreynolds
Reviews.Content: Overlooking ground zero, extremely convenient transportation with subway and Path train within 1 block. Clean modern decor. Quite room in spite of nearby construction. View of Hudson River. Nice lobby bar. Helpful staff. Restaurant onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Candacewp
Reviews.Content: Really disliked not being able to check in until 4PM. The room was a nice size but the bathroom could use an update, especially the tub area. The shower head was bent and there was zero water pressure. Still, I've stayed in a lot worse in NYC. The location is very good for theatre goers.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient classic”
Reviews.Author: SarahMckSingapore
Reviews.Content: I visited New York for the first time on business and stayed at the Millenium. It was incredibly convenient for me in terms of location and everything about the experience was ... ok. I arrived in advance of my trip and paid for one night myself and as I am travelling from Asia-Pacific, I found the price very high for what the place offered - I've no doubt this was in keeping with normal New York prices. The location of the hotel is great and is right next to a subway station, which is excellent news for amateurs like me. I had read reviews that said that the noise from the 9/11 memorial being built next door was intrusive and luckily I had a room on the 29th floor, so this was not an issue for me. The hotel is older and obviously a classic from it's time, but it's looking a little dated now and the rooms are incredibly small - again, this is likely in keeping with most of New York. As with most US establishments, the staff were adequate, but wanted a tip for simply performing their job. I don't mind tipping the guy who lugs your cases up to your room and gives you an overview of the hotel and surroundings, but I do resent the long face when you don't hand over a couple of dollars to the guy who opens the door. However, for the most part, the staff were friendly and polite - especially the Concierge desk. The food was fine and the selection pretty good. Overall I was not unhappy with my stay in New York, but it doesn't really compare in terms of value for other places. It is a wonderful town though and the 9/11 memorial next door was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....staff break the deal”
Reviews.Author: tjsampone
Reviews.Content: Working in a hotel myself I obviously have a bias opinion when it comes to hotels. However, a hotel is a hotel as far as I'm concerned....rooms, as long as they're clean and pretty are great, which here they definately were. The location is great and the hotel itself is nice, the staff hoever were incredibly robotic and cold. From the desk staff at check in, when we called regarding pool hours, the bartenders, and the lobby greeter( man standing near elevators in suit?) Everyone was incredibly cold and very unpersonable and for me that is the most important aspect of a hotel. So I rate the hotel itself a 4 and the staff a 1. I couldn't honestly even tell u one employees name because they didn't leave a good impression at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokkev
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and myself stayed for four nights early December, we had a corner suit which was very nice, good decor, plenty of room until the sofa bed was pulled out but it didn't cause us any issues. Nice bathroom with good toiletries, plenty of good sized towels. There were extra pillows in the cupboard. Two TVs, one in the each room; coffee making facilities but oddly only two cups when they knew three people were staying in the room. Our room was located on the 30 Floor, I contacted the hotel and requested a high floor, we weren’t disturbed by the building noise from ground zero although it was fascinating watching the work going on through the window from such a height. It was my daughters 21st birthday and the NY trip was her present, I arranged a bottle of champagne to be available in the room upon arrival with a birthday greeting, not very good as the card in the room said “Happy Anniversary” and again only two glasses when they knew three people were staying. I suppose that somewhere in the hotel there was a couple on their anniversary, with congratulations on your 21st card with their champagne! The bar was nice in the lobby and the Front desk staff very helpful, charging my daughters iPhone when her charger broke. The hotel is ideally placed for the subway taking you uptown in minutes and much cheaper than a taxi. You are minutes from South Street Seaport and all the restaurants in between. All in all a great stay and we would stay again. As regular visitors to NY we have always stayed in the area around the village but we have had a change of mind now. I strongly recommend this hotel looking at what we got for the money and the advantages of its location which might not suit all.

Reviews.Title: “Great gateway to a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: socforward
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location--we found this property to be very convenient to the subway. Both the bell staff and concierge were helpful with dining recommendations and attractions

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysFrench
Reviews.Content: Our weekend at the Hilton Millenium was enhanced because the front desk was accommodating (thank you Javier Alvites!) and helped us out with the printing of our passes for the 911 memorial and because the all of the hotel staff was so pleasant and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the Hilton is in a great location. I would definitely visit the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Insel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our recent trip to the USA for two nights and I am so glad that we chose to do so. Having been to Manhatten may times we have always chosen to stay Midtown or around Times Square however this time we made a decision to stay somewhere different and were not disappointed in our decision. It was a short limo ride from La Guardia to the hotel and upon arrival we were warmly welcomed to the hotel and allocated a room on the 30th floor which had views across to New Jersey and over the World Trade Centre site. We also had views of the two pools that mark the footprint of the towers and the waterfalls within them. The room was comfortable with a large bed, nice bathroom which although was a little dated was fit for purpose together with coffee maker and a mini bar. The location was excellent, close to many of the subway stations, Statten Island ferry service, World Trade Centre site, Seaport, as well as shopping and much more. The staff were good at giving advice on where to go, where local shops were located and much more and nothing appeared to be a problem for them. There is also a very nice pool and gym and restaurant, although we never had anything to eat within the hotel instead choose to eat at many of the local restaurants and delis all of which were excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 diamants hotel”
Reviews.Author: a-french-aloha
Reviews.Content: we booked through a travel agent a TWIN for 6 nights,06/12 november, giving the 2 different names to be sure to receive a twin bedded room. Reservation was well detailled on our voucher. Arrival was immediatly a shock = no help for the luggage, no the usual welcome when arriving to a Hilton, nothing except = no way for a twin, your reservation is for a king size bed ! I'm 65 years old, travelling with my daughter at least 2 times per year to United States and used to this category of hotel. Never had such problem at the check-in. I had to insist to get the twin and this was done after 20 minuts negociation. Hotel was not full.... and I'm a silver honors member. Room was OK. No bath robes in this 4 diamants hilton. After a call, we received it. First problem was the breakfast. On the internet site, this hotel is giving with full details, the price for the cold buffet breakfast 21 USD. At the end of our first breakfast, the maitre d'hotel told us that, if we want to come back, we will have to pay for the full hot buffet. It was decided by the Director that only the hot buffet will be offered. We came back, the menu was detailled at the entrance of the restaurant with the 21 USD for the cold buffet but they charge us 27 USD. It's not a question of 6 dollars, it's the fact that what is written must be respected, especially because it's the United States and a Hilton hotel ! We found nearby the hotel a large choice of places to have a very nice breakfast, with a good service. Another situation not acceptable for me = once, we left the room at 11.30 AM and when we came back at 10.00 PM after a Broadway show, we found the room not clean ! As the day before we had not asked to change the towels, this was a new problem. I was obliged to go downstairs to speak with the Reception. Thanks to a nice lady, the first one we found in this hotel, we received towels immediatly. Booking this hotel, I was ready to face problems because of the noice, but never because of the lack of service. Back to Paris, I sent a detailled email to the Hilton custumer service but no answer. Hope travelers will understand that I cannot recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the view from high floors!”
Reviews.Author: langvass
Reviews.Content: Also the dining hall was ok. Efficient staff and good food. Othervise the service level was below par by continental standards. For five days the soap dispensers by the pool were not refilled. Had to ask for shampo and conditioner. Faucets leaking, light bulbs out of order. AC sounded like an airplane and had to stay off. Front desk was helpful, but general standard did not match price. Manager on holiday ??

Reviews.Title: “It`s ok”
Reviews.Author: pds80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent Saturday and Sunday night for a wedding in town, and most of the reviews here cover the pros and cons of this property. The downtown area of this hotel is a busy hub, with Wall Street, Zucotti Park (occupy Wall Street), and the World Trade Center site steps away. The valet parking which is always pricey in big cities, costs $55 per night. The outside of the hotel is very nice, and quite tall at 55 floors. The lobby is nice and clean, with a friendly staff that says hello when they see you. The is also a gift shop with an ATM, and many other New York related souvenirs. The gift shop also sells snacks and drinks. There is a bar called "Liquid Assets" in the lobby, which is not too impressive, consisting of one tv, and not enough seating in my opinion. The hotel also has a fitness center on the 5th floor, and restaurant on the third floor. I did not use either. The hallways are clean, but otherwise pretty standard for a hotel. We had a room on the 10th floor of the hotel. The room was average size, again nothing special. The tv was a 42` Plasma, that was in the wall. The picture on the tv was not great, with several channels being fuzzy. There was an issue with the heat in the room, with the room being very cool when we walked in. We played with the digital thermostat for a while to no avail, and had to call maintenance. The man came quickly to fix it, but we could never feel quite comfortable temperature wise. The rest of the room was fine, a normal bathroom, a stocked mini-bar, and pricey snacks. Our room had a view of the World Trade Center site, which is currently under construction. You can see the newly built 9/11 memorial from the room as well, which is beautiful. As many others have stated, the construction noise is an issue. You can hear hammering in the morning, as well as throughout the day. Construction cranes are visible passing by as well. Being a New Yorker my whole life, it was kind of sad to be so close, and replay the tragic events of that day in my mind. This particular hotel closed for 2 years after 9/11, so its rebuilding and capacity of guests are important, but the noise can be an issue for some. The sound of honking horns and sirens could also be heard, I just wish they soundproofed a bit better. I could also hear guests speaking in the halls. I slept relatively well, soft squishy pillows, big bed. The maid service was great in my room. The total for our room ( 2 nights, 2 guests, no room service) just room, taxes, and parking, was $532. I believe the room was $229 per night. As I stated in the title, the hotel is just ok. I am sure things will be a bit better when downtown Manhattan is fully rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton is great.”
Reviews.Author: pottermom101
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked through Orbitz for a long weekend. I'm always a little concerned about booking through the computer but we weren't disappointed; this is a beautiful hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It's directly across from the WTC memorial site and there is constant building going on but we never heard it. While the hotel is way downtown and not close to Time's Square it has subway access in front. It's only a 5 minute walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and is in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I always stay at the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: twogrape
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Millenium several times over the past five years, most recently in December of 2011. We have never had a problem with noise, in fact I sleep better and longer at the Millenium than I do at my own home. The rooms have plenty of space and amazing views of the WTC site. As far as criticisms - We get free breakfast due to my Hilton points, but one criticism that I would have is that the list price of $27 for the breakfast is preposterously high. Also it can be surprisingly difficult to get a cab. Ultimately if you have the cash, this hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you are into noise, book your expensive room here”
Reviews.Author: SherryFrumkin
Reviews.Content: Although this location may one day be interesting, right now and for the next few years you can expect lots of noise around the clock as the work on Ground Zero progresses below your windows. And though the bellmen are very helpful, it really is difficult to get a cab outside the hotel. The rooms seem very small for the price. They are clean, but if you think of New York City as place for some luxury, this is not it. And, skip the hotel restaurant. There are so many delicious places to eat at a fraction the cost just blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - in all ways”
Reviews.Author: tonypct
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel in lower Manhattan.
