First of all, I was concerned about previous reviews I'd read about the noise from the new World Trade Center construction going on, which is directly across the street. To avoid the noise, I request an upgrade to a higher floor, for an additional $19 per night, and I was put on the 50th floor, where the view was absolutely spectacular and the noise was non-existent. This hotel is incredibly expensive, which was no surprise considering its location in lower Manhattan. I didn't drive but parking was $55 per night. A Chicken Caesar salad is $18! If you're going to stay here, I highly suggest that you eat out. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. Standard room rates start at about $350 per night. Because I was there on business I was able to get my client's corporate rate of $289 per night. The location is very close to subways and NJ PATH lines so getting around the city, whether going uptown or midtown, or even to the outer boroughs is very convenient and easy. One of the biggest drawbacks to this hotel and why i rated it only three stars was the price of internet access. It was $5.95 per hour. I haven't seen an hourly rate for internet service in years and thought this was price gouging. Later on I found out that I could also get 24 hours of internet service for $14.95. I still don't get why higher priced hotels charge for internet access at all. The room was clean and small, which is so typical of NYC hotels. The service, from the front desk to the concierge was excellent, which is expected from a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: leylek
Reviews.Content: Front desk: That was our fastest check in experience. We arrived to the hotel at 01:30 pm, it took literally 2 minutes to get our keys. Thanks to Cynthia at the front desk. Location: Right next to world trade center. 15- 20 minutes walk to Soho, China town. The outlet store Century21 is 20 steps away, you can use your room as the fitting room! Room: Plenty of room. Bathroom is clean and big enough. (old but more than okey) Beware: You can hear the WTC construction. It is not like knocking but there is a constant background noise (like air condition noise) on the A bank.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: BCMom27
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights over Thanksgiving at the Millenium and it was fantastic! We had a room on the 49th floor overlooking the WTC and the view could not be beat day or night. I could have sat in that window the whole time and been content. The room was beautiful, the beds were perfect. Super fast elevators. The staff was courteous and helpful and always knew exactly the information we needed to get to attractions and places to eat. The location was perfect, right at Ground Zero, the subway was right on the corner and the PATH train was a block away. Plenty to do within walking distance. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A definite must stay - will go again.”
Reviews.Author: rickwood50
Reviews.Content: I was unsure about the location as this trip was a mixture of business and pleasure. I need have no doubts. The subway was so close and many lines to choose from......access everywhere was perfect! I normally stay in mid town 2-3 times a year. As a HHonors gold member I was lucky enough to have an upgraded room and the opportunity to sample the breakfast buffet. Both were definitely brilliant. I will return to this location again. Just one word. The front desk staff need to learn to smile.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: dbifulco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium over Thanksgiving and could not have been happier. We booked our rooms through Priceline, so were not sure what kind of room we'd end up with. When we checked in, we requested a king bed and the clerk asked if we'd like a higher floor (to which we gladly said yes!) When we walked in, we were amazed to look out and see the entire 911 Memorial and WTC site, backlit by the sun setting over Jersey City to the West. Our room was very quiet even though we were just around the corner from the elevator, and the bed was quite comfortable. The concierge directed us to the kiosk to get passes for the 911 Memorial the next day, which was just a short walk. The memorial itself is worth a trip - absolutely fabulous. The hotel is an easy walk to Tribeca, Soho and Little Italy/Chinatown for lots of eating options. Also a short walk down to Battery Park where one could get a boat to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. We opted to walk along the Battery Park esplanade and enjoy the nice fall weather. This hotel is great for people who want to see something other than mid-town Manhattan. If your room doesn't have views of the WTC site, it will most likely look over the Brooklyn Bridge, also a fantastic view. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What Luck!”
Reviews.Author: HowlnBubba
Reviews.Content: As part of a birthday trip to NYC, my wife booked us into the Millenium Hilton for one night. We had a reservation to visit the 9/11 Memorial, and this hotel is right there. We got a Junior Suite with free buffet breakfast off of her frequent flyer miles. Beyond that, we had no idea what to expect. How about a 37th floor, corner room overlooking the WTC site, past it to the Hudson River and NJ, and including a view up town toward Broadway?!?!. Even with drizzly weather, we got incomparable photos. Even better, we had other planned stops for which this was an ideal hotel. We wanted to see Zuccotti Park and the remains of OWS - about a one-minute walk. We wanted to visit Wall Street and Federal Hall National Memorial - about another five-minute walk. We chose to dine at the Fraunces Tavern - probably a ten-minute walk. The hotel is very close to a lot of sites to visit. The only problem I can think of is that none of the sites/distances appear in the guest guide in your room (Oddly, this exact info appears on the hotel website). There is a helpful concierge in the lobby, but it's easier to skim through a prepared listing in your room. Oh yeah, the room is probably key to the review so - Very clean, well laid out and nicely furnished. Everything that I would expect from a Hilton, and perhaps a little more. Breakfast was a good, though unremarkable hot/cold buffet, and we ate while watching the WTC construction crews across the street. Only one criticism, possible arising from the fact that I used to work for a Hilton hotel. The concierge looked like he had dressed with laundry bag contents in a dark room. It didn't have any adverse impact on the quality of the service he provided, but it was an unprofessional appearance. All things considered, this may be one of the best hotel stays I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Always a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdlpras
Reviews.Content: Been here every year over thanksgiving break for about six years now, and this hotel always has been great. The rooms, very urban chic, modern...my favorite is the corner rooms facing uptown...just an awesome view at night. Get as high up as you can, 52nd floor is best...keeps you away from the noise of reconstruction down below too...the restaurant on floor 3 is great...breakfast buffet is blah, but the breakfast menu is fine. The coffee...awful..they need to work on that, but there's a Starbucks right downstairs facing Century 21, (which of course is always a blast to shop at black Friday.) We love the Millenium Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous views, but room was in poor repair.”
Reviews.Author: TheNorsk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a 48th floor suite at this property during a weekend visit recently. We lived in lower Manhattan for ten years, so were familiar with the neighborhood. Service was in general good. We requested early check-in, and when we arrived late morning, we were accommodated quickly. Our suite featured expansive views from Brooklyn Bridge to the Hudson. Having a room separate from sleeping area was a bonus, although both bedroom and "living room" areas were very small. While the room was clean, we found peeling wallpaper in bathroom, broken dresser drawers (fell out upon opening) and flat screen TVs with terrible reception. Expected more from this property, and would have reservations about staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jonesyguy
Reviews.Content: When we visit our son in NYC, we dread the typical closet sized overpriced rooms and uncaring reception desk employees. Not the case here. Somehow we were efficiently bumped up to a corner room jr. suite on a high floor overlooking the new 9/11 memorial. Very clean, spacious rooms and somehow quiet during the entire weekend stay with the exception of some drum playing fools associated with the OWS park sit in. Room furniture/carpet show a little wear but the mattress was newish so slept well. Housekeeping most attentive and the front desk cheerfully helped with a few small matters. Shower pressure somewhat low but the norm for the 38th floor. The breakfast buffet was average but included in my room price so not an issue. The WiFI internet charges corrected at check -out but they need to change this poor billing system altogether. The lobby got very crowded during the days with tour groups that mass book here and the front sidewalk was a mass of humanity visiting the memorial as well as all the construction about the near blocks. Subway and Starbucks very close. We paid $225/n plus tax for this, a steal in NYC for a standard room, the upgrade was pure luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great price for a weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: foodshooter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during US Open in September. Got a great room for a very reasonable price. Was up on 23rd floor and had a great view. Bag Check guys were great, the front desk a bit pompous and I'm a platinum HH member. Restaurant staff friendly. Overall a great place to stay for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Millennium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Me9432
Reviews.Content: Front desk attendant was very nice and quickly got us to our room on the 22nd floor. The room looked like it was very recently remodeled. Very comfortable and large for NYC. The view of the World Trade Center site was incredible and it was very interesting to watch the construction going on. Did not have any problem with noise...what we did hear was very muffled and not annoying at all. If you are primarily wanting to go see a lot of Broadway shows and do a lot of shopping on Park Avenue, this obviously would not be for you. If you've done that already, and want to explore the south end of Manhattan, this is a fantastic spot. Century 21, the discount clothing store, is right next door, there seemed to be plenty of places to eat close by (take out pizza, Stage Door Deli), and lots of tourist attractions, including the Statue of Liberty Ferry, The Museum of the American Indian (free, quite interesting, and not overwhelming), and some of the churches affected by 9/11 have very poignant exhibits. Also, walk up Broadway from here, and there is GREAT shopping at funky clothing stores as well as some well-known chain clothing stores. AND, I found out that they do not charge tax on clothing (or at least on the $20 worth I bought!). It is about 15-20 minutes by convenient subway to Times Square, so it's not THAT far from Broadway shows, but with each subway ride being about $2.25 each ride, you're looking at $4.50 per roundtrip per person. If you get a Metro Card, and purchase $10.00 worth, you get an extra 7% back on the card to use. There are also Metro Cards for $29 that are good for 7 days, so that would be a better bargain for a longer stay. I think we spent around $20 per person on subways for a three day stay, so not bad. So back to the Millennium Hilton. Price was really good, clean and comfortable, and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lemonlux
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton millennium in November 2011. After cheekily asking the hotel we got an upgrade to a suite room which was very beautiful and had a living room area as well as a bedroom. The room was on the 50th floor which gave us great views of the city and also of the world trade centre site. While we were there we witnessed the builders filling the site with water. On our first night there we took a look inside the mini bar. However once we had finished investigating we saw a sign saying that any items handled would automatically be charged onto our bill! I've never come across this kind of sensor technology so was quite surprised. Right away we called the reception area and explained we hadn't taken anything out, just handled a couple of bottles. They were very nice about it and said they would wipe the charges off our account right away. So be sure not to play around in the mini bar unless you actually want to consume the products. Food and drink in the hotel is quite expensive so try to venture outside to local cafes and shops. Two bottles of still water were $11! So don't purchase much there. There is a subway station right outside the hotel which is the R line and goes to central park, times square and other tourist attractions. Getting around is pretty easy and the new Yorkers are very friendly so don't hesitate to ask directions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: belowtheradar
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend at this hotel. There were many reports of it being to nisy due to the WTC construction but not so for my stay. I was on the 8th fllor facing the site and it was an amazing view. Did I mention the bed!!!! It was the mist comfortable bed I have slept in in years. The room was the usual NYC size but nicely appointed. The front desk staff very helpful and friendly. Just a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view but bad service”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsGood-Travel
Reviews.Content: Great location near subway stations and amazing view of 911 Memorial Site. Bad service throughout our stay, from front desk to bell service. They tend to have some kind of attitude that they are too good to help you. Remember that you're in service business. Management: please train your staff to treat everyone with courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “The view overlooking the new construction of the world trade centers and the memorial was mesmerizing .”
Reviews.Author: framerman777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and it was very nice .The view we had from our room overlooked the new construction and the memorial. Our tv was never turned on because I was always watching the team work of the construction guys rebuilding the towers . The service from the staff was excellent . Transportation from there is easy , You can catch the subway right out front or cabs are always on stand by . Very nice hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bizone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October, great location,well appointed spacious room. My husband and I stayed here for his birthday and were not expecting too much. We were pleasantly suprised by this great hotel. Excellent location, we looked out over the world trade center 911 memorial. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would definately return to this lovely hotel next time we are visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Financial district hotel convenient for business”
Reviews.Author: CarpeNox
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Millenium Hilton hotel in New York City's financial district while on business in the area. The hotel is directly across Church Street from Ground Zero so the area is always crowded. The hotel was acceptable in all regards but is probably due for a refresh of its decor. The staff were more business-like than friendly, but that is characteristic of New York itself. It can be noisy on the lower floors due to all of the construction in the area so try for a higher floor as the work starts early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: italian4560
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right next to Ground Zero. The view was really impressive. The hotel is clean and staff was great in the bar, concierge, front desk areas. The only thing that was not great was the restaurant, the service was slow and food overpriced for what you got! If they fix the restaurant situation I would have probably given them a 5!

Reviews.Title: “Really Solid Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The property offers a solid customer experience. The staff are trained, courteous and get it right. I would stay here again, especially to see the progress of the WTC from a birds-eye view.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Millenium New York”
Reviews.Author: Mkaddo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel millenium for a night towards the end of October 2011. Situated right next to Ground Zero, and right in the heart of New York's financial district and wall street the views from the room comprise of skyscrapers and office blocks. The view of the September 11th Memorial site was impressive from my 18th floor room although there was not much else to look at as alot of construction was going on around the area. The rooms are excellent in terms of their cleanliness and decor, and the bed was very comfortable. Room service was very helpful and efficient meeting my extra requests and queries promptly. The location of the hotel is not ideal if you are looking to walk to more vibrant clubs and bars within Manhattan, although I stayed on a weekend so can appreciate that most of the local amenities in the financial district would be closed. It is however a short cab ride away from the meatpacking district and Chinatown, and the concierge was more than helpful in getting me a cab. It is also a short journey into Brooklyn for anyone looking to experience more than Manhattan. When I requested to check out an hour later then stated due to a hangover, they were very accommodating and allowed me this extra time to gather my belongings and leave without any extra cost. This was great value as well so would definitely recommend it for any people looking for short affordable trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: MrsKnicki
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from a "name your own price" website- otherwise we would have not been able to afford this beautiful hotel. It is in THE CENTER of the Financial District and nearby to subways to any other area you'd want to see. The hotel's check in policy was 3pm, however, when we arrived at 8am off a very late night, they let us into our room so we could head out to our tourist adventures early! The desk was so helpful, the concierge was super helpful- just ask "Hey where can we get a great breakfast?" and zip, a print out of nearby locations and directions on how to get there! We had breakfast at Sarabeth's on recommendation. Amazing! And upon checkout, we had our bags held by the doormen in a locked room so we could spend our last day in the city checking out the sites instead of dragging our bags around. A perfect ending! Had some trouble getting a cab on a snowy night even with the help of our doorman, but what do you expect? Overall the hotel itself was in the best location. The rooms were clean and upscale. We had a large screen tv, wifi access in our room, and a nice lounge chair to relax after a busy day of tourism. The helpfulness of the staff was top notch, they were extremely accomodating.Would recommend it, but not at their prices. :)

Reviews.Title: “good stay....”
Reviews.Author: saintsaad
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in june, 2011 for a couple of nights....this property was available for points & money rewards via hilton honors so i had booked a couple of nights for 25k points & $85....this was a great value.... checked in a little early in the day & had to wait a couple of hours for my room to be ready....not a problem as i just walked by to the many many restaurants nearby to have an early lunch....when i got back, as a diamond, got an upgrade to a junior suite on the 34th floor, facing the construction site....i was initially concerned about the noise due to the construction but there was no noise.... for diamond members there is only free wired internet & the speed is pretty disappointing.... i got up to use the bathroom around 5 in the morning & there was a little noise coming from the construction site....it was not enough to wake me up though as i went straight back to sleep.... breakfast was good, one of the better spreads i have come across in a long time....lots of choice....again, this was free for diamond members.... all in all, a very good stay & i would definitely come back....

Reviews.Title: “The New Times Square”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: With the opening of the 9/11 Memorial site, this area around Ground Zero is full of tourists from morning to night. It is very crowded. We stayed 3 nights here last week and also had a room overlooking the WTC site. The noise begins at 6:30 a.m. The room is clean and comfortable, the staff rather impersonal. Doormen are totally unhelpful. The nearness to the subway is a real perk, and shoppers will enjoy having the huge discount store Century 21 right across the street. It, too, is very crowded. Enjoy the original site of the city of New York, the historic churches and inauguration site of George Washington. Wall Street is not far away, nor are the Occupy Wall Street protesters. You can see the Memorial site from your room, so no need to endure the long lines and heavy security to get closer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: leanner84
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this house with my partner and family. We were original wary of the noise of the ground zero site but I can honestly say we didn't notice it at all. They stopped around 10pm at night and didn't start again until around 7am. The views overlooking the site are amazing! The hotel is also in a great location, even if you plan to travel Uptown. There is a subway station right outside the hotel where you can get a direct train up to Times Square and also a larger subway station around the corner where you can get on most lines. It is easy walking distance to Battery Park, South Seaport, China Town, Little Italy etc. The rooms are standard quality for a Hilton Hotel, very large comfy beds and well equipped rooms/bathroom. The hotel bar is nice, although some drinks are quite expensive, however this is a common theme in New York. Best value for money are the cocktails :) There is also a starbucks next door, which is great for a morning coffee and/or breakfast. Century 21, a large discount department store is also across the road and definitely worth a visit for some bargains. All staff seemed very friendly and willing to offer advice on transport, restaurants etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people traveling to New York and don't be put off by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: IheartNYC30
Reviews.Content: Told the attendant at check in that I was celebrating my birthday and he upgraded my daughter and me to a 20th floor suite with breathtaking view of WTC. We had difficulty closing one of the windows we'd opened, called the front desk and a maintenance man arrived less than 5 minutes later to solve our problem. Bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to leave it in the morning. No construction noise. No problems with room key. Employees extremely courteous. I have stayed in many, many Manhattan hotels and this one stands out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice NYC hotel with a pool!”
Reviews.Author: jmp1975
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to NYC and we have always stayed in Times Square prior to this trip. I was ready for a change and really wanted a hotel with a pool. The property itself is very nice - very clean and modern. Huge windows lend lots of light and we had a really beautiful view of the WTC Memorial. Room size was pretty good. Typical NYC small, but I have definitely stayed in smaller. There is construction work going on around the clock (literally) at the WTC site but we did not hear any construction whatsoever. The pool is beautiful and convenient and it was never crowded. Location is really convenient - we took to E train from Penn Station and the stop is steps away from the hotel. One drawback was that hallway noise was very noisy in the room. This was easy to mask by sleeping with the tv on. I prefer dark and quiet/no tv when sleeping, but it was a much better option than hearing people in the hallway at all hours. Staff was helpful. We would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jollyroger007
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in this area, and most were highly priced and/or did not have good reviews. We got a good rate at this hotel, and got upgraded to a Parlor Suite for an extra $99/night. The suite was large, with 2 full bathrooms, sitting area, 2 flat panel TVs, and separate bedroom (with ensuite). We also had an amazing view of the WTC site. Staff were friendly and polite. Bar was good. Did not try restaurant. Would definitely return here and recommend to others. Only negative was internet access, which was only free if a gold or higher Hilton Honors member (I think).. else it was $5.95/hr, which is obviously ridiculous. I can handle maybe $9.99/day, but those prices were extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Other Hiltons in NYC far better”
Reviews.Author: cc1047
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 nights at the Millenium Hilton having moved from Hilton Time Square for the weekend. Air con TURNED OFF due to the cold weather, so rooms became very steamy and damp, especially with trying to dry off wet clothes, shoes etc. Maintenance opened window for us, but that was very noisy, even on 39th floor (and quite scary!).Asked for car to be booked to take us to airport, got back to find it had never even been booked (and told it was our fault). Average service, nothing is their responsbility. The customer is clearly always wrong. Paid for stay with HH points, not worth the 100,000 points. Only stay here if you get a really good deal. Rooms OK, a bit dated but spacious enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible location, close to subway, shopping and the magnificent 9/11 memorial.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Archimedesrules
Reviews.Content: Booked this ground zero overlooking hotel directly at hilton.com for 120 USD/night for a double. Prime location, 5 min from metro, Wall street, entry to the ferry (Statue of Liberty). A great outelt next door (21st century). Nice restaurants and cafes around. A bit noisy due to ongoing works on the ground zero site. No restaurant, only bar with relatively good prices. 1 h drive to the airport (average traffic)

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: BnCh6
Reviews.Content: About everything you would expect from a Hilton. We had a jr. suite as there was three of us and it faced the new memorial.. View was fantastic and noise was not a problem Subway within a block to get you where you need to go. We got a good rate and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Emotive location, but a great one for exploring all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Cn-three
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted a 4* hotel at a reasonable price, and we found it here. The rooms were great and the location easy for everywhere even tho you are down town not in the middle of everywhere. Use the subway right outside the hotel to get everywhere. Get a 7 day pass and it is quicker than taxi's. I called the hotel as soon as booking and asked for a high room and true to their word they gave us greatrooms on the 30th floors. It was our daughters birthday as well and they arranged for balloons and cake. Also we were delayed in getting to the hotel due to flight problems and the concierge phoned the top of the rock for us to explain we were going to be late for our scheduled slot. Fantastic service!! The rooms were good. Big enough for everything. Lots or draw space to unpack properly and the beds were amazingly comfy!! Their pillars were wow and they gave you lots!! The rooms were a bit chilly and we did not work out how to re set the air con but they gave us an extra blanket for each room and then we were fine. I'm sure if I'd asked about the air con someone would have helped! All in all a great hotel. Don't be put off by the noise from the WTC building. It is not too bad at all. The location looks a mess because of the building, and when we were the the wall street protesters were also just across the way, so eveywhere was barracaed around, but that adds to exactly where you are! The views were amazing!! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “woke up with bites on my arm”
Reviews.Author: PetuniasParadise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton on a short trip to New York City this past weekend, October 21-23. As we entered the hotel our first impression was that there were no doormen or bellboys to greet us--we were on our own to try to open the heavy glass doors and somehow get our luggage inside. Not a huge problem, just a minor difficulty. Our room was a corner Junior Suite on the 41st floor--we did not face Ground Zero and it was very quiet. The room had a large flat screen TV and free Wifi. My only complaint regarding cleanliness is that when I pulled out the nightstand in order to plug something in....I saw a huge amount of dust back there. All in all it was an average hotel stay--not fabulous but not terribly bad either. Except for one thing. I awoke the first morning with 8 bug bites on my right forearm. Because our schedule was so packed in those 48 hours I really didn't have a chance to ponder the cause of the bites. I know that an accusation of bedbugs is a very serious charge and I would not say this lightly, but I cannot rule it out. These are definitely not mosquito bites...I always have the same reaction to them and this is totally different. The bites are hard red pustules. They have become much more itchy, reddened, and inflamed in the past 2 days. By the time we arrived home I had become extremely worried that we could possibly be bringing bedbugs home with us, so I immediately washed all of our clothing in hot water and even threw away my suitcase because it had been on the floor next to my bed. I am not taking any chances. At the time I did not look for nor did I see any bedbugs, but now I cannot figure out what else could have bitten me during my sleep. This has never happened to me in a hotel before. Now I am honestly pretty hesitant to return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, everything else just OK”
Reviews.Author: pamlvs2trvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for work. It was located one block from where I needed to be, and my room overlooked WTC, so the view was pretty awesome. However, there was a few things lacking: for example, a working phone. The phone in the hallway didn't work either, so I had to go all the way back downstairs (from the 33rd floor) to the front desk, and it took about an hour for them to come fix it. In the meantime, I went to the 32nd floor and ordered room service. The food was lukewarm (and way overpriced), but edible. The elevators didn't arrive immediately when called, but once you were on, were fast. The room was clean, and fairly large by NYC standards, so no complaints about that. I'm not super picky, but there were just a bunch of little misses that added up to me not being overly impressed with the hotel. I wasn't paying out of pocket, so I didn't make a big deal out of my issues, but when I come to NYC for leisure, I probably won't stay here until I find some crazy cheap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Room?”
Reviews.Author: goofygirl1969
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well maintained. Fast elevators. Good staff. Very clean room. NO BEDBUGS! Directly next to World Trade Center site. So, why only 3 stars? Because what is the point of a non-smoking room when the ventilation system directs smoke in anyway? If you are a smoker, then I'd say five stars. But, I am not and couldn't stand the smell of second hand cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel at War with its Guests”
Reviews.Author: Shamal_PLL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Millenium Hilton in New York a couple of times over the past few years, and while to date it has always ranked as a forgettable but overall professional experience, it is only now that I feel compelled to highlight what have become major shortcomings in basic hospitality and service. Its location is good for the downtown business traveller, though not to be recommended for the tourist and leisure traveller. Where this property fails on nearly all counts, is on its service. There are pockets of resistance against this new culture of "the guest, our enemy" (notably a minority at reception and in the breakfast bar), but overall, I felt the hostility at times was so gross, that I ultimately decided to put up and shut up, in fear that housekeeping would defecate my bathroom or room service would burry maggots in my burger. Ok, I admit, I'm polarising somewhat, but I have no other description for certain obvious deficits in basic customer service. I nearly considered walking through the lobby in my pijamas when I was brusquely told by the operator that there was no one available to deliver an overnight fax to my room at 6 in the morning, and that I would have to get it from the front desk myself. I was told off in no uncertain terms for being responsible for the malfunction of my key card, after it repeatedly failed to open my hotel room door. And the remains of my less than average burger, which someone from room service had kindly volunteered to actually deliver to my room the previous evening, were still spread out on the try outside my room the next morning, filling the corridor air with a welcoming smell of onions and kitchen scraps. These are just a handful of the somewhat more extreme examples. Whoever runs this place needs to get a grip, and more importantly liberate this hotel from the grip of its staff, which clearly regards those people temporarily occupying the rooms, bars and restaurants as its enemies rather than paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but thats it”
Reviews.Author: SpamMk
Reviews.Content: We stayed about a week ago and the first impressions are a clean & tidy hotel. The front desk staff on check in kept us waiting whilst they were talking but were quick at allocating the room in the end. Our room faced the WTC Site and you can hear the building work but its not to loud. We had one breakfast at the hotal and it was expensive!! However this was overshadowed by the waiter who when he picked up the check and realised we had not left a tip on the credit card receipt he went mad!!!! Slammed the folder closed, muttered under his breath and threw his pen down. We normally add the tip in cash not credit so the waiting staff do get it, but we didn't get chance as we actually had not finished our breakfast so needless to say he didn't get a dime! Apart from that the hotel is okay, not special as we found that the rooms needed some TLC, a bit of dust on surfaces & the shower was dirty and needed a rinse out. For the price we paid it was fine but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 65DDD65
Reviews.Content: We purchased a room for two nights on a travel service. On arrival the hotel gave us a different (lesser quality) room and said that was their perogative. There is no way that this is a four star hotel. The Hampton Inn at Times square is more comfortable and just plain better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed from the moment we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: lthompson2000
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel. I typically stay in midtown on business travel, so I am not very familiar with the area. After 8 hours of traveling my husband and I arrived at the hotel at 5:30pm on a Friday only to discover that our room was not ready. The hotel's check-in time is 3pm, which the staff acknowledged. They explained that they had a number of late checkouts that day and the rooms were not ready. I was shocked that we were not able to check-in 2.5 hours after check-in time because the hotel had extended the check-out time for other guests. They should know how to manage the timing of arrivals/departures and only grant accomadations accordingly. I asked for an upgrade to an available room but was told that none were available. The staff had no idea how long it would take for a room to become available and we were told that there were other guests in line ahead of us waiting for vacancies. We were offered a complimentary drink in the bar, which I found offputting considering we were carrying luggage and exhausted from our travels. Instead, we headed to their restaurant for a bite which was completely unimpressive and overpriced. The waitstaff appeared disinterested in their jobs and the service suffered immensely. When we finally made it to our room we discovered that we were right on top of Ground Zero. This hotel isn't just near, close to, or have a view of Ground Zero - noooo, it is on top of it! The views are amazing, but the non-stop construction noise is not. We typically use the fan on the hotel A/C unit to drown out any hotel noise, but that did not do the trick. After 3 seperate calls to complain and ask for advice (as if no one complains about 24/7 construction noise at this place), housekeeping sent up a white noise machine for which we were charged a $200 deposit until it was returned. It didn't help. We ended up changing our flights to leave a day earlier. In accordance with our other experiences with the hotel it came as little surprise that we were charged in full for the entire stay that we book despite checking out 36 hours early.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at Ground ZERO”
Reviews.Author: Bud32695
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at this hotel. The service and staff was friendly, very helpful. The beds were amazing! The view from the 34th floor of ground zero was unforgettable. Only had breakfast in the hotel on two occasions. The buffet was well stocked, food was hot and the servers were on task. A bit expensive, but its New York. This is my second time at this hotel and recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,amazing nouns do not do it justice”
Reviews.Author: Prop1410
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. We stayed for four days on a room only basis, and cannot fault anything as a professional employed within the service industry I found the the experience impeccable. If you are looking for a retreat not too far away, there is a great little bar called The Growler on stones street, just off water street. Which offers a relaxed atmosphere with a range of fine beers, wines and spirits, with amazing service. Definitely worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Ground Zero views, great location”
Reviews.Author: jmptrips
Reviews.Content: As a former resident of Battery Park City and an urban designer, I like this hotel with outstanding views to the re-building of Ground Zero. The hotel is a single hall system so every room has a NYC Harbor, Ground Zero and NJ view! A pretty simple place, not a resort but great base camp for business or sightseeing. Nothing overly impressive about the lobby or public spaces, in fact don't expect much there at all! The rooms are spacious, nice big flat screen TV, desk, and floor to ceiling glass for great views!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maconmerlyn
Reviews.Content: Large rooms (by ny standards) and great views of ground zero make this hotel a good choice for those staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Jack L
Reviews.Content: Booked the Millenium Hilton for a business related trip as it was just a block from where I was to meet all week. The location is convenient and with exception of the related noise from construction, peering out the window onto the WTC site is very interesting. Upon arrival at 9 pm, I checked into my room on the 18th floor which was simply unacceptable. Phones were inoperable, internet was inoperable, light bulbs out in the bathroom and a large stain on the bedroom lamp shade. After hours of calling and finally having an IT person unsuccessfully attempting to get the in-room electronics working, the hotel offered to move me to a new room. Repack, move, re-unpack: 11:30 pm; and now have working wired (aka no wireless yet that works in the hotel) internet at the whopping cost of $15 per night per PC. Rooms are a bit tired and worn, although this hotel was supposedly redone in 2003 after damage fromt he WTC attacks. Clearly, housekeeping does not pay attention to dusting the sills of pictures and furniture. And perhaps they're all on a smoke break, as after leaving my room at 8 am and returning at 6 pm, my room had not been cleaned. A call to the front desk and over one hour later: no housekeeping to clean and provide new sheets and towels. Ordering a bland pizza for room service and two diet cokes? $50.00 and some change. Never booking the Millenium Hilton again for work? Priceless. Next time you need to stay in the city, book the Omni Berkshire Place; the rooms were unusually large for NYC and the staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel in good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: knkuk
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here, all the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly. We went to get changed before leaving and there was a large, air conditioned cab waiting to take us to the airport without us even asking! The room, although small was bigger than others we've had in New York, was spotlessly clean, had plenty of towels, much needed air con, great Lavazza coffee maker and lovely toiletries. The decor was generic modern hotel, nothing to complain about, and the bed was soooo comfy after days and nights walking around the city. We were at the front of the hotel which had an amazing view of the World Trade Center site, having thought it would be eerie it was actually very calming to look down on the fountains. We found the location great as this visit we were more interested in the Downtown and SoHo areas which are within easy walking distance and everything else is easily accessible by Metro (3 stations within easy walking distance) and the city sightseeing buses pick up just around the corner. We got a price we were happy with through lowcostusa, and having read on here what others have paid think we saved a good £150 or more on a 2 night weekend stay. The only very minor negative would be that there was no free WiFi, but there was a PC set up in reception so at least we could check in and print our boarding passes for our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great view with corner room”
Reviews.Author: vacnarak
Reviews.Content: My room number 4111 and it's very great view , you can see river and 911 memorial place from your own room . Location is near battery park to take a cruise to liberty island just 10 mins walk world finance building 5 mins Room is like standard Hilton but there is no free wifi anywhere in the hotel. On night time around 10 pm while I stay , there is complimentary apple for free

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEWS!!”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlanner335
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with a group of 30+ coworkers for a meeting/sightseeing trip. This hotel was BEAUTIFUL! The second you walk in the door you know that the hotel is nice. It looks like it has newly been renovated. It is next door to the WTC and the 9/11 memorial site. Most of the rooms look over the 9/11 site which is really cool. There were other complaints of voice from the construction but I never noticed anything. The hotel staff was great. They helped me with directions to different locations that we were going. The only con was that the restaurant and bar closes really early. Other than that it was a great hit with all of my guests. I had one issues with a drunk guy following me to my room but I called security and they were there within minutes to take care of the situation. It was really reassuring that they were so quick to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a location!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel P
Reviews.Content: Stay here and you'll be glad you did! The Staff, room, bed, view, location, are all outstanding! Don't worry about the noise from construction because it's not that bad besides anywhere you stay in this city your going to get a little noise. Try it and you'll love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: mdipierro
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a perfect downtown location. Great views of the 9/11 memorial site. There are lots of subway stops nearby. An easy walk to shopping on Broadway and site seeing on Wall St.

Reviews.Title: “A solemn view of 9-11”
Reviews.Author: steveberry2020
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking views from either towers of the hotel (we were upgraded to a junior corner suite the second night). The hotel is only secondary to the 9/11 Memorial view. Both the day and night views are mesmerizing. Once the other towers on the site are completed, the views will not be the same. Everyone at the hotel from the clerks to the concierge were very helpful and accommodating. It was a stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tara212323
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel and the front desk and doormen were attentive. My room looked out over ground zero so there was noise from the construction site. While the hotel is across the street from the subway so its easy to get around there's nothing in the immediate area to do after 8pm. My big complaint is that the hotel doesn't have Wi-Fi in the rooms(only ethernet/modem access)and charges $14.95 a day for it. Most other hotels i've stayed at charge that price(or lower) for wi-fi. My other complaint is that the housekeeper came into my room when i had the do not disturb sign on my door. I'm not a fan of my privacy being invaded. I stayed here because it was a last minute trip and i got a deal on the room but there are better choices in the city in the same price range that are more centrally located.I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could use some help in minor ways”
Reviews.Author: aeromama
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location is VERY good if going to visit the 9/11 Memorial or have business in lower Manhattan as it is across the street from Ground Zero and around the corner from Fulton St. subway. Beautiful St. Paul Chapel is next door also. Rooms - As a Diamond member I inquired about an upgraded and was happily obliged to a junior suite. Perhaps one of the smallest jnr suites I've seen but was happy anyhow. My biggest complaints, the noise from the A/C system or some central unit with a constant loud hum. You can't fault the hotel for the construction noise during the day, just don't expect to sleep much after 6am when the noise starts. I'm actually in DC now in a quiet hotel and very glad for it! --- My other complaint: the carpet. It could use replacing. The carpet felt sticky on the bottom of my bare feet. This could be from residue from carpet cleaners, but either way, gross and you could still see many stains. -- Last complaint: the food. I ordered several items and they were all average or sub-par and the prices were INSANE. I get it that it's Manhattan, but a $6 6oz diet coke. Seriously? You'll be fine if you avoid the hotel food and over-inflated pricing. The staff were always smiling and kind and helpful so no fault there. I did not like one wait staff member that was there every Tue-Thursday for breakfast. He was a bit gruff and hurried and never once offered a high-chair or seconds on drinks. I will probably stay elsewhere next time, but I'd def stay here again if it were a reward night.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tyng
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Millenium Hilton in September 2011. I was very pleased with everything about the hotel. The room was spectacular. We had a corner room with two windows, one overlooking Brooklyn Bridge the other stature of liberty and 911 Memorial. It is practically impossible to get passes into 911 Memorial right now, there is a limited number of passes and line goes on for ever to get them, but we had a good view of it out of the windows! The room was very comfortable: comfortable mattress, nice linens, coffee maker with two cups that can be brewed at the same time, hairdryer. The room was spacious and well appointed: there was a desk and desk chair with internet access (not free), and a comfortable recliner with ottoman in front of the TV. TV was a 42 inch LCD, I only wish it would swivel to get a better angle of the TV from the bed (but viewing LCD was okay at that angle just not straight on). The location is excellent. There are several subway stations right next to the hotel. Seaport is within an easy walking distance, as are a number of other interesting destinations. We took taxi a few times into the theater district and museums areas which are only a couple of miles away, the taxi ride cost was consistently around $25 because of the traffic and took longer than the subway (but was convenient and less confusing than the subway). The cost of storing the car in the Hilton garage is $55 per day. There are additional charges if you take the car out during the stay. However, once someone sees Manhattan traffic the thought of taking out the car goes away. The only one slight negative: there is construction going on near 911 Memorial. We stayed on 53 floor and there was some noise that can be heard in the room 24 hours a day. I am a very light sleeper but with ear plugs in my ears the noise did not bother me at all. So it was better than I imagined from reading the other reviews before we booked the room. I am attaching 4 photos of the room: 3 photos of the room itself from different angles, and 1 photo of the bathroom. In the night photo that includes the window you can see the lights of the Brookline bridge.

Reviews.Title: “All smokers beware of the Millenium Hilton!! They will try to get $200 out of you.”
Reviews.Author: Ashton79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Millenium Hilton for three nights between 15-17 September 2011. First of all the positives: great location in downtown manhattan, awesome concierge service, stylish lobby bar, decent room size and a great set of staff (bellboys/porters were the best for help with luggage and knowledge of the area). One massive negative: At the end of our second day we came home to find a note pushed under the door, this informed us very vaguely that smoke had been smelt at "this end of the corridor" and smoking was against the law in NY. Now we are both smokers but having been used to non smoking hotels in the UK for the past four years since the smoking ban we were fully aware that lighting up in the hotel room would not be allowed and so at no point at all during our stay did we smoke inside the hotel. Each morning we would go down to the designated smoking station outside the hotel for a cigarette (usually 6am-ish). Then we were out and about until late at night so usually were asleep as soon as our head hit the pillow. Due to this, we read the letter and because it didnt pinpoint our room directly, we honestly thought no more of it (in fact there was a small party going on in the room opposite us the night before so we put it down to this), The second day we returned after a long day of sight-seeing to find our keys didn't work. We were told on reception that the room had been deep cleaned due to us smoking in the room and a charge of $200 to cover this had been automatically applied to my credit card. I was struggling to speak I was so angry with what I was being told. "Cigarette butts and ash have been located in your room this morning" I was informed. This was categorically impossible as we had NOT smoked in the room. The manager then showed me a form that had been completed by housekeeping explaining all of this, and explained that it is their usual procedure to evidence the issue by taking photos to accompany the report, however, the maid had forgotten her camera that day and so no photos were available!!!! (This was laughable - the simple reason why no photos were available is because there was nothing to photograph!) My initial reaction was that they had the wrong room but I was told it was definately where we were residing that they had an issue. My next thought was that this was a scam against those the hotel were aware of as being smokers, there were a couple of open packets of cigarettes in our room as we would take a full packet out with us at the start of a long day, leaving the odd remains of the previous day's packet in the room. - could the maid have mistaken this for "evidence" of smoking in the room? The next day we met with the Housekeeping Manager, a lady called Sylvia. This involved a 20-minute back & forth discussion mainly consisting of them saying "the room smelled of smoke, the housekeeper found butts and ash" and us defending ourselves. I told them that this felt like a scam to get $200 out of those guests who are smokers which they denied it was. I also informed them of the exact times each morning that we had ventured outside for a cigarette (so they could confirm by CCTV if necessary) - why would we bother if we were lighting up in the room anyway? As the discussion was no where near a resolution Sylvia offered to reduce the charge to $100 (exactly what the charge covered was also unclear as nothing appeared to be "cleaner" than the day before). This angered me even more as the cost wasn't the main issue, it was the fact that we were being accused of doing something we hadn't done!. At this point Sylvia informed us that she would sit down with the housekeeper responsible for raising this the previous day and would get back to us straight away. Well, she didnt - and we needed to check out at 12 to get a flight to Vegas. However, we discovered on check out that the charge of $200 had been re-imbursed. I wanted to let any fellow smoking travellers know about this, it made me think of how many times they probably get away with it because individuals do not want the fuss or confrontaton involved whilst on holiday. It definately tainted our experienceof New York, which is a shame, as the rest of the trip including the sights, locals that we met and the food/drink were all fantastic. You picked the wrong room to apply this charge to this time Millenium Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here twice and enjoyed it both times.”
Reviews.Author: KevinMJM
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the Millenium Hilton was in March, 2010. My prior stay was about two years before that. My first stay - booked through Priceline - caused me some concern in that there were online reviews that commented about the Ground Zero construction noise. Fortunately, I arrived early in the day and had the ability to request a room facing away from the construction. The second time around, I booked directly with the hotel. However, since the hotel was fully booked, I could not succeed in requesting the side facing away from construction. Granted, during the day, there was discernible construction noise. However, by bedtime, the noise had stopped. Regardless, the view overlooking Ground Zero was incredible. When my friends came to meet me for dinner, we spent at least half an hour comparing the construction site map with what we saw from the window. The area immediately surrounding the hotel is bustling with activity. There is a Starbucks downstairs and the Century 21 Department store just across the street. Subway transportation is conveniently nearby. This area of Manhattan may not be an obvious choice for NYC visitors. But, if you stay here, expect a comfortable stay in a safe and convenient part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Much better choices in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_in_Britain
Reviews.Content: You know you are off to a bad start when the doorman abuses your taxi driver (in front of other guests) for hooting his horn to get another cab to move. The hotel lobby resembles an office lobby and is relatively charmless. The reception staff were not particularly helpful and seemed to want to impart the minimum amount of information and get you out of there as quickly as possible. The rooms themselves are adequate in size but I have stayed in much larger rooms in NYC. The rooms are tired and are in need of refurbishment. I had a room on the 49th floor which had a great view but the room itself was a let down. There is no Wi-Fi in the room and the Broadband was not exactly quick. At over USD500 a night this hotel was also very poor value for money. Returning to the hotel in the evening required me to show my room key to the security guy in the reception which was a bit odd. If you need to be in Downtown Manhattan or want to have a view of the WTC construction site then the hotel has a great location. If on the other hand you need to be in mid-town or up-town you either face a relatively long taxi ride or subway ride.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking OK but terrible value for money”
Reviews.Author: mikemin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the edge of the WTC construction site which operates 24/7, so take some earplugs. This is not the hotel's fault of course, but the ancient airconditioning unit is, and it too makes a terrible din. The Hilton chain is generally tolerant of smokers, which is something to be grateful for in this city, where the anti-smoking lobby is near-hysterical. Fortunately, the Millenium has one floor of smoking rooms, but it is wallet-bustingly expensive. However, the big disappointment came when I arrived in my smoking room to find cigarette butts in the ashtray and the waste bin still full. The bed was clean, but the room had a grubby air. Housekeeping quickly finished what should have been done before my arrival, but it was a terrible start and unique in my experience. It coloured the rest of my stay. On my first night, full of jetlag, I ordered room service and received soup which looked as if it came straight from a tin and a pizza that consisted of rubber cheese on a cardboard base - the worst pizza ever. Ever hopeful, I tried the restaurant on the next night and had a distinctly average, but very expensive meal. Fortunately, there are a few decent restaurants and bistros nearby and I would recommend these rather than the hotel restaurant. All in all, a disappointing stay and just about the worst value for money I have come across.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LeicJT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great all rounder for service and location, overlooking ground zero and with the metro station outside its doors. The rooms of this hotel are a good size and tastefully decorated with all the facilities you could need and quiet. The staff were very polite and professional even offering to ring our transfer company for us, thanks to all of you for making our stay a pleasure.The only negative thing I have to say is that we chose the hotel for the leisure facilities (pool) and it was freezing, according to the staff 80 degrees, no way, so I missed out on swimming which did take the edge of it and I messaged the manager but never got any response from him!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: jhungtx
Reviews.Content: Staying there for one evening during our last trip to NYC. Noise level was superb. Rooms were large and staff was absolutely fantastic. Would highly recommend it. Used to stay for business, and it certainly didn't disappoint this time around either.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: MelAntIndy
Reviews.Content: While I read many of the reviews on here before booking this hotel, I was still hoping that Hilton would live up to it's great reputation and surprise me with a beautiful hotel right at the heart of ground zero. Maybe I was being too hopeful and a little ambitious and should have take the word of other reviewers on here wih a bit more notice, especially given that I was staying for 9 nights. Upon arrival, the actuall building looked quite nice and well maintained. The foyer and lobby bar on entrance were well looked after and still appeared fairly modern which you would expect from a rather new hotel such as this in comparison to others in the area. But that is where the compliments stop. It is very hard to describe how helpful the staff were as they were all extremely different. The men seemed to all be very helpful and always seemed more than happy to help while I honestly did not meet one female who could even afford a smile. I only dealt with 3 females on the front desk, and they were all very condescending in their approach and seemed to think that their job stopped at processing my payment. They really had no idea on the concept of customer service. When we finally got into our room(junior corner suite) I was pretty shocked at the state of everything. It looked like the hotel had been fitted out in the 80's and never updated since. The bed was very comfortable but probably about average for a Hilton bed. Certainly not as nice as those in Australia but still very comfortable nonetheless. We had wi-fi in our rooms but were expected to pay an exorbitant amount for it so decided against it. given the price of the hotel, and the fact there is a Starbucks downstairs with FREE wi-fi, there is definitely no need to fork out more cash. The showers double as bath tubs which I believe is not acceptable in a decent hotel, especially when decked out with cheap looking shower curtains. The bedroom lighting is very poor with only two small bedside lights for the bedroom. There are other lights for joining rooms which suffice however. We were extremely disappointed with the room service. We stayed during the recent hurricane/tropical storm and understand the limitations this placed on staff, but we were never even told that we would not have room service for the weekend. not that it really mattered, seeing though our room was only made up twice during how ENTIRE stay!!!! Not including the day we were checking out, where we had 2 staff cleaning while we were still in the room trying to relax before our long flight back to Australia. The noise of the construction next door can be annoying at times but we were aware of this from other reviews on here and given the circumstances, it's hard to criticize the hotel for that. During the hurricane we were forced to eat at the hotel restaurant. While I was fairly happy with the quality of food, the service was terrible. We had to wait 30 minutes before we were asked for our order. Then, before we could even finish telling him what we wanted he was off, without even asking for drinks or sides. We also had breakfast there which is ridiculously over priced. $6 for a small glass of orange juice or disgusting coffee? Who are they kidding!!!? We arrived just as the renovations were completed on the restaurant so we were expecting something special. Well, weren't we in for a shock. I seen the before and after photos and i really have no idea why they even bothered. Whether they failed to employ an interior designer or whether they had a budget of $50, I'm not sure, but the renovations were a joke. Apart from the new carpet it didn't look any different. While we were there they started renovations on the lobby bar which I didn't think really needed one anyway and when I left it didn't look like that was going to change much either really. The only plus side to our stay was the help of the concierge. He was a fantastic help and could not do enough to help us find our way around NYC. The only note I have with the concierge is that he finishes quite early and there should be an evening concierge as this is when a lot of patrons are in need of info for somewhere nice to eat. I am a member of the military which entitled me to a great discount. Without this, I would have been even more disappointed(if thats possible). I really hope that this hotel gets it's act together, especially the from desk female staff and improves because at the moment it's a scar on the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a nice price near Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: HPT4Boston
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was very modern and close to several neighborhoods we wanted to check out. It was very convenient to the subway as well. We loved the pool and the Amish market around the corner. They offer Lavazza coffee in your room which is simply amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough for business”
Reviews.Author: BlueIslander
Reviews.Content: A pretty bog standard NY hotel in the financial district downtown, just off Wall St. Rooms are comfortable enough and have views over the World Trade Center site and the Hudson. Well equipped and not too noisy on the high floors. Expensive with no outstanding features but everything you need for a few days in the office.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from the 44th floor”
Reviews.Author: Swissworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: My room was on the 44th floor, on the west side of the bulding. I had an amazing view with the Empire State Building far to the right, many Manhattan towers, the Hudson River and Jersey City. The hotel is very conveniently located if you want to stay in Lower Manhattan. Subway Station "World Trade Center" has an entrance right in front of the main access. You can walk 10 minutes to nice restaurants and places in Tribeca as well as the North Cove Marina with its terraces and its view on Lady Liberty. The room (standard King bed) was big enough according to NY standards, well equipped and very clean. Most of the hotel staff was very friendly and efficient. The pool is small but ok for a quick refreshing bath. The breakfast buffet is nice but very expensive (27 dollars). Finally, I was not disturbed by the construction work during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaZSherman
Reviews.Content: Ended up getting a really good price on this hotel through a last minute booking when the rooms can otherwise be pretty pricey. It was very nice and had modern features. The only issue is that the staff was not very pleasant when checking in. The hotel is located close to many attractions which makes it very easy to get around and experience the town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not memorable, and very expensive”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: The best that can be said for this hotel is that it is in a very convenient location for doing business in the Wall Stree area or elsewhere downtown. The hotel is located directly across Church Street from the WTC site, and is convenient to most downtown locations. My room--on the 15th floor--was nice enough, but not special or memorable. Despite directly overlooking the WTC site and all of the construction going on, construction noise was not a problem--let's face it, most of downtown and midtown Manhattan is noisy anyway, so any construction noise just blended in an was easily ignored (plus, I stayed there 2 days before the 10th anniversary of 9/11, and construction activity was probably slowed down somewhat to accomodate memorial activities). Staff was not rude, but not particularly helpful or friendly. In fact , after checking out in the morning and checking our bags with the bell desk for a few hours, when my travel companions and I came back to the hotel mid-afternoon to pick up our bags from to head to the airport, some overzealous staff member accosted us (and most other patrons) as we walked in the door and demanded we show our room keys (which, having checked out, we didn't have, so we explained that we were there to pick up our bags) and made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome--so much so that he essentially made us feel we needed to wait outside in the 90 degree heat for our airport transportation rather than waiting inside. This may have been attributable to increased security due to the 9/11 anniversary, but as ordinary, unassuming buisnesspeople wearing suits and ties one would think we wouldn't have looked like major security threats. I didn't think it was necessary to give us (and other patrons) the bum's rush. Technogically, my room was about 10 years behind the times. My room did not have wi-fi internet access (though apparently some in the other wing do). In an era when even damn near every Super 8 type motor lodge in places like East Bugtussle, Oklahoma has free wireless high-speed internet acess, it's inexcusable that a place frequented mostly by financial sector businesspeople on buisness trips in the most important financial center of America does not. The only internet access is through a wired ethernet connection, for which you will be charged about $15 a night, on top of the rather jaw-dropping room rate I was charged--and even at that, the router was unplugged when I got my room and required me to trace through a spaghetti bowl of dusty wires under the bed to find where to plug it in an get it powered up. About half the lights didn't work in the room either--I don't know if they were also unplugged or had blown bulbs. The TV was a modern, large flat-screen unit, but the signal was terrible--it looked like something you would see on a TV hooked up to a pair of 1950s rabbit ears. I was charged a rate of right around 500 bucks a night for this room. Even in Manhattan, $500 a night should get you a VERY nice place. This wasn't. Again, it's a great location for those traveling to the financial district on business, and the place is clean and comfortable enough, but overall it's mediocre and highly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton standard rooms but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: sshannon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Labor Day weekend, so first of all, I was a bit jarred, as a recent ex-NYer, by the tourist traffic on the sidewalk, so that perhaps colored my stay, but I did stay in this same hotel on September 11, 2010, in a last minute booking because it was available and I wasn't as affected by the tourist traffic. So, in the next couple of weeks after the 10th anniversary, the location next to the WTC is definitely a factor to consider. Having said that, if you have a room on the WTC side, you can spend some time viewing the site in peace - both times I stayed I had a WTC view even though I didn't request it either time. However, I was disappointed by the amenities at the hotel. I didn't pay a bargain rate for the hotel, so I was a bit dismayed to find out not only is the internet access in the room not wireless, it was also $14.95 a day. I think they get this complaint a lot because when I was trying to plead my case as a Hilton Honors member to the front desk, the front desk person corrected my $15 to $14.95 and just repeated the wired complaint like it was a matter of fact. I can deal with the internet charge, but then it became about the little things. The ice machine on our floor was broken, and we called down to report it. Nothing was done to address the broken machine during our two day stay. And finally, the elevators were ...taxed. Several times we waited five or more minutes for the elevators. None of this is tragic, and if my rate was less than $300, I probably wouldn't have noticed. Housekeeping was excellent, the room was comfortable, and the tv worked well, as I would expect from a Hilton hotel. I probably won't stay here again, unless I get a good deal, because the internet charge effectively raises the rate, and for me, the hyper NYer, the slow elevator is really problematic. But overall, its a decent hotel in an interesting location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but one problem”
Reviews.Author: ls74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you would expect from a Hilton, nice room, clean, reasonable size (for NYC). The location is very good in terms of transportation (E and R stations are few steps from the hotel), but until construction in the WTC site end, it is somewhat noisy. The reasons I gave it 3 and not 4 are the construction and because at check in we were told that there are no rooms not facing the construction (when making the reservation we asked a room not facing the construction), which we soon learned is not true! That is something that I wouldn'tt expect at a Hilton (lies to customs)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average amenities”
Reviews.Author: gone_aforeign
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on Church street and close to various points of interest in Manhattan. The hotel staff was friendly and forthcoming but the room seemed rather basic. Another drawack was, that there is no wireless interenet in the rooms. If you have an Ipad, you need to do your work in the lobby. Also, there was no complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: DanWh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Aug 2011. Hotel is located right next to ground zero. work shuts down for the most part during the night but starts early in the morning. The hotel also has closed the restaurant and bar for renovations. There is a Starbucks right next door so that is a good alternative for breakfast. Rooms are fine with flat screen TV's and very nice toiletries but otherwise the furnishings are feeling a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and interesting view”
Reviews.Author: Mulliganm
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. The last time was about 6 years ago. The view continues to be very interesting looking straight out on ground zero. You get a much better perspective on what is going on that you would form the street. Probably worth the staying here to see this. There are some renovations going on in the lobby and a bar however, unless you're looking to use the hotel bar you probably won't notice. I wasn't bothered by any sound from the renovations. The door to the hallway in my room didn't seem to do much to stop noise from the hallway, however, this was only occasional and not related to the renovations - just people coming and going from their rooms. The hotel is also well located in terms of subway transportation with an entrance to one line right outside the hotel and another larger station a block or so away. Work on both of these is ongoing and the line outside the door should be ready for both uptown and downtown travel in the next few days (it currently only goes uptown). The front desk was also helpful. When I arrived early on a Sunday morning no rooms were ready, however, they helpfully took my cell number and called as soon as someone had checked out and a room was ready. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. Only real complaint would be charging $14.95 for a day of internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina M
Reviews.Content: The hotel had all of the perks we were looking for with just one night in the city. The room was spacious, modern, and clean. The views, from any side of the hotel, were absolutely stunning. We were spoiled with Peter Thomas Roth bath products (which I spend a fortune on at home). The location was great - easily accessible for the rest of the city. And on top of all that, the staff was very helpful and courteous. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “historic location”
Reviews.Author: shivaniii
Reviews.Content: the WTC site is historic for all of us.Staying in a room facing the new construction 10 years after the ill fated event was very memorable..we liked the hotel rooms and the awesome view from the windows..we stayed on a saturday nite and didnt have any construction noises. Clean and a good hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aris_DeO
Reviews.Content: Millenium Hilton in Financial District was a very pleasant stay. Great deal for the service and room ambience you get for a weekend in Manhattan. Depending where in Manhattan you plan to go out the most taxi can get to be a bit much. Staff was very helpful, professional and of great service. Def worth requesting a room with window view...Although hotel is by a reconstruction site view will still be memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, pulled fire alarms, soaking wet floor, noise-need I say more!”
Reviews.Author: nursenomo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location to WTC site. However, construction was ongoing across the street. We are talking both SAT and SUN I awoke to loud noise from cranes, machines etc.!!!!!! To top that all off, the last day of my stay, I found 5 dead bugs in my bed and the shower had never drained properly so we were constantly stepping on soggy wet flooring. Don't be lured by the $200 per night price at this hotel. It is NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “#3rd time around”
Reviews.Author: carlatm
Reviews.Content: This is a great downtown hotel. It is directly across from the 9/11 site. From your room you can see all the work that is being done. But no you don't hear a thing. Rooms are large and comfortable, price is reasonable. Hotel is short walking distance to Battery Park for strolling boat rides restaurants. A completely different part of Manhattan, feels like you are somewhere else. Breakfast is delicious and they have a great pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good option in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Millenium in several years (since pre-9/11) and I found the experience to be very good. It is very convenient for business in the Wall Street area. I got a great rate on a junior suite on the 29th floor that had a separate sitting area and a good sized bathroom. The bed was firm and comfortable. There was some noise 24/7 from the World Trade Center construction. It didn't bother me, but could be a problem on a lower floor. Be sure to ask for a quiet room on check in.

Reviews.Title: “Besides the view, underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: kingbobIII
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in May 2011 on business. Pros: stunning view of the WTC site; comfortable bed; decent price. Cons: Some noise from WTC site; terrible service over the room phone (wake-up call, area restaurants, etc.); inexplicably poor-working room phone; cramped room and below-average bathroom; poor cab service - i had to stand in the rain to hail a cab with no help from staff; and underwhelming buffett breakfast (not included). I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location and Great service”
Reviews.Author: bntzmimi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really convenient for lower Manhattan attractions. A very quick 5 minutes walk to Battery Park and Wall Street. The hotel has been completely renovated and has very nice sized rooms for NYC. The staff could not have been more personable and wonderful. There is construction happening all around since it's directly across from ground zero, but I can't say we were bothered by it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View, Nice & Modern Rooms - Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Val S
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic views, nice rooms, but a little noise from the WTC construction. You can't find a better price for a 4 Star hotel in NY. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: jakajuda
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in order to see a "Fringe" musical in Greenwich Village. The rooms were spacious and immaculate with an amazing view of Trade Center construction, Brooklyn Bridge, and Hudson River.
