The only negatives was that the restaurant was being renovated, and there were not a lot of choices within a couple of blocks of hotel., and I could not get the internet to connect in the room. The price was below average for the area (and we searched obsessively via the internet), and it was a great value given the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Col-and-Kim
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I were planning our honeymoon there was one place we both agreed that we wanted get to regardless of everything else and that was New York. We were lucky in that I have a friend who has lived in New York his whole life and he was good enough to pick us up at the airport and take us to the Millenium Hilton. It wasn't the easiest for him to get to the hotel with all the roads being cut off for the construction work at the WTC, but he did a fantastic job and got us there with very little hassle. The hotel was very nice. We had a king room that overlooked the WTC site. I remember reading reviews about the construction noise being an issue, but we didn't hear a thing during our stay. The room itself was well appointed and suited our needs perfectly. It was very comfortable. On the first morning before we headed out to explore the city we stopped off at the concierge desk. While we were there Joseph booked us tickets to Jersey Boys for that evening and also booked us in for dinner before the show. He was a great help and very courteous. Thanks to our friend from New York we had a good grasp of where to go and how to get there. The hotel has is within a short walk of three subway stations which was the easiest way to get around the city. We took the R train right outside our hotel to 34th street (Herald Square) which put us right next to the Empire State Building. From there we explored all around the city. That night we had an absolutely wonderful dinner where I had possibly the best steak of my life. Then we saw Jersey Boys (in very good seats). It was a great day spent in a great city. The next day we spent some time shipping some things home which only took a short walk down the street. Then we walked to Battery Park and took the Staten Island ferry across the river and saw the Statue of Liberty. After that we walked around Wall Street, Bowling Green and onto Brooklyn Bridge. There is plenty to do and see in lower Manhattan and we took advantage of staying in that area to its fullest. Later that afternoon we had a well deserved dip in the pool to cool off our tired feet. That night we had a nice meal in the hotel restaurant. On our last day we were able to check out and put our bags into storage so we could spend a few more hours seeing the sights before we had to catch our plane. We could not fault the hotel or the staff as they were all very helpful. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, conveniently situated”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I can't say it was great, it wasn't, but it wasn't bad either if you just wan't a base to explore NYC. Its right next to the building site that is the new world trade center and when we stayed they were working 24/7 and its quite noisy. The hotel restaurant was also closed for refurbishment - no big deal really, and the subway next to the hotel is also undergoing refurbishment (presumably for the new WTC site) so we had to walk a couple of blocks for the subway. Its well placed for the financial district and battery park (for Liberty and Ellis Island cruises) and its only a 10 minute walk from the Seaport (nice shops and restaurants). Hotel was clean, staff were polite and helpful - it will be nice when its all finished (including the WTC).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmylou302
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel looked very modern and grand and the inside recpetion was well kept, clean and tidy. Rooms were fantastic; great size, huge windows, comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and gave some great advice on where to go and what to see. Even though you could walk everywhere (if you had the time to!) there's a subway right outside. Altohugh it was a touch expensive, we had a great stay, and would be very happy to come back as well.

Reviews.Title: “good for business downtown.”
Reviews.Author: C_A_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Location: for business travelers with meetings downtown, great. Otherwise rather poor unless your willing to walk far or pay to travel to an area with more restaurants, activities, etc. Rooms: Decent size for NY, clean, comfortable bed, didnt like fact shower was tub with curtain. Restaurant: No idea, its under renovation for next cpl months ( until Sept i believe) Staff: From my few interactions, they were nice and helpful. Concierge: he was on 'lunch break' when i needed help at 630 pm for a dinner reservation, so not sure if he/she is helpful. The front desk substituted, and all things considered did a good job ( once i gave them the names of restaurants i may be interested in) Lobby: rather small given the size of the hotel Gym/Pool: didnt see or try

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, awesome view of ground zero.”
Reviews.Author: SarahinFrisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel July 28-August 1, 2011. The view of the hudson river was beautiful..we were on the 38th floor facing ground zero. It was a very moving experience to see ground zero that way. We could see the new fountains they are making for the memorial on the footprint of the old buildings. I really spent time reflecting about that day. Besides that experience, the location was great to access all of lower manhattan as well as subways and taxi's anywhere you want to go. The rooms were clean and the staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: meggreg2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We sprung for a junior suite, so our room was quite spacious and we had a view overlooking Century 21 and the new WTC construction. We knew about the construction ahead of time and were interested in seeing how the rebuilding project was coming along. The view was actually pretty sweet! And the noise was very minimal - it didn't keep us up or anything like that. The room itself was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. If you're planning a trip to NY and want to do the downtown touristy stuff, this is a great place to stay - essentially on top of the WTC, walking distance to Battery Park City, Statue of Liberty tours, Wall Street, etc. There's also a subway stop nearby - maybe a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Financial District Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights for combo of business and vacation - beginning a tour of New England and Canada with family (wife and two sons 11 & 8). This is a great location for a variety of reasons - transit, sightseeing, and dining options within walking distance. Transit - There is a subway station at the steps of the hotel (northbound only during WTC rebuild) but southbound stations are only short walks away. The PATH subway is only around the corner and a convenient way to arrive from Newark Penn Station (we took a cab from Newark Airport to Newark Penn Station and the PATH from there to the WTC station). I had a corner jr. suite (if you plan far enough ahead, you can get relatively decent rates on jr suites) on the 44th floor with a great view of the WTC site out one window and a great view north to midtown and the skyline out the other. The room was very clean and everything was in good working order. Pretty spacious, considering it is Manhattan. The only complaint I have with the room is that there is no wireless internet - hard-wired only. The pool seemed kind of cold, but it was the only hotel I could find in the area with a pool, so we had no problem getting used to it! It was actually pretty decent sized, all things considered. There is also a hot tub, which was very nice and relaxing after days of work and/or sightseeing. We ate breakfast in the restaurant daily, it was a pretty good buffet (you can also order off the menu). The entire hotel staff was very friendly, doormen, concierge, front desk, housekeeping, etc. There are a few fast food places around within a few minute walk and Chinatown and Little Italy are only about 15-20 minute walks. Walk east toward the East River and you will find a great selection of restaurants and shops right on the waterfront. This was the perfect location for our family (especially with the pool) for our trip. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel5856
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to NYC for my birthday, and we stayed at the Hilton Milenium Downtown. Everything was perfect from check in to check out. The front desk staff is very friendly, the sleeping room very nice. The sleeping room is tastefully decorated, though a bit small. Being small is somewhat of a given in New York, though, so this was not an issue for us. The housekeeping staff was very efficient and thorough, the bar is quite nice, and one concierge was extremely helpful in getting us tickets for an event we wanted to go to. The entire staff was professional, yet courteous at the same time. If I had one negative thing to say is that our room on the 8th floor had a direct view to Ground Zero. The view was very somber, but it is not the fault of the hotel at all, and is an unfortunate part of America's history. The hotel is very convenient to good shopping in Century 21, Starbucks just around the corner, and subways. Millenium is also very near the financial district just a few blocks from Wall Street with more good shopping. Many sights and activities are within walking distance, but if you want to go somewhere a little farther, a doorman is always available and ready to help hail a cab. I definitely plan to stay at this hotel again on my next birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Some of NY's best views”
Reviews.Author: MGD54
Reviews.Content: Most pleasant Manhattan experience -- helpful and very professionally friendly check-in staff (Arturo), great and spacious room on the 49th floor with incredible views. On one side, the majestic Brooklyn Bridge, NY's City Hall and many historic high-rise office buildings, on the other side the rebirth of Ground Zero and further, the Statue of Liberty. What more to wish for? And if downtown with its business district and shopping opportunities is not your destination, within one or two blocks from the hotel, the subway brings you into the heart of Manhattan in a heartbeat -- take the express lines to Grand Central or Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not classy but functional”
Reviews.Author: Puteshestvenik5
Reviews.Content: For those expecting high fliers wall street luxury experience - don't . This hotel has a nice facade , but feels pretty busy ; a bit sort of rundown, and somewhat crowded. Quuite a lot of various tourists ; the front desk is busy with no classy touches one would expect from hilton in this area. No business lounge. The rooms are ok (we stayed in suite). There are subway station all around this hotel - so public transportation uptown is good. Decent hotel to stay in New York, but don't expect to be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: uwland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NYC for 4 nights, and we wanted to stay near the Soho area. We had a very satisfactory stay at the Millenium Hilton overall. The location is great as it is close to 3 subway lines. Service was good overall and we were happy with our room which overlooked Ground Zero. There was an engine noise that continued into the night that came from Ground Zero during our first night there. It could be disruptive to sleep. That didn't happen over the next 3 nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: caly1
Reviews.Content: nice place, room, staff. good experience. I got our rooms at about half off, which helped my pov I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and Breakfast ...”
Reviews.Author: Bariloche-61
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in July 2011 in the Millenium and again I enjoyed them. We stayed in the 53rd floor and were able to enjoy on our first day a view of the Liberty Statue. Unfortunately the progress of the various buildings on Ground Zero was too quick and already on the second and third day one had only limited view left. In a few days this view will have gone. Until mid September 2011 the lobby and the restaurant on the 3rd floor are re-done - breakfast is possible in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Staying Here is Like A History Lesson”
Reviews.Author: DentwomanofDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful with all the standard amenities. And the views! The Brooklyn Bridge side is fascinating in the daytime when the East River is alive with water taxis, ferries, sailboats and tour boats. At night, with the bridges lit up, it's quite lovely and romantic. The World Trade Center side has equally spectacular views of the Hudson River and it's flotilla of ferries and pleasure cruisers. But, in addition, you are looking down onto the site of the World Trade Center as it rises to reinvent itself while memorializing the events of 9/11. The original footprints of the Twin Towers are clearly outlined by cascading pools of water. The dramatic lines of the museum are starting to take shape. As many as 3,000 construction workers are committed to having the work completed by the tenth anniversary. It's haunting and uplifting and just an incredible experience to witness. I will never forget my stay at the Millenium Hilton and look forward to going back, someday, to stroll amongst the trees being planted at the World Trade center site in memory of those who were lost.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRSFLAME
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over 4th of July weekend. Our room was clean, and very spacious. Staff was friendly and attentive. Although the hotel is downtown, it is very easy to hop the subway and get around. It is also within walking distance to South Street Seaport. Check in process was a breeze. The pool and spa area was clean and a pleasure to use. My favorite place to stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here again and were not disappointed. The rooms are big for NYC and sparkling clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a great view of the re-building of One World Trade center and the river. It is all the way downtown and may not be convenient for everybody but it was a perfect location for what we were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dark ages internet”
Reviews.Author: The_Hoffs_11
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay overall - overlooking Ground Zero and with wonderful views, especially if you're higher up (we stayed 40th floor). Good facilities (gym, pool) and helpful concierge, receptionist etc. Only downer was the fact that they don't have WIFI, and you have to plug in via one of those old school wires (my Mac didn't even have the right docking plug). Apparently they're upgrading it by the end of the year, but the receptionists said that this had been chatted about for years and still hadn't happened. If internet access if important to you, maybe choose somewhere else. Booking through hotwire is also good.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite NYC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheAirwaves
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for around 30 nights since May 2010 and this place always leaves me more relaxed than the last stay. The location is excellent and the staff is wonderful. The doorman are very attentive and keep up with the high volume very well. The front desk team has great suggestions and makes you feel taken care of. The rooms are beautiful and not too small for your typical NYC trip. I will say tho after staying in a corner junior suite, I don't think I'd ever not pay the extra for it. They are so comfortable! The breakfast buffet is great, but be careful if you're with your family. You can spend more than $100 for breakfast for a family of 4. The upstairs bar in the evening was a little quiet, and prices were to be expected. I love the close proximity to the R, N, and 4 trains. The location is wonderful in lower manhattan. I will stay every future trip to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and great service!”
Reviews.Author: kathywb
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, great location, and you can watch the new Towers being built at Ground Zero. We have stayed there before and always find the hotel to be of a high standard. We got a great weekend rate too!

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th stay at this hotel - home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Kin_DCWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This last visit to NYC, July 14 to July 18, marks our 5th stay at the Millenium Hilton, and I feel we must join in the chorus of praises for this outstanding Hilton. The front desk staff, Graphika and Arturo in particular, have always extended themselves, way beyond the call of duties, to help us and other guests feeling welcomed and comfortable. And even though Hilton hotels have always impressed us, I simply must place Rutger Vandenberg, the Front Office manager, in a class by himself. As usual during other stays, there are some pleasant surprises this time: for instances, on two of the days, we found complimentary apples during HH in the lobby. The rest of the staff, from the concierges, bell captain, bell boys and housecleaning staff, are always pleasant, helpful and polite. There is just one minor nuisance during this visit: the FAN button of the AC is always set to automatic and cannot be changed to ON or OFF. But it did not distract us from enjoying this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton Fan”
Reviews.Author: BillNWarwick_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner Junior Suite July 3 & 4. We enjoyed the usual great service & well cleaned room. This review has to do with one unfortunate circumstance. Our room had a southern & western exposure. July 4 was a very warm day and after returning after a long hot day of activities we were looking forward to resting and maybe a nap before dinner and the fireworks. Our room was like an oven, the thermostat was already on it's highest position and it showed the room was 82*. It was way too late to even think of changing rooms or have the A/C serviced. I don't know if it was just that room or a problem throughout the hotel with the same SW exposure. If you are staying there this summer in a room with a SW exposure be sure to leave a note to the maid with her tip to keep the heavy drapes drawn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Medicjoel
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Great views. Great rates. Great location. Will stay here again. The staff went above and beyond and the room was better than perfect. Heard no construction noise inside the hotel and room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor service”
Reviews.Author: JF-STL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in NY many times at the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park, the Millenium Hilton is no Ritz. I immediately got the impression that the hotel staff dislike their jobs and readily blame guests for their own poor service. Less than average level of service for the $$$. The hotel is in a great location however at the price of WTC's 24hr/day construction noise. Constant droning from large construction crane sounded like someone parked a running bulldozer outside the hotel until 5am every day of my two plus week stay. The hotel when asked about the construction noise told me that there is no construction during the night. Well... I saw and heard people working around the clock during my entire stay. My very comfortable bed couldn't help me sleep through the noise. Warning - if you stay here for business and anticipate receiving packages from FedEx, you will need to camp out at the dock otherwise you may never see your packages. The hotel claims the dock is staffed 24hrs/day however FedEx was unable to deliver packages on several occasions because no one was there to accept delivery. Of course the hotel said that is not possible, someone is always there to accept delivery. Several times much needed packages were delivered a day or more late, even after FedEx confirmed they were delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Top option in SOHO”
Reviews.Author: QuincyPup
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a couple of times before and each time has been enjoyable. Rooms are clean and updated and staff are friendly and helpful. Most rooms have a terrific view of the WTC construction site and elevator lobbies a good view towards Brooklyn. A great concierge is worth a fortune and in Joseph they have one, he even helped me find a place to get a new EZpass. Internet is ethernet, not wifi, but works well.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK experience”
Reviews.Author: DrSYu
Reviews.Content: I am bias... I am a HHonors Diamond Member... so, I am bias... The hotel is a bit rundown. The room decor looked tired. Seems the same as the last time I went to NYC (before 911). It was walking distance to Wall Street and next to Century 21. WOW! Commuting to NEWARK was easy via PATH. I get upgraded to junior suite but overlooking at the 911 site. The bed and pillow was GREAT! Breakfast was disappointed. Our flight back to London was 9pm. So, we checked out and left our luggage with the Bells. However, instead of putting our luggage securely in the locker room, it was just left out in the hotel lobby for 4 hours!!!! Luckily, they were NOT stolen. Trust me, if we were not rushing for the flight, I would have made a BIG COMPLAINT on that. Disappointed on the service!

Reviews.Title: “Changed perspective; changed offerings”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Since I last reviewed this hotel, my favorite NYC hotel has closed (The Embassy Suites Battery Park). Therefore, my perspective is not as slanted as it was previously. Furthermore, the hotel has since begun offering free internet for Gold/Diamond members, as well as free breakfast for our group. I was impressed by the allowances they made when, needing to drop my son off before returning our rental car, they allowed me to park near the Fulton St. entrance for 20 min so I could get checked in and luggage to the room. The staff is friendly, the views are amazing, the room is clean - and the location excellent. The rooms are still somewhat compact (this is NYC, after all), but they are pleasant. The location in lower Manhattan will keep me returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JPortuese
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Manhattan! Hotel was extremely clean, hotel staff was friendly and helpful! Located a bit far from Times Square but the Subway is directly in front of the hotel. Amazing views of the progress on the World Trade Center site! Restaurant within the Hotel is very pricey but good.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service and best New York hotel I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: KMC2011
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hilton for two nights in late June while I waited for a moving company to deliver furniture to my new apartment in Manhattan. After the moving company had to postpone my move date due to an equipment failure two hours after I checked out of the hotel, I was stuck for the night with nowhere to stay. After getting off the phone with the movers, I headed back to the hotel, hoping they'd have ANYTHING available so I wouldn't have to carry all of my suitcases to another place and expecting to pay a lot more, since it was very last-minute on a holiday weekend and my previous reservation had been made via Priceline at a steep discount from the advertised price. Not only did the desk staff offer me back my original room several hours before check-in (already cleaned up and looking great) after asking whether I had liked it , they booked it for me at a very reasonable price only slightly higher than I'd paid for the first two nights. To make matters worse for my move, I was told by the apartment building management that I couldn't move anything in until the following week, so the Hilton extended my reservation for an additional two nights at the price they quoted me earlier. If I ever need to stay at another hotel in NYC, it'll be this one! As a note, I've seen some complaints about the construction in the area (post-9/11 WTC rebuilding), but I wasn't bothered by it at all despite being a troubled sleeper. It is a little noisy if you're outdoors in the area during the day, but from my room, I never heard more than a low hum that was almost completely muffled when the A/C was running. And I actually enjoyed the view of the Freedom Tower being built - can't wait to see the final result!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good business location long way to shoppping and other sights”
Reviews.Author: mantra1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in June while passing through New York. Its a lovely hotel but I wouldn't stay here again simply because I love walking around central park and Time Square etc but its very far away from all these places and the best shopping. We found it really difficult to get taxis as they all prefer the shorter runs, it cost us a fortune coming and going as all the restaurants we like are up the other end too. We would have stayed in the Waldorf for what we spent on taxis! Its a nice hotel if you wnat to around the business district or ground zero area.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Jschmidlapp5
Reviews.Content: Checking in for a brief one night stay, had to change rooms twice due to that yucky mildewy bathroom smell that can permeate a small hotel room. Construction noise all night compounded with our neighboring room have a rockin party in the middle of the night, made for an undesirable stay. Better luck next time for us.

Reviews.Title: “Less than my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Travelroyal
Reviews.Content: It was rated as four star. The location is excellent as it overlooks the whole World Trade Centre construction. The room is standard size and we have been given one on high floor and facing the water as the world trade centre is still under construction. We appreciated that gesture. The hallway desperately needs update. The bath tub has a poor drainage and when I notified them, they were not too keen to know more or to show any concern. It seems to be a common problem for an old hotel. The rest did measure up to Hilton standard. We did not have free wifi, and the cost of breakfast is $28 per person. Each local phone call costs $1.50.

Reviews.Title: “It is in the middle of a construction site”
Reviews.Author: ukysses
Reviews.Content: Not a good choice. Go elsewhere. Anywhere. Noise. Bad lobby inadequate elevators. Bad expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, rooms ok, service no thanks”
Reviews.Author: londonmatDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the 30th floor and had excellent views overlooking the World Trade Center Site. Unlike other reviewers have pointed out we didn't get earplugs, so better bring your own as you will here some noise ftom construction work. Staff at reception wasn't really friendly or welcoming and when asked about driving times to La guardia airport the receptionist insisted we would need an hour by cab on a saturday morning-it took us just a bit more than 15 minutes. When we arrived there was no bellboy and nobody assisting with luggage- unusual for a city centre Hilton. Our room was spacious with two of those comfortable Hilton beds, however room could have been cleaner like the whole hotel. Fitness centre needs maintenance and a thorough cleaning. All in all not what we expect from a Hilton and are a bit disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Coder82
Reviews.Content: My stay here was marvelous. I was a bit concerned about construction noise after reading several reviews here, but those fears turned out to unfounded, at least when I stayed here mid-June. Being on a high floor certainly helped, but we may just have gotten lucky with the noise as I didn't notice much noise even on the street. The service was better than expected, even from Hilton. The front desk staff had no issue letting us check in a bit early when we arrived or leave our bags the last day. Everyone we dealt with was very polite and efficient. Housekeeping staff were very pleasant and actually tidied up the room twice a day. We were upgraded to a junior suite on a high floor, which was a pleasant surprise. The views from the room were phenomenal: WTC construction site on one side, statue of liberty on another, and a view of the Brooklyn bridge next to the elevator. The room was spacious, very clean, with all the amenities one would expect, including one of the most comfortable beds ever. Finally, the location is great. Directly beside one subway station and a minute or two walk from at least two others makes getting anywhere in NYC a breeze. Getting BACK, however, isn't quite as easy on the weekends due to Cortlandt station being under construction (downtown only) and the limited train service to downtown on the weekends (we ended up in Brooklyn on accident due to all trains being express).. The Church & Dey restaurant on the third floor is nice and has a decent breakfast, but for $23 per person it's about three times what it should be. Unless you get breakfast comped, pass on that. There are so many cheap, good places to eat in the city that there's no reason to eat here unless you are in a rush or, again, if you get it comped by the hotel. This hotel is pricey, as are all nice places in Manhattan, but if you have the cash to spare it is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great service”
Reviews.Author: simonallardice
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton offers excellent access to battery park, financial district, WTC and the Subway system. If you're looking to get to Times Sq etc then it's an easy journey on the E. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Jr. Suite with views over the WTC and to the Empire State, truly magnificent both day and night. The staff are very friendly and helpful. You should probably be aware that the walls seem pretty thin, both night I could hear my neighbours. All in all, a great place to stay and I'll certainly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “For business what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: tringuyen82
Reviews.Content: stayed several days in the corner room: pros: view is fantastic (corner room) good prox to wall street firms good view of WTC, esp from work out room indoor pool modern updated decor decent food from hotel service, but inconsistent, ordered margerhita pizza several times, prepared differently every time (but you should be eating out anyway) good size for new york standards, didnt feel like i was working on the bed the entire stay used free show shine service clean room, a/c worked fine, flat screen, menu was only on the tv channel Cons: cant think of much, worked throughout the stay, required a bit of taxing to get to midtown/uptown for restaurants. its pretty far south TIP: nobody wants to taxi you back downtown during rush hour... they cant find fares back uptown Cant imagine people would complain much unless you had a unique situation? Its a decent hotel, its a four star priced and maintained property... its a hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The Best We have had in meny years!”
Reviews.Author: Richlandtown
Reviews.Content: Love the service here!! We started staying here for the indoor pool for our young daughter and have continued to stay. The staff recognizes us every time we arrive and are like familia!! The fact that Century 21 is located right next door is a definite plus! My hubbie likes to shop! I would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Special if you like NYC”
Reviews.Author: Handyman301
Reviews.Content: A wall of windows overlooking the World Trade Center and NY harbor. Maybe not for everyone, but dazzling for anyone with ties to the city. The room and staff were way larger than most NY hotel rooms, clean and with everything working. It's a great base if you want to explore lower Manhattan and the transportation access is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Awesome views....but far from everything uptown!”
Reviews.Author: jase369
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with very comfortable rooms and great views. It is far from anything uptown so if that's where you want to be (Times Square, Ventral Park, etc...) look elsewhere. But if you dont mind a nice walk or taking the subways, this hotel can not be beat for price compared to quality. Parking garage is a bit expensive, but they all are in NYC. Staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible Nyc trip.”
Reviews.Author: mahboodroe
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great weekend and have to thank the Millennium for a big part of it. Everything from early check in to the fantastic view everything went without a hitch. Though we where on the eighth floor directly across from ground zero we heard no construction noise. Andrew in the lobby bar is not only a mixologist but also a great comedian and conciere. We have no problem recomending this fin establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: We overlooked the WTC construction site, at which construction DOES go on even on weekends and at night. It was a bit loud but not overwhelmingly so. The hotel staff is okay; rooms were okay. Nothing to write home about. It IS across the street from Century 21, though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly and attentive staff, clean room... Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTimeTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The staff were friendly and attentive. Our room was very small, but it was clean and quiet with spectacular views. The bathroom was clean, the towels and bed linens were clean.The hotel arranged all of our transport and the staff were very helpful in giving directions/advice on where to go/what to see/do, etc. Overall, it was a lovely experience! I would stay there again, and I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Meplusd
Reviews.Content: Get a corner room... After a night in the city, looking out over 9/11 memorial project, statue of liberty, etc... Just really beautiful. Far from the theater district - but close enough to little Italy and soho. Big, clean rooms with great views at a good value

Reviews.Title: “Average and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelMasta
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a stunning location right next to the WTC. Its slim design limits the number of rooms per floor and affords most rooms with stunning views of the WTC site and the Hudson. It is literally on-top of transit with easy subway connections uptown. However, that's the extent of its positives. The rooms are small and the decor is tired and worn out. It reminds me of dated Hilton's in 2nd rate cities accross the country, and does not feel like a flagship property in Lower Manhattan. For $460/night (not including a $15/day charge for an unreliable and slow internet connection) I would at least expect a toilet without a broken handle and bathroom counters that were not covered in dust. If this property was not located adjacent to the office where my business meetings were being held I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for NYC”
Reviews.Author: bossenSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in May 2011 with my wife. Not our first visit to NYC but he first to this hotel.We think the Millenium Hilton is the best hotel in town! Spacious and beautiful rooms, great views over WTC, and no disturbing noise from the construction work going on there. We had the full buffet breakfast each morning and it was delicious.Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, bread, yoghurt, cereals, fruit...plenty of food! Can´t understand the other reviews but I guess they did not go for the full buffet then. The location of the hotel is perfect with the metro station just outside, the outlet store:Century 21 across the street , and walking distance to Battery park and the free Staten Island ferry. We had dinner on our last evening at the restaurant Les Halles just a few blocks away and wished we had found it sooner. Wonderful food. Really recommend the roasted red beets with goat cheese or the salmon for starter, and the Filet bouef béarnaise for main course.It will melt in your mouth! We would like to extend our gratitude towards JOSEPH the concierge who went out of his way and helped us out on departure day when our voucher for the transportation we had booked had got lost somehow. He made several phone calls and what not to help us locate it and later made sure we got on safely to the airport. That´s a service minded person for sure! Perfect for his job. Highly recommend this hotel. We will stay here again for our next visit to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting views of WTC”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreNYClover
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (Friday night) with myself and two teenage sons. Got a very reasonable price directly through Hilton website for a Junior Suite (under $220). It was a corner room with one king bed and a pull out sofa. There was plenty of room for the three of us (naturally) but when we first walked in it felt somewhat cramped for a suite. It's just that visually, I always expect more volume from a suite when I first walk into it. The way these rooms are set up, they don't "feel" as spacious as they actually are (if that makes sense). Our room overlooked the ongoing construction of the WTC and the Hudson River to the west and a view of the city to the north. The WTC worksite is really something to see, it's not everyday you can sit and observe a skyscraper being built (Freedom Tower). Amazing. Truly amazing. And we would not have had that birds eye view if we had not chosen this particular hotel. Other than that, it was a typical Hilton Hotel which is fine. Not great. Oh, the boys loved the swimming pool and suana on the 5th floor, that's also something special about this hotel. I do prefer trendy, chic hotels but with the WTC worksite in full swing right now, I think this is a great time to stay at this hotel. And in our room, there was absolutely no construction noise at all (Room 3211).

Reviews.Title: “Best value in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jacquibr123
Reviews.Content: I'm a new yorker but live in a shoe box ... so when my mom came for a visit I splurged and booked a room here. The staff could not have been more helpful and accomadating ... big rooms for nyc standards ... a Starbucks in the lobby ... every major subway within fifteen feet and peter Thomas roth products! plus ... a Lovely sun drenched pool and sauna ... if you have concern over the noise from ground zero don't ... we were in 3001 and heard nothing!

Reviews.Title: “excellently comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sieramaestra
Reviews.Content: 1) Faster turn around time 2) good room service 3) hot and well maintained swimming pools 4) Excellent gyming facility 5) Situated in the heart of NY financial district 6) cheerful and courteous staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhyta
Reviews.Content: we had great time staying there for 4 days ,the hotel location is Great ,mall across the street great view from the 46 th floor you can watch the constructionsite and the statue of liberty from the window ,rooms are very clean ,bed sooo confortable ,BUT one thing missing WIFI in the rooms very disapointing,i enjoyed my stay and will surely be back when i 'll be visiting NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, No Internet!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRM017
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the large size of the comfortable room, which seemed enormous by NYC standards. Very clean, too. There were no special amenities, which I found surprising for such an expensive downtown hotel. But the room was perfectly nice. BUT the hotel has a significant problem for the business traveler: There is no WiFi in the room; the hotel provides only an ethernet hookup, which of course will not work with a modern laptop with no ethernet port. The staff had no solution to this problem. This is an enormous problem for a business hotel. It's in the financial district, how can it have no in-room internet service?! In fact, if I had known about it I would have found a different hotel. The hotel then has the temerity to charge for lobby-only WiFi. Not okay and it's enough to keep me from rebooking. Also, the breakfast buffet was lame--essentially a Days Inn buffet for $30. Really overpriced for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT ATMOSPHERE”
Reviews.Author: kv-dallas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 6 times in the last year at this hotel. Each time I have had a wonderful, enjoyable stay. I finally decided I needed to give proper credit to the staff at this hotel. The hotel is located directly across the street from ground zero. A nice walk to China town or Little Italy. Try going the opposite way; a nice walk to South Seaport. (to sit and view the Brooklyn Bridge) . Location is one thing, but the staff is what makes this Hotel stand out. They are courteous, helpful, friendly and always willing to go the extra mile. Okay, for the light sleeper, some noise may be heard from the construction at ground zero..but nothing too invasive or disruptive. Hilton is a great hotel chain but this one is a real Gem...in the heart of a wonderful town.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Ring0rosie
Reviews.Content: This property is conveniently located and a typical Hilton. I found the rooms to be quite nice for a NYC property and spacious by NYC standards. As a HHonors Diamond member, I was upgraded at approximately half of my stays. The city view corner king was an absolutely breathtaking room and gave you are break from the ground zero noise. It should be worth noting that most guest rooms are equipped with ear plugs due to the 24/7 noise next door at ground zero. I found the concierge to be very knowledgable and they gave me wonderful recommendations within walking distance. Unlike other places I didn't feel coerced to use the hotel restaurant. The breakfast is quite overpriced (I believe it was $22 for some dry pastries, mediocre quiche and other continental staples). Although the quality of the breakfast was so-so, the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supernatural-Bunny
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed here and our floor was literally over the WTC construction site which to be honest we felt honored to see this view as you can see the hard work these people are putting into the tribute site. You can hear the the workers all night but it really didnt bother us at all and we slept sound so i wouldnt really worry about the other reviews. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. They were very pleasant and made us feel really welcome. The rooms were spacious and clean. They were cleaned daily too. I would definitley recommend this to a friend and we will be staying here again on our next trip to NYC. Thanks xxx

Reviews.Title: “Good View from Our Room”
Reviews.Author: JoeBKK
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Millenium Hilton. Our corner room was on the 47th floor with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge on one side and a view of Ground Zero and the Statue of Liberty in the distance on the other side. We had limited contact with the hotel staff, but every contact was courteous and efficient. I liked the fact that the staff was not intrusive, but there when you needed them. The maid forgot to replace the towels on one day, but a quick phone call brought a full set of towels in less than five minutes. The only disappointment was that sheets and pillow cases were not replaced every day. The maid just wiped down the used sheets each day while making the bed (I watched her do it on one occasion). We stayed in several hotels during this trip and this was the only hotel that didn't provide chean sheets and pillow cases every day. The bed was very comfortable and wiping down the bottom sheet kept the bed clean enough during our three-night stay. We liked the location even though the hotel isn't in midtown. Many subway stations are just outisde the door so it was easy to get anywhere fast. Checking in and checking out were nearly instantaneous. The bill was under the door on the morning of checking out and a quick phone call to the front desk completed everything. Overall, it's a good place to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the service”
Reviews.Author: MarcS3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is distinctly average. The rooms are clean and comfortable enough, although the bathrooms are starting to look and feel a little dated. I had read a lot before my trip about the construction noise from the World Trade Center site below, however this did not actually bother me at all from the 31st floor, and in fact the only annoying noise I did hear was from the pipes in the bathroom. The fridge in the mini bar did not work and thus smelt a little bad, but apart from these minor gripes, this room served as more than an adequate pad from which to explore New York. My biggest complaint is with the staff. Not one member of staff in this hotel impressed, apart from the lovely lady who cleaned our room every day. Everyone else seemed to glide around in miserable, drone like state, seemingly all forgetting the ability to smile. From the gloomy woman who checked us in, who without a 'hello' straight away asked for my credit card, to the utterly rude and contemptuous porter who handled our bags when we came to check out. Sadly, I still felt I had to tip the boorish man for fear about what he might do to my luggage, and when I went to give him several $1 coins I was bluntly told "I don't take any of that, I don't take any coins... Jeez tell me where you get any dollar coins in the United States!". After informing him that I had got the coins as change on the subway, he didn't back down, mumbling something else about not wanting any coins. Needless to say, this experience thoroughly soured our last day in New York, and ruined what otherwise was a great holiday. This hotel is convenient and comfortable, but there are far better hotels in New York in the same price range, and where you will probably receive a service that you remember for the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: stashman
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations from the first moment of arrival. Friendly staff, clean wonderful JR Suite with U N B E L E I V A B L E views, I will definitely stay there whenever I am in New York. Traveling to the theater at night (my one concern staying across the street from the WTC) was easy and quick.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to sleep stay somewhere else. if you want a view of ground zero stay here”
Reviews.Author: exBostonian
Reviews.Content: I am a HiltonHonors member and am in general a giant fan of all Hilton Hotels. my 12th floor room (like all except a few rooms) facee the concstuction site.Construction happened ALL NIGHT LONG... bright lights snuck through the curtains, but worse were the jack hammers, trucks backing up with beepers, and generators going all night. needless to say 2 hours of sleep and wished I had brought my Ambien. I dont need to spend $300+ to be awake all night. I was in NYC on business--and was there on a Tuesday night. I can't speak to weekend stays and if they work all night on weekends. you might ask when you reserve. Room was small, but clean. bathroom small, but updated and fine. breakfast was good (buffet was $27+) front desk and room service were nice and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler77ar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton April 30th-May 1st. Nice hotel. Our room had a great view of Ground Zero. Room was a fair price. Lobby smelled of too much air freshener. Dowstairs lobby bathroom was kind of dirty, which is understandable since people probably walk in and out. Angie at the front desk was very personable.

Reviews.Title: “what noise”
Reviews.Author: happychap99
Reviews.Content: our room was on floor 19 and looked on the trade centre site i am a light sleeper and had no problem hotels in this aera should be praised for keeping going dispite trouble caused by terrorism it is discusting to hear poeple moaning about a bit of noise especially americans they should have been here ten years ago when this building work is complete this hotel with its views of the freedom tower aera will be exspensive for most poeple to stay at so make the most of it now if you book a hotel next to a building site dont moan about noise forgive my spelling mistakes

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money...there are others with better service for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Loonutik
Reviews.Content: My first introduction to the hotel was the restroom in reception...it was dirty and not of the standard I would expect for a Hilton hotel. The staff were not particularly friendly....they seemed to have a 'take it or leave it' attitude...and weren't very friendly. And the NOISE from the construction was bad! And it goes on all night! PS: The hotle staff lie to guests about what time the construction starts and ends.....I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: WarsawConnection
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews about this hotel, I had some reservations. However, I was pleasantly surprised. They upgraded our room to two double beds from a king size bed (which was all that was available when we booked). The room was situated on the 9th floor and was quiet. During one evening, construction work was going on and I was very concerned about the noise because the drilling could be heard in our room. By about 11.30pm it stopped and that was the only time during our 3 nite stay that we heard any noise. For breakfast, there's a great natural food eatery just around the corner from the hotel on Broadway that I would recommend. For dinner we would recommend Les Halles (French Bistro) a 5 min. walk from the hotel. Only real complaint was that due to construction at Ground Zero, several of the subway entrances were boarded up. Otherwise, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Torture worse than waterboarding”
Reviews.Author: Voyager2606
Reviews.Content: The construction noise was a torture. We were 'upgraded' to a mini-suite. This is the noisiest room in the hotel. Even on 45th floor it was as if the construction machines were inside. 24 hours tortuous noise meant no sleep so pulled out of a 4 day stay in NY. We were not warned at check-in or reservation. This is a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great first trip to NYC.”
Reviews.Author: koritsi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the noisy heart of the city but still within easy reach of everything, with subway stations right outside. It is opposite the World Trade Center, a great location and it was wonderful to see the progress being made daily in this poignant and unforgettable site. Having said this, if there was construction noise at night (and apparently there was)it had no effect on our sleep. The beds were very comfortable and the room had a great two- aspect view. They were very clean, consistently restocked and the bathroom large enough for two people not to have to fight for the mirror. There was always plenty of hot water. There's a coffee making machine, a large TV and comfortable chairs - although how much time do you spend in a room in a city such as New York? We had room service at 1.30AM, when my son arrived from Canada - a ridiculous time to eat and we were told it would be half an hour but was much faster. He had New York strip and I had a salad that would have fed about 5 people- really delicious. The staff on the front desk were always very helpful,polite and friendly ;giving info on the subway, how to get to places using the fastest route, and where to eat. Hotels in the UK need lessons on this!! We used the pool, which was comfortably warm and and the changing rooms were clean and well stocked with toiletries. Starbucks was next door and a deli across from it. Century 21 is also nearby and too easy to pop into every day. It's a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and not too far to Battery Park and the Staten Island ferry. Everything about our stay in this hotel was positive and we hope to be able to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But Nickeled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: katiekaw
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for his birthday on a Saturday night and we had an extremely mixed bag of experiences. Here is the breakdown: PROS: -Location: If you like downtown NYC this is the perfect location. The hotel is located directly across the street from the new Liberty Tower complex and a few blocks from Wall Street and Battery Park. The subway station is 30 feet from the front entrance of the hotel and if you drive in (like we did) the hotel is located a block away from the West Side Highway and a short distance from the Holland Tunnel. If you are flying into JFK or LaGuardia the hotel is right over the Brooklyn Bridge and/or the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel. -Service Staff: The maids and maintenance men were very helpful and provided us with solutions to our hotel problems (see below). The maid staff was so nice that once they heard it was my boyfriend’s birthday they left us two breakfast vouchers and a box of chocolates with a "Happy Birthday" note. -Room: Our room was newly renovated and immaculately clean with plenty of towels and pillows. I usually always have to request more towels and there were three large and many smaller ones. Also, the bath products were Crabtree & Evelyn, so they were good quality if you don't want to bring your own bath products from home. (no toothpaste though...lol). View-Even though the hotel sits directly across the street from ground zero we had a great view of the water through Battery Park. All rooms facing the street give you a nice view of the Hudson River and all the rooms facing the side will give you a view of the Statue of Liberty and waterways (I figure this specific view is for floors 20 and higher because the building next store is pretty short). CONS: Reservation & Requests: I booked this room directly through the Hilton website and got a wonderful deal ($189). Because of this deal when they offered an upper floor upgrade on the webpage after my confirmation I immediately jumped on it for an additional 18.99(An upper floor upgrade is considered any room above the 30th floor. The hotel has 55 floors and from what I have read if you are on a lower floor you get a significant amount of noise from the ground zero construction). Between the time of the reservation and day of arrival I called the hotel twice to confirm the upgrade and requests we made. We needed to request foam pillows and blankets because of allergies and a room on an upper floor. Upon arrival the front desk claimed that they had not received any of these requests, so the maid staff had to be inconvenienced by having to change all the bedding. Also, AND VERY IMPORTANT, the upper floor room upgrade is NOT GUARENTEED. The front desk employee was a bit rude in explaining that we can only get an upper floor upgrade if the rooms are available. So, even if you request an upper room they technically don't charge you the 18.99 until you get there and if the room is available. I thought they charged us already and we were guaranteed an upper floor. We were pretty lucky though because we were on the 30th floor, which is the highest level of the "lower" rooms. Room Temperature & Thermostat: I know this is an odd topic but when we entered our room it was a bit muggy and warm so I automatically went to the thermostat and turned the air conditioning on and assumed that the room would cool off quickly (like most hotels). After an hour and a half the room was still muggy and warm so I called down to the front desk and they sent up a maintenance staff member. When the gentleman got to our room he explained that during the winter/spring months the hotel "NEUTURALIZES" the air system, meaning that they turn off the chiller for the conditioning unit. So, he showed us how to open the windows and told us the room would cool off that way. Unfortunately, our window made a terrible buzzing sound every time the wind got heavy (which for the city is very frequent). So, when maintenance came back up they put caulking in the window and said that should be fine. Also, management is able to turn the chillers on in each room and they refused too for us. Extras: Most hotel rooms come with a refrigerator; this hotel charges you to rent one. Also, the hotel parking was $55 for the night (which is pretty normal but still high). There was no free continental breakfast, we got free vouchers from the maid but the food was TERRIBLE. If you can avoid the hotel breakfast please do so. Noise from Ground Zero: The hotel staff is pretty rude about this. Obviously, there is no way to avoid hearing the construction noise because they work 24 hours a day, 7 days a week because they are behind schedule. While the hotel does provide ear plugs I found that if you request a higher floor you don't hear any noise. Plus, with your air unit running it helps drown out any additional noise also. All in all I would stay here again. It was the best price I have ever gotten in the city for a nice hotel. I don't like being nickeled and dimed for everything but when we needed help the service staff were professional and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beats than staying in Midtown.”
Reviews.Author: Timbointheapple
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here on during a recent visit to NYC because a lot of the activities I wanted to do were found in Lower Manhattan. This may not be the case for most people but you are just a "E" or an "R" train away from Midtown and both stations are located within steps of the lobby. This hotel was priced better on almost every website when compared to hotels in Midtown and in some cases a hundred dollars cheaper than hotels located in Times Sq. It is also very up to date and looked extremely modern inside and out. Our room was facing the WTC construction and I hardly heard anything during the evenings. We stayed over a weekend so I'm not sure if there is a difference during the weeknights. Hurry up and stay here while the prices are lower as I can see the costs going up once construction is done. Great hotel, will definitely stay here next trip

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For WTC, Financial District and accessing the Ferry Services...”
Reviews.Author: TarinJohn
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern and friendly hotel. Lifts are efficient. Rooms are nice. I had a spacious Junior Suite. With views down into the WTC site from Level 37. Ask for a room that looks over the WTC site and you will also get a great view of Jersey City and the Hudson River. No free wi-fi in rooms, however you can access wi-fi for free on Level 3 and in the Foyer. If you have a laptop that you can connect a cable to it from your room then you will have access to paid Internet. Alternatively, you can access free Internet at the nearby Burger King or McDonalds. There are no laundries on site. There is a small shop that has essentials, but it is expensive. The breakfast is nice and fresh, but is a bit pricey if you order off the menu, best go for the buffet for $27.50. If coming from JFK, take the AirLink train to Jamaica Station then the E line all the way to the WTC Station, exit the Subway on Church St and the hotel is about 20 steps from the top of the Subway stairs - easy, and only $7.25 for the entire trip from JFK !!! It takes about 45 mins from Jamaica Station. Trains were all on time, very clean and very safe.

Reviews.Title: “best bargain luxury on weekends”
Reviews.Author: shagbug
Reviews.Content: This is the place I like to stay when in NY for a weekend. It's downtown in the financial district, so usually caters to the weekday business crowd. Weekends rooms are often deeply discounted..the jr suites are very nice and can sometimes be had for under $200. It's away from the tourist attractions of mid-town, but near the subway and a nice walk to the seaport, china town and soho.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and location”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: First, this isn't a hotel in the heart of tourists. It is located across for the WTC and near Wall Street. Busy yes. Times Square no. That being said, it is by plenty of subway stops so it is easy to get in and out. The hotel is a tall (55 floors) and skinny hotel. It feels modern and the rooms are nice. I had a small corner suite but the room felt large because of the large windows. The bathroom was nice size with plenty of room. Downsides: the hotel is in the process of upgrading the Internet so not all of the floors have Internet. Also, the construction at WTC does create some noise. I was on the 32nd floor and didn't hear enough to be bothered. However, I would imagine a lower floor might get some extra noise. If you are looking for a hotel on this side of NYC it is worth a look. The views are great and it is a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizardqueen1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and were beyond pleased with our room and the service. We had a suite on the 40th floor which overlooked the WTC site. We could barely hear any noise from the continuous construction. Instead we were awed by the view! Joseph the concierge was excellent, helping us with restaurant reservations, subway directions and general questions. All the staff was helpful and super friendly. The location was great, subway stop was just outside the doors. Overall, I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “value with a view”
Reviews.Author: charlietrisj
Reviews.Content: spent the weekend at this hotel in conjunction with the nyc half-marathon. we like staying in lower manhattan for the history, great restaurants, playgrounds for our daughter, safe places to run,and relative value when considering nyc prices. when we checked in, it was quite late, and the staff seemed pretty annoyed. that made me wonder what we got ourselves into. nevertheless, the room we requested was ready with additional pillows as requested. we asked if we could buy a few water bottles anywhere, and the girl checking us in said she'd send up some water, on the house, which was very nice. the views from our junior suite on the 26th floor were spectacular!!!! we enjoyed the view at night, and during the day. the suite had plenty of room for the three of us with a king bed and a pull out sofa. swimming pool was really nice, if a bit cold, and our daughter enjoyed herself a great deal. noise from the wtc site was an issue the first night, but was nonexistent the second night. overall, we would stay here again for the location, views and value.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a great locale but the Hilton hotel name has lost it's lustre.”
Reviews.Author: shocktop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had two separate but consecutive reservations, one night was in a junior suite and the next two were in a smaller room on a higher floor. We loved the location as you can witness history and view the future with what they're doing at the WTC site. As most reviews tell you the construction noise is an ongoing issue with the deadline for the tenth anniversary fast approaching and the need to complete the memorial before 9/11/11. The noise is not particularly bothersome but our room locations were on the 32nd and 47th floor giving us great distance from the work. The junior suite was a corner location and it had two adjoined rooms by a walkway which the bathroom was situated off of. The windows spanned this walkway and for 180 degrees around our bedroom. We had both a large flat screen in the living room and bedroom but they didn't carry an HD signal(why?). The room was very nicely appointed and maybe getting a bit dated but we didn't mind. The bathroom is large enough for two with mirror stretching to the ceiling and the shower was powerful and hot. Everything in the room very clean and shiny and the windows spotless for great views North and over the WTC site. The bed was comfortable, large, and supportive with plenty of room for two and it helped that when rising it didn't disturb the other sleeper. Our next room was a better one. It was smaller in area but the bedroom was larger overall. We again had a corner location giving us magnificent views of the Statue of Liberty in one window and the Brooklyn Bridge in the other. This room was duly appointed like the last and we like the espresso machine included in all rooms which is great pick-me-up when needed. Now for the bad which has turned me off the Hilton name that was once the standard bearer for good hotels. Our check-in times was both long and seemingly arduous (since we had two separate reservations they wouldn't allow us to check in once for both). We waited for quite a few minutes and what was strange was that a staff member would check in someone and then instead of helping the next guest, disappear into the back room or leave the area for a while. It happened on both occasions and to many of the guests even as we were just hanging around the lobby. We noticed some people annoyed with the waiting and who wouldn't be; there was many staff mulling around that desk but sometimes just one person checking people in. In addition, the check-in staff twice tried to get us to stay in the junior suite rather than moving to our new room. I didn't want to do this as I knew we'd get better views with our other reservation for the higher floors. The only thing I can think of is that it makes their job easier to keep us in one room and maybe they can make more money by having another high end room open for Saturday and Sunday night. Another sad surprise was that on a weekend the bar area would close before midnight. Thinking that this is NY and a weekend night you would think they would have it open till at least 1am. Maybe they've had trouble with drunk people as the bar is an open area next to the lobby but we were disheartened to not finish with a nightcap after taking in the city. Another minor issue I had was the restaurant wouldn't serve me a dessert that I could take to my room. The waiter politely said to get room service and I know it's available but again this was after coming back to the hotel and I didn't see what the problem could be by me doing this. (And yet another minor issue is no free wi-fi. Do you have to charge for every little thing Hilton? Fifteen bucks for an all day pass! I pay less for my monthly world access account!) My main problem was a toilet issue. The toilets are low flow for water conservation which is smart and I'm an eco person. But after doing my business ours got clogged. After trying to flush it down I had to call for help. It took 15 minutes to get someone up and it was a guy armed with a plunger. He got it working and I felt bad that someone had to deal with my waste like that. But after he left there was water spilled over the floor and toilet. He didn't think he needed to clean anything after plunging the heck out of the toilet! So I wiped up the floor and toilet but regretted not mentioning this to the manager. Some of these reviews talk about the staff with a "that's how it is" attitude and I concur with their assessment. It seems they are not really concerned with putting a good image out there for the hotel. They seem dismissive and disregarding of whatever happens around them. As I think how I didn't talk to a manager I find with other reviewers that it most likely wouldn't have mattered anyway. The only good staff are the concierge who are eager to help you with directions and having a good time in the city. So we had great views and a comfortable room. But the downside being the staff, no extra benefits staying at a Hilton and finding inconvenient surprises during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton You Expect”
Reviews.Author: kenmbender
Reviews.Content: We had some extra time, so decided to spend the Thanksgiving holiday in NYC (and catch the Macy's parade). We wanted a brand hotel and not a boutique place. We also wanted to be downtown. The hotel itself is in an absolutely fantastic location. Access to pretty much all of the subway lines - they are all within a few blocks and 2 of them are right there. Century 21 is right next door so you can't beat that. Our room was mid floor and looked down on the WTC site. We had heard comments about the noise of construction, but we never heard a thing. It must have been the height. The rooms themselves are in need of updating. While the bed and other furniture are newer, the infrastructure is definitely in need of work. The air handler was either on full blast or not at all. The thermostat worked when it wanted to - which meant either the room was too hot or too cold. This made it a little tough to sleep. When asked, the front desk almost acknowledged there might be issues with some older equipment. Housekeeping made the bed and provide new toiletries, but seemed to lack the ability to clean other parts of the room. It appeared the spaces behind the desk, around the air handler, within 6 inches or so of any piece of furniture was off limits to cleaning as was any flat surface like the desk, armoire, nightstands, table or countertop. For the most part the staff was helpful, albeit not engaging. The exception was the concierge desk. They were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Not only were their directions precise, but they gave landmarks as well "you will see ..... when you get there". The final piece of this trip was the bar area. It seems as though housekeeping doesn't even cover this area, and neither does any other staff. The chairs were stained, the tables dirty and there were food bits all over the floor. We decided one night to have a Manhattan (since we were IN Manhattan). This is, by far, the worst cocktail I have ever charged for. Part of the issue was the lack of service. After waiting 15 minutes for a server - which we had seen when we sat down, but had disappeared within seconds, we grew tired of waiting and approached the bar and placed our order. The standard garnish for the cocktail is a cherry, so we were surprised when they were made without. When questioned, the bartender (and we are assuming that is what he was since I had to interrupt his daydreaming to ask for a cocktail) shrugged his shoulders and said that's how he makes them. We sat back down and the mystery server came back. I asked about the garnish and was informed that they did not use cherries. When she saw the questioning look, she explained this was a corporate decision. Hilton did not serve cherries. (When we got home I called Hilton and asked and was told that is specific to that location). When we were almost done with our whiskey - I can't call it a cocktail, the server came over to take the order of a table that had just sat down. She provided them with bar munchies. This may be trivial, but we really felt like we had not been treated with the same level of service as the other folks. We went to our room, packed and got ready to leave as our flight out was the next morning. Needless to say, we will not be returning to this location. When we returned home, I contacted Hilton and provided these comments, which were then relayed to the hotel. The hotel management had no concern for any of these issues and had the general attitude of that's how it was. The hotel rates 3 stars mainly because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by History”
Reviews.Author: Mykil
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is located at the foot of the WTC complex. The construction is right across the street, literally outside your window. The hotel is a modern 55 story tower with well appointed public and suites. Staff is friendly, surrounded by numerous subway stops within a 5 minute walk. The views of Manhattan and the Hudson River are stunning. Restaurant was over priced with a limited menu but the area is surrounded by eating spots all within easy walking distance. The hotel website does advise you of construction noise emanating from the rebuilding of the WTC complex as does staff upon check in. Sleep quality was an issue not so much from construction but from the elevators. The design of this narrow building means the air from the elevators rising and descending in the elevator shafts can be heard throughout the hotel on all floors and at all times. A bit disconcerting but not a reason to avoid this hotel. The work stations in your room are well appointed and if forced to spend an afternoon working in your suite, there are no distractions preventing a successful day "in the office". I pre ordered items for arrival and within 10 minutes of checking in and verifying to the front desk my room was satisfactory, the items arrived in my suite and were uniquely presented. Staff declined a tip as it was a pre-order! If heading to the Theatre and you require a taxi, allow for 90 minutes as a taxi can be difficult to find and traffic can be heavy. I will stay here again. The views alone make this hotel a winner but when coupled with a staff that goes out of their way to make you comfortable, it is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms - swimming pool - affordable”
Reviews.Author: 2Euro-Travellers
Reviews.Content: I reserved the Hilton Millenium directly through the Hilton website, but found a better rate on the French ebookers website. "Terian Dillard" from Hilton's "Our Best Rates Guaranteed" replied that they would not honor my complaint even if I took screenshots. The Hilton Millenium is situated right at Ground Zero which may be frightening for some souls, but we found it very nice and interesting. We received a room at the upper level of the hotel and what I have been told is that nearly all rooms overlook Ground Zero. There was work going on all day, all night and during the whole weekend. Nevertheless we did not hear anything of the noise. The rooms are very big and bright for New York. The week end rate included free breakfast (this breakfast buffet is nice and big - we were told to choose one entrée from the Menu) There is a pool at the hotel which we enjoyed as well. The only thing I did not like is that it really is a business hotel. The area was dead during the week end and they even closed the subway station right at the hotel during the week end. There is no nightlife around the hotel. + great week end rate including breakfast, large and bright rooms overlooking Ground Zero, Swimming Pool - "Our Best Rate Guaranteed" not honored, business district location which means that there is no nightlife around the hotel and during the week end

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Tantastic_7
Reviews.Content: We are getting married in NY in April and we will be staying at this hotel, along with many of our guests. We wanted an advance stay to make sure we were happy with the hotel, with a view to ironing out any issues prior to our April stay. We let them know this at check-in and were immediately upgraded to a Junior Suite on the 50th floor. The room was excellent - very spacious with outstanding views uptown and across the Hudson. The bed was very large and extremely comfortable with plenty of pillows and wonderfully fresh smelling linens. There was only a murmur of construction noise and definitely no need for earplugs! I am unable to comment if this was due to our room height. The maid service was prompt and thorough. The only negative, along with the majority of reviews, is the lack of wifi. As iPhone users this was a little annoying - although there is a Starbucks beneath the hotel that has a free hotspot so it wasn't too hard to go down to check emails etc. We were overall very happy with our 3 night stay and are very much looking forward to returning in April.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Pat71
Reviews.Content: I may have been unlucky but the maitre d at breakfast was surly and rude, the room still had not been serviced by 5pm (along with all the other rooms on the floor by the fact that they all had room service platters outside their doors). And the quality of the room was only so/so (no wi fi) etc. There are better hotels for this price point in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “The best is the view”
Reviews.Author: NelsonRiera
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for two days and I must say the view was great, we stayed at the 52 floor, the personel is nice and the room was great, but I really didn't like and to be honest never thougth I would have to pay for internet and no less than u$s 14 the day, everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Olympic400
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a room here at the last minute (at New Year's) and managed to get a great deal! The rooms are a bit small and the "double" beds are more like extended twins - not much room. I was impressed with the location and was delighted that our room overlooked the new "Freedom Tower" construction. Many reviews here have mentioned the noise associated with the construction but I did not notice it - no need to use the free ear plugs provided! The hotel is centrally located near several subway stops making for easy travel. Broadway is close by and the piers are just a few walking blocks away. There is a restaurant in the hotel but I did not use it. I did visit the lobby bar. The prices are high (as would be expected) and I found the bar a little to close to the lobby traffic - there is little to differentiate between lobby and bar. The service desk was "typical" New York City hospitality (quick and impersonal). I enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to people on business or traveling solo. Overall a pleasant visit and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: chef2011
Reviews.Content: The room has a price too it but the view alone is worth it! Stay there again in a hearbeat

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: RobinTinto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton ! Loved it ! apart from the fact that I couldn't use my I pad in the hotel room..... Would recommend other than that. Robin Tinto

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: 1Rookie21
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Highly recommended.Clean well kept. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is not four stars!”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York on Business once a month. My requirements are a clean, four star, safe hotel. I don't care where in the city that I stay as I love to explore new areas of the city. I booked this hotel on Priceline. Priceline says it is four stars but it is not and there are two main reasons. 1. There was a letter in my room upon check that said that Ground Zero construction is not 24 hours a day and they are sorry for the noise but deadlines are to be met. The note was accompanied by earplugs. I kid you not, earplugs. The hotel was sold out so I was stuck in the room. Besides the view of ground zero (which is not very four star and very sad and depressing) the fact that construction went on all night and was loud was horrible. I would never wear earplugs in a hotel room. I need to be able to hear if there was a fire alarm or other danger. 2. There is no WIFI in the hotel.
