I have not been in any good hotel in the past three years that does not offer WIFI. The room had a phone cord modem available at a price. My Ipad and phone need WIFI not a phone modem. This is totally antiquated. The room was clean but a little dated, especially the bathroom. The neighborhood has no nightlife and is actually dark to walk around at night. The only good things that I could find is that it is right next to a subway station. You don't have to cross the street to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “building site vacation.”
Reviews.Author: hairybear007
Reviews.Content: arrived about 01am, after long delays due to the snow,entered reception with no one around,felt really strange,waited at least ten minutes with nobody at all,then my partner rang the phone and three members of staff came out of the doors, checking in was,ok,member of staff said due to the holiday period noise was not an issue,( she was wrong),not a fanatic,but do like clear,precise information as a customer. well thats all the negatives,a room was on the 40th,floor,great views over wtc,spotless,large room,with lovely bathroom,nice fold down service inthe evening with chocolates on the bed,could hear some noise but never an issue,as after a day out in new york,we could not remember which side of our heads hit the pillow first and the beds are so comfortable,never used any of the hotels facilities,ate breakfast at roxy,s coffee house 2 minutes walk away, ( usually for under 10$ ) this hotel is next door to century 21,also has great subway links. nice view (free) if you ride the elevator to fiftyfifth floor,,reception let us keep the room till 1430 on the day of departure.,doorman was very helpfull new years eve geeting us taxi,blowing his whistle to get us one.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To NY”
Reviews.Author: JPSLittleAston
Reviews.Content: Stayed 27th Dec 2010 to 3rd Jan 2011 after the snow - glad to get there at all!. Great room on 40th floor with fantastic views of the Hudson River and the TWC site. Noise not a problem - didn't need the ear plugs provided!. Good sized room and bathroom. Comfortable bed was very welcome after days out exploring. Bed turn down service every evening was a nice touch. Roxy's coffee shop in John St near hotel great for breakfast. Good links for subway nearby. Didn't use dining facilities or bar at hotel. Only moan - no free WiFi either in room or lobby - something we are used to when staying at Hilton Hotels in the UK.. You need to sort this! Lobby staff helpful - allowed us to stay in our room until 2pm on departure day. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, if you want to watch piles being driven.”
Reviews.Author: AkulaTheShark
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty well known hilton. The rooms aren't that great and they are driving piles at ground zero, right out the window. This place is almost in the construction site and the construction is LOUD and goes all night. The staff is pretty nice and willing to help, sometimes. You have to ask for a room that has Internet, its a new thing this Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in the end this hotel is in the middle of a construction site.”
Reviews.Author: Jakub3000
Reviews.Content: Ground zero construction is due to go on for a little while yet and this hotel overlooks it. The location is awesome for transport links with subway on your doorstep but if you're a light sleeper, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value...and no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bigredbard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rated 4 stars...but at best rates a 3. It faces the WTC construction, which is going on from 6 a.m. to midnight. Never mentioned of course by the hotel at booking. Note in room... "we apologize in advance" and a set of earplugs. Thanks a lot! But the construction noise was nothing compared to the high pitched whine and click that went on 24/7. Never found the source...and we weren't near an elevator. Awful. Room was small. One sink in bathroom. All in all about the level of a Holiday Inn (only the Holiday Inn gives you more amenities!)...but at a premium price. The restaurant was dreadful and a hamburger costs over $20. The only plus--a nice view of the river. This one is definitely a pass! P.S. I am a former New Yorker and have stayed at many city hotels. This one was a great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, not special. Great views, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: AdrianTorontoOntario
Reviews.Content: I don't really like this secion of lower Manhattan as a place to stay because there is little going on after the Wall Street office workers go home. However, the Hilton is right across the street from the World Trade Center site, and there the construction actually never stops - so on the one on hand, you have spectacular views of the construction and the river and New Jersey beyond; on the other hand, there is constant noise. Management helpfully provides some ear plugs to deal with the noise ... It appears that all rooms face the same direction over the construction. Used the fitness facility, which is adequate. There are 6 or 7 tread mills, a decent selection of dumbells and one pulley weight stack machine. The facility is not really large enough for the hotel, so at 6 pm it's packed. I found this hotel efficient but completely unremarkable. And it irked me that they don't have free WiFi anywhere in the hotel. Within a few blocks, there is a W, an Embassy Suites (which is closer to the river and probably quieter) and a Ritz Carlton if your budget allows. So I would not recomment this hotel to a friend because ... the location is only good for Wall St. type meetings; and the hotel itself has nothing special to recommend it, and it does have a lot of noise, which is one of my pet peeves.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location, I wont stay in any other hotel when visiting NY”
Reviews.Author: Bel31_10
Reviews.Content: Two of my girlfiends and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton from the 3rd - 6th December, I must admit I was a little concerned about the noice levels after reading many reviews warning guests about what to expect. On arrival to the hotel at about 5pm, my first impression was that it looked very cosy and comfortable, with a beautifully decorated large Christmas tree in the lobby area. Ater checking in which was very swift, we were shown to our room which was on the 14th floor, facing Century 21 depatment store. The room was very clean and modern, however I was quite surprised to find two double beds (more like a one and half persons when compared to UK size) instead of the triple room we had booked. This was not a problem as after a quick phonecall to the reception desk, there was a third bed set up in our room when we got back that night. The Hotel is well aware that some guests are not happy with the noise levels coming from the construction site, that they provide earplugs to ensure you get a peaceful night sleep - however we found that these were not needed as you could hardly hear anything other than a very low vibrating sound, which is drowned out if you have the heating system on. Overall our stay was very pleasant, even though we only spent our time at the hotel sleeping (which was for a total of only about 10 hours during our time there), All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, even allowing us to check out at the later time of 3.30pm as opposed to the 12pm check out time, as our flight wasn't due to leave until late that evening. All requests we made were met very promptly and without any problems at all, which made our break a very enjoyable experience. This was the second time all three of us girls have been to New York, and stayed in the Financial District. The last time I was there I stayed at the Embassy suite, and I must say it's Millenium Hilton all the way for me! I'll definately be staying there again when I visit NY in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quickie Trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: ericm315
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Millenium Hilton about a year ago, and liked the fact it was very nice and in a part of NYC I enjoy. I booked the hotel for two nights (12/18/10-12/20/10.) We arrived at the hotel at about 11am and was immediately acqknowledged as a previous customer. Additionally, I was given a room on the 42nd floor, which overlooked the WTC site. I was not concerned about the noise from the site. After dropping our bags in the room we ventured off to a day of shopping. You can get the "E" train to most stuff uptown right outside of the hotel, very convienient. Also, if you have good feet, you can walk to your destination in Chinatown, Soho, or Canal Street areas. I did not use any of the hotel's restaurant's or bars on this trip. I had real good recommendations of restaurants from relatives who live in the area. Try Joe's Shanghi (Pell Street) in Chinatown for a wonderful meal. Also, Bar Pitti on 6th Avenue. We actually sat next to the actor Ed Norton in the restaurant. Wonderful Italian food. Me and my wife slept very well, and the construction noise did not affect is at all. The view from our room was wonderful, looking towards the water. I must state we will be staying at the Millenium Hilton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-good location”
Reviews.Author: xxkrystaxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 9th December til the 13th. We had a room on the 39th floor with 2 queen sized beds, from this floor there was no noise to be heard from the WTC site. The rooms are lovely, beds are sooo comfortable! The rooms themselves are clean and look nice, the bathroom was lovely with a good shower. There is a coffee machine in the room which makes lovely coffee. The corridoors however dont quite look as modern as the rooms and lobby area. Only fault I could find though. Concierge was very helpful with giving us directions and stored our suitcases for us on out last day free of charge. You do have to leave your credit card details on reception to cover incidentals however there was no money taken or 'frozen' on the card which does happen at some other hotels. The hotel is in a good location for subway links with 4 stations within walking distance so easy to get around. All in all a good stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars...”
Reviews.Author: Spousetoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my spouse while he was at business meetings. I intended to spend the mornings doing work on my computer, but the internet service was a huge pain. I couldn't use my AirCard because the office towers around made reception spotty, and I was constantly bounced off the network. So I plugged in the hotel's internet. Such a hassle! First, I spend hours trying to get a connection. Finally, AT&T, the provider, determined it was the cord in my room. I got a replacement cord, and then the next day repeatedly was bounced off the network due to "bandwidth" issues. I was NOT downloading movies or music. I was multitasking among several websites and sending photos/documents back to the home office. After my third call on this issue, I finally got resolution, but by then we were checking out the next day. In all, it was a great frustration. Still, the view is incredible -- watching the work on Ground Zero was amazing. Being close to the subway stop and close to St. Paul's were nice. Century 21 is interesting. Would love to have had time to try the health club and pool (and WOULD HAVE if the internet connection had been less a problem). Didn't price drinks in the lobby. Nice bed, nice pillows, good-sized room. Satisfied with everything else. Would I recommend? Maybe. But I sure was irritated at the internet issues!

Reviews.Title: “nice furnishings but customer care missing”
Reviews.Author: the_klute51
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is generally finished to a good standard but the customer service is very shabby. I was checked into a room which was opposite some vents which were extremely noisy. I was moved to another room where the heating wasn't working. I had to move myself, help from the bellhop was evidently not an option. After complaining about that an engineer came and fixed the heating (although left the thermostat almost inoperable). Breakfast today I was left at a table and ignored for a good 15 minutes until someone finally came and took my order after waving madly across the restaurant. The phone in my room has been beeping as if there is a message waiting for me, which there isn't. Someone was supposed to come and fix it yesterday, I phoned again today and was told that they could fix it at their end, which evidently they have not done, but then they have not called back to check. I guess that I shall wrap it up in a towel and leave it in the bathroom again! The eggs Benedict are good, however, they aren't good enough to make me come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: tea-babe
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here, booked through Hotwire and got a fantastic deal. Some people may be uncomfortable with the location of the hotel, directly next to Ground Zero in lower Manhattan, but that didn't bother us. Our room was on the 20th floor and had an amazing view of the site -- it was really interesting to watch the construction workers and to get an idea of the work still to be done there. It's also a very convenient location, right near the subway. The room is comfortable and pretty spacious for a NYC hotel room. Chic, sleek furnishings and design. Great bed. They were happy to keep our luggage all day long after we checked out. The only quibble I would have is that the front desk person was pretty rude when we checked in. No "hello" or "welcome," just "I need your drivers license and credit card." We lived in NYC for 10 years so we're not complaining about "rude New Yorkers," but it seems that the first person we encountered at the hotel could have been a bit more welcoming. Everyone else we met was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jackoNewmarket
Reviews.Content: I don't normally give hotels 5 star ratings as I always think there is room for improvement, however I have just returned from yet another brilliant stay at the Millenium Hilton NY. As usual the staff were friendly and accomodating. I was travelling with my daughter and it was her first time to NY. Asked for a room high up as I know the the views are great, wasn't disapointed as we given a junior suite on the 44th floor. Yes there are some noise issues with the rebuilding work going on but this didn't really affect us too much and yes I agree the bar prices can be a tad on the high side but you are in NY and I don't think they are any dearer than other hotels. Just do what we did and take soft drinks back with us. It is a good location for looking round downtown and the metro is close by for travelling uptown. As two women travelling on their own it feels like a safe hotel as the staff are so friendly and helpful at all times. Keep up the good work Millenium Hilton and already looking forward to my next trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but ripoff at lobby bar.”
Reviews.Author: laura25ct
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, convenient, and the staff are mostly very friendly. Our only complaint regarding this hotel is the lobby bar service and prices. Inattentive and disinterested staff here, and $14 for a glass of wine (in a chipped glass). Other patrons from different parts of the world also were astonished at the extremely high prices at the bar.This hotel clearly takes advantage of residents looking to have a relaxing drink at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely do it again”
Reviews.Author: mexicanwannabe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Millenium Hilton. As previously stated, it can get a little loud at night, due to ongoing construction, but nothing to keep us up all night! The location is wonderful. It is in the financial district and overlooks the World Trade Center construction. They do work all night, but it truly is fascinating to watch, and know that you are experiencing history in the making. Staying so close makes the disaster of 9/11 seem that much more real! There are subway stops every where you look, within easy walking distance. We purchased the 7 day unlimited passes, even though we were only going to stay for 5 days. It was much more economical than paying as you go. At the end of our stay, we gave the 2 remaining days on our passes to airport employees, who were very appreciative. There is a coffee pot in the room, but also a Starbuck's connecting to the hotel, a small market across the street (right next door to Century 21) and a Stage Door Deli across the street the other direction. We didn't eat in the hotel, but did use these conveniences for morning coffee. There was a mini bar in the room, along with an iron, flat screen TV, hairdryer, and Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. Everything you could need while out of town! Our room was very clean, the hotel staff very friendly, and the beds are comfortable. We have absolutely no complaints and would stay here on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay At Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: StornowayLouis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took our first trip to New York along with four friends and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. Having found an excellent Hilton Hotel in London, which we have used each year for the past three years, we decided to use one of their hotels in New York, and we were not disappointed. Checked in around mid-day and within a few minutes we were shown to our room, which was comfortable, warm and spacious. Despite some of the reviews on this hotel mentioning problems with sleeping due to the noise from the Ground Zero construction site, we didn't find this at all. Our room was on the 24th floor and looked directly into the site, but with the combination of long fantastic days making the most of our trip and very comfortable beds (and without the use of ear plugs!) we both slept well for our entire stay. Our experiences with the staff at this hotel were all to the good, both friendly and helpful. Can't say anything about the food or the other amenities at this hotel as we did not make use of them. We hope to visit New York again and would probably opt for a hotel closer to Times Square the next time, but would not rule out the Millenium by any means. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for its amenities, staff and location. All six of us enjoyed our stay and we hope you will too.

Reviews.Title: “no sleep”
Reviews.Author: viallisix
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 5pm. Showered then out for our first time in the big apple. Stayed out until approx 10-30 pm, then back to hotel for a good nights sleep and an early start the next morning. No such luck. The constant noise from ground zero meant that we were awake at 2am, then could not get back to sleep. I ended up walking the streets of NY, at 5 am. My wife rang me at 8am to see if I was ok. Asked to be moved to another room only to be told hotel full.I think the hotel should be closed until all the work complete. Spoiled our first visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sunkist00
Reviews.Content: Despite being located directly beside the Ground Zero construction site, we never heard a peep. The room was very nice as well as the bathroom. We had drinks at the bar in the lobby and they were great and the service was excellent. The concerairge desk was helpful with the subway map and calling a cab to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not amazing. Service needs improving.”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a safe bet for the finance district, however its very noisy because of the building works, make sure you get a high floor on the otherside of the trade centre site otherwise you wont sleep. The hotel has a down stairs bar which is ok, service is slow, atmosphere is not great, people come and go plus you cant get food in the bar. You need to go to the bar on the 3rd floor for food, but this also lacks atmosphere and isnt used much. The gym is small, about 4 treadmills, couple of cross trainers and a cable machine and some free weights. Anymore that 8 people and its "tight." It has a pool which is ok for a few lengths. The rooms are clean and a good standard. Service needs improving, not the best Hilton I have stayed at, so overall ok, no issues but is pricy for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: CammiB
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our hotel with Strawberries and Wine in our room. Not a honeymoon, but definitely a needed getaway!! The concierge was great and referred us to many wonderful restaurants. The room was always clean when we got back from our "tourist duties" and the hotel staff was soo helpful. We will always stay here when in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive view of the WTC building site, but also noisy”
Reviews.Author: jfoxy82207
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline for $125 a night, which is a great deal for NYC. The first night we stayed in a room overlooking the WTC site. Construction is going on 24/7. The view of the construction site is very impressive. I could have sat by the window for days watching the construction activities. It was quite loud due to the ongoing construction. I used earplugs and didn't mind. But my husband got very upset. We were able to move rooms the next day facing the other site. The concierge was very helpful in helping us make dinner reservations at all kinds of restaurants that my husband had preselected for our trip. I used the pool once but found the water temperature quite cold. The subway stop is basically right outside the hotel. Rooms are slightly outdated but I remember the beds being very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Safe bet for the financial district”
Reviews.Author: CubbieBear
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium Hilton a few times for work in fall 2010 and have always had a positive experience. Now that the noise from the WTC has diminished this hotel is a good place to stay. The price for ra room has been in line with other similar hotels. It's very close to a number of subway lines making it convenient to the financial district and a quick underground trip to the rest of town. While I've only stayed in corner rooms on the back side of the hotel, the rooms are spacious and the noise hasn't been a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrVarmint
Reviews.Content: Really really nice hotel, surprisingly low price, and great location in the financial district, but still within walking distance of many sights (and close enough to the subway that it has easy access to everything). Would highly recommend. Despite construction going on at WTC across the street, couldn't hear a sound inside the room!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Experience, WTC Tribute”
Reviews.Author: HTX009
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Hilton : "Superb treatment" Date: 17 Dec 2009 Booked this hotel threw our Travel department and by god this has to have one of the best views of the city. From the moment you get to the front steps you are enlighten to see and pay tribute to our heroes in your front door steps overlooking the WTC. The hotel it self has a fast and speedy check in and check out service, the amenities that are in your room is either a view of the WTC or a City view which I received overlooking the Manhattan bridge and Brooklyn Bridge. In room the comfort of your oversized bed and sheets, Plasma HDTV and your own security vault to store all valued items you do not want to be caught walking with. The restaurant on the 3rd floor has great food as well, a bit over priced but it's NYC. On a final note, if staying on the World Trade Center side overlooking Church St... please make sure to ask for ear plugs to sleep. Construction shift is working 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “You know what you're getting...”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: We were staying with friends in New Jersey in August 2009 and needed a hotel downtown realtively near to Pier 11 in get the Seastreak in and out of Manhattan. We got a relatively good deal through the American lastminute.com website which was about $103, so about £70. Check in was swift and fuss free, despite it being Saturday and the hotel being slap bang in the business district, the lobby was quite busy. The room was clean and modishly furnished, probably because this was a relatively new hotel. I've read many reviews who stated that the noise from the building works at Ground Zero/World Trade Center is quite disturbing. Even though it was a Saturday, and we were at the front of the hotel work was still being undertaken and to be honest we didn't even notice it. We didn't spend much time in the room as we were in the City to watch the Yankees Red Sox game (the one that went on for hours if you can remember it!), but I'd quite happily stay here again. On a side note, this is a great place to stay if you do want to watch the new World Trade Center site taking shape (ask for a room at the front of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Incredible views, Will definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: JmiThng72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 28-31, 2010. We had a corner junior suite on the 45th floor with views of the World Trade Center site. The views were stunning and I could just stare out the windows for hours. The room was great, no complaints there. I was a little worried about the construction noise after reading so many negative reviews here, but the noise was a non-issue and I wouldnt let that deter anyone from booking this hotel. The service wasn't the greatest - they didnt clean our room one day and when we called later that night for towels they said they'd be right up and nobody ever showed. Then the next morning we called for towels again and it took over an hour for someone to bring them. Beware: the hotel puts an extra $75 a day hold on your credit/debit card in addition to the daily rate for any services you may use (mini bar, room service, etc). Again, not anything that ruined my stay but it wouldve been nice to know this beforehand. However I didnt let this ruin my stay and I would absolutely stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Deterred By The Noise”
Reviews.Author: joabil
Reviews.Content: We booked a cruise and stay package and were slightly concerned when we discovered that we were staying at the Hilton Millenium after reading the many reviews commenting on the noise from the reconstruction of the WTC. Yes their was some noise but this was more than offset by the wonderful views over the Hudson River and the superb sunsets. Rooms are comfortable and well furbished and staff were friendly and helpful. We normally enjoy eating and drinking in the hotel in which we stay but prices were exhorbitant so ate out instead. Although in downtown Mnahattan the Hilton Millenium is only a 20 minute subway ride to Times Square and a 10 minute walk from Seaport which has some excellent eateries and pubs. All in all a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY PLACE TO STAY IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: karkulture
Reviews.Content: Very, very cool hotel.. Clean with wow factor.. Some construction noise but never a problem.. If you want decent large rooms and worth the cab/subway fare to get to times square. Stayed all over NY and this is the best bar none!!! Could be cheaper though at $499 a night..!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible view of WTC construction”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: From the 36th floor I watched both sunset and sunrise, which was magnificent. Yes there is the countries largest construction site just below the hotel, it seems as though guest would know this well before they ever booked. Having spent two weeks in a hotel at the foot of Burj Kalifa in Dubai while it was being built, this construction zone is small potatoes. I found the staff helpful and efficient. The room is no frills, but clean. For New York good sized. I spent most of my time in the room looking out the window, as that was the centerpiece. No free Interent :(

Reviews.Title: “bargain price for lower manhattan”
Reviews.Author: samson2512
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after booking it through airmiles. Price was really good for a 5* hotel (about £125 per night) in lower manhattan, and I did notice the warning referring to possible noise at the ground zero site. This is bacause the hotel is just beside the construction site and the work does continue most of the night - they even provide ear plugs in the room. These worked really well and I had 2 good nights sleep. If you are staying for a couple of nights and dont mind having to use earplugs (may be necessary, I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again. Its clean, friendly and a bargain at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - no wow factor and pricey food”
Reviews.Author: TheG00dfella
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 47th floor in corner room - excellent views and a large room with full amenities. Hotel is very close to Fulton st and Chambers st tube stations that can take you north either side of Manhattan. There are restaurants in the area but you have to find them - the Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Food was 'OK' but very pricey. The service was average - very surly staff. Insane Jazz music played all day long in the restaurant. Beds were very comfy and we heard no noise from ground zero at all. Location wise I would have picked something further up in mid Manhattan along the south edge of central park. I found we were constantly travelling north to see the major sites and go to all the main shops. A special note to the receptionist 'Thomas'. Very friendly and spoke to us like humans beings. Local knowledge was excellent and told us all we wanted to know. Just what you need after a weary journey.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyElHaybe
Reviews.Content: Although lots of noise due to the WTC construction site, we've had an amazing stay at the Hilton with an incredible view !

Reviews.Title: “Great views, convenient to transportation and shopping, yummy breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: rolandep
Reviews.Content: I am a bit of a hotel snob so I notieced that the bathroom could stand some updating but this minor detail aside, I enjoyed the convenience to shopping (it is right beside Century 21 one of the best upscale discount stores in the world), and to transportation subway stations abound within a three block radius of the hotel. I also really enjoyed the views we stayed on the higher floors and it was wrth the couple bucks extra. What was also a good deal was paying a bit extra to have breakfast included ,it was cheaper than paying at the table. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, super comfy beds - will stay again, but beware the pushy bellhops”
Reviews.Author: ShukHan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for those staying in Manhattan. I booked it as a package deal and it ended up being a good deal compared to some of the places uptown. I saved over $100, which if you're somewhat watching your pennies, nets you cab fare, an unlimited ride metro pass and a meal at a fine restaurant (ie. Perry Street). The discount designer department store Century 21 is right next door - beat the crowds and shop early in the morning or in the evening. It's really accessible by subway, with a station right out front and out back around the block. Chinatown is about 2 stations away. SoHo is about 3. There's not a whole lot of good dining around the hotel - you are in the Financial District, you know! The hotel, though renovated/rebuilt after 9/11, looks sleek and modern on the outside, but the inside is slightly worn (I stress, slightly!). Rooms and the beds are really comfortable and clean (no bed bugs)! I stayed in a high-level, spacious corner room with a great view north of the city and the Empire State Building from the near floor-to-ceiling windows that will make your head spin. (Last trip in NYC, I stayed in a mid-town Marriott - cramped with a great view of a wall)! The hotel is literally across the street from the 9/11 site, so construction on the weekdays goes on all day and night. You can hear the noise from the room, but I slept through it like a baby (the beds really are comfortable). The front desk and concierge staff are great. The bellhops, however, are really, really pushy to the point that I almost wanted to scream at them. There's nothing like a bellhop yanking your bags out of the hotel when you're just standing around waiting. Even worse, they tossed my bags into the cab with less care and attention stereotypically given to bag handlers at the airport! Snarl at them, ignore them, do whatever you can to avoid them! Otherwise fabulous. I would have no issues returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nick”
Reviews.Author: nbnsh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located in the financial district of NYC. Easy to find, would stay there again. Beds were exceptionally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An impressive hotel that overlooks history!”
Reviews.Author: Krefelder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Hilton from 30 September to 5 October. On arrival by train at the Penn Station, we used the subway to get to the hotel - a 15 minute journey which brought us out in Church Street just a couple of minutes from the hotel. Check-in was quick and efficient and we were soon whisked to the 30th floor where our room gave us an excellent view to the west - Ground Zero immediately in front of us and the Hudson River and New Jersey in the middle distance. The room was a very good size, clean and well equipped, including a wall mounted 42" flat panel television! Work is non-stop day and night at Ground Zero and, outside the hotel and in the immediate area, the noise is loud and can be quite intrusive. But, despite slight concerns, at room level the noise was minimal and caused no disturbance at all at night. We didn't eat at the hotel, but instead for breakfast found an 'Au Bon Pain' deli just a couple of minutes away from the hotel on Broadway. At night we ate at different restaurants further uptown. One night we wanted an early dinner followed by a cinema visit - the hotel's friendly and helpful concierge provide all the necessary information and booked us into an excellent Italian restaurant close to the cinema. The Millennium may be slightly out of the centre of Manhattan, but we found that Brooklyn Bridge, the Staten Island Ferry, Battery Park, Wall Street and the Hudson River were all in easy walking distance. We'd recommend the Millennium for its location, for its generously sized rooms and for its room rates which are more reasonable than uptown Manhattan. Oh yes! and of course its place in history too!

Reviews.Title: “For downtown Manhattan stay here!”
Reviews.Author: WanttoGetoutMore
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and always stay here when I have business downtown. There can be a lot of noise due to ground zero construction, but the location is so great. The groundfloor lounge is a great place to meet up and the concierge has a ton of good suggestions. Public transportation is easy to get. Like always in NY, construction is to be figure in as a hassle somewhere, sometime. The rooms have all been renovated in the past couple of years and there is a gift shop in case you forgot something.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Views of Walll Street, Status of Liberty, Jersey City and Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: Maude1017
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - we were on the 42nd floor in a corner room facing SW. Bed, lines, facilities were all clean and pristine. Wish we could have stayed longer -

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT NOISY AND OUTDATED”
Reviews.Author: aaykay_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during Sep10. Was in NYC with some friends...the hotel is nice but nothing special. Noise I read about the noise before i went there however its unbearable. the noise is on 24/7 also there is a little vibration. For this reason alone i would avoid this place. Location Good if your working or interested in the financial district but 10min-15min taxi ride away for times square and all the main attractions. However theres is Starbucks attached to the side of the hotel (which is good for a strong coffee in the morning) Room We had a junior suite, which was small, the beds, decor were outdated. Extras No wifi in the rooms, and in the lobby it was $15 per day! Overall Nice but the location is a let down and the noise unbearable

Reviews.Title: “Nice, noisy but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in June 2010. Arrived mid afternoon from DC, cab from Penn Station was around USD $15. The hotel is right in the Ground Zero constriction zone and there are a few closed streets which can make getting to the entrance tricky. No huge drama though. Check in was a breeze, stayed in a Deluxe room on the 28th floor. Our room overlooked the construction site where the Twin Towers once stood. This was really quite breathtaking. What everyone else says about the noise is true - the construction goes on 24/7 and you can hear it even up high. In saying that, we literally didn't lose any sleep over the noise. Room was very clean and modern and have been nicely renovated after 9/11. We had breakfast included with our room which a little average but not terrible either. The hotel is close to loads of subway stops and close to everything you need to be close to in the financial district. There's not much going on at night around the hotel so make sure you have reservations somewhere. Overall, not too bad at all and I'd stay again if I needed to be in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “For a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jn_Gore
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about the noise from Ground Zero but thought it can't be that bad. IT WAS, we tried to sleep in 1402. We could see the work being done from our room. It didn't seem bad during the morning as the traffic covered the noise, but at night even the loud air conditioning unit couldn't cover the noise. Our last night there Sept 28th was the worse, I got about 3 hours sleep.Other than that it is near to the subway, we had a lovely time on the Staten Island Ferry and will go back to New York but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel Security shake down!!!”
Reviews.Author: judi2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Room was large. Trying to get there was a problem. Concierge sent us to a street that was closed. Room was large. Some staff were friendly. My husband forgot his suit and called. They said they would mail it, but we don't live far and had a friend who lived in the City. He went next day to pick it up and they told him no one was there from security. He insisted he wasn't leaving. They told him they couldn't find the suit. Finally, he realized it was a shake down and he offer $20 and the suit APPEARED!!! That's no one to do business. I have not yet contacted manager, but intend to. It's too bad. everything else was fairly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Professional setting, in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: sbradford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at Ground Zero and has been rebuilt since 9-11. The site is right in the heart of Financial district, convenient to everything. The rooms are extremely comfortable and immaculately clean. The meeting rooms were well staged and perfect for our needs. a word of warning--Ground Zero construction goes on 24/7 and you can hear it in the rooms, especially on that side of the hotel facing the construction area. If this type of noise disburbs your sleep, you may not be happy at all. The Hilton bed was wonderful, the most comfortable I've ever seen in a hotel. The meeting room on the 4th floor overlooks the construction site as well, with a panoramic view. The staff were extremely friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, comfortable hotel, convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: rockmama12052
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Millenium Hilton for a business trip that was being held in the hotel for four nights. We had no issues with noise (we were on 50th floor) but one of his coworkers had to change rooms due to the construction noise that goes on at all hours. He originally was on a much lower floor (like the 20th). The rooms are very clean and comfortable with flat panel tv and mini bar. We were pleasantly surprised on the first night to receive turn down service with chocolates and ice in the chiller. Unfortunately, this did not happen the remainder of our stay so I'm not sure what happened there. The front desk and bell staff were most friendly and helpful if you even looked like you had a question they were ready. The lobby bar seemed to always be busy and there is a Starbucks connected to the property. The location (for downtown) was great...right outside the front of the hotel is the entrance to the R train. Right next door is Century 21 department store for anyone who has the energy and motivation to shop in the crowds there. I gave it my best shot! This is a lovely hotel, but not on our dime...so cannot say it was a value at over $400 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, pushy staff.”
Reviews.Author: awslufc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights in mid Sept 10 with my 19 year old son. I cannot fault the room in terms of size and cleanliness and the location is good with easy access to the rest of Manhattan with numerous Subway stops close by. The one fault I can find is that the bell boys are a little pushy. I prefer to handle my own luggage but they wrestled my bag away from me on a couple of occasions, and I am not a small chap. I can move my luggage 5 yards and if I need assistance I will ask. Maybe it is the English aversion to tipping for something I can do, and prefer to do, myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Downtown Manhattan, but not as great as it could be”
Reviews.Author: Rusttribe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton in downtown Manhattan. If you don't know by know, this hotel is directly across from the former Twin Towers site, which is under constant construction. In fact, our room looked directly into the construction pit. There are lots of reviews on TripAdvisor where people are complaining about the noise. Ignore these! These people either did no research into the hotel, or just like to complain. Remember, this is Manhattan, so any hotel has some street noise during the day. I didn't hear noise at night at all. But the hotel makes it clear on its website that the surrounding streets are under constant construction (even on Weekends), and the hotel even offered ear plugs. The location of the hotel is great for exploring lower Manhattan. The South St Seaport, Staten Island Ferry, and local city boat tours are all within close walking distance. And there is good subway access, as the hotel is near the 1,2,3, and N,R,Q trains which easily get you uptown. The lobby is small for a major Hilton Hotel, and often very crowded. That being said, Check-IN and Out were swift and uncomplicated. I used HHonors points for my stay, so I can't speak to the value or price of the hotel, but I have a feeling it is average price for large NYC hotel. That being said, I have said at new Hiltons that probably cost less and are just a shade nicer. The room was small, which is to be expected in NYC. The bed is very comfy, the pillows are just way too soft. The bathroom, while also small, looked a little beat up, which was unexpected for a nice Hilton. They offered free continental breakfast coupons which was more than acceptable. My biggest gripe with the hotel is the room service. First, they don't offer a printed menu, only one on a special hotel channel on the TV. It is a pain to use as you can't search. You have to sit and wait for it to cycle through if you miss something. Second, the pricing is ridiculous!!! My wife and I just did dessert one night, and ordered a ice cream sundae and a piece of cake. The total bill was $50 including the delivery charges and included tips. And the desserts really weren't that good!!! In NYC we would normally not do hotel dessert, but in that part of the city, there aren't many after-hours/late night restaurants. Overall, a nice place to stay. I'm glad my room was free. But if I was paying, I think I'd do just as good at one of Midtowns Hampton Inns or Hilton Garden Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JCALV
Reviews.Content: Having paid 600 USD for one night in an executive junior suite it was the worst service experience of any hotel stay. The internet did not work because there was a problem with the modem. The modem was never replaced and I was told I would have to pay to access the internet in the business services room. My room key went bad after every time I left the room and had to get a total of 10, yes 10 replacement keys. We asked for a cab to be arranged and we were sent to three different locations to find a cab ourselves as the guy in charge of getting cabs was at lunch but they do not have a back. I will pay for service, but there was no service at the Hilton Millenium. I will never stay there or at any other Hilton again. The rooms are nice and clean and the bed very comfortable, but the service was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Both of us loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEEBEE48
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best of everything, lobby, staff, great room, views, "cool" pool, location. Got an upgraded room which was absolutely gorgeous, spacious, clean, modern....the breakfast was great, the bar, late on a Monday night, was perfect for a nightcap. Bartender was funny, guests were "cosmopolitan", great experience all around. Close to Little Italy and chinatown...............Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the place but service was "cold".”
Reviews.Author: RayoMcQueen2010
Reviews.Content: Our family group of 7 stayed here and we all liked the hotel for the most part. The rooms were ready and all clean and very sharp. We were afraid of construction noise but that was not a problem. The view from our rooms was the construction site across the street but given the history of the place (ground zero) we didn't mind that at all. Perhaps my only complaint was that the service attitude of bell boys and the security people in the lobby was not up to Hilton's standards. They were very rude to us. The bell boy on the side street got confused because he thought we didn't tip him for handling our luggage, but my brother in law had given him $12 but he was expecting the tip from me, so he was very rude and loud to me when he suggested that he had done his service and now it was my turn to pay up!! Big confusion at the moment, and I'm sure he still thinks we didn't tip him. Besides the bad service of these people everything else was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay with a Poignant Location”
Reviews.Author: carolinabluefish
Reviews.Content: I am from NYC and my partner and I recently stayed at the Millenium Hilton. This was our second time here and we really like this hotel. The Hotel is directly in front of the World Trade Center Site---Ground Zero. If you get a room facing west, you will get a very good view of Ground Zero and of the construction that is going on to rebuild it. I would say that the view you would get from one of the rooms here is one that you will never forget. You cannot help but think about what it was like on the morning of September 11, 2001. We could not imaging being a guest in this hotel on that day. The hotel sustained severe damage during the attacks, but it re-opened in 2003 and it is truly amazing that the hotel survived. The location is a good one. There are subway stations right in front of the hotel, so getting around the city is easy. The hotel is in lower Manhattan, so places like the financial district, and the South Street Seaport are nearby (but with the subway, everything is easy to get to). Yes, the area around it is very busy, but this is New York City--would you have it any other way? During our most recent trip, we booked a junior suite, which was wonderful since it had a small living room area separate from the bed. The room was also very bright, with windows facing west and north. Because of this, our views were spectacular. The construction at Ground Zero is constant. You will hear it, but honestly, it was not bothersome. If staying in a hotel directly across from Ground Zero seems a bit strange, even disrespectul to you, I would ask you to reconsider. By staying at the Millenium Hilton, you will be contributing to the re-growth of lower Manhattan, which was devestated on 9/11. This area of the City has really come back and staying here would make you a part of the revitalization.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in August this year, the hotel was perfect in everyway, had a great corner room of the 46th floor. Yes there was some noise, but the hotel I stayed at uptown for two nights had more. The view was breathtaking, the buffett breakfast was outstanding, the staff where wonderful, never rude and where beyond helpful. Century 21 next door would have to be the best department store I have ever been too. New York has noise, get over it. The rooms are large, close to everything. One of New Yorks great hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Construction noise wasn't bad”
Reviews.Author: bri0831
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on August 21-23rd 2010. My wife had to fly out of JFK and I was not trying to drive back & forth to MA in such a short timeframe. I read reviews & people complain about the noise from WTC construction, but honestly: find another hotel or at least look at maps so you know that you WILL be right across the street from it all. I was on the 19th floor and could barely hear anything. Just the noise from the TV or AC made it disappear. Now I bet that the 2nd floor would probably suck, but call the hotel 1st to see what floor you might get. It was extremely clean, nice 42" tv in the wall and super comfy king size bed with lots of down pillows. It was worth my $172 per night on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: dyong
Reviews.Content: We got this room at a great price on a certain travel auction site, hence the 5 star rating on value. We're normally frugal travelers who don't need much for amenities, and we didn't use any of the hotel's services other than using the swimming pool and sauna. We found the hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful, even on check in when they knew we had won the hotel on aforementioned auction site for a song. I knew about the construction on WTC site, and asked for a room on a higher floor and they didn't hesitate to move us up. The room we had was huge with newer furniture, queen size bed, sitting/reading area, writing desk and a 40" LCD. We never found any issues with construction noise. The only con I have with this hotel is the location in the financial district which requires a 10 minute or longer subway ride to the touristy areas in NY. This hotel caters to the business crowd, so if you want to be near the action, choose somewhere else. However, we've been to NY before and the location was nice for morning strolls to Chelsea and the Village to enjoy the NY lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very nice, but LOTS OF NOISE from Ground Zero work”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location many times, and the service is always good, rooms are nicely done, great A/C, and good sized rooms for NYC. Gym is very adequate, and the restaurant on the 3rd floor is good as well...BUT the noise level is late at times for construction work being done at the adjacent Ground Zero. I had noise both nights till 2 30 am which was difficult for 6 am starts in the morning. Also no food is served at bar (weak bar scene) in lobby which is frustrating. Location is Financial District so at night there is hardly anything to do, but I would check out the brand new W around the corner on Allen Street as their "Living Room" bar scene is very good. I got a corner room at this Hilton once and that is spectacular. Lastly the business center is great, but VERY PRICEY at .99 cents a page b&w and double that for color.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel most of these reviews are very harsh”
Reviews.Author: chrisliverpool101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last weekend, rooms nice big and clean. Great plasma TVs in both rooms (Booked a corner suite). If your going to NYC definately one to book. Staff are very friendly and nice. You wont hear the ground zero noice honest!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jami_Brooks
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice room and we were quite pleased due to all of the remarks about noise. We were not bothered by the noise but we did stay on a Friday and Saturday night so maybe the construction wasn't going strong, at night the construction noise was minimal at best. If I had to do it all again I would have stayed at this hotel for the entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: NobodysName
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have never, ever, ever stayed at a hotel with such unpleasant, unhelpful staff in my life. My friend and I booked two double beds, but they gave us a king size the first night - then told us to check back the next day to see if any would come available. When we called down the following day, we were told we'd have to pay an upgrade fee for two doubles because our occupancy is increased (we were still only two people - and that's the room type we booked to begin with). When we went down to the front desk, the clerk had no idea what we were talking about and said there is no additional fee for two doubles. Staff can't seem to get the story straight. Other fun issues we had to deal with: * Construction noise all day and overnight (hotel's right in front of ground zero) * Cockroaches in rooms * Paid upon checkout and when I got my credit card statement in the mail, it looks like the clerk added an extra digit to the amount that was charged. Big discrepancy. Don't these people balance their cashes at the end of the night? My advice: stay elsewhere. Not worth the time or effort. This is the WORST Hilton I've ever stayed at. Run!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost until WTC is rebuilt”
Reviews.Author: Yom07
Reviews.Content: Let's put this straight. The hotel is IN FRONT of the WTC construction site. 24x7 noise. While checking in, the staff told me "you might here a little noise". Come on guys ! That's non stop. Apart from that, breakfast is OK, but I had better ones in other Hiltons, Rooms are OK, but could use a refurbishment. I won't ask Mr. Hilton to offer free internet, just Wifi in the room would be OK, even at 15$ a day.

Reviews.Title: “Most terrible experience I could have ever imagined....”
Reviews.Author: NWN100
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible! I booked this hotel to celebrate our 1st Year wedding anniversary, wrong choice. Let me preface my following review that I have accrued over 40K Hilton Honors points just from stays since becoming a member in January 2009. First off check-in took over 1.5 hours...uncalled for. I suffered a broken ankle 5 days prior to going to NYC so I had a walking boot on my leg. My wife and I got our room key and went to our room on the 48th floor, reeked of cleaning solutions in the hallway. Our room had to be one of the smallest rooms at this hotel? I wanted to switch rooms, staff said they were booked full and there was nothing they could do. If they changed reservations I would have lost my room for Friday night.....asked a second receptionist they suggested I could PAY 108.00USD for an updgrade.....WHAT? Absoulutly terrible! I laid down on the bed later that night about 9:30 and rolled over and saw some kind of stain that ran down the wall about 4 ft high. Sickening! I used the bathroom the next morning and the handle to flush the toilet the plastic was worn off. How can this not be replaced? I didn't want to place my clothes in the drawer because there was dirt in the corners of the drawer. How can this hotel fall in to such disarray? WILL NOT RETURN TO THIS HOTEL EVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: Traveurcpl
Reviews.Content: Millenium has it all! On our return trip to New York prior to flying home we chose this Hilton, based on reviews and our want to see the WTC area. On arrival we were met with quick baggage service and check in, 8 minutes max, and we were on our way to the 43rd floor, corner room. Our baggage man gave us a quick run down of the room and even pointed out all the city landmarks. Our room was very clean and spacious with large DBL beds, a nice desk and chair. The lounge chair was perfect for relaxation while looking out our two huge floor to ceiling windows! WOW~!!!! Did not care for the older stlye of bathroom and bathtub. The surrounding area, WTC, is somber, "do not ever forget what happened here" We walked the area and took many pictures. Minutes from the river and wonderful views along the skyline. We were seconds from the subway, minutes from the Brooklyn Bridge, City Hall and Wall Street. Many comments on tripadvisor about construction noise, guess what......get over it! This is reality and for many a once in a lifetime chance to see history, a little noise won't hurt, take the ear plugs. The jackhammer crane stopped at 11:15 p.m. and since we were on the corner, facing north it was not that bad. We had the buffet B-fest, very good, with plenty of choices. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: catch20stu69
Reviews.Content: After countless reviews i read on this hotel, good and extremely bad, i have to say that this hotel was absolutely perfect! the staff made our stay very memorable. I'd like to thank the staff for giving us the best time in New York! Myself and my girlfriend were dying to visit New York City and this hotel was just great! We stayed in room 2606 (26th floor) and the view was breath-taking. (for a great view go to the 55th floor and look out the hall window!). The noise from Ground Zero was VERY minimal, didn't know what all the fuss was about from all other bad reviews on the noise. The room itself was a perfect size for two. Bed was extremely comfy. Our room was cleaned everyday and the minibar was replenished too. Spent a sh*tload on the minibar, so watch out, it is pricey. haha. Great location, 10min walk to Battery Park, underground stations all around pretty much. the 9/11 Visitors Centre is on Liberty Street on the south side of Ground Zero and it is just something else! if you want a more detailed list of eating places etc look on Google Maps. If you want to take a cab, there would be staff waiting to get you one which was awesome! Even when we would arrive back at the hotel, there would be someone there to open the door for you and help you with any bags you may be carrying. It's about 15-20min cab ride uptown to Central Park South and would cost roughly $15 inc tip. just to give you an idea of how big Manhattan is. That's about it i think. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “you can't sleep due to construction at night at world trade center”
Reviews.Author: test2010
Reviews.Content: 7/21/2010, 12:30am: loud nosiy is still going on due to construction at world trade center. My Friend family(I booked hotel for them) can't sleep at midnight even they stay at 19th floor of the hotel. We call front desk, they told us that nothing they can do to reduce the nosiy. They are planning to escape the hotel tomorrow even I reserved hotel for 4 nights(today is their first night). Front Desk told me that it is New York Law to allow construction working at midnight, surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: LisaC22
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is part of a generic chain. Whilst this means you’re guaranteed a certain standard of accommodation, it also means that it’s lacking in individuality. The hotel is in the financial area of downtown New York and therefore attracts mostly business clients. It’s very close to the subway and Brooklyn Bridge. The room itself is clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed and a huge TV. The staff were also very helpful when I asked for assistance. My only criticism would be that the toilet paper could have been better quality. The hotel is right next to Ground Zero. This means that most rooms have a view of the entire ground zero site. They are currently in the process of building a memorial which means there are construction works being carried out all day, every day. The noise is constant and can be heard from the room. Saying that, its hard not to be emotional when looking out of your window and after the first few days we almost forgot about the noise. When you’re in New York sightseeing how much time do you really spend in your room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with a good location next to Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller73
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great view (ask for upper floors) and good breakfast. Hotel is very close to metro. Also from the WTC you can easily get a train to New Jersey and Newark airport. Century 21st Outlet Mall is next to the Hotel if you feel like shopping - prepare for many people and hot atmosphere :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not Ideally Located, but Doesn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: gregbodenlos
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property downtown, and while I can't say the hotel has an ideal location -- its haunting location directly across from Ground Zero is a bit much to handle -- it's well situated to the Chambers Street Subway stop and well within walking distance to Battery Park, the Financial District, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side near SoHo. Rooms are what you would expect from a Hilton product in the NYC market: clean, relatively modern, moderately sized and comfortable. Request a high floor if you have the chance, as there's construction daily across the street (our front desk agent reminded every guest as they checked-in that earplugs could be provided). Luckily, they blocked us on the 54th floor which afforded us a great view of the Hudson River and was quiet from the noise down below. We weren't able to secure the 2 beds that we had requested previously, but that's the way it goes sometimes. The pool was icy cold and small (what can you expect in Manhattan, though) but the recreation area redeemed itself with a nice steam room and exercise facility. Overall, I was completely satisfied and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Genny77
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Hilton, celebrating our son's birthday. We were a little apprehensive about possible noise due to the construction at the Ground Zero site. Our fears turned out to be unfounded. Perhaps it was because we were on the 45th floor and the air conditioner was running but we never used the ear plugs or noise machine we were given at check in. The work on the site did continue for many hours each day, but the only way we knew it was going on was when we looked out the window and watched. We never heard it. Everything about the hotel was immaculate, including the pool. We had a junior suite with beautiful views of the Hudson, the bridges and New Jersey. Really spectacular at night. The room came with two 42 inch TV's (one for the bedroom, one for the living room.) The bedroom had a king size bed; the living room couch folded out to a small (and I do mean small; no one over 5 ft 9 could have slept on it) but surprisingly comfortable bed. Each room had its own climate control system. The suite had all the little amenities (plush robes in the closet, umbrella in case of rain, extra blankets and pillows, good hair care products, Lavazza coffee for the coffee maker. . .) We walked a couple of blocks to a Duane Reade rather than pay the overpriced charges for snacks from the self service bar. There were also restaurants nearby so we never ate in the hotel restaurant. The service was also impressive. For example, it was only when we came back from a night out celebrating that I realized there were no sheets for the sofa bed in the closet. I called the front desk (it was 3:30 in the morning) and they immediately sent someone from housekeeping to bring sheets and make up the bed! Downsides were no free internet (we paid $14.95 and it was not wi-fi) and ridiculous charges ($55 per day) to park a car. Luckily we took the train into the city! Still, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...not great”
Reviews.Author: tmwallace
Reviews.Content: Good- -Hotel has a very friendly staff. -Check in was very easy...and I was actually much earlier than posted check in times. -FANTASTIC location with subway access directly out of the front door. Bad- - Has a very bad cigarette smoke smell to it...and I'm not on a smoking floor. - EXTREMELY noisy construction at ground zero. It is now 1:16am and I'm sitting in my room and they are STILL doing construction outside. Overall a decent hotel, just bring earplugs if you aren't a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonBerry84
Reviews.Content: we needed a place to stay when we arrived in New York and we booked this hotel through name your own price on priceline. Got a really good deal. about £85 before tax. We were upgraded to a twin room which was HUGE! we had a view of the Twin Towers site from out room which was slightly eerie. Location was ok, it was downtown but right near the subway station so wasn’t a problem travelling into times square and other tourist spots. Concierge was really really helpful, gave us some good tips on where to buy tickets for shows etc... This is more of a business travellers hotel though, if you’re looking for something more in Midtown i wouldn’t recommend this hotel. For a 4 star it was one of the nicest i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed In The Guest Service @ Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MilleniumHiltion
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed in the guest service @ the Millenium Hiltion in New York during my stay over the 4th of July week. My husband and I booked 2 nights at the hotel for Friday and Saturday night. Right from the start we were suprised with little disappointments. No greeting from the Service Desk Attendant; had to wait on her to come over to check us in....We were then told that there was a lot of construction around the hotel and that if we needed them we could come get ear plugs from the front desk. Dont you think that might be something that they should notify us about when we make the reservation? And if it's that bad, why not just leave a pair of plugs in the room. Why should I have to get up and go down to the desk to get them after I've already been fighting to get to sleep in my noisy, expensive room. ...There was no one to offer to assist with our luggage... Later on, my husband and I took a nap after dinner before we went out to explore Times Square at night. I was woken my a phone call in my room that I did not make it to. Then a few minutes later, a knock on the door by a security guard. I told him to hold on, and that I was not yet dressed. I quickly threw on my robe and as I was opening the door, the man already had his key card in my door and was preparing to enter on his own, even though he had heard me. Not cool. He tells me I need to go downstairs and speak to the manager. But does not tell me why. What? I tell him I'll be down in a minute after I get dressed. No sooner had I put on shoes when I heard another knock at the door. A second security guard, telling me I need to come with him. When I get to the manager, he tells me that they had woken my husband and I up at 10:30pm because we had ordered the $14.99 in-room internet earlier in the day, but they did not have a card number on file for us. Ok, #1- I paid for the room up front with a credit card? So how do I not have one on file? #2- This is only my first night @ 10:30pm. I've already prepaid for 2 nights and 3 calendar days of valet. Surely you can assume that I'm good for another $15 dollars in the morning. #3 - They had not had our breakfast tickets ready when we checked in and were supposed to leave them under our door that night. Could they not have just left a note with the tickets and asked us to bring our CC to the desk in the morning when we went to breakfast? That would have been a bit more guest-friendly don't you think? The breakfast bar there is $50/person. So they technically still owed us 4 tickets worth a sum of $200 because they were not prepared when we checked in. But they will wake us up and have me escorted by security to see the manager at 10:30pm over my $14.99 wireless internet charge on my own room #, becasue they forgot to put the credit card number on file for any extras. Seriously? This hotel needs some serious lessons on ediquet and guest service. I was extreemly disappointed and frustrated on how they handled this situation. Seriously, $14.99 warents me being treated like I'm a suspicious criminal? And not one sincere apology from any of the staff for the foul treatment or disruption of our sleep... Then to top off the ordeal, they had still not delivered our $200 worth of breakfast passes when we got up to go eat in the morning. We still had to go down to the desk to pick them up before we went back upstairs to the dinning room. Again, what's with the service at this hotel? I've always enjoyed the Hiltion hotels and have relied in the "brand" of thier hotel chain. But the staff and poor service experienc at the Millenium has negatively altered my perception.....I do hope that this is not the typical experience of the hotel's patrons, and that it will be read and taken as a learning experience for the hotel staff. We were there for vacation and a fun, care-free get away. But this hotel experience soiled our trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cbkr11
Reviews.Content: We had an Amex Convention and they offer this hotel with corporate rates. Excuse me? I checked today the prices and now the double bedroom is U$179 and the room rate in June 25th was u$320! It was a rip off. No service at all from staff. We asked for earlier check in, we arrived at 8:30 AM and the front desk lady said no madam, we have no rooms for you and check in is around 2 PM. More than 50 floors and no rooms ready? She continue to tell us to leave our luggage at the storage room and come back. We were tired, and we had no choice. We came back and we had to take our luggage to our rooms ourselves. No help from anyone. We were almost invisible for the staff except the nice doorman, who greeted us with a smile. The room was basic simple, and kind of small, nothing fancy, with a really comfortable bed mattress. Basic amenities in the bathroom, annoying TV system. The indoor pool was ok, the water was more cold than I expected, my impression of course. The issue with the noise from the construction at the Ground Zero is a the breaking point, I didn´t even bother to ask them to change my room to the other side of the building. The rooms should be free of charge. And this room was at the 36th fl! Just to have the best example of a NO GOOD SERVICE for a so called 4 star hotel: there was an used breakfast try on the floor in front of my room door for almost 36 hours! It was so disgusting. And the bar in the lobby was something else, I don´t know were the bartender had his How to do a Cocktail course, but let me tell you Mr., a Margarita has Tequila in it, not just ice cubes and a sort of sweet mix drink, we asked for a real Margarita. It was awful, tiny and quite expensive. They charged for the use of the internet at the Business Service Room u$0,16 p/min, the Wi Fi Room, etc. So, corporate rates not in here. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “The View is worth the Noise.”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Got a bargain weekend deal on Hilton Website, included breakfast for two, and 2pm check-out for Hilton Honors members. After booking, Hilton website starts offering discounted perks based on availability. For extra $15 they would upgrade to high floor corner room. Decided it was worth the money and upon check-in was told the upgrade was available. We ended up on the 54th floor corner room with panoramic view of East River on one side and Hudson River on the other. King Room was huge, well furnished and extremely clean. Bed was comfortable, but like other reviews you can hear the noise across the street. Staff was very professional as well as pleasant, they even offered us ear plugs upon check-in. We ordered room service late and asked for it to be delivered at specific time, which was no problem. Hotel Restaurant that served breakfast was nice, but I probably would not eat there if it had not been included in our rate. Staying downtown on a weekend is a great way to beat the higher midtown hotel prices, and cabs are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Sawellin07
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel. I got a great deal on a Junior City-View Suite. I love staying in the city suites b/c the view is amazing. I was high enough to not really hear the construction. I think the A/C unit is what really makes all the noise in the rooms and people just think its the construction. I ended up turning off the A/C my entire stay. I used the lobby bathroom and that was pretty gross. They should clean that more often. I passed by the pool and it is so small. I also looked at the menu but the food was way over priced. I ended up going to soho and tribeca to eat since there really isn't anything nearby the hotel. I really like the location of the hotel Its walking distance to pier 17, battery park, and tribeca, and Its just a train ride to central park and time square. Everyone says wait until the construction is complete to stay at the hotel..but I think thats the best part of the hotel. I love seeing how much they have completed since the last time I was here. I always take pictures to record the progress. I also think that when they actually do finish the WTC Construction the price is going to be rediculous. I think paying 194 a night for my suite was pretty good but eventually I could see that price zooming up to 400-600 a night. My advice if you really want to stay here but are worried about the noise is to try and come during a holiday. I was there on 4th of July and It seemed like there was no construction the 4th and 5th of july. So im assuming all major holidays would be a great time to stay here. Oh and there isn't good internet in the rooms and They charge 15 dollars to order a movie. (Prince of Persia)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: swgalt
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here multiple times, and going back in 2 days. We love the downtown location- easy to subways, quieter than midtown. Rates are good for NYC. Easy access to TriBeca, SoHo, Lower East Side and Brooklyn Bridge

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy Due to Proximity to Ground Zero - Avoid Until Work Complete”
Reviews.Author: Nordirland
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here and the decent price being offered for a room (well for New York anyway) I subsequently booked this hotel expecting good things. Having checked in and arrived in my room the noise was deafening that was coming from Ground Zero some 40 floors below. The room was clean if a little small and came with a lovely big television. My one major criticism with Hilton Hotels is the lack of a free Internet service but even if you did pay there is no Wi-Fi in the hotel rooms just in the lobby. The hotel also doesn’t offer complimentary breakfast which I knew about but having stayed in another Hilton two weeks previous it did offer complimentary breakfast. I think Hilton should perhaps have a standard policy on breakfasts, and for the price customers pay for rooms you would really expect a breakfast. There was a coffee maker in the room though which is always handy. The view from the room was superb but the noise was very loud although we assumed that the construction work would cease before night. How wrong were we! The work and extreme noise (drilling concrete) was continuous and was as clear as day through the ear plugs I had with me. Nowhere on Hotels.com did it mention that this noise would be apparent so I will be taking matters further with them. Come 1am the noise was still extremely loud so I went to reception and enquired about it and they said it is 24 hours a day 7 days a week and they couldn’t do much about it. The girl at the front desk was very pleasant and offered a room change which I gratefully accepted. The room was on the same floor but on the opposite side of the hotel. Although quieter the noise coming from Ground Zero could still be heard in the room and with ear plugs it was a constant humming noise reverberating right up through the bed and into your ears… very annoying and hard to sleep with. There is also the occasional horn sounding from the harbour area. Although the noise is not something the hotel has direct response over (they offer earplugs and sound reducing machines) if I had have been made aware that noise was present I would not have booked the hotel. I thought I was getting a good rate and now I know why but that is something I will be taking up with Hotels.com. Upon checking out I had two concierge staff trying to help me with bags and getting a taxi. However, one was quite rude to the other in front of me when he told his colleague to shut a door even though he had to retrieve another one of my bags which he obviously made him aware of! For the price of a room now and even more so pre-construction I would expect breakfast and complimentary Wi-Fi but the hotel did not offer this. The rooms however, are nicer than most hotel rooms and the reception staff member I dealt with was very nice and polite. However, I think better value is to be had elsewhere and until the construction has finished (Sep 11) I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, not 4 star, good if gotten at a value!”
Reviews.Author: kipwingerjr
Reviews.Content: I will start this with the basics, but please read the whole review! This is the FIRST time I have written negatively about service (I honestly am not picky and will stay at a motel 6, etc.). First, the room. Very clean, warm hallways, cool in the room. Bathroom was a mid-range space, not four star. Basic, some outdated fixtures, good size. Room itself good size for NYC. Bed very comfortable, chair and ottoman clean but starting to show wear. Coffee maker and desk area good. TV console great size, minibar fridge stocked (and of course, expensive). View gorgeous over into New Jersey and over the WTC work site. About the noise - we were on the 24th floor and could hear some rumbles, but it did not upset any sleep. Hotel public spaces not impressive, again, basic. Quick check in, elevators, front desk and front doors all within 40 steps. No grand lobby here. ON TO SERVICE. I promise that I am not picky, yet when I stay at (and pay for) a 4-star hotel, I expect service that makes me feel somewhat special (anything - a welcome note, door help, anything). First, I walked in carrying two large shopping bags and a purse.
