Went through the revolving door with a door/bell man outside and one inside, no help offered (eve though it isn't that large of a lobby, there should be some help offered to guests). After checking in, still no help offered for carrying bags after passing a different bellman. This is not 4 star service - I wasn't even asked by reception if I needed help, had a preference for floor or beds, etc. Went in and out of the hotel at least 4 times first day, and never a door held open when I did not use the revolving door. HERE IS THE REAL COMPLAINT! The next morning, and this is the kicker, housekeeping knocked and came in the room THREE TIMES while we were sleeping!!! at 8:30am, I did not hear a knock (sleeping), but heard my door open and housekeeping talking to each other and walk in. They then saw us in bed and closed the door. At 9:45, I heard knocking, then the door open AGAIN! I shouted out that we were in the room, and they left. At 11 or so, they knocked once again, but this time I put the security lock on (I must have forgot) so they couldn't get all the way in. FYI - checkout is not until NOON!!!!! At 11:40 a gentleman knocked on our door (we were packing up) and asked if we were leaving!!!!! Of course we are - after we CHECKOUT! I have worked hotels - a simple report shows what guests have checked out. I was appalled that at a 4 star hotel I would be awoken twice by housekeeping HOURS before checkout, then twice more been bullied out. Absolutely unacceptable. Overall, would NOT stay here again unless desperate or paid almost nothing. Felt overpriced for the room - even in NYC. To deal with poor service, less than stellar accommodations, etc, but have to pay for 4-stars is not okay. Look around for other deals.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: durhamdonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in May 2010. There is nothing really wrong with the hotel just do not expect top notch service and accommadation. If you can book this hotel for say $199 a night go for it.. As previously stated the staff seem to stand around a lot talking all day and do not seem interested in helping the guests of the hotel. The hotel over looks ground zero, which is a construction site at the moment and can be noisy. Ok stay, but not blown away and we would not stay again, unless we got a really good deal from them.

Reviews.Title: “Large room with brilliant views, flooded with light”
Reviews.Author: Mulleram
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in a boutique hotel in Times Square on my business trips but this time, decided to stay in the financial district close to a second meeting location (walking to the 730am mtg rather than cabbing). I was surprised by the proximity to Ground Zero (100 feet maybe?) but there were always doormen, day and night to help me from my cab, I was always acknowledged and assisted each time I passed the front desk. My room was a spacious king, overlooking the job site which for me was fine coming from a construction background the noise was minimal and the activity interesting to watch. The views were spectacular and the afternoon light that flooded the room was gorgeous. I did have some difficulties at first with my internet connectivity but the Millenium Hilton provides dedicated phone support that helped me resolve my issue very quickly so I was hard at work in no time. I had checked in while the hotel restaurant was between service but the recommended Stage Door Deli was just a short block away and I grabbed breakfast and lunch from there during my stay. Best thing besides the glorious bed? And views? A nice, deep, cast iron tub that I filled to the brim and luxuriated in a relaxing bubble bath each evening. The water was hot and plentiful and it did wonders for my stress levels. (any chance bubble bath might be added to the products provided guests? I had to plan ahead a bit and stop at a drugstore to find some.) Only issue -- I need more / better task lighting while working at the desk in my room. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful but unfortunately, engineering / housekeeping was not able to source another lamp for me during my two day stay. This is not an issue unique to the Millenium and it would not keep me from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Appears classy but isn't impressive”
Reviews.Author: bluehatbarbie
Reviews.Content: I'm a state employee staying here on business. We booked this hotel because it's within walking distance of the office. Whenever people asked where we were staying, they seemed impressed when we told them “the Millennium Hilton” but I’ve been telling them just how unimpressive it is: At $318 a night, it isn't cheap, but then again, no where in NYC is! They charge your credit card up front for your entire stay and I hadn't deposited the full amount yet so my card declined. They were willing to just charge two nights to get me checked in. I immediately transferred the necessary funds to cover the whole stay, went back down (the same day) and asked to have the rest charged/approved/held. I was told I was all set however, today (3 days later) when I got back to my room, the key didn't work. I had to go all the way back down and ask the front desk to charge my card again. The girl at the desk told me that my card had been declined 3 times and I could not use it. I told her I knew the money was there but she didn't care, told me to go get cash, and kept my key--she refused to do anything to help me and was a complete snob about the whole thing--I was LIVID. I wasn't about to walk 7 blocks to my bank (which I just came from btw) so I called my bank to double check the available amount before doing anything else. When I confirmed that I had 6 times the required amount (no different than 10 minutes ago when she refused my card), I went back to another front desk clerk (who wasn’t an idiot) and he had no problem with my card. Then when I went back to my room (receipt in hand) my key still didn't work so I had to wait for security to let me in. The view is interesting (beautiful but sad--you are looking directly out onto the WTC site) but the noise from the construction really is non-stop (I was on the 33rd floor and it wasn’t too bad at night, some people might be bothered by it though). What was REALLY noisy was actually the air conditioner! With the temperature set at 68, it was on constantly and full blast. With the temperature set at 72, the heat came on. At 70, it went back and forth between the A/C, heat, and being off. Whenever it was on--either hot or cold--it was LOUD. It knocks horribly--sound like the construction at the WTC is being done on your window. For a “business” oriented hotel, it is just mind boggling that internet access in the rooms is NOT FREE and that, if you do get internet access, it’s not wireless! I heard that Hilton Rewards members got a choice between free internet and free breakfast (yeah folks, the breakfast isn’t free either--they charge you for everything you need!) so I signed up. As a state employee, I knew from other employees who had stayed here that you get the same choice. I figured I’d get the internet as a state employee and breakfast as a rewards member…NO! You still only get one or the other. Big rip off. One of my colleagues was charged $5 just for opening the door to the minibar. In the hotel’s defense, they did reverse the charge, but that is the most ridiculous thing I’ve ever heard of! I assume they do it because it’s a small enough charge that many people won’t even notice it. To me, that’s unethical and greedy and makes for TERRIBLE customer service. Because of it, I was afraid to touch or use anything in the room for fear I would get charged an absurd amount (they do NOT make it clear what is free and what they are going to charge you for). Now, again, I know NYC is expensive, but when I go back to Syracuse this weekend, I’ll be staying at a Super 8 that has bigger rooms, free wi-fi, free breakfast, and front desk employees that know how to charge a credit card and it’ll cost me around $70 a night! The Hilton staff needs to remember that without service, a hotel is just four walls and a bed--no one is going to choose your hotel over another if you treat people like walking credit cards instead of human beings. Much to my dismay, I am supposed to spend another two weeks here in June. I check out tomorrow morning--if there are unexpected charges or any other problems I will definitely be cancelling my reservations and finding another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Riyer68
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again and I am a gold HHonors member. The staff are rude except for the folks that keep your luggage. The concierge and the front desk had the worst attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: JamesShelley
Reviews.Content: The price of this hotel really seems to fluctuate depending on time of year and when you book. We were impressed by many of the reviews we read and decided to upgrade to a King. It wasn't much extra, and was worth it. The room was massive, had the most comfortable bed and the nicest sheets. We barely wanted to get up. The one criticism I have is the noise from WTC outside. I am a heavy sleeper so no issue, but would perhaps be a problem for the light sleepers. It starts early and ends late. The amount of noise is probably reflected in the price and is why the hotel was such a steal.

Reviews.Title: “The worst "service" with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: RSC
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I wanted one with a pool. The description of the hotel is a little misleading. It is IN Ground Zero although the noise did not bother me the fact that taxis don't like to stop there does not help as Church St is one way. Also there is no wi fi- but Starbucks next door has wi fi. Even if you pay.. there is no wi fi in the rooms. Having read all the reviews I thought I would chance it - Porters etc leaning on the counters, all staff chat amongst themselves. At check in I was given no information , no smiles and spoke to if I was a hustler from Harlem. If you are a HH member you get no real benefits- free wi fi otherwise $15 a day/ rubbish breakfast or 1,000 points. My room was not what I reserved and the room smelt of damp as the bathroom door was left open. I was told there were suites available only but they would not give me one. I went down to speak to the Manager face to face rather than over the phone and told him that his rudeness was unacceptable. I asked to be moved to another Hilton hotel instead. After I told the staff and the whole lobby that the staff needed training in customer service and manners, staff after that were more compliant but not friendly. The housekeeping is haphazard.. I arrived back to my room to find a radio on, obviously the maid had it on whilst cleaning.. some rooms have comp water and my suite the next day did not! Breakfast was a joke- they do not replenish .. so if you come after a certain time there are no bagels, mini crosissants or quiche left. For your money I would definitely go elsewhere more as the service was so poor consistently for 2 days with the exception of Vanessa the day Manager who apologised for her staff .. and came through with what she said she would do. The point being she should not have to apologise for her staff.. I have stayed in other Hiltons/ used them as venues for Events and its never been as bad as this. Even a Travelodge is better run and the staff friendlier

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed stay, may be problems for others”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night in April. The room itself was very well appointed and clean. By New York standards, the rooms are HUGE. I had a king bed, chair and ottoman, side table, desk, suitcase stand, small dresser (with mini fridge inside) and two nightstands. There was still plenty of room to walk around. Also had a closet which could easily store larger pieces of luggage for those staying longer. The bathroom was updated with plenty of towels and toiletries and was very roomy. The biggest downside is that the hotel faces the Ground Zero construction site, so rooms facing that direction will have construction noise 24 hours per day. I am not a light sleeper so it did not bother me. Others may want to bring earplugs if they are sensitive to noise - but heck, NYC tends to be noisy anyway, so bring them no matter where you stay! The staff were pleasant and efficient - no complaints there. The location is OK but not my first choice. Close to a couple of subway stops but there really is a lack of decent restaurant choices within walking distance. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities other than the free continental breakfast we were offered. It was fine but nothing to write home about. Coffee, juice, pastries, oatmeal, quiche, cereal and some small trays of cold cuts and fruit slices. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay for a business trip. But if I were spending my own money for a leisure trip, I don't think this would be my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CtPaddler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. Both times were great. I highly recommend the Millenium if it is in your price range. It is one of the few Manhattan hotels with a pool, so don't forget your swim suit. Check their web site because sometimes they offer discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service & noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: •Substantial construction noise •Mediocre service •Front desk agreed to remove a charge but did not, front desk manager then refused to adjust the bill notwithstanding prior commitment by front desk clerk - complaint to management about credit card being charged without notice went unanswered •As Hilton Honors Diamond member, offered points or breakfast because hotel lacks concierge lounge - each time I've opted for points and points are not credited by the hotel •I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and am a loyal Hilton customer, but will not go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and services - the rate made it even better”
Reviews.Author: UDHighDad
Reviews.Content: We obtained excellent rates through Priceline, and we expected a very small room. Our room not only had 2 double beds, but also plenty of room for a roll-away. The roll-away was not the usual glorified cot; it had a full 4-inch thick mattress and was very comfortable compared with the regular beds of other hotels. The view of the WTC work was fascinating. Even though the work was proceeding 24/7, we did not hear that much activity at the 39th floor level. We did not eat at the hotel, but we understand that the food and service were very good. The location for Subway access was also excellent with several lines within 1-2 blocks. We would go back in a "New York minute."

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish Hotel - Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter71
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say. What a CRAP Hotel. Stayed here late March with my wife and close friend. Booked room via Hiltons own website. Booked a Double bed room for 3 people. Made clear note that room required was for 3 people. Please note a double bed room was booked. To me this is a double bed that can sleep 2 people in each bed, so expected a room with 2 double beds. No the beds here are king singles not double beds. So it is physically impossible to sleep 2 people in these beds. Checked in for the 3 nights stay. From the outside the hotel looks quite modern as was obviously renovated after the 911 incident. The rooms however are a different story. Rooms have not been updated for some time and are not 4 star standard. Contacted the Front of house management upon checking in only to be told that the beds provided are as is. Upon trying to explain to the front of house manager that the beds cannot sleep 2 people we where advised that a cot could be provided for $35 per night. This is after paying $895 AUD for the 3 nights, tried to explain that I would not have booked or stayed in this hotel knowing that we would need a cot to sleep a 3rd person advised that this was unacceptable.The front of house manager then became rude and agressive and advised that there was nothing else could be done. The next day we approached the front of house desk and was advised that double bed meant 2 beds, not 2 double beds. I then asked if they have ever been to the room to view the room in which the answer was No.....Again the response from the front of house staff was "so what is the question" Due to the fact that the Hilton had our money we stayed in the hotel which I must say would be one of the most overated Hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff are rude and aggressive with very little local knowledge and present very little customer service. We Stayed the last night in New York in a Hotel around the corner called "The Reserve Hotel " a great little 3 star hotel with rooms with 2 Double beds, free Internet in room internet access and great service. Cannot wait to provide this feedback to the Hilton chain. Stay in another Hotel such as the Affinia or Hotel 57. DO NOT STAY HERE you will be disappointed and pissed off like I am about my stay in the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: I am staying here on business for 5 days. I have to say service is very good, everyone is polite and helpful. It is not in a great location for a vacation as its in the finance district but ideal for business. There is some construction noise so be aware of this. Rooms are clean and tiday and a reasonable size, espically for NY. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY!!”
Reviews.Author: ver6
Reviews.Content: The only thing you need to know about the hotel is that it is located directly across from the 9-11 site or Freedom Tower and construction continues into late evening hours (1 am during my visit) and resumed at 5am. I had the pleasure of paying over $250 for this wonderful experience. It is very loud at the construction site and I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, nice room, so-so location, some construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night last month on business. On balance I liked it. Nice room and great views, as others have noted. The location leaves something to be desired, in that unlike so many other spots in NYC you don't have a great choice of places to eat, etc. right outside your door. But the very helpful concierge directed us to a good brick oven pizza place (Harry's) about ten minutes away. As many others have noted, you can't completely avoid the construction noise. But to minimize it, you can try to get a room in the northeast corner (I believe the room number is 12) and to be as high up as possible. At check-in they offered me ear plugs and/or a noise machine. Having said that, I'm a pretty light sleeper and would still go back to the hotel for the views and if the price is right. I don't recall whether I used my ear plugs or not, but I did manage to sleep fine there.

Reviews.Title: “Security from hell!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephrn01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times before, in fact I'm a hilton honors reward member. We were intown for a friends birthday and while getting dressed to go out we decided to listen to music (on a portable speaker the size of a deck of cards) . Several minutes later, we heard a loud police style knock on the door; security. I asked to see picture id, they refused stating "Open the door or we'll knock it down". We were upset, shaking, not sure if it was security or imposters. The gentleman even refused to step closer so I could read their nametags. Then when I spoke to the manager on duty Charo, she stated how she didn't appreciate us threatening to call the police. The entire incident occured because of a noise complaint, that could have been handled with a simple call to the room (I'm doubtful that a small portable ipod speaker compared to the commotion that security caused). Then mamagements response left an unsavory taste in my mouth, we were basically called liars. As a result I've ditched the hilton brand and chosen the W brand instead (and the W time square has noise proof suites)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, EXCEPT for the Jackhammer at 6AM...”
Reviews.Author: geekcatnip
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings here. The hotel is beautiful - well kept, modern, with a friendly staff. Our room was average sized for a NYC hotel (probably a bit smaller than you'd expect in other cities, but not too small for two adults). The room was extremely clean, as was the bathroom, and featured all modern furniture and fixtures - including a large flat screen TV, wired internet (for a fee, no wireless in guest rooms), coffee/tea service, and minibar (which was extremely overpriced - $5 for a CAN of soda or juice is beyond ridiculous, but I normally skip the minibar anyway). The bathroom was a good size with marble counter tops and shower back splash; however, the most important thing to point out is that it was VERY clean and well kept. That's the shining point to this hotel - they really do a fantastic job of keeping it looking "shiny and new." The hotel itself is located on the cusp of Tribeca and the Financial District, literally across from Ground Zero (we were mislead by another website that said the hotel was in SoHo, and only learned the property name and address AFTER booking, so beware!). Probably not the best location if you're a leisure traveler, as the area gets pretty dead at night, and businesses close early, but there are a few places that stay open late to catch a good late-night meal. BonChon Chicken on John Street, and Harry's Italian on Gold Street are both great places to eat within a 5-10 minute walk of the hotel, and serve dinner until at least 11PM (even on Sundays!). There's also never a shortage of ground transportation around the hotel, as there are Subway stops in front of and behind the property, as well as a steady stream of taxis driving by. As mentioned before, the property sits directly across from Ground Zero. The hotel does advise you that the construction from Ground Zero continues around the clock, and that they have ear plugs and noise machines to help combat some of the sounds. They're not kidding. Despite getting a great deal at this property, I would NOT stay here again until the construction at Ground Zero is complete (which won't be for another few years, unfortunately). It MIGHT be a different story if you have a room facing the OTHER side of the hotel, but we were put on the 23rd floor in a room that faces Ground Zero and the East River (nice view, by the way). Most of the "loud" construction work is finished up by 11PM, meaning it's possible to fall asleep with the low, constant hum of what I can only guess is a generator. However, at 6/6:30AM EVERY morning (yes, weekends included), they start up first thing with the jackhammer, making getting any decent sleep impossible. If I were a business traveler, this probably wouldn't be too much of a hindrance, as I'd probably be awake by then. However, when I'm on vacation, I like to stay out late, and sleep in sometimes, something which is IMPOSSIBLE to do, right now at least, at the Millenium Hilton. I would recommend this property to anyone AFTER the construction at Ground Zero is complete. It truly is a lovely hotel, and they staff are great. However, I absolutely refuse to stay here again, until the construction is finished. It's just too noisy to catch a good night's sleep on what's supposed to be a relaxing, rejuvenating trip!

Reviews.Title: “The room view/ bed makes up for the noises”
Reviews.Author: Sawellin07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the millenium hilton for 3 nights. It was a beautiful hotel. I stayed in a city view junior suite on the 47th floor of which I recommend to everyone. Facing the bed was the view of the city, to the left of the bed was the view of ground zero, and there was another window on the other side of the suite which had a great view of the brooklyn bridge. And at night the view was breath taking. I ordered room service one night I got a chicken wrap and soup ....which came out to be 45 dollars! The food was good...but not 45 dollars good. So here are my problems. The vents!!!!! Everyone complained about the noise of ground zero but the heat vents were worst. And of course the vents only made wierd noises at like 4 am when I was asleep. I eventually just turned off the heat and added an extra blanket to my bed which worked out fine. About the ground zero construction: I assume that i got such a good deal on the room b/c of the construction noise. $700 (w/tax) for three nights at a cityview suite is a pretty good deal for new york city. What I advise everyone to do is just stay at this hotel but stay in the city view rooms just b/c they are so high up you barely hear the noise. The location was great for me. I did all the touristy things on past trips so i didnt want to stay in time square or by central park. The hotel is walking distance to the south street seaport which was amazing. I recommend going there, as well as visiting the brooklyn botanical gardens and prospect park. I will be staying here again. I didnt try the pool or the fitness center but its also a plus for the hotel. As for resturants and activities near the hotel...well there weren't anything that really caught my eye as exciting so prepared to walk up broadway to find more interesting places.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in New York City”
Reviews.Author: jeanine-marie
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Circumstances made our stay 3 days longer than planned but the hotel was fantastic and let us continue our stay at the rate we agreed upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to stay. EXCELLENT VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingkat15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton, New York , New York, for 3 nights 4 days. The room I got was 2 beds and pretty roomy. The view on the non-view room is of ground 0. Which at night looks nice with all the lights. recommended if you would like to shop, and go places.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but slightly out of the way of the main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Maz1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally on the doorstep of the world trade centre. The hotel is fantastic but as we were there for Fleet Week, it was slightly out of the way as most of the navy activities occurred near times square. The open top bus does have a stop nearby on Broadway and is a fantastic way to see the city and learn little bits of information that the guide books don't tell you. The hotel is right next door to Century21 which should be avoided unless you plan on spending the whole holiday in there. I thought TK Maxx was unbearable until I went here. It is a fantastic location for the statue of liberty and ferry trips. The pool is very clean and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary & Yes, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Leer
Reviews.Content: Would not recomment this hotel at all. So many others to choose from where you can get a good night's sleep and better service (hotel was booked by someone else). Concierge would not call restaurant but gave me the number instead as he was going home! Each time I have asked him something it has been a real effort - he should change jobs. Noise is fairly constant like a dull drilling noise - reminds me of a noisy air conditioner that never stops. Yesterday room was really hot & today the room is very cold - air con is not coping. Bathroom very average & dated. TA Photos look better than the actual. Has been room service try in hall on our floor all day. Moving to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cityboy_nz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Chrstmas for 3 nights, I'st time in this area of NYC but have been back to the area since. Lobby is grand and tastefully appointed, check in was quick and easy, got a room upgrade without having to ask for one. Champagne and chocolate dipped strayberries were waiting in the room as requested. We had a one bedroom corner suite. Furniture was beautiful, decor was lovely and there was lots of windows. Room overlooked the World Trade Centre site, workers were working at all hours of the day and night, only taking Christmas day off. I love the Hilton pillows, they are the best! The bed is amazing, so comfortable. The room service menu is located on the tv menu. The staff are friendly, breakfast was a hot buffet and as usual was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of 24/7 Construction Project!! Pile Driving! Air Horn! & More!”
Reviews.Author: lowes_island_VA
Reviews.Content: A room at the Millenium Hotel comes with a fresh set of ear plugs. When I mentioned to the front desk person that they really should tell people there will be a LOT of contruction noise in their rooms, the front desk person said, "We do. There's a warning on their website in BIG RED lettters." Well, here's the big red letters she was referring to: "The Millenium Hilton is proud to be a part of the World Trade Center Rebuild. For the latest updates on construction progress please visit www.wtcprogress.com or www.lowermanhattan.info." Does that sound like a warning that there's a HUGE 24/7 construction project playing in your room? Bottom line: Your room will have a loud hum from all of it. It will be a great location in three or four years when the construction is done. Stay away for now.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the dollar in lower manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: kevin12572
Reviews.Content: Got a $168 deal on a mini suite. The bellman did warn us about the noise and many of these reviews mentioned the construction noise. I assume the low price is because of the construction. The problem with this hotel is that all of the rooms face the WTC construction so there is no avoiding it other than going up to a higher floor. Since they are behind schedule the construction goes on 24/7 now. However, it did quiet down significantly overnight and I could hardly hear the construction noise at all (I was on the 29th floor) over the sound of the blower on the heat/a.c. unit. The Millenium Hilton is a slick, modern hotel that obviously caters towards business people. It has a nice lobby bar and another small bar/restaurant on an upper floor. Bring your swimsuit because there's a very nice pool, sauna , gym on the 5th floor. All hotel staff were very friendly. Bellman, front desk, housekeeping, parking attendant, bartender. Even though this was lower manhattan there were lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance and the #6 express subway line to uptown was only 2 short blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton - not noisy for us”
Reviews.Author: suzabanana
Reviews.Content: We booked a King room with a free option to upgrade upon check-in through Hilton Honors. We were upgraded to a King suite on the 46th floor with complimentary Continental Breakfast vouchers for being Gold members. The corner suite had an excellent view of Battery Park, Ellis Island, Ground Zero, Brooklyn Bridge & Staten Island beyond. The suite was a good size, very comfortable bed, huge flat screen in the bedroom - exactly what you expect from a Hilton suite. Upon arrival, we asked about the construction schedule & were told "It is on-going day and night. They will not provide a blast schedule. The mayor is pushing for it to be done ASAP, so they are constantly working." The hotel has no way of knowing whether you will sleep well or if the construction will be bothersome. We were fine. We bring earplugs & eye masks wherever we travel and are always prepared. If you are a very light sleeper, I would suggest looking elsewhere as the noise is audible much of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had read the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: PalmBoulevard
Reviews.Content: I had no idea that construction next door (i.e. right outside the window of my room) would go on through the night and into the morning. The hotel offered to bring ear plugs.....I wish they would have disclosed this information when I booked the room. This has been a really bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Financial/Battery Park districts”
Reviews.Author: Wootten00
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly as it is very close to the office. It's a beautiful hotel amidst a lot of construction and pretty much 24x7 noise. You can hear the dull thuds in the rooms; the hotel offers ear plugs and other noise cancellation devices. This said, there is a lot that you can do that is close by. Battery Park and the ferries are within walking distance as is the Brooklyn Bridge. The boardwalk/esplanade on the west side near the World Financial Centers is a very nice walk especially in the warmer weather. For shopping, Century 21 is next door – go early (it opens at 7:45am) and avoid lunch time and after work as it is a zoo. The subway is close by and there are multiple trains that take you to different sections of the city. Central park via an express train is less than 30 minutes away. Besides the fast-food regulars, there are small delis and shops nearby. The large office complexes usually have food court and a short 15-20 minute walk uptown takes you into Tribeca, Soho, Chinatown and and Little Italy where proper restaurants can be found. During the day, there are lots of people milling about. While the area tends to clear out in the evening, it still feels quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good Service. Will be a lovely hotel when the World Trade Centre construction is finished.”
Reviews.Author: wicklowglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is a nice hotel, located very centrally in the lower manhatten / tribeca area of NYC. The hotel itself is kept very clean and service was excellent. I didn't dine in the restaurant but got room service on one occasion. The food was very good but Extremely expensive, I wouldn't recommend it! The one major problem with the hotel at the moment is that it is situated directly opposite the World Trade Centre site, which at the moment is a building site (http://twitpic.com/112fxv). I was on the 48th floor so the noise wasn't too bad, it was still audible most of the day and night but didn't keep me awake. However, if you are a light sleeper or are on a lower floor, it could be a problem. Another issue, especially for the business traveller, is that the rooms do not come with free internet! I'm always amazed by this as it has almost become an accepted norm in parts of Europe. Its €14 per 24hour period for broadband, and then it is wired not wireless and the quality was patchy at best. Overall though, the hotel is clean, comfortable and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ElaineNewcastle_UK
Reviews.Content: Before we travelled we read many reviews in which people say the staff were rude and unfriendly...not the case. Every staff member we spoke to was very helpful and friendly. Our room was on 49th floor and although you can hear the construction through the night it did not keep us awake at all, we certainly didn't hear any explosions and we were up most mornings by 6. We would stay at this hotel again and would certainly recommend it to people who want to explore the financial district, but its a long walk up to central park!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, if you don't mind explosions in the middle of the night.”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: Decided to do a long weekend/Valentine's Day trip to NYC. Got a great rate ($141/nite) on the Hilton site with a Visa Signature card. It was barely worth that! The hotel room 3503 was tiny. There were water stains on the ceiling, lipstick? stains on the carpet, black mold in the sink rim and water stains on the TV speaker. Checked in on Friday night, stayed til Monday. Staff was fine. Problem was WTC construction next door. When I say they blast at all hours, listen! There will be jackhammering at 4am. There will be dynamite blasts at 7am. They do not stop for weekends, holidays, or sleep. Be forewarned. We were on the 35th floor and could still hear it. Room faced construction. Didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked nice. The internet is $15/day wired, from the room. You can also print out stuff in the business room on the 5th floor near the gym. That's like $.69/min plus $1.99/print page. The gym was sparse. 2 ellipticals, 2 bikes, 3 treadmills. 2 weight machines, and free weights. It faces the WTC construction too. Ate dinner on Friday at Church & Dey (their restaurant). Food was ok. Service was just ok. Prices were pretty pricey for a diner-looking type place. Convenient to many subway stations. But I'd wait til construction is done before staying here again. And I'm a Hilton Honors member... got no perks that I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money! LOUD & RUDE.”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway54
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to spend our 1st Valentines day at this hotel. (we live in the city and thought it would be nice to "get away" without getting away) The room was nice and the bed was very comfy EXCEPT the noice from the construction site(we were on flr 31) was SO LOUD I was cranky from getting no sleep. It was as if they were in my room doing the construction. They work 24/7 so don't think that it will stop at night. It only got louder. Then when I called the front desk about the noise they told me that they were full and HUNG UP on me. I called back and spoke to a manager and they comped breakfast the next morning. At brakfast the waiter must have been having a bad day cause he was not friendly and it took FOREVER. Now we have an extra $85 undefined charge on out credit card statement. So much for our romantic valentines weekend. Basically with all the Hotels in the city I would NEVER EVERY stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “BA-BOOM”
Reviews.Author: cmacNYC
Reviews.Content: Wow, we have stayed here before, a few years back around the holidays, what a difference this time, not happy. We are Hilton Honors Members, so, we were expecting some kind of treatment other than what we received. We arrived on Fri. 2-12-2010, at rush hour, 5PM ish, it was pan-da-moni-um. Being Native New Yorkers there is not much we have'nt experienced here, until our stay here. The construction for the new Towers directly across the street has cut Church Street in half, we pulled up, unloaded the luggage and were told we had to park the car ourselves, I explained we wanted the valet service, then we were told to they do not do that any longer and to drive up 2 blocks, make a right, one block, make another right on Broadway and again another right to return the car to Fulton Street, problem is, during rush hour, you are prevented from making any turns off of Church Street, a detail that I found out on my own, we had to park in a garage about a mile up on the west side of Church. Walked back, they would not check my Fiance in without my ID, so she waited in the lobby for me to arrive. They had trouble with the booked room, not as we ordered, no CD player in the corner suite as stated, however, we were told of the constuction going on at the Trade Center, ok, we figured the weekend would be quiet, not the case, the work is ongoing 24/7, morning, noon and night. At night was the hammering into the Bed Rock, and to wake up to dynamiting, explosions, wow, Never Again! Could not get a cab at 6:30 PM, waited to 7PM out in the cold. After one night we left and checked into the "Downtown Marrriot" what a difference, bee-u-tee-full.

Reviews.Title: “NY ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: oneonone1010
Reviews.Content: AMAZING !! Was on the 52 floor and the views were incredible.Excellent service! Wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accommodations although the noise did bother me...”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolIndiana
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in spectacular shape ..beautiful lobby and the room is very large, well-decorated, clean and a very comfortable bed. Ignoring anything else, I would stay here repeatedly. That said, the noise is a problem for me. I've stayed here two times in the past month for business, on floors in the 30s and 40s. Both times, even with a noise machine, I repeatedly get woken up throughout the night with noise from the Trade Center sight. And, I am NOT a light sleeper. I stay here when I come into town b/c my office is right around the corner, but I am not sure I will keep staying here if the noise continues to bother me. I may try one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dasindog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and found the hotel to be excellent. We had a king room on the 48th floor overlooking the construction. In our room the noise was not bad at all, you could hear a little activity but not enough to bother us. The room was clean and a good size for NYC. It is convenient to downtown locations. Check in and out went smoothly as did the valet service for the car. The staff that we interacted with was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. Great Location. Somewhat rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: tjjanes
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC for my first time this past New Years. After hunting for what seemed to be weeks for a decently priced hotel during this busy time, we settled on the Millennium Hilton as the prices seemed to be the most reasonable. Upon arrival (which was very early - around 8 am) we were pleasantly surprised that a room was ready for us (check in is not supposed to be until 3 pm). We were a bit disappointed however to find that the extra money we paid to be in the "city view" rooms (floors 31-55) resulted in us being put on floor 36, but what can you do. Upon entering our room, the first thing we noticed was the ground zero construction noise. I'm not going to lie, it's pretty loud. We went downstairs to ask if they had anything higher up to escape the noise, but they informed us everything was full already. Fortunately, the construction noise was very easy to get used to, and it only woke me up once (on the very first night) in our 7 day stay, so what we thought was a big deal at first turned out to be something pretty minor. As for the location, we found this hotel to be in a perfect spot for what we were in NYC to do. We were, of course, in New York for New Year's Eve, but didn't want to stay too close to the festivities. This hotel has a Southbound subway station right outside the door, and a Northbound one less than a block away. It is walking distance to all of the Financial District sights (Wall street, Battery Park, St. Paul's Chapel and Trinity Church). If you enjoy a nice walk, you can also walk all the way up to the Empire State in probably 30 - 45 mins, as well as Little Italy and Chinatown in about 20 mins. The nice thing about staying in the Financial District is the peace and quiet at night, once all the business people have gone home from work! Regarding the staff, some of them do seem to think the Hilton is comparable to the Plaza, and that you should feel lucky to be staying there. Also, everyone seems to expect a tip nowadays, even if they're simply moving your luggage from the front desk to a locked room right next to the front desk....something that I don't quite agree with. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to NYC on business or pleasure, however if you are an extremely light sleeper you might want to think twice regarding the noise at WTC.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Lower Manhattan...one of the best in NY”
Reviews.Author: wuz-in-tha-biz
Reviews.Content: I spent a wonderful birthday at the Millenium Hilton in lower Manhattan. My high-floor room overlooked ground zero...while many people find this view a bit morbid, I find it fascinating to stand and stare at a piece of history, and new history being made every day. On the clear days, we could see the Statue of Liberty, the WFC, ships on the Hudson, and across to New Jersey (I think as far as the TV towers in the Meadowlands.) The otherside of the hotel has views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Lower East Side. The room is much better than a typical Hilton...very urban minimalist...but bright. Somewhat reminiscent of how Kimpton decorates their rooms. The rooms are small, as are all rooms in New York, but this hotel did a great job designing the interiors to maximize space and efficiency. Flat panel TV on the wall, built-ins, etc. Bathroom was large and clean, but more of the typical Hilton design. The hotel pool is awesome, as is the fitness center. Location is great in Lower Manhattan...shopping is pretty good, especially the J&R Electronics around the corner. Several 24hour pharmacies/convenience stores and a 24 hour McDonalds, as well as a Backstage Deli and many higher end restaurants are in easy walk. The Church across the street is quite historical...I think J.J. Astor is buried there. Wall St, the Federal Reserve, and Battery Park are sights in easy walking distance from the Millenium Hilton. The PATH trade center line terminates directly across from the hotel, and several subway lines are accessbie from the same block. While many of NYC's sights are uptown, they're still pretty accessible from this hotel due to the subway. Also, if you don't mind walking 20 or 25 minutes, you can be in the East or West Villiage without even using the subway. TriBeCa and SoHo are also walking distance. There's not much nightlife right around the hotel, but if you can't find something in SoHo, TriBeCa, or the Villiage, then you shouldn't be in New York to begin with. About parking: Yes, I drove into the city. Valet parking was ridiculously expensive (something like $55 a day!) but on the weekends you can park on the abandoned lower Manhattan streets without having to pay anything at all. Just make sure you're gone before 5 AM come Monday morning. If you're staying through the week, I'.d suggest parking at a PATH station in NJ and riding the train over, or somewhere in Brooklyn and either walking across the Bridge or taking the subway. Excellent public transit connections. I did not eat the food at the hotel, but I did walk by the restaurant and it looked quite chic, but kind of empty. Take what you will from that observation. I definitely suggest this hotel for anyone visiting lower Manhattan, or if you get a good deal and don't mind riding the subway to sights uptown.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent 4 Star Stay!”
Reviews.Author: austexmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights during new year’s eve. Wanted to stay in king corner room so reserved via Hilton website. Arrived to hotel at exactly the 3pm check-in time with only one guest in front of us. Check-in was smooth and the gentleman helping was pleasant. Stayed on the 47th floor and never had a problem waiting for one of the three available elevators during our stay. Room was spacious especially by New York City standards. The bed was VERY comfortable, bathroom amenities plentiful, room spotless, and never heard housekeeping during our stay. The drawers were spacious enough to unpack for 3 days and not live out of luggage bags. We had a room facing the Hudson River and the two bridges – Brooklyn and Manhattan. It was a pretty quite stay and the only sound we heard were a couple of sirens our last night stay on new year’s eve. It was pretty cold- freezing actually- during our stay so I actually wanted to use the coffee/tea maker. It’s a great machine that allows for both coffee and tea brewed at the same time. No coffee taste in my hot water as with other makers! Since the room only had one tea bag, two liquid creamers (the good stuff!) and two sugar packets I called the front desk to request more. Within 20 minutes housekeeping was up to my room with a bag full of cream and sugar. Great service! The hotel is within 2 blocks of a subway lines that will get you anywhere. We enjoyed leaving the crowd at Times Square area and returning to the more quiet, peaceful Financial District area. Didn’t mind at all having to show our room cards at night for added security. One morning we had an early start and had breakfast delivered by Champs Deli (www.champsdelinyc.com) located a few blocks away from the hotel. Not only was it convenient, but an inexpensive, delicious start to a full day. While I would not consider staying here when traveling on a tight budget (which I often do) since there are so many choices in Manhattan, I would recommend this as a great value if you’re already spending Times Square area prices. To me well worth the area quietness and subway convenience, comfortable bed, and familiar Hilton brand service. Overall a very solid stay at a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed for a Hilton, can do better ...”
Reviews.Author: mar_2903
Reviews.Content: We started 9 days in New York from December 24 to January 1 this year. We booked the Millennium Hilton in mid-July because this hotel was well situated, not too eccentric, while remaining fairly "calm" in order to recharge his batteries after a long day of sightseeing. On arrival, our first impression regarding the construction and decoration was good. For cons, the staff not very smiling even a little unpleasant. Our room was on the 25th floor with stunning views of the East River and buildings of the Financial District.. What was sad and disturbing was the sight on the Ground Zero. We saw all the details which is very stressful when thinking about what happened 9 years ago. Regarding the room, it was as we imagined, pretty, fairly large, good condition, bright and clean. Only flat, the smell of urine emanating from the bowl but I think it was a sewage problem ... It came intermittently. The cleaning was done to 9am by very nice ladies. Regarding noise, it is true that some days it was really noisy because the construction of Ground Zero don't "sleep" but if you're as tired as we were, nothing will prevent you from sleeping: -) ! In addition, upon your arrival, a box noise will be proposed at the reception. We haven't taken it because we are early risers, but if you want to make long lie or you want to sleep in total quiet, I'll advise. Concierges are friendly and are always helping you. Especially Jeff, very nice! If you want to leave your luggage aside when you leave and go make one last trip to town, you've shed free and guarded available which is really nice ... To summarize, I think some things should be reviewed to improve the stay of any traveler but Millenium Hilton is a good hotel. P.S: Sorry for my english :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...excellent location...just brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: IonaHelen
Reviews.Content: My friend managed to get a bargain 4 night deal, staying from Dec 2nd 2009 to December 7th 2009. Despite the fact the hotel was directly overlooking Ground Zero, we were never disturbed by the noise. I would add here that our room itself did not directly face onto the site unlike other rooms so I couldn't comment if noise was a problem there. The room was spacious, very clean with great amenities although we were hardly in our room as we discovered the magic of the bargain shop of the city..Century 21!! It is literally a door-to-door walk....directly opposite the hotel. My friend and I became obsessed by the place despite cramming in all the usual site seeing activities!! We liked the fact the hotel was away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. There are several subway stations located right outside the hotel and it only took about 10 mins to get up to Times Square anyway. Another brilliant fact about the location of the hotel is that you can walk to many tourist attractions including Wall Street, Battery Park (where you can catch the free ferry to Staten Island and passing the Statue of Liberty), Brooklyn Bridge (we did this at night and it was just out of this world). We felt completely safe and the entire area was easy to find one's bearings. My friend and I enjoyed our stay so much, we are planning a Christmas shopping trip again this year and the Hilton Hotel will hopefully be our place of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert2010
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Millenium over the New Year period, having stayed at the hotel previously I thought it was a good bet. The staff were great and gave us a free upgrade upon arrival and were very helpful throughout. However despite the website saying building was going on at the World Trade Centre site we certainly didnt expect it to be going on into the early hours of the morning. The noise was sleep preventing and extremely annoying and many people were complaining in the lobby during our stay. This is shame as the location is away from the crowds and the hotel standard is excellent. If you plan to stay in the future ask for a room at the rear of the hotel, the view isnt as good but sleep will be much more peaceful!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: sez10
Reviews.Content: We have recently just come back from the Millenium hotel having spent a week there on our honeymoon. If you are expecting any special touches in the room- forget it. I was very disappointed that there wasn't a vase of flowers or a basket of fruit which most hotels of the world would offer. They also put us in a room next to Ground Zero which was extremely noisy but they were kind enough to move us. The hotel is luxurious and so are the prices to go with it. The staff were very friendly and the hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. The beds are far too comfortable. If you are staying at this hotel make sure that your room isn't on the side next to Ground Zero and theres a lovely diner- The Diner round the corner and Les Halles restaurant which is much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great homebase for our trip to Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Tucker33
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here (Dec 29 and 30) with our two-year old son and had a very nice stay. 1) It was noisy... I ended up using complimentary earplugs provided by the hotel... and the white noise machine the hotel offered was very helpful. Our son stayed in his little tent right against the window. With his regular bedtime CD and the white noise machine, he didn't wake at all the first night. The second night he did, but he was with a sitter and our neighbors down the hall were very loud. So, noise is definitely a consideration... but in our case, not a deal breaker. 2) The staff was all incredibly friendly and we never had to wait for anything. Jeff the concierge was helpful and encouraged us to buy our MOMA tickets there at the hotel so we could skip the big ticket line (though we still had to wait in the big information line and big coat check line). From the front desk, to the porters, to the housekeeper on our floor, everyone was genuinely warm... 3) Though downtown, the hotel is very easily accessible by the subways and buses. It turned out to be great for us, because we parked on Staten Island and took the ferry... not too much of a hall to get in. 4) The room was a good size and well appointed. We put the desk chair in the closet, moved the little two-drawer dresser under the desk, and found that opened the space as needed for a two-year old to have space. 5) Nice indoor pool and sauna. The pool is heated, but a little cool still. We had no problem with the proximity to the WTC site, though some might. Our son really enjoyed looking at the construction equipment working down below. We got a good deal on priceline, making this an even better deal. This ended up being a great homebase for an awesome trip to the city... Anthony Bourdain's old restaurant (Les Halles) is just a block and a half away... and a GREAT deal for breakfast... $9 for two-egg breakfast, which was tasty and reasonable for NYC. Also, you can get your latte in a latte bowl. Would've loved to come for dinner, but not with the little guy.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: lv4488
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past and didn't remember that the construction at the WTC site was a problem but this time it kept me up until after midnight and then started again at 5 or 6am. When I asked the front desk about when they stop working, she said they have a right to work all night. There seemed to be one lone crane working on the site late at night and I was shocked at how loud it was, even on the 44th floor! It was hard to believe that it was worth all the noise. The hotel itself is very nice and my parents were on the 51st floor and that was quieter. Granted, I have no problems with the actual hotel. The views are stunning and the hotel is well appointed. I understand that the hotel can't help the construction noise but for a sensitive sleeper, this might not be the best option.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but not worth the 4-star pricing”
Reviews.Author: go27560
Reviews.Content: I had never seen before a 4-star hotel with no ventilation in the bathroom, that somewhat puts a dent in one's scent of luxury...! It also sets the tone for the hotel as a whole. The lobby of the Millenium Hilton is luxurious and the revolving doors manned by uniformed personnel provide a very nice first impression. Upon arrival, you start feeling good about spending a premium price for your room there. That is... until you actually see the room. Ours was much smaller than we expected and had the cookie-cutter look of a regular Inn. The same comparison could be made for the restaurant, which had a very small selection of items for dinner and breakfast alike. What wasn't small was the price of the items. A very basic breakfast buffet will cost you around $25 a person (not included with the room!) and adding a simple omelet to it will cost you an extra $20 (must be eggs from very gifted chicken...!). From a location standpoint, it is fine if you are there for business in the financial district but if your interest is in Broadway, Times Square, or Fashion Avenue type attractions, you will find many hotels much closer to these. There isn't much in terms of attractions around the Millenium Hilton. You will have to take the (nearby located) metro or a cab to get to the action every time. The only 4-stars I'll give this hotel is for the room service personnel, extremely professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, little pricy, bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for exploring NYC and is not too close to all the tourist hotels. The hotel is a few yards from the WTC subway entrance which is very helpful! The construction work at the WTC is going on around the clock, so if you are a light sleeper you may find the noise will keep you awake. The hotel offer noise machines to help (it makes sounds of water, trees in the wind etc) and give out free ear plugs. The breakfast on the 3rd floor was quite good, offering buffet and off menu items. The room we had felt a bit dated, the flat screen TV looks like it was an early modal, although I am told the hotel was refurbished around 4 years ago. This is a pricy hotel and there may be better options around.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in NYC for Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: Carolina-Hiker
Reviews.Content: Each year my wife and I visit NYC the first weekend of December. In previous visits we stayed in Times Square, but last year (2008) we stayed two nights in Times Square but decided to stay one night at the Millenium Hilton in order to get a feel for staying in another part of the city. We loved the location and the hotel so we decided to stay three nights this year. This year we took other family members and booked two rooms. The hotel was again perfect for our visit. The staff is great. We arrived early and need to secure our bags (including my computer bag). No problem. The bags were taken care of immediately. I pre-registered for the rooms and was told they would be ready around 3:00 PM. As promised, both rooms were ready at 3:00 PM. Both rooms (per my request) were on the same floor. We were on the 38th floor and the noise from the traffic and WTC construction site was slight. The price for the rooms were approximately $200 per night less than rooms in Times Square. In addition, the rooms are larger. I've noticed some comments about the rooms being small, but I can't figure out what the complaints are about. The rooms at the Millenium Hilton are larger than the typical NYC hotel room (especially in the Times Square area where every foot of real estate is prime). Here's a tip that worked for me. At check-in at I asked for and received complimentary vouchers for breakfast. We received vouchers for the continential breakfast served in the Church & Dey resturant (on premise). This is a $19.00 value per person. With five in our group we saved almost $200 and had the convenience of having a sit down breakfast together before starting our day. We are not sure if we will return to NYC next December or go some where warmer, but if we do return you can bet I will be staying at the Millenium Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: flowerpie
Reviews.Content: I've always thought Hilton hotels are overpriced. This is no exception, but since I paid discount prices (military rates) for this stay, I won't complain about the price. The hotel looks very good, however the rooms are way smaller than they appear to be on the website. Well done photographers. It is however very nice, comfortable beds, nice bathroom, clean and well maintained. The room service also does a splendid job cleaning the room every morning. Drawbacks: No free internet. Really, 14.99$ for an internet connection per day? Pathetic. I also had a bad experience at the hotel restaurant. The servers seem ignorant and none-welcoming. After sitting at the table for 15 minutes - still waiting to be served. I decided to pour myself some orange juice. I then heard that you can't get juice yourself, you must wait to be served. I later overheard the servers talking to each other, one of them claiming that I stole "his" orange juice. The pool is fairly dull too, no music and the sauna is too cold. Anyway, if you stay away from the restaurant, don't go to the pool, and you don't need internet: You will love this hotel:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noise didn't bother me”
Reviews.Author: mortimer01
Reviews.Content: I was staying here to visit my son who works and lives nearby so for me the location was excellent. A pleasant surprise was the ease with which you can get uptown from the hotel. I was not able to check in when I arrived, tired from an early start and transatlantic flight; the reason given was that the room was registered in my husband's name ( he was in the UK) although I was the named traveller on my Expedia documents. 45 mins later and phone calls to Expedia & my husband ( 0245 local time!)- all done on my mobile phone, I was graciously upgraded to a Junior Suite which was stunning. Another glitch was the concierge's advise about travel to JFK: I got on a Shuttle Bus at 1530 for a 1940 flight. We picked up 9 other travellers around Manhattan so didn't leave the city until after 1700. The driver then fell asleep on the freeway and crashed into another car. I have whip lash and chest pain but caught my plane as final call was being made. Very stressful. Catch a cab to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: SPoddar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for a week at Millenium Hilton, New York. The hotel is magnificent and I have never experienced such incredible service before. It was very lovely there, with view to the historical world trade centre, thames river and statue of liberty. I was booked for a standard room, and by virtue of my membership was upgraded to a junior suite. I stayed on the 45th level with its own living room and 52" TV in living as well as bedroom. Breakfast was lovely and delicious and at evening open lounge bar was a heaven with lots of cocktails and mocktails on serve. Only negative point I noted was that some portions of the room do need some overhauling and tariff was on a higher side.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, unbelievable noise from WTC site”
Reviews.Author: Galadriel72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just sepnd three days in NYC for a friend's wedding; the Millenium Hilton was chosed as the hotel for the wedding party and guest. First. the pluses: the hotel is elegant and well appointed; we stayed in a junior suite on the 21st floor, with views of Manhattan and the WTC construction site, as well as the Hudson river - can't beat that! Compared to the average NYC room, the Millenium Hilton has spacious rooms; even the bathroom was large. The bed was very comfortable. For the minuses: construction at the WTC sites goes on overnight with no interruption - the first night I had no sleep at all! In addition to the unbeliavable construction noise, the fact that the hotel facade is completely open now exposes it to wind - and we had very strong gusts of wind - if felt like the windows were about to break. So, despite the comfy bed, no sleep for me. Thsi really ruined the experience.... Another (smaller) issue was that the restaurant is closed between 2 and 5 PM , and in this time frame there is not even room service - we arrived at 1:45 and were refused service. Minor point if you can go out to a local eatery, but we were in a hurry to get somewhare and had no time to spare. Also, the concierge recommended a nearby italain restaurant that was in fact closed (at least you should know if you are the concierge!) I would recommed this hotel only to people who are not bothered by loud, constant noises throughout the night; or I would suggest waiting until major contruction at the WTC is over ( a couple of years?)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Millenium Hilton, especially since we got it for $130 per night on Priceline over Thanksgiving weekend. Since it was a holiday weekend, noise was not really an issue for us although there was some jackhammering for a few hours on Friday afternoon. If that went on all day, I can see why people would be upset. The hotel does try to make things right - before we even checked into our room, they offered us a sound machine and earplugs. I think the current prices probably reflect the noise inconvenience. The location was fine and it was easy to take a subway anywhere. Cortlandt Station is right in front of the hotel. We also walked across the Brooklyn Bridge, which is nearby. There is not a lot going on in this area but it doesn't really matter in NYC since it is so easy to get to all parts of town. The TV remote was annoying. At first I thought it needed new batteries, but it turns out you have to hold it at a certain angle to change channels. It would be nice if they would do something about that. Other than this small nitpick, we loved our stay and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in that hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magu1982
Reviews.Content: I might sound a bit extreme but my experience in this hote was just terribly. This was my first time in NY and my first time in Hilton chain. I was arriving from a long trip, I was more than 24 hrs sleepless and my bf and I arrived very early morning. He has some frequent client status with Hilton so he adviced we would arrive early. The room was still not ready... We asked for room on highest floors to avoid the ground zero noise and we said we would not mind to wait a bit longer. As he had traveled to NY for work he left me at the lobby and I gave them my cell phone number to advice when the room was ready. He asked if they had the information of his credit card . The receptionist adviced everything was fine. It passed 3 hrs and they never called me or let me know anything. Even I was sitting just in front of the reception. I had to ask if they had news about my room. Then the receptionist realized she was suppossed to call me. When I tried to check in they asked me for another credit card cause my bf's credit card did not work. I gave them 3 different credit cards and none worked what it was very strange cause I have used them all around the world and I've never had problems before but with Hilton. I even use them in NY to pay for everything. I called my bf and he asked them to try with another of his credit cards but they demanded him to be there personally.They said the only way they could check me in was for me to call my bank in front of them to authorize the charge or my bf to go to the hotel and do the same. He verified the information by their website and realized the credit card in his profile had a wrong expiration date. We both adviced that to front desk staff and they insist they could not try to charge the credit card again and they demanded him to check in phyisically. Finally he called the manager and she agreed to try to charge his credit card again and it worked. We both spent lot of time trying to convince them to change the expiration date. Then I asked for my bags to the storage guy. No one helped me to take my bags to the room even they saw how I could not handle pulling two huge bags. A guest who was in the lobby had to help me to take all my stuff to the elevator. My boyfriend complained again when he arrived to the hotel and they gave some vouchers for breakfast which it was so poor . The service at the bar on the 3rd floor is just as poor as all the staff service. They would not even offer for a drink. It was very slow. Menu is bad, food quality is bad and poor. The room is really nothing special, the room service is poor as all the staff service ( did I say that again?) they just made bed and changed towels but it was clear they would not even clean the floor. We asked a couple of things for room service like a sewing kit and a small fridge for our own drinks as the one of the room could not be used due to electronic inventory and they would just not understand what we asked for. They sent water instead sewing kit and sent someone to take out the room fridge instead installing one for us. I understand probably the credit card not working it is beyond their hands as I am myself a customer service agent and I have to deal with this everyday but it is the way they handle things. They are totally careless they would not even look for an option to solve things and all out suggestions were refused. They gave the impression to have enough guests and not wanting to waste energy in keeping more customers. They made me feel unwanted there. I know I am not their gold customer as my bf is but they dont even treat me as any average guest would deserve to be treated. I really would not stay there and I doubt I would ever try hilton chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nolo96
Reviews.Content: Remote for the TV was terrible but everything else was great. 20th floor overlooking the WTC construction - just high enough to not have any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it, even with noise”
Reviews.Author: twixette722
Reviews.Content: We honestly loved this hotel. We had a room on the 30th floor with a spectacular view of the river and Ground Zero. While we expected noise, it was more than we bargained for. Luckily, we had earplugs. In spite of the into-the-evening construction noise, we'd stay there again in a heartbeat. You can't beat the location for the historic value, both old New York and Ground Zero. Wouldn't have missed it for the world. Within easy walking distance to Battery Park, Battery Park City, Wall Street, and many other things. Watching the construction at Ground Zero was fascinating. The entire area around Ground Zero had an atmosphere that could be felt and that every American should experience. What a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, convenient location, good business travel choice”
Reviews.Author: MIAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for business-related trips to the Financial District and surrounding areas. Everything was very clean, the check-in staff were friendly, and the location is great with a subway entrance just across the street and plenty of Tribeca restaurants within easy walking distance. (Check out Blaue Gans for something different.) Room rates were high, but it's Manhattan. Make sure they don't overcharge you if you eat breakfast in the hotel - the buffet price includes coffee/juice and your choice of a hot entree off the menu, so you're better off saying you want the buffet rather than one of the individual hot breakfasts by itself. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: jnismith
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel more times than I can remember and am a Hilton Diamond VIP. So why on my last visit did they give me a low down fron facing room when the noise from the WTC site is so bad.. I just couldn't sleep as the noise was so loud at 10:00pm at night. I complained and was told I could not move as the hotel was full, asked to speak to the manager and eventually got moved to a corner room which had been out of service. So in the ned everything was fine but with a bit of forward planning, it could have been a much nicer stay

Reviews.Title: “nice room, good view, good location”
Reviews.Author: marjacDenmark
Reviews.Content: we stayed there on a stopover - good location close to the subway. although construction was going on at ground zero we didnt notice any noise in our room (high floor), but we were made aware by the hotel that we should note this (ahead of booking). the breakfast was very good and the room was clean and modern. nice large LCD tv.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay in the Hilton Millenium. I was staying on the 39th floor, overlooking the Hudson river and WTC ground zero. The rooms are large in size for NYC and very comfortable. Large bathroom with all necessary amenities. Room: very large flat screen tv; minibar (automatically charging), coffee maker with lavazza coffee, very comfortable bed, internet (ask for it when checking in, as not all rooms have it), ottoman chair, working table. The hotel has a nice swimming pool, gym and small sauna, where you can get in with your room key card. The hotel location is very convenient: a lot of things are in walking distance. You can walk to the financial centre, brookly bridge, city hall, SoHo, ... For shopping; you have the century21 outlet just next doors. public transport: different metro lines pass next to the hotel. There is the PATH station for trains to Newark and NJ nextdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- noise for us was not a problem”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Very high level floor overlooking WTC. Friday they were jackhammering something, which was very annoying and noisy. They stopped about 6pm and never again heard construction for the remainder of our stay. Well appointed rooms. Decent bathroom. Not a lot of things to do at night, so we went to our regular haunts in the West Village. Easy subway access. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - But the Noise is a problem for now”
Reviews.Author: Lenexajones
Reviews.Content: We found the Mil Hilton to be a great value. Almost half the price for a comparable room in mid town. The rooms were very clean, the staff was super helpful and the location was super close to all of the subways. As expected, the construction at Ground Zero was a distraction [but fascinating to watch]. The views from the rooms were spectacular. The noise from the construction was annoying but after awhile we got used to it [sort of like a thunderstorm that goes on and on]. That will be a short term problem. The area around the hotel seemed very safe at night and not the zoo that midtown can be. Several quaint sandwich places were open where we got some really fine sandwiches and a bottle of wine to enjoy in the room. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto, bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: BobbyFrings
Reviews.Content: I recognize New York is noisy, and while you're up high in the Hilton Millenium, construction at ground zero can be pretty loud, even on a weekend. The rooms are very clean and for business travellers to downtown, the location couldn't be better. It's a bit overpriced, but which hotel in New York is not.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is a very high tower hotel directly across from the WTC/Ground Zero site. The rooms are nice and clean, and the views of the Hudson River / NJ are just incredible. HOWEVER - buyer beware... the construction at Ground Zero started at around 5am and went on at incredibly loud volume - even on Saturday! I got a major discount for this hotel on Hotwire, but wouldn't repeat - even at this rate. Also, wireless internet, radio/CD didn't seem to work. The image on the beautiful large flat-screen TV was strangely terrible. The location in Lower Manhattan is convenient to the Financial District, City Hall and a couple of subway stops, but not really ideal in terms of central location for tourists. Very few good restaurants or night life nearby (The West Village would be a longish walk). The rooms are nice enough. The lobby area is very small with a tiny bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...if you don't mind a little background noise.”
Reviews.Author: AJones09
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a prime location. Located down near the WTC, this hotel felt central to all the great shopping, restaurants and tourist hot spots. The nearby subway station made it easy to get anywhere in the city. Staff was courteous and very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. Gym and pool were clean or well maintained. Room was big (by NYC standards) and was well equipped. Being across the street from the WTC, you do hear construction noise almost 24 hours a day. Bring a bottle of sleeping pills if the noise might bother you. Living in downtown Philly, I'm use to the sounds of the city so the noise didn't bother me to much. Overall...great stay in a great hotel at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “The Millenium Hilton is perfect for a private getaway!”
Reviews.Author: amarie176
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to NYC together in September. The Millenium Hilton is close enough to everything to grab a taxi or jump on the subway right across the street. We got there earlier than expected and had no problem at all with a very early check in. The staff was amazingly polite and helpful. The nights were quiet on the 38th floor. There was not much outside noise that came in at night. The hotel is set up in such a way that you don't hear people shuffling up and down a busy hallway. Housekeeping was polite and kept the place immaculate! I cannot say enough nice things about our stay at the hotel. It was memorable and I will definitely stay there again! It's right across the street from Ground Zero and we could see it from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Trippin_Fools
Reviews.Content: We loved the Millennium Hilton! I booked this room through Orbitz and got 3% Fatwallet cashback, combined with Entertainment Book coupon codes, we saved a bundle! I called directly to the Hilton before our trip and talked with the front desk clerk a little and he volunteered to bump us up to a higher floor room from what Orbitz gave us. I would definitely recommend staying on floor 31 or higher, the views are spectacular and there's almost no noise from the 'round the clock WTC construction site that's directly across the street.
