We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 in the morning and when I went to the concierge to ask about keeping our bags until check-in, they said "Why not check in now?" Really? At 9:30 in the morning? No extra charge? OK! The Bellhop grabbed our luggage and off we went. We were very impressed with the room. The Hilton hasn't let us down yet. We opened the door to a clean, fresh smelling, and spacious room. I was worried if the Standard room would be nice enough for our romantic getaway, Absolutely. From the plush King bed to the trimmed out, wall mounted flat screen, even the sofa chair and executive desk, it's all there. The little interaction we had with the staff during our 4 day stay was all pleasant and cheerful, they always seemed eager to help. Housekeeping was great! Security was never in question. The lobby and front entrances are well lit and there was always a doorman, even after midnight. The financial district is mostly quiet on the weekends, but even so, NYPD had officers posted at the hotel on Friday and Saturday mornings during the week of 9/11. There are just a few things you need to know about the location of the Millennium. It's directly across the street from Century 21 discount clothing store (You could spend hours in here shopping, they have a separate 3 story annex for shoes). There is a Starbucks within walking distance in either direction and also a Dunkin' stand. The Fulton St Subway Station is just a few steps from the side door of the hotel, that gets you right uptown. It's just minutes from Chelsea Harbor Market with plenty of shopping and the Bodies Exhibition (See this! It's worth every penny!). There are 2 for 1 coupons in the NY Entertainment book that you can buy online for $10 bucks before you go. It's worth that for the Bodies coupon alone. Our trip was fantastic thanks to the Millennium Hilton. I'll be posting a trip report soon! Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: carolamelia
Reviews.Content: If you want to see Ground Zero, or be located near Wall Street or Brooklyn, this is a great location. We found a good deal on the hotel ($199/night) and used public transportation everywhere. The room was large, clean, quiet, good ventilation and had a great view of ground zero. Starbucks around the corner was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nic-Rod
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a long weekend in New York. We stayed at the Millenium Hilton on church street which overlooked the site of ground zero. This hotel is lovely. The staff was very helpful both at reception and the door men. Always ready to help you catch a taxi if needed or with bags of shopping. This hotel is situated at the opposite end to Central Park (we walked there one day and were quite tired!!) apart from that most sites are walkable! The hotel had all the necessities you could need including: hairdryer, coffee machine, air conditioning, extra towels, shampoo etc. I forgot my travel plug and the hotel were even able to provide me with one (UK to USA). The hotel is in a sort of quiet area (if there is anywhere in New York that is quiet). A trip to Times Square would cost you about 15 to 20 dollars including a tip depending on peak times. We bought our room through travelrepublic.com as it was the cheapest by a mile. We had a beautiful view of the sea and as mentioned ground zero. Ground Zero is still much in rubble however the 9/11 museum is just around the corner from the hotel and the plans for the memorial look lovely. In a few years once complete the views will be absolutely gorgeous. Century 21 is a couple minutes walk south of the hotel where you can find designer brands for a knock down price but you will need to fish for things. The hotel is quite close (maybe a 20ish minute walk) to Battery Park where you can go on to the ferries to take you to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. I would say that a must is to go to Broadway. If you are going to New York before 22nd of nov

Reviews.Title: “Disppointed.”
Reviews.Author: MCMRochester
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Millenium Hilton, booked through Priceline. To provide background, we usually stay at 5 star establishments. Upon returning to our room at the end of a very long night, we found our bedsheets to have hair on both the fitted sheet and pillow cases. There was promptly somebody in our room to change the sheets. However, the next set of sheets also had hair. The following morning, I spoke to the manager on duty. She stated that she was aware that I had called "very late at night" to complain about my sheets. She stated that she planned to look into the matter with housekeeping, and the company who serviced the sheets. She did not plan do to anything further to remedy our inconvenience. I asked for our parking fee to be waived, and she reluctantly agreed to credit half of it. I find it both disgusting, and unacceptable for a guest to be booked into a room with sheets that had not been cleaned, and possibly slept in already. The staff of the Hilton did not. Furthermore, I wonder, is it odd for couples travelling to New York City on the weekend to return to their rooms "very late" at night? Not only was the manager's response to our complaint unsatisfactory, she told me that she planned on asking the staff person who changed our sheets where he put them. For what purpose? Also, the noise from construction is quite loud, so keep that in mind if you book a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuergenL
Reviews.Content: From time to time you can get fabulous rates at this property on the Hilton website. While their weekend rates are generally good, this sometimes also applies to mid-week rates when business is low. Rooms are spacious for NYC, very clean and decorated in a contemporary, though not cutting edge, style. Great views from upper floors. Nice indoor pool. Perfect downtown location with easy access to several subway lines within one block. Trendy hangouts in Tribeca can easily be reached in a short walk. The Millenium Hilton is my first choice when looking for accommodation in Manhattan. If the price is right, I don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: chixtrvl
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. The staff anticipated every need. The view was breathtaking. Totally worth it. No better view of the hudson or ground zero. The room was spotless and well maintained....inroom dining was pricy but good and quick. I generally do not stay with hilton but I was pleasantly surprised. Great shopping in soho next to century 21. One thing...they start construction on ground zero really early so it may be too loud...but i actually enjoyed it...it reminded me to get up and enjoy New York.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Come True in New York City”
Reviews.Author: judy1955
Reviews.Content: This was the first time ever in NYC. This was our summer "family only" trip (19 year old son, 16 year old daughter). The Millenium Hotel is in the financial district - near the tip of Manhattan - across the street from where the Twin Towers were. We rented 2 rooms - one for my husband/son and one for myself/my daughter. The beds were luxurious and unbelievably comfortable. We rose in the morning and walked all over Manhattan for hours and when we'd get back to the hotel, I'd take a shower in the pristene bathroom and crawl into the cool sheets - it truly was paradise. We kept the room cool - it was very hot outside and we were so lucky with 5 continuous days of sunshine. We visited Century 21 (shopping plaza) next door to the hotel. Very very busy with lots of shoppes - quite understandable as the deals on designer clothing/items was very good. My kids love labels (Lacose, Tommy Hilfiger, Dolce & Gabanna) and it was affordable at Century 21. We visited Macy's and some really cool boutiques that were so reasonable (my daughter bought 2 pairs of gorgeous jeans - $19 for each pair). These jeans at home (Canada) would have been $49+. There were outdoor restaurants/cafes and the prices were very reasonable and the food was good. We walked to Staten Island, down by the water where we could see the Brooklyn Bridge - it was a dream come true to see all of the sites we only enjoyed on t.v. It was so exciting to see New York City "in person." We purchased tickets for the Broadway play "Rock of Ages." Everyone in the family enjoyed it immensely. We felt so happy afterwards. (Anne Hathaway was in the audience!). Time Square was beautiful and busy - but surprisingly not as busy as I thought it would be. We visited the Madame Tussauds wax museum. I went crazy when I saw "Jon Bon Jovi." We visited Ripley's Believe it or Not. That was very enjoyable too! Although I'm afraid of my own shadow, we decided to take a helicopter tour of the City. It was beyond exciting and we were so happy we did it. (Although about a month after we arrived home, there was the terrible helicopter/plane crash over the Hudson) just where we had been. We flew from Ottawa, Canada to New York City. The trip was about $5,000 in total but worth every penny! As an aside, I have to say the people in New York City were so warm and friendly and inviting. I will never forget this special trip to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, hotel based right next to massive worksite”
Reviews.Author: pugface
Reviews.Content: Read all the other reviews and you'll see the summary of: nice very clean rooms, potentially lots of noise from the WTC reconstruction works, expensive breakfast, no free internet/wifi, it can be found very cheaply on hotwire/priceline/etc. I second all that. Managed to book for $144/night for three nights at last minute on hotwire. Checked in at 2pm no problems and was given a room on the 53rd floor. Stunning views of the river and WTC site (if looking at construction interests you). I wasn't too bothered by the noise below but you should bring ear plugs, or take sleeping tablets, if you really think it's going to be an issue. Frankly most Manhattan hotels suffer from noise pollution of some sort, so if you don't like noise stay further out. It's right next door to Century 21 (the discount department store) but apart from that, there isn't much to do for the tourist but don't let this put you off - this area is amazingly well connected by the subway and a cab to Soho shouldn't be more than about $8-10. Nights are quiet but the hotel is well staffed, so you can have a great night out and come back to a place that feels safe and welcoming. This is a Hilton hotel, so expect polite discrete service aimed primarily at the business traveller. It's not a home from home but a good clean bed/shower/desk to use as a base as you explore Manhattan and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: rainer49
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a few days in August 2009 for work. Hotel is very nice and the staff was friendly and attentive. Home was clean and decorated in a modern style. Toiletries and towels always restocked fully each day. WTC construction across the street is loud and dirty, but the noise is over by 6pm. PATH station is very close so you can get pretty much anywhere. Not much of a problem getting cabs. Starbucks around the corner for those that are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ovidiu1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one week in July , very clean hotel, we booked a standard room and they upgrade for free to a junior suite (corner room) , super views !!! Staff was very friedly and concierge help us to find best offer to diffrent attractions. It is possible to be a little bit noisy from the ground zero building site, depends of the floor you stay. I have one minus - parking is very expensive !!! But if you can wake up in the morning (at 7am) you can park on the street (between 9 pm-7am). Business center is expensive - but you can print online bording pass from the reception and save some money. Internet also is expensive on the hotel , but in the room you can find some free wireless newtork from outside building! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanandGlenda
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton was a brilliant one. The staff were excellent helpfull and ploite. The rooms in this property were on the large side with plenty of room very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located directly across from the world trade centre and we didnt expierence any noise even with the late construction work. Our room was on the 26th floor which offered some amazing views of the city skyline. Locatin wise its a little out of the way but at $2 to ride the subway too time square and a journey time of 10 mins and th station located oppisite the hotel perfect. All in all NYC was an amazing expierence and the Hilton the perfect Place too stay. Oh one little negative the food its noot too bad but best avioded in place of another.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon59
Reviews.Content: Generally I would say the Millenium Hilton is a save play. You always know what to expect. The beds are comfortable and usually good sized. The bathroom was clean at any times and so was the room. I would classify it more as a business hotel especially since it is in the financial district. Price-wise it won't get any better considering we had a view facing Brooklyn from the 42nd floor which was, I have to confess, simply amazing. The hotel itself is, as you would expect in New York, very busy and obviously has a huge turnover which makes. The entrance hall feels more like the Grand Central at times and therefore the staff can't be as attentive as you might hope for. Besides a domestic fight between a couple next door (which isn't the hotels fault) at 3am did we have a quiet stay even to there are construction works going on day and night on ground zero. So you better make sure not to have a room facing the wrong side. All in all enjoyable stay but too buzzling for me and busy as I would like to relax once back in the hotel. Location-wise too downtown for me, would always prefer staying more uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: monicamadison
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to subway, theatres, restaurants. Amazingly more than decent size room, large bathroom and the view is out of this world. Hotel staff extremely friendly and the fitness center was perfect. Highly recommend if you can find a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: ErinmarieX
Reviews.Content: Not only was this hotel absolutely gorgeous and new but the staff really was the icing on the cake! Our shuttle service from JFK to Hilton Mil. (umm 2 hrs- yeah) left me in such a bad mood I just figured it was only going to get worse...but the second we stepped into this Hotel the staff was INCREDIBLE! OUR room was ready (it was early!!!) and he was so nice it immediately made up for the terrible shuttle service. And it wasn't just one time that the staff was wonderful, it was every time we left or came back. AND they gave us tips to tell the cab driver so we could make the 3pm wedding that we were late for :) The hotel view was incredible, the room itself was incredible. I cant say enough about this hotel - when we go back - we are staying here. Oh and the view was INCREDIBLE. We were in the corner room, city view.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mwfiesole
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium for both business and leisure. The hotel is comfortable with clean, comfortable rooms that provide a nice rest from a busy day in the city. The ongoing construction was a slight annoyance for me on my most recent visit, as we were in an 8th floor room directly facing construction that continued late into a Saturday evening. I was so exhausted though, I quickly fell asleep through it. On another visit a few years ago, I was in a 23rd floor room where the noise was not at all audible. This is a nice hotel that I will continue to frequent at prices of 200/night. It can feel a bit isolated down in the financial district, but one can quickly access the train and get anywhere they want to go. It's particularly convenient to Brooklyn.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, fresh and clean. I love the location--many good restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and roomy by NYC standards. We were originally given a room with a view of "ground zero" and the Hudson River in the background. When we found this too depressing we requested another room and were given a room with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge with no problems. We enjoyed the view and our stay very mush. Great staff! Only one complaint was that when we left for breakfast and came back to our room the maid had already stripped our bedding off. It was only 9AM!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTravelerA_Z
Reviews.Content: Subway right out the door, so you can get just about anywhere! Good service, quiet, printer at the front desk for your plane tickets! We had a great view of the financial centers and the Hudson river. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonCat76
Reviews.Content: At first I was overwhelmed by the view we had over Ground Zero. The noise from the site was noticable and some nights it was as if the drilling and digging didn't stop at all and I recall that a couple of nights it went on until the early hours and started up at what seemed like an hour later. However, we did get used to it! The hotel was clean and comfortable and had a great coffee machine and a great big TV. The bar on the 3rd floor was relxing for a quiet drink in the evening. The location of the hotel was good and as we were staying in NY for sight seeing it was ideal for jumping on the subway. One down side was that we were kept awake on the Friday night by a group of young men in the next room to use being very loud, banging windows, smoking and shouting. I had to phone the security twice as it went on for well over 2 hours until 4am!! Overall though we had a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tackett2004
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here through hotwire and had NO idea what I would be getting, and could not have been more happy. The view was incredible, and the noise did not bother me even though I'm a light sleeper. I loved the decorations, and the bed was great. Bathroom was great too. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Got engaged in New York's Central Park...”
Reviews.Author: NWN100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here June 7th-9th and the weekend was amazing. The rooms are great and the staff was excellent. The hotel is located right next to one of the secret gems in NYC, Century 21. That was the only way I could covince my girlfriend at the time to go to NY for the weekend, we are no married since.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with sad view”
Reviews.Author: MeliWV
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of NYC hotels, and toured many more in a previous life (career). Our room was so spacious! The location, however, I just don't know. Obviously, if you have business in the area, or have never really wandered that far south, it's worth it, but taking a cab uptown for every little show or museum is tiresome and expensive. If you are actually doing the tourist thing the location really isn't ideal. Of course, if you haven't really been there, there's a lot to offer nearby; much of it new - the hunger memorial; that new ferry station. The view into the WTC site is really sad. The service is pretty good. Like all the Hilton franchise, you have to pay for every little thing, including internet or any decent tv. We had to ask the front desk for a sewing kit to replace a button. They refused us extra coffee. My husband was kinda cranky about that - he says that there's no benefit to better coffee if you're limited to one cup per person per day. On the other hand, I honestly think our housekeeper was the best I've ever encountered. The actual facilities: Because it is primarily a business property, its regular clientele are doing something more important at ten or five than a sauna and swim. So although these are kinda teeny, we had them to ourselves as often as not. And that is the beauty of downtown Manhattan - if you are relaxing midday, it's like you're on your own private island. highlights: check-in, housekeeping, spacious rooms lowlights: nickel and diming, had to ask twice to have remote replaced

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Jess_Oslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time staying at this hotel for 4 nights in June 2009. Friendly staff helping me with my bags and when I checked in after 18 hours off traveling from Europe the receptionist asked just as many questions she had to. Some times when you check in they NEVER stop! Thank you again! I have two things to point out that surprised me, more then it disappointed me, breakfast were pore but very tasty(!!!) and internet access were expensive, $6/hour I think it was. Perhaps I`m just spoiled with free wifi in Europe… I do recommend this to anyone who would like to stay at a hotel with great location and FAB shopping Century 21 on the opposite side from the hotel. The harbour is 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, poor service”
Reviews.Author: DulinIdaho
Reviews.Content: I had requested an early check in and tried to check in at 1:30. We were told our room on the 52nd floor would be ready by 3:00, or we could have a room on the lower level. We waited around until 3:00, endured a long line for check in as they only had one staff at the counter, and was told our room was still not ready, so they put us at a lower level anyway. They were unapologetic as I voiced my disappointment. We tried to take a dip in the pool before leaving for dinner, but the pool is closed in the afternoons. I asked several staff if there was anywhere in the hotel we could look down into ground zero, they all told me no, even though there are great views from the 5th floor conference room and exercise room. The views may be worth the poor service though. Breakfast was very dull and expensive. Try the Starbucks breakfast around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Looking over ground zero - amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: This was just another business trip and the hotel met my expectations for another metrolpolitan hilton. The incredible experience was looking down over a snow covered ground zero. All construction activity had stopped because of the weather and it was both sobering and impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a dozen times in the last two years, most recently on July 9. The hotel sits next to the old World Trade Center site and was completely renovated after 9/11. The hotel is sleek, modern and comfortable. The standard rooms are small, but very comfortable. The room decor is also modern and minimalist in a good way. Light wood furniture; glass tops on the dresser and desk; large flat screen televisions. I've eaten in the restaurant many times and have been happy with the food. The continental breakfast used to be better and has been scaled back a little of late, but it's ok. It's several years out now since the renovation, but everything is still in very nice shape. Noise has sometimes been a problem with the continuous day/evening work on the World Trade Center site, and most of the rooms face that direction. There are rooms on each end of the hotel that face the opposite direction and they are quieter (although the view isn't nearly as interesting). These rooms are also significantly bigger than the typical rooms facing the WTC site. I've stayed in four of these end rooms, and it seems to be hit or miss if you get one. I've attached some pictures of one of these bigger rooms, so for the standard room, imagine something much narrower. The staff is courteous and professional. One extra bonus of the hotel is that it is also right next to the Century 21 department store. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, rooms and value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights over the 4th of July weekend. Being Gold HHonors members, we have used points to stay in most of the Hilton properties in NYC. We chose this hotel with the hopes of being able to see the fireworks from our room. We weren't disappointed. Using our points and reserving on line, I was offered the opportunity to select to an upgrade. I chose all upgrades and at check-in we got a King Jr. Suite with a city view. It cost an extra $49/N which was a bargain for the view! We were on the 34th floor, (room 3411)a 2 room suite with a first room with a sofa, lounge chair, desk, honor bar and a flat screen TV then the bathroom (great water pressure!!) and a nice size bedroom with king bed and large flat screen TV. The best part was the floor to ceiling windows with a spectacular viewsof the Hudson River, Empire State Building and the WTC site. This was a corner room, so views really spanned from the Hudson on one side to the Brooklyn Bridge on the other. We were able to see both the Macy's fireworks and those at Liberty State Park. It was such a clear night that we could even see fireworks in the distance all around NJ and LI. The hotel is located downtown and if you are looking for nightlife closeby, you would probably prefer the midtown area; however, if you want to be close to everything (many subway lines within walking distance, 2 within a block) and like the peace and quiet, then this is a great choice. In my opinion, you will not get a better value in NYC. This is a lovely hotel in a very safe neighborhood. We were given the choice of free breakfast, free internet or 1000 points as Gold members. We chose the breakfast, which was adequate for a continental breakfast. (Yes, as previously mentioned they charge $24 for the buffet which is high, but perhaps not for NYC.) They also had an option to upgrade to a 'real' breakfast for $6.50. With all the great food options in NYC, we only wanted a bit of breakfast so never bothered with more than the buffet. We looked at the fitness room and pool, but never had time to use them. They looked nice and clean. All the staff we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back. P.S. - Century 21 department store is next door. It is a must experience if you like shopping for bargains! St. Paul's Church has a very moving memorial and tribute to 9/11 which is also next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: I won't go on and on. Excellent hotel, very professional staff, larger rooms for NYC, very clean and well-kept. Housekeeping met my request (extra teas each day). Even earned free breakfast at the restaurant -- an over-priced continental breakfast (who would pay $23 for a selection of bread, fruit, and cereal??). The honeydew melon tasted off at the restaurant (I tried it all three days, and it always tasted sour). Had problems with the phone every day and it was never resolved. Only major warning to future guests: the hotel overlooks the former World Trade Center site. Work on the site begins EARLY and it ends LATE (some work appeared to go on around the clock). If you are a light sleeper, you will not be able to sleep in. I was on the 23rd floor and was awakened each day around 6:15. This isn't a complaint because the work must go on, it is merely a warning to future guests who may desire a quieter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property, boring location and no Diamond benefits”
Reviews.Author: lac14
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a decent property in that it is quite new and the rooms were pretty good for a Hilton. However I was disappointed that there was no concierge lounge and I was not offered any breakfast or drink vouchers as is customary for Diamond VIP benefits. Also the WFC neighborhood pretty much shuts down after dark with not many food options. It is nearby the subway both the ACE and 4,6 lines. I will probably continue to look for a better hotel to stay in for frequent NYC business travel.

Reviews.Title: “An otherwise nice experience marred by poor service”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location, well appointed rooms BUT, service is a problem. When we arrived at 4:00 PM there were dirty dishes from breakfast on the floor outside our door (and were still there at 7:00 PM when we went out for dinner). Then at 10:00 PM I realized that I had forgotten a prescription medicine and called the front desk to find a pharmacy and were told that there were none in Manhattan that were open this late and offered me a hotel doctor for $300. ((I'm not sure how that was supposed to help if there was no pharmacy and I already had a prescription). I went on the Internet (for $14.95) and found one a short taxi ride away and all was solved.

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality, great price, nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over thanksgiving 2008 and with the price reduction because of the WTC rebuild its perfect. An super quality hotel following its own facelift with great room size and cleanliness. We upgraded to a high floor corner room, and although you can still slightly hear some of the construction, after a day out in NYC you should be tired enough to sleep right through. The views from high up the hotel are excellent, we could see the Statue of Liberty, over to Jersey and the Brooklyn Bridge. We didnt eat here so cannot comment, but its close to a couple of subway stations and you can be in the heart of shopping and attractions like Times Square within 20 mins, plus the subway is a bargain. Could the PATH back to Newark airport as it departs from under the WTC opposite the hotel, saves a small fortune compared to a cab!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biobrat
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hilton for a weekend get-away. Part of our plans included walking across the Brooklyn Bridge which is only a few blocks away. We walked many blocks uptown, though Tribeca and the next day, downtown through the financial district. We've lived in New York all our lives and have been to Ground Zero many times but from our room we were able to look right down onto the site. It was a spiritual and sobering experience. Hotel is across the street from St. Paul's, which is a must-see. Lots of good shopping in the neighborhood. If you can, park in a garage off-site as the hotel charges $55.00 for 24 hours and then $25. if you're one minute over!! Rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1967
Reviews.Content: This was a first trip to New York for the 3 of us. What a fantastic time we had during the 4 days we were there. The Millenium Hilton is a lovely bright airy, very clean and friendly hotel and an excellent base to start a sight seeing trip to the BIG APPLE. The staff are helpfull extremely friendly and funny. The room we shared was spacious very clean and had everything we needed (including a hairdryer, an essential for 3 girls!). We had a corner room on the 42nd floor which gave us a detailed view into ground zero and across the bottom part of Manhatten Island. Within walking distance of Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, Little Italy , China Town and has Century 21 just next door. A lovely little deli just round the corner for a great breakfast to start the day. Subway stations are close by for getting into the center ie, Times square/Central Park but you could walk it if you had a spare hour and a half....... and no blisters! We got a great deal on the price too so an all round excellent hotel. I would definatley recomend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CyberPhox
Reviews.Content: We booked the standard room with two queen beds but they made a mistake and gave us a room with one king bed, we were upgraded to a junior suite! The location is great, right by ground zero. It 's probably good for business trip. The downside is they charge for everything -- parking is $55 a day and we used PC to browse the web for 10 minutes at the business center and was charged $5! I guess this is normal in New York city?

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: kinuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. If you want 5 star without the NYC 5 star price I highly recommend this hotel. It's downtown opp the WTC but don't let that put you off. The subway station is right outside the hotel entrance and you'll get to Times Square and midtown in around 10 mins on the tube. It's also perfect walking distance to the trendy restaurant/bar areas of SoHo and Tribecca and the meatpacking district. Book online at the Hilton website. Has very good rates and an option to upgrade (for a small fee - much less than price of upgraded room if you booked it) if an upgraded room is available at the time of check in. I happily found I had been upgraded from a king room to a junior suite on the 36th floor. On opening the door I was struck by an amazing view, finding myself in a corner room with views over the Hudson and Midtown. It was pretty amazing going to sleep looking at the Empire State Building. All the usual 5 star luxury, nice toiletries, bathrobes, mini bar. Hotel also has a pool and fitness centre. Staff were excellent. Restaurant and room service is pricey but the food and service couldn't be faltered. I will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern spacious hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: jackson_sprandy
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for 5 nights after staying 2 nights at the Waldorf Astoria so it sure had something to follow! The hotel is very modern inside and the staff are very helpful. We stayed on the 52nd floor which was great for views of the river and New Jersey. Must mention how fast the lifts/elevators are! Never waited more than 30 seconds for one and we could do top to bottom in 23 seconds. Our room looked right onto ground zero - pretty surreal. The room itself was very modern with massive bed and massive TV. Some reviews on this website complain of the noise from ground zero but we couldnt hear a thing. (Probably due to the high floor room). Great choice of on demand films on the tv. I would have liked to have seen free wireless internet throughout the hotel. The USA are really behind UK hotels in offering this service. The gym and pool facilities were great and always really quiet. Great way to wind down. Having use of the free online check in facility in reception helped us out a great deal. The subway stop (53rd Church St) is about 30 paces from the hotel door and catching an E train will take you into central (times square, broadway, china town, little italy, penn street, madison square gdn, macys etc etc) in about 10 minutes. We bought a metro pass for 27$ for the week which we used loads and well worth the money. There is a little Armish Deli Market about 1 block from the hotel. It sells great food such as pizzas, sandwiches, massive salad bar and all things which you need for your room like extra drinks etc. Well worth a visit. I got a great deal through hiltons website for this hotel and i wouldnt hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Orengivi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week there, the hotel was great (easy to get from the airport by subway), the room was great and so is the service. Amazing view over ground zero but it's noisy. We stayed on floor 48 and heard the noisy especially in early morning, hotel restaurant is expensive and not so safisfying, you can print online bording pass from the reception and save the expensive business center

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: gigide
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4/14 - 4/15. Had a great deal $129/nt for City view and was upgraded to Jr. Suite on arrival for additional $15/day. Arrived 10 am and room immediately available. Nice surprise! Check in was quick. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Corner room was decorated nicely, clean and spacious. Great views from 50th floor. Construction noise didn't bother us. Elevators were quick. A few subway lines within very short walking distance so getting around was easy. Ate at Les Halles and Pearl Street Diner for breakfast and lunch- both within 5 - 10 minute walk. Century 21 next door. Plenty of other restaurants/fast food within walking distance. Otherwise, midtown is about a 20 minute subway ride. Only took taxis if it was past 11 p.m. Otherwise, felt safe in area since subway line so close. As for cleanliness, the lobby public bathrooms were a mess. Never got the night turn down service - not sure if we were supposed to??? Not a big deal. Toilet stopped up. Fixed within 10 minutes from calling front desk about problem. Room service within timely manner but burger a little overcooked but still edible. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Rooms and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: victoriapezzella
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent priced hotel in the city that did not lack comfort or class. The Millenium Hilton in the Financial District was just right. For $170 plus taxes, we had a corner room with two double beds on the 39th floor. Not, bad for NYC. The beds were a little small but the room itself was very clean and stylish. The view was great also. The bathroom was roomy and clean, as well. The subway is a few steps from the hotel and it's only a 20 min ride to mid town. Location is nice and quiet. Although, they are doing constuction on ground zero (which is right across the street), being on the 38th floor, we did not hear a thing...maybe on a lower floor it is different. There is a great deli across the street called The Stage Door or Backstage...something like that. Wonderful food! I'd highly recommend this hotel for the price and the great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: onegoldendog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night of our long Easter weekend because I was able to book a free room with Capital One rewards points, which made it a fantastic stay. We had a Junior Suite on the 44th floor (corner room) and liked it very much. The location is great for doing downtown things and subway is very convenient. I actually like how quiet the neighborhood is at night. We travel to NY often so the location was fine with us, but might not be best for a first time visitor. The price of parking is high, much more than I pay in midtown, which seemed odd to me. The staff was pleasant and helpful, although we didn't have any interaction beyond check-in and check-out. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hedleymom
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a junior suite and had a fabulous room overlooking the Hudson and the harbor with windows on two sides. We also could see directly into the WTC site. The room was spacious, and the layout terrific to allow one person to sleep while the other watched TV in the other room. The staff is very helpful. Because several subway lines are located right at the hotel, it is very easy to get around or you can easily walk to Little Italy ( what's left of it) or Chinatown, Tribeca or around the FInancial district. The only downside is that the internet in your room is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning views from very high up...”
Reviews.Author: jgl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for 4 nights early April. It is located just opposite of the ground zero sight. Both interesting and sorrowful...and a bit noisy as there seemed to be constuction all night and all day. Check in, emenities, service, room were all great. .Good location for walking to Chinatown, waterfront, Wall St., Little Italy and very easy to catch the Metro or busses. My room was a real bargain....not sure why as I booked directly on the website and worth much more than I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireandJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter, paid a little more than some reviewers but still enjoyed our stay. Reception staff werent very friendly on check in, but the hotel was over booked and they tried to put us in a lower grade room than we had paid for. We refused and after a delay the situation was eventually resolved by the Duty Manager. Our room was on the 34th floor and as noted by a previous reviewer it does have a constant buzzing noise. The bed was very comfortable, a little disappointed that even in a junior suite the shower & bath were combined. The view over the city was nice but if you looked down it was Ground Zero and very depressing. Even more so the numbers of tourists who come each day to stare and take photos quite macabre. Food and drink is very expensive in New York but Church & Dey restaurant was quite good and compared well for value to other restaurants in the area eg; The Palm Restaurant in nearby Tribeca is nothing special yet expect to pay (before taxes etc) Steak $45 and $10-$15 for each side order. Biddy Earlys Irish pub is neither authentic nor friendly. I was born quite close to where Biddy Early, the wise woman from Co Clare lived so I was very excited to experience some Irish hospitality. I have never seen black/white pudding like the burnt offerings we received, there are no facilities to make tea and the coffee was cold. Not very friendly either and we were the only patrons there. The kitchen seem to be run by what appeared to be South American staff, so not terribly authentic. The Hotel is ideally situated for the subway which connects with the sky train for JFK. Daily unlimited tickets for the subway cost just $7.50 or $25 for 5 days. The shuttle from JFK costs $19 but took one and half hours. When it rains it seems to last all day and when the sun shines there is an icy wind, its still winter in New York. I would return to this hotel but only when reminders of mass grave at Ground Zero are gone

Reviews.Title: “Lower Manhattan, Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Bikeluv1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from April 5 to 10th, 2009. Upgraded to a corner suite on the 51st floor with a great view of Brooklyn Bridge and Statue of Liberty. Excellent room with comfortable surroundings, friendly staff and great Concierge! 25 steps out the door to the 4,5,6 trains to Upper Manhattan and around the corner to giant discount shopping. Just an excellent stay at a great hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “a good trip”
Reviews.Author: cnpist
Reviews.Content: Last September, our cousin booked a room through vengoo.com for the Millenium Hilton hotel. The rooms were very nice. They reserved a connecting room so that we were all together. It is a clean and nice hotel and also close to Chinatown and Soho. Before going, we used the vengoo.com's Concierge service. It was very good and we didn't expect an online service like that. They booked tickets for my cousin's parents and the tickets were at the hotel when we were there. For our next stay we definetly will use the Millenium and the vengoo.com service.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: jenandjody
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two daughters to New York City for their first visit over spring break. After lots of research online (and through trip advisor), we booked the Hilton in the financial district. The price we got on Hilton's website was awesome, at $179 per night. We also opted for the $20 per night upgrade when we booked, so if a junior suite was available at check-in, we would get it. When we did check in, we did receive the corner, junior suite, for a total of $199 a night, much less than the usual going rate I'm told. We stayed on the 43rd floor, which looked directly down into Ground Zero. At first I thought it was cool, then I thought about all the people that perished on 9/11 at that very spot, and I felt a little sick to my stomach as I laid in bed trying to sleep. The bed was VERY comfortable, and the room and bathroom were exceptionally clean. The hideabed our girls (13 and 11), shared was a bit small (full-sized) and the mattress was a little saggy, but for their size it didn't matter. Having two large flat-screened TVs was a nice plus. The pool had strange hours (only open until 9:45 on the weekends, and 6:00 during the week), and the restaurant (Church and Dey), was WAY TOO overpriced. Don't get stuck eating at the hotel, a lot of restaurants close early in that area of the city. A subway entrance was located just outside the lobby, which was a nice feature. All of the staff was very polite and smiley. The concierge was also helpful and recommended two wonderful pizza places to us (John's Pizza in SOHO on Bleeker St. was AWESOME). The fitness center was also very modern and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca99
Reviews.Content: Booked two deluxe king rooms for £90 a night, with one that was a corner room. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior corner suite with separate lounge. Hotel rooms as expected were very clean and modern. There is no Wifi access in the rooms and to get access you have to pay nearly $15 for a 24 hour period. The one drawback of staying here is that it is right next to the World Trade Centre site and all the building work at Ground Zero - but this is probably why the hotel is cheap. As long as you are high up in the hotel, the noise dims, but there is noise during the night, although at a lower level than the day. If you want someone 4 star to stay and plan on being out most of the day then this is a good place to stay. Great location, and easy to find - he only drawback is the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: slates7
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent as the room was. The only annoying thing was that on the 34th floor we lived has a strange noise, sounded like a dial tone. Maybe it came from the construction of the new WTC but we could hear it at the corridor as well. Wasn't a problem because with earplug we slept very well for 4 night. The panorama is outstanding. Overall the hotel is awsome especially for the price we lived there ($110).

Reviews.Title: “An okay experience at best”
Reviews.Author: snirtanion
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here over Christmas, the result of a very cheap rate through priceline. The proximity to the WTC made for some odd experiences with tourists - strange to see people smiling and getting their pictures taken in front of what amounts to a huge grave - but we were not bothered by noise from construction. I was very unhappy with the level of service and cleanliness of the hotel. The public areas were disgusting at best. Hotel workers were harried and hadn't received the level of training one would expect from a hotel in this class. The rooms themselves were fine. Location was very nice - close to a number of trains, not too far from shopping, restaurants, etc. Good spot for cabs, etc. As a tourist, it's also important to recognize that this is a business hotel, so all of the extras will include a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BelfastMarcus
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about staying at this Hotel because of all the negative feed back about noise from ground Zero, we also thought the reason it was so cheap for a 4 star was due to people not being able to sleep. Anyway, we took the risk and booked it - we requested a room at the back of the hotel on Level 44 and didn't hear a thing, slept like babies and the room was exactly what we expected from a 4 star Hilton Hotel - However, the money we saved on hotel accommodation was probably eaten up by all the travelling from down town to up town. You need to consider that you're located right down town and about a 20-25 minute train ride to time square...taking the odd taxi ride back & forth soon chews up the dollars...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mlouprice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for a week last Spring. Everything about my experience there was first rate. The rooms was very nice: modern furnishings, flat screen TV, incredibly comfortable bed, very nice bathroom. But the real star of this hotel is the staff. Every single person I encountered that worked there went out of there way to be helpful. I was able to check in early without hassle, given detailed directions several times, and offered help with my shuttle to the airport. I would definitely stay there again. It is downtown, so it's a little further away from main attractions than some other hotels, but it's close to Soho and Chinatown. It is directly across from Ground Zero and we were warned about noise. It didn't bother me at all. New York is a noisy city anyway and the noise from construction wasn't that loud and I got a good night sleep every night. I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mikerush
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Millenium Hilton and had a wonderful time. Excellent in every way. It will be our hotel of choice for NYC in the future if the price is right. The hotel is within walking distance of South Street Seaport, which would make its location not ideal for some, but for the room value and easy access to the subway everywhere it could not be beat. We stayed three nights, two nights for the opera at Lincoln Center and one musical on 46th Street. On the 2/3 express subway line two blocks away, it took all of 10/20 minutes to get to the theater/opera. Rates can be as low as $119.00 per night, non-refundable, and they will give you an upgrade, if you ask and if available. We ended up in a corner king, which can rent for $389 per night. And a pool on top of everything else. I did laps every morning. The only downside is the ongoing world trade center construction which is just across the street from the hotel. try to get a room as high as possible and mention the construction. They are aware it can be an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Service in the City”
Reviews.Author: ourfrank
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night for business due to its proximity to my business location. From the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out, service was absolutely amazing. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating~ a far cry from the service I've received at other national chains in the city. The rooms were quite large for NY and immaculate. I would not hesitate to stay here again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vistbr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Valentines Day weekend and it was just perfect. The view from our room was just breathtaking and the service was second to none. The staff knew us from the moment we walked in the door and did everything to make our stay enjoyable. After the weekend I extended my stay for business and our room went from a romantic escape to a comfortable work space in a instant. This was the first time that I have ever used an in room coffee maker because this was the first time that I have ever seen one so clean and well stocked. The pool was nice except I had trouble locating the towels. I think the girl working the pool area was the only employee who wasn't very helpful. She seemed more interested in her ipod than her job, but that didn't matter much. The dry sauna was just what the doctor ordered after a long day in the city. The only thing missing was a hot tub. Check out was a breeze and once again the lobby staff impressed me beyond words. If you are looking for a nice getaway or need to be fresh for that meeting in the morning the Millenium Hilton is the way to go. SIDE NOTE: Best hotel room TV you will ever have.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here Valentine's weekend. I booked a 46-54 corner room and the view was worth the extra money. Views of the Hudson River and Empire State Building out of one window and the Brooklyn Bridge and East River out of the other. The lobby is very nice and the doormen were friendly. We had a few drinks at the bar which is very overpriced. Within walking distance of the South Street Seaport and across the street from Century 21, NYC's most popular discount clothing store. I noticed several people had mentioned the lack of restaurants and nightlife. There are several Irish Pubs within a few blocks of the hotel (a couple of blocks north and one block west of Church Street. We ate at the Tribeca Palm steakhouse which is also within walking distance on West Street. Parking was a whopping $55 per night, arriving Friday I was able to find street parking since many parking restrictions on the side streets are lifted for the weekend at either 6PM or 7PM Friday.

Reviews.Title: “3rd times a charm....love it”
Reviews.Author: PortCredit
Reviews.Content: We stayed over valentines weekend....which we really didn't think about when we booked our getaway to NYC. We planned to come to NYC to experience the food, the shopping and the city again for the 3rd time in 3 years, and since it was valentines it just made the trip worth while. We reserved through expedia in combination with the flights from Toronto. and since we have stayed here 2 previous times,it was a no brainer to come back. We have learned the subway system and have used it extensively to roam across the city. The hotel has become our refuge when we have worn out the numbers on the credit cards...sipping cocktails at the bar to refresh and hit the town again...for dinner. This time we did a little research into places near the hotel that stay open passed 9 or 10 in the evening and discovered an Irish pub "biddy earlys' up on Murray st 3/4 blocks north of the hotel . Well within walking distance. The hotel is always quiet and the rooms are always clean. We love the simple attention we get from the staff, the guys at the doors are still the same from when we started staying here. Always friendly. We made reservations for Gordon Ramsay's for Friday night and then for Valentines we booked Del Frisco's for dinner. Always a treat at both restaurants. We always recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC and wondering where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal via priceline - wonderful hotel! Great location”
Reviews.Author: kerrylongphoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a fabulous deal on priceline for this hotel. Great views of Ground Zero and the river from our room. We had a spacious and clean King room with HUGE windows overlooking Ground Zero - kind of interesting to have a birdeye view of what is happening down there. Hotel conveniently located by several subway stops, so makes getting virtually anywhere very easy! Hotel staff was very nice. One downside is that the pool has odd hours - not open during the day at all during the week, which is not advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wmutunga
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on Valentine's day 2009 with our one year old daughter. Reservation: We had booked a room with a king bed,but when we checked in about 1:30AM, they told us they had no more king beds, only double beds. The desk agent told us that we should have called by 1pm to confirm our reservation to make sure we got a room with a king bed. In the end, we got a double bed room on the 34th floor. Staff: Very courteous, apologetic about the lack of the reserved room. Cleanliness: Very clean, very quiet which made for a good night with a one year old.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagolandgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Friday and Saturday night. Booked on Priceline 200.00 a night. Arrived around noon on Friday and were able to check in on arrival. Hotel staff could have been alittle more friendly. Stayed on the 52nd floor. View was directly over the WTC site. Room was a great size. King size bed, desk, and chair. Good size bathroom. Room was alittle warm despite turning off the heat. We were able to open the windows which did help alot. Hotel is a few blocks away from several subway stops. It was in walking distance to South Street Seaport ... about 8-10 blocks. Hotel is around the block from St Pauls Cathedral and Century 21. Did not find much nightlife or places to dine around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wowzers! What an incredible place to stay on the weekends!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDC
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stayed here over Halloween weekend in 2008 and had an absolute blast. (NYC is a hoot over Halloween, btw!) Staying in the financial district on the weekends is very cheap, and this hotel is just a block or two from countless subway stops. You're also walking distance to Battery Park if you're playing tourist and plan on visiting the Statue of Liberty. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous and staying on the 29th floor had incredible views of the river and the World Trade Center site (the hotel goes well above 50 or 60 floors). The pullout sofa and bed were incredibly comfortable, the housekeeping staff was very attentive, and the flat screen tvs in each room were a great perk. For less than $300 each night, you can't beat this in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Cohen_Jack
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is one of the best hotels in the Wall Street area. We stayed one night for a business trip for my wife, and had an elegant room with a Hudson River view on the 41st floor. Even though the hotel overlooks Ground Zero, you cannot see directly into the construction site unless you try to do so. Instead, you get a breathtaking view of the sun reflecting off the office towers of Jersey City at sunrise. The hotel has a very nice exercise room, with more than the usual quota of equipment, and a swimming pool (a rarity for Manhattan hotels, particularly downtown). I paid $200 on Priceline, which I believe to be considerably less than the fees quoted on most of the usual travel sites. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: amanda78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two seperate occassions. During our last stay ground zero (which is directly across the street) was under construction. The hotel provided guests with ear plugs but I did not find it necessary as I was out of the room for most of the day and upon my return the construction site was vacant. I had a room directly overlooking ground zero. It is an experience with many mixed emotions. To have the opportunity to have that view from above both in 2006 and again in 2008 is something that I will never forget. Staff are curtious and attentive. The hotel is in Manhattan which is a ways from all the sites and shopping (5th Ave) in New York. The hotel is located near the subways (which is a very cost effective and convenient mode of transportation once you get the hang of it) and also in close proximity to the financial district (stayed for pleasure in 2006 and both business and pleasure in 2008). I was able to walk to Wall Street. Great place to stay in New York for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, confortable, and convienient!”
Reviews.Author: timbuk2
Reviews.Content: Review: The Millennium Hilton is an all around great hotel for a traveler visiting New York, for any length of time. Before I continue on with this review, I’d just like to let my fellow travellers know that I’ve stayed in New York before, so check out my other reviews for a comparison, if you liked this one. My friend and I booked a five night stay at the Millennium Hilton. We arrived at the hotel on the 21st of December 2007 and planned to stay there through Christmas. The hotel was nicely decorated and the location of the hotel is an ideal spot for those wishing to stay in this city during this busy time. Midtown and Times Square were both chaotic at almost every hour of the day. Even after midnight, the streets in Midtown were filled neck to neck with people. I liked the fact that the downtown area of Manhattan wasn’t so hectic and crazy and if you can imagine how Times Square can be when it is busy, picture Midtown and Fifth Ave just flooded with pedestrians in every usable inch of sidewalk space. If you choose the Millennium Hilton, you can avoid this mad rush as you leave the hotel and when you come back to it at the end of the day. It is nice to be able to breathe and see a more relaxed side of New York and if this appeals to you than I’d definitely recommend this hotel or any other hotel in this area of the city. The room we were given was on the 54th floor of the hotel (there are 55 floors in total). Since our room was not ready at check-in, we were given a complimentary upgrade to this higher city view room. The views of Ground Zero and the surrounding area were impressive and you could even see the Statue of Liberty in the distance. Due to the location of this hotel, you might expect construction noise at all hours of the night, but luckily for us, it seemed that construction wasn’t in full swing during the Christmas holiday. I believe the hotel has lowered their rates to reflect the disadvantage it faces with the construction nearby, and we got a fantastic rate for our room for booking it in advance. The room itself was above average in size for this city. There was a large king sized bed, floor to ceiling windows, large closet, and a comfy chair. It was an all around comfortable space for us. The room also had things like an umbrella, safe, fridge (filled with Hilton items only, which are on a sensor, so they cannot be removed), snacks, pay-movies, and Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom amenities. These bathroom products were nice and were replaced once they were taken out of their basket, not once they were completely empty. I appreciated that the Hilton changed our bedding and towels when needed and that the room was cleaned to a high standard each day. I had no issues with our room or housekeeping and definitely feel that standards for quality are high at this Hilton hotel. The hotel has an indoor heated swimming pool, sauna, massage room, lobby bar, restaurant, fitness centre, and more. It is conveniently located next to several subway stations, which is great for those who would like to save time and money, as traveling by taxi can get quite expensive. From Newark airport, I simply hopped on the air train (free) to catch a train to Penn Station in Jersey (7.75), and from here it was easy and cheap to hop on the Path train into New York (1.50). One of the reasons I enjoyed staying at this hotel so much was that I was able to travel so cheaply to and from the airport and the final Path train stop is located right at Ground Zero, which means the Millennium Hilton is literally at it’s doorstop. For this reason alone, I would definitely consider staying at the Millennium Hilton again. The restaurant in this hotel is good, but nothing special. I would recommend eating here if you want a decent meal, but don’t expect to be blown away. It ranks better than most of the hotel restaurants I’ve eaten at, but it is also much more expensive. Entrée’s here average $19-25, which is a little pricey but if you’re pressed for time, it will do the job, I just wouldn’t bank on eating here every day. They offer two breakfast buffet options: one is $17.95 and gives you access to juice, coffee, pastries, and cold breakfast items; however, for 21.95 you can also have hot breakfast food. We tried it once and thought it was quite good, and the selection of both hot and cold items was quite large. Some of the hot buffet breakfast items included: sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, hash, hash browns, French toast, waffles, and a few other items. In my opinion, it is worth trying once during your trip. Lastly, I'd like to note that this hotel has full sized bathrooms. I know that this is very important to some travellers, so I wanted to point it out. You'll have a large counter to store and place all of your toiletries, etc. It's also a very bright room. This is in stark contrast to most of the bathrooms located in the Grand Hyatt New York. Issues: We only had one problem during our stay at this hotel and it was regarding the disgusting service we received in the lobby bar. The main bartender there is extremely rude and should be fired. I won’t go into details here about the problem, but it was serious in nature and it happened on Christmas eve, of all nights. I will take a moment to thank the director of food and beverages at this Hilton property for resolving the issue for us. He was able to compensate us for the incident that happened and as a result, we definitely will be returning to this property in the future. I would, however, never, ever order a drink from the lobby bar. The director of food and beverages is committed to making sure every guest feels welcome at this hotel. Service at the hotel restaurant was also somewhat lackluster, and we often had to raise our hands or get out of our seats to signal the staff to refill our orange juice glasses. The food was above average, and no one was rude to us there, it's just that the service was lacking. Update: Well, I’m posting this review a year late, but better late than never. I’ve decided to return to New York for Christmas 09, with a small group of friends, and we’ve decided to stay once again at the Millennium Hilton for part of our future trip. We’ll stay at another property as well (mostly to cut-down on costs), but we couldn’t resist booking with the Millennium Hilton for the following reasons: convenient restaurant inside hotel (which is important for a stay over Christmas day!), indoor heated swimming pool, location, price of room, view from rooms, cleanliness, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Like a big, tall boutique hotel (on steroids.)”
Reviews.Author: talibragg
Reviews.Content: I cannot wait to stay in this hotel again. The quietest room I have stayed in in NY but not the highest (only the 50th floor.) Views over the East river and midtown. Unobtrusive service, a comfortable comfortable bed, a pool, fast lifts. The lack of complimentary internet was a bit 1990s but there is a complimentary airline check-in terminal in the lobby. I was in NY on a leisure trip and found this hotel clean, quiet and located perfectly for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: fastcars74
Reviews.Content: I acutally did not pay a thing to stay at the Millenium Hotel on Dec 30- Jan 1st because I won a contest on the computer. I thought I would write a review because this is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. We stayed on the 46th floor with breath taking views of the Hudson River, the Statue of Liberty, the NYC skyline and of coarse Ground Zero. The amenities were above par, the bed was the best I have ever slept on and we did not hear any construction noise at all. The staff were always helpful and friendly. This would have been a 5 star if it wasn't for the front desk calling to tell us 2x that we ate from the mini bar which we did not. They also tried to tell my family in 2 other rooms that they did also. I am not sure why that was but seemed a little fishy. Other then that it was the best place to stay especially in my case since it was free. I would not spend 400+ dollars on it but might shell out 200 for it. Also it is far enough away from tourist attractions to get some sleep but not too far to get to the attractions. In my opinion a wonderful New Years Eve stay.

Reviews.Title: “New Year @ The Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: banbridgebhoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the 'Millenium Hilton' Hotel with my Wife for 5 nights over the New Year period. We were on the 49th floor(room 4909) with stunning views over the Hudson River, Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island & 'Ground Zero'. Our room was spotlessly clean with all the amenities expected including tea/coffee maker, ironing board & mini bar(very expensive). The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!! with clean linen every day. I used the pool/sauna on the 5th floor on several occassions, the water was so warm.... a tranquil retreat after a day of shopping and sightseeing in NYC. We did not use the 'Church & Day' Restaurant on the 3rd floor although it did look quite nice but fairly expensive. We did have a drink in the 'Liguid Assets' lobby bar...... $12 for a glass of wine & $7.50 for a bottle of Budweiser!!!!! We were quite surprised by the amount of Bars/Restaurants in the vicinity of the Hotel. Try 'Mocca' a few hundred yards up Church St for something to eat...reasonably priced good food ,and 'Biddy Earlys' Irish Pub on Murray St(off Church St - 5 mins walk from hotel) for a cheap beer, $8 for a pitcher of 'Coors'. Also South St. Seaport ,only 5 mins walk from Hotel, is well worth a visit. Wall St, Battery Park & the Brooklyn Bridge also only a few mins walk away as well We used both the nearby subway($2) and taxis($10-$15) to get up to Midtown sights. Overall a great stay at a very comfortable Hotel, far enough away from the hustle/bustle of Midtown but still only minutes by subway or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty and weak on service”
Reviews.Author: JD #25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was disgustingly dirty. I'm not kidding when I say that I found my room filty: nail clippings in the bathroom, toothpaste mess on the counters, food spills on the furniture, dirty floors, etc. I asked for the manager and only had someone from housekeeping show up. My room was swapped but the new room was not impressive even though they were to have cleaned it carefully. I travel a lot and stay at high-end hotels. This is NOT a four-star hotel and I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Jackismet
Reviews.Content: Due to snow, we left for the city early arrived at about 7 a.m.. Check-in time is 3:00, but the staff let us check in early! Our view was of Ground Zero (not a nice view), but we could also see the Statue of Liberty. The staff told us that we may hear construction noise, as Ground Zero is still being worked on every day but Sunday. They provided earplugs, bub we didn't need or use them. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the location. There's a subway right on the corner, but it's the last stop on the F train, so you have to wait for an F to get down there. I got on another that looked like it had a stop close to the hotel, and it was a nightmare walking to the hotel because of all the construction, closed streets and sidewalks, etc. It rained and/or snowed the whole weekend, so we ended up getting lots of cab rides, which got expensive because the hotel is so far away from midtown, broadway, and all the other cool neighborhoods. Hotel room was super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: silverbacksloth77
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what peoples problems are with this hotel, but I class myself as a light sleeper, and my room was facing the WTC site, and I could not hear any works going on wheather I was having a sleep during the day or night. I was upgraded to a King Corner Suite on the 27 floor, and had great view to the north as well as the WTC. I don't find the site "grim" but am fascinated at the work going on. Overall we had another excellent stay, and if your looking for accommodation downtown, this hotel should be your first choice. Subway connections are great, did not use the restaurant, as we ate at the Stage Door Deli across the way for breakfast. Would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: EastCost3
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (12 years old) and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton a few days before New Year's Eve. The purpose of the trip was to catch some shows, shop and see the sights. We purposely chose to stay away from midtown and the Times Square areas. The Millenium was at a great location to get away from the crowds and experience Lower Manhatten, but still convenient to Broadway, Central Park and shopping. There were several subway stations very close to the hotel. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations for a NYC hotel. We had a junior suite on the 51st floor that was super clean, comfortable and fairly spacious. Our room had views of the rivers, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and into the Trade Center's work site. My son really enjoyed the bird's eye view and watching the construction on the WTC site. The construction activities did not bother us. The hotel's front desk, bell and security staff were very friendly, helpful and courteous. The front desk was able to accommodate our requests for early check in and late check out. Although parking was expensive ($65 a day/SUV), it was on site and the parking attendants were very efficient during a very busy time. It you are looking for grand public spaces, a lot of restaurants and an ostentatious atmosphere, this is not your hotel. But, if you are looking for an upscale hotel in a great location with modern, very comfortable and clean rooms with great staff, then you may want to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average...given 'priceline' room”
Reviews.Author: Maryalamb
Reviews.Content: stayed there during an expensive time, between christmas and new years...got an ok deal thru priceline...would have preferred times square or midtown west, but felt this area was fine. I arrived at 9pm from a long day of flying...sarah at the front desk checked us in, friendly enough, but given a dreaded 'priceline' room...i asked for 2 double beds and something quiet away from the elevator...was given a king right across from the elevator...had a bellman with us, I wouldn't even go into the room..didn't want to hear "ding" all night....he was very helpful and got us a room further down the hall, but a lower level..it was very noisy due to the WTC construction....went downstairs to complain and was offered to get a new room tomorrow or they could send up a sound machine of some type...decided to suck it up and spend one night in that room..the next morning went downstairs to get a new room and got a better one...27th floor corner room with 2 double beds...was very satisfied with this room...internet was fast, beds were comfy and tv was huge...Didn't eat at the restaurants..easy access to subway...be sure and take the "e" and not "a "or "c" on the way home or you'll end up several streets away trying to find your way back home...my only complaint is the comforters smelled dirty and they never changed the pillowcases while i was there and one was dirty with food and not from us....

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay in NYC (on points)”
Reviews.Author: Aksel
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hilton hotel is very good, if you are looking to spend time in the lower part of Manhattan. Its just opposite to the World Trade Center work area, and yes, it does sound even up to the 50th floor, but if you are bothered or not, I cannot answer. Its just around the corner from Wall street, and easy access to the metro. Walking distance to SoHo and Chinatown/Little Italy. The fitness- and pool area is supposedly very good, but did not have the time. A quite good hotel with a marvelous view. Location 6/10: At the bottom of Manhattan with easy access to Wall Street and boats to either Statue of Liberty or New Jersey. Its between two metro stations. Walking distance to SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy and its shopping, restaurants, etc.. It’s a drive with taxi if you want to go too mid Manhattan or Times Squre. Lobby/Check-in 6/10: Small and average lobby, nothing special. The man check us in was not service minded, but just did his job, nothing more. Elevators were super fast, which was fun. Room 7/10: We asked for, and was upgraded, to a corner room with Brooklyn view. So we had a marvelous view from the 50th floor (5009), with the Statue of Liberty and the WTC work area from one window and Brooklyn and Brooklyn Bridge towards the other. It was quite breathtaking to be in bed and see this view. The room was not big, but enough. It fitted a large king size bed, a chair with ottoman and a desk. The closet was small and just a few drawers. The negative part was that the big flat screen TV was placed on the wall to the right of the bed, so it was difficult to see. The bathroom was big and very good, with a large wasbasin and area. The negative was the shower head that when I tried to move it up or down, it almost came out of the tiles. Restaurants 6/10: I did not dine at either of the restaurants in the hotel. So I cannot comment on it, but we had breakfast, which was a quite nice buffé, whith all the necessary breakfast things, but also very American. The plus was the view of the WTC work area. Other: Fitness center/pool area seemd quite good. We just went there to see if we were going to use it, so we can only comment on that, but it seemed good. No jacuzzi, but a good size pool and a shared steem sauna. The gym had a few machines for work out and some free weights, basically you have what is needed for a good, hotel, work out.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay but very austere. But the thing I would want others to know is that the rooms overlook the former World Trade Center so if looking out at the site of a massacre of 3,000 people is a downer for you, maybe try another hotel. Restaurant is grossly overpriced and inefficient if polite service. Small rooms but not too bad for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: jkelly86
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, with large rooms (by NYC standards) and excellent views. The location is excellent (subway stop right outside the hotel entrance) and next to Ground Zero as others have noted. The construction noise was not an issue- I did notice that the cranes were working early Sunday morning when I looked out of our window, but I could not hear them. We were on the 17th floor. Also, we found it to be very new and clean, and could not hear noise from other rooms or the hallway. We were also pleased with our rate through Hotwire. Overall, it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 star....”
Reviews.Author: Tyjen
Reviews.Content: There are some positives about this hotel... The location is great (out of the way but well connected to the subway/mass transit), the rooms are a good size, and the view is incredible. However, we experienced a number of problems which made the stay almost unsatisfactory. First of all, we came in and wanted to check out the refrigerator... but it wouldn't open for some reason. Then we noticed there was a cup missing and hair and a stain on the bed. We immediately called Guest Services and they advised they would send an engineer and house keeping up immediately to rectify the issues. We then went out of the room for a few hours to go explore. When we came back the bed was in exactly the same condition as we left it and the refrigerator still would not open. We called back down and they replied, "Oh, house keeping said they already changed the sheets." This was, however, was a complete lie because we had moved pillows and the sheets around and they were untouched. After explaining this to the front desk manager she replied, "Oh, OK. Do you still want the sheets made up then?" Flabbergasted, I replied, "Yes! That's why I called the first time 3 hours ago!!" I also made sure to tell them to come after 6:30PM b/c we were in a rush to get to a dinner reservation (it was 6:00PM when I called).
