Five minutes later, however, both housekeeping and "engineering" came up and I had to explain again to please come back at 6:30. Fortunately, this time when we returned from dinner, all problems were solved... or so we thought. The next morning when we took a shower, there were long and nasty hairs all in the tub and on the tile wall of the shower. We hadn't noticed it the day before because we hadn't used the shower. This clearly showed us that they either did not clean at all or did a totally unsatisfactory job of cleaning. Overall, it's a decent hotel - fortunately, we paid a lesser rate through Priceline. However, I'm a gold member and have come to expect a certain level of service which, had I paid full rate, I would be completely dissatisfied by this stay. Management was, in general, indifferent and lackadaisical Only stay here if you get the cheapest rate possible. .

Reviews.Title: “Efficient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeKAP
Reviews.Content: Great location for business downtown. The rooms are quite large for NY and the bathroom is modern. The best part was that we had a spare afternoon before the flight and the concierge was able to suggest the perfect tour so that I finally managed to see some of NY. Gym is brand new and quite well equiped for a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Top Location - go back when construction finished”
Reviews.Author: rjhawkes
Reviews.Content: Top venue & away from Times Square and midtown (if thats what you prefer), everything went well and we were lucky to stay from Friday night through Monday night so Sat, Sun morning quiet and even Mon as a bank holiday (columbus day). only issue was tues morning as construction started early on the Ground Zero site. Couldnt fault it otherwise

Reviews.Title: “Large room - Great stay”
Reviews.Author: anglophone
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 3 nights at the Milleminum and had a wonderful stay. We had a large bathroom, king bed, full size desk with chair, large plasma TV, a mini fridge, lots of storage space, a wing chair and ottoman and still had room to move around. Our room overlooked the World Trade Center construction site, we were told that it may be noisy. There was some noise but not bothersome in the least. We took the subway everywhere, its so much faster. We purchased a daily metro pass(MTA) this made getting around easier. We walked through Tribeca, SoHo and Greenwich Village and dined in the West Village. I would highly reccomend this area. Times Square is extremely busy. We also had dinner in the port area, at the end of Fulton Street, also worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annchgo
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very classy. I had a suite on the 40th floor (bedroom and sitting room connected) which was the largest hotel room I have ever been in in NYC. Staff was friendly. No complaints. (Please note that there is construction going on immediately next door where the Twin Towers stood. The construction seemed to end around 9pm or so and start up again between 6am and 7am. So, if you are a light sleeper or particularly bothered by construction, I would avoid this hotel for a while.)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel - attractive lobby, decent sized and well appointed rooms. You get a birds eye view of Ground Zero and with it 24 hour noise (even thirty odd floors up). The corridors were rather drab. My real objection to this hotel was just that it seemed to lack any wow factor - but I guess that's to be expected in a large, non boutique, chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: moe-moz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a spur-of-the-moment honeymoon in NYC. We booked our room by naming our own price through priceline, and - to our great fortune - ended up at the Millenium Hilton for 6 nights at a very reasonable rate. Our request for a quiet room was accommodated, and I can honestly say that I don't remember sleeping as well for so many nights in a row. The bed was comfortable, the sheets were soft, the room was immaculate, and our view of the bridges and Brooklyn was fabulous. The staff was extremely helpful - my husband received great advice on romantic things to do in the city from the concierge and upon hearing that we had just gotten married the desk staff sent up complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries and sparkling wine. We weren't staying on the side that faced the WTC construction, but during the daytime the noise was not that bad on the street level. Also, the hotel is perfectly situated next to several subway stops and Century 21. Our stay couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: brandonmstraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on the 49th floor in a corner room (4901). View was incredible, out one window, we could see the SoL and out the other, the Brooklyn Bridge. Was a bit pricey for my budget, but this was a special trip for us and the Mill Hilton made it even better. Added bonus, the E train is less than 300 ft from the front door. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Location not so much”
Reviews.Author: dan211
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel, nicely decorated stylish rooms. Quite spacious for New York. The location is not ideal for anyone who plans to spend a lot of time midtown or uptown. Taxi's to Times Square anywhere from $11 - 15 each time and although subway is close by, during our stay the E line wasn't operating. Great location for Wall Street and walking distance to South Street Seaport. Ongoing construction at World Trade Centre site however noise was not a problem. Overall a good stay however my next visit we will stay further uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, great rooms, fine location”
Reviews.Author: BritainDC
Reviews.Content: With reasonable rates, excellent spacious rooms with great views of the city and a decent location close to a busy subway line this hotel quickly became my preferred place to stay in Manhattan. It may not have the immediate proximity to major New York landmarks as a hotel near Times Square, but the Millennium Hilton is less than a block to the E line. I've always found it easy to get around town using the hotel as the starting location. The nightlife round the hotel is non-existent, so you should budget for a $20 cab ride back at night -- or just take a subway back for $2. The rooms are very large and the furnishings, as with any Hilton, are excellent. Huge, comfy king beds that you can disappear into, a few chairs and tables arranged around the room, and well-sized bathrooms that are always clean. One of the biggest draws for me is the swimming pool at the hotel, which is a real treat. It's never too crowded and it's a pleasant way to unwind. There's also a sauna -- though the heat is only slightly above room temperature, so I guess it's more of a lukewarm paneled room -- fitness center and a decent business center that I've used a few times. The staff are friendly and the concierges I've dealt with all have encyclopedic knowledge of the city. They add to what is always a pleasant experience staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, indifferent service, construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Cranky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a wedding in NYC. The hotel is nice, and the bedding and toiletries were decent. The shower pressure was not the greatest. The big issue I wanted to mention is that the hotel is across the street from Ground Zero, and construction is practically 24-7 there now. There was a pair of earplugs in the room and a note from the manager about it. I was there on a Saturday night and construction seemed to start around 7am Sunday. It didn't bother me because I was already up, but this could be a big issue for some.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in New York at a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Mike4328
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Within walking distance are 5th Avenue, Empire States building, Grand Central station, Time square. The view from my room was brilliant watching the sunrise across Brooklyn. The gym is good and the horizon pool on the 28th floor has to be seen, especially at night. Just check out the tennis court on the 32nd floor. My room was clean, well furnished and quite spacious for New York

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Delight”
Reviews.Author: mastutio
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown NYC. We were on the 16th floor directly overlooking the WTC site and had virtually no building noise. The room was spacious, clean and luxurious - everything you would expect from a Hilton really. The bar was good but we didn't eat in the restaurant. The pool was great and the gym looked good. In a very convenient location - only a few minutes walk to Battery Park and the ferry to Liberty Island. The subway station is just outside the front entrance to the hotel. Would certainly recommend as a good base for New York visit.

Reviews.Title: “Its a gem”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter019Nyc
Reviews.Content: Hilton Millenium is as comfortable and tranquil as it is majestic from outside. The people at the reception are very helpful. We checked in early and the reception gave us a room on one of the top floors. The room was spacious with a very confy bed, flat screen tv, clean bathroom with Crabtree and Evelyn bath and body products. The tall wide windows provided breathtaking views of downtown Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge. The housekeeping is quick to respond and meticulous. We never felt any disturbances from the Ground zero construction going on next to the hotel. There are variety of hotels nearby for lunch and dinner. Its very easy to reach any other place from here since the subway is just across the road. We enjoyed every bit of our stay here, specially sipping wine while seated on the window pelmet and watching the Brooklyn bridge sparkling all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Slick Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew23
Reviews.Content: Glass walled building across from Ground Zero, it stands majestically in downtown Manhattan, the Hilton Millennium offers luxury accommodation for both leisure and business travelers alike in a very convenient location - just steps away from the subway station that will take you to anywhere you need to get to in minutes. The lobby is small but chic, staff members were plentiful and most efficient. The rooms were very new and while they may lack in size, the decor and amenities surely made up for it. We had 2 rooms on the higher floors so we were able to enjoy not one, but two breathtaking views of NYC. Actually, one was a corner room, so we had really had three views as the corner room had two windows!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View!!”
Reviews.Author: BlueCupcake
Reviews.Content: The view was absolutely amazing from the 49th floor corner King Suite. The computers were down when we checked in which seems to be a problem quite a bit...could be all the construction next door at the World Trade Center though. The rooms were meticulously clean and the housekeepers know their jobs and are very efficient. You never see them, but your room is always clean and ready. The location is great - lots of nice, casual restaurants around. Got a great manicure/pedicure around the corner and sushi. Walked up to Canal Street for shopping. The lobby is horrible with all the tourists coming in and using the bathroom. It could not possibly be any smaller and it is quite astonishing how poorly laid out it is. The front desk is helpful though and just ignore the bellman and take your own bags. It isn't worth it to hail one down when the elevators are so close and quick. The beds are really soft, but the pillows are too soft so had to ask for some foam ones. They came up pronto! The only problem was our family coming to visit - they were staying at another hotel and they would ring our room often and the phone never rang. Important as they were going to leave on a flight back to the UK that night so they were in the lobby for an hour waiting for us. We didn't even know they were early. Overall, worth every penny. Use the AAA rate!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel located in downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after getting married. We wanted to get away from family and friends so we went to Priceline.com and ended up with this place. My wife was able to get a good deal from Priceline for one night. The hotel is right across the street from the site of the WTC (World Trade Center). Check in was fast and easy. We were on the ninth floor. All rooms face the WTC construction site. There were ear plugs on the desk and a note apologizing for any noise from the construction across the street. The receptionist also apologized and told us if it became unbearable to contact the front desk. We never heard any construction, but we did stay on a Saturday night, so construction was probably light. It might be worse during the weekday. The room was very nice. Flat screen TV, nice modern decor. Very comfy queen size bed, a desk with wired internet and an armchair. The bathroom was also pretty spacious. Walk in shower, with two shower heads. After getting settled in we went down to the bar/restaurant located on the 3rd floor for a drink. The one bad thing is that since this hotel is in the financial district, there really isn't much to do around after the sun goes down. There are a few fast food places near by. Most of the restaurants are found near South Street Seaport, which is a little of a trek. The hotel is easily accessible via mass transportation. There are a handful of subway stations less than 5 blocks away. The PATH train is also across the street. Overall a great hotel. I would definitely stay here again or recommend out of town friends to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: karbuyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Millenium Hilton great location, close to subway . Like staying in lower Manhattan easy to get around quiet. Parked the car at the hotel very easy , the staff was excellent in handling arrival. Arrived early room was ready and the hotel staff right there to take care of you......hats off to Bobby the bellman,,,,an asset to the hotel. Friendly , smiling and ready to help you. Room was spacious and clean and modern very happy with it, great view of Hudson and ground zero,,,,may we never forget our brothers and sisters on that horrible day. Hilton has earned my business,, they took care of me and my quests in a professional and friendly manner. Recommend you won't be disaappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located in the Downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Happyhobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night whilst on a business trip to New York. The hotel is located next to Ground Zero. My room was on the 30th Floor and I had views over the site - it was the first time I had been in NY since 9/11- it was a "reflective" experience to say the least. There's lots of construction happening at Ground Zero and there were notices in the room apologising to visitors for any noise and disruption. I can honestly say I didn't hear much noise. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel had a vibrant and busy atmosphere. The room was well equipped, clean, and spacious. That combined with the location makes it perfect for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elithecat
Reviews.Content: I go to one of the online sites where you bid on hotel rooms when I travel to NYC. I'm always *so* happy when my bids land me at the Millenium Hilton. I really can't believe it --I used to live in NY so feel odd staying in hotels there, and I consider myself more of a boutique hotel person than someone who frequents a big chain. But I'll say in all honesty the the bright, professional, competent and considerate Millenium staff treat you like it's a boutique hotel. Each time I've come in on the red eye from the west coast, the staff has suggested that I go freshen up in the spa and then store my luggage until my room is ready. That a.m. shower alone sets this place apart from others which (simply, reasonably) expect you to wait until check-in time. But I have also had splendid luck with my rooms at the Millenium --I'm always on a high floor, and the views over the Hudson or the Brooklyn Bridge are magic. The hotel is also very close to nearly every subway line you would want to travel on, and it's walking distance to great restaurants and sweet parks. The WTC construction is ongoing, but noise has not been a problem when I've stayed at the hotel. Just in case, each room I've been in has carried a letter from the general manager explaining the construction plan. The letter comes with a set of earplugs (so far, I've used them on the plane and in other hotels!)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanishTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights from June 28th to June 30th 2008. We booked a room on Hilton's website and chose not to pay the extra 30$ per night to have a hotel room on the 30th floor and up, yet when we checked in, we were given a room on the 54th floor facing Ground Xero. When we leaned out a bit, we could see the Statue of Liberty from our room. It was excellent! We were not bothered by construction noise, even though they worked around the clock the two days we were there. The Subway was steps away from the entrance of the hotel, so it was very easy to get to all the tourist places on Manhattan. One block from the hotel there was a really nice restaurant that had the most delicious bagels. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, if we visit New York another time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rethw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for 4 Days. I emailed the Hotel before departing and they kindly upgraded us to a Suite on the top floor and also Champagne and Strawberries. Great Location for Brooklyn walks and Century 21. Didn't use many of the Hotel facilities as every possible taste is catered for in NYC. Great Hotel we would deffo stay here again for the attractions of Lower Manhattan. $75 for taxi from Hotel to Newark.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Millenium Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: SpringTexasGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for our latest stay in NYC. I was hoping I wouldn't have problems with the WTC construction noise based on some of the comments here - I didn't know what to expect. Noise or no noise? Bothersome or not? We got a room on the 24th floor and didn't hear any bothersome noise. Yes, you could hear a "ping" every once in a while but during my stay through Monday I was never awaken or bothered by any of the noise. There was no construction Saturday or Sunday nights past midnight while I was there. The room itself was exactly what I expected based on pics from other users. The view was the same as seen in other pics as well. Our room was located very close to the elevators and if anything - that would have been the one thing I should have changed. I don't enjoy hearing that noise all night - loud people getting off of the elevator before quieting down because they realize they're not outside anymore. The room was very clean and tidy. The tv was a little quirky in my room. We couldn't just press Power on the remote control and have it turn on. We had to press Power then go to the tv and press the source button. I saw a post on here that complained about there not being any HD channels and thought that was just picky - BUT - the output on the tv was worse than what I'm used to from my regular non-HD digital cable. It was pretty fuzzy on most channels but we spent most of our time away from our room so we didn't really care! You don't go to NYC to watch TV!! Another problem with our room was the toilet - it didn't just FLUSH. We had to hold the handle down for the water to properly go down. The bathroom otherwise was clean...they have Crabtree and Evelyn products for your use but I didn't like the smell of them - too strong for me. I liked the showerhead but didn't feel good about the bathroom faucet because it didn't have any type of aeration-SO much water was being used every time it was turned on. The down pillows and comforter were 100% comfortable-loved them! Overall I enjoyed my time here from the prompt check in to claiming my bags from storage at check out. I enjoyed the location because it was near everything downtown that I didn't get to see the last time I was in NYC. The subway is really close by and a half block walk away. I have pics to share but can't find my transfer cable right now so I'll put them up later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is a great place to stay if you are having business to do in the Financial District of Manhattan. I like the hotel atmosphere and the location. The service is very friendly and the rooms are above average, both in style and size, compared to other hotels in New York. Ask for a room above the 40th floor if possible and if possible not facing the large construction site on Ground 0. They work there basically 24h/7d and it can get pretty loud.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AdsGoFaster
Reviews.Content: We booked two Grand Parlor Suites, I was given a room on the 54th floor and my family were in the 52nd, room 5210. Even though we paid the same price for both rooms, 5210 was much bigger than mine (5209). Both rooms had amazing views, were very clean and had lots of extras. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the concierge was brilliant and the staff in the gift shop couldn't do more to help. It is in a great location, right next to Ground Zero in the downtown district. The subway is literally less than a 1 minute walk from the hotel which gets you to uptown in less than 5 mins. My only gripe is that my massive widescreen TV didn't work in the lounge area, but there was another huge TV in the bedroom so I didn't bother contacting reception. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone, if you are afraid of heights they do rooms on lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise not bad”
Reviews.Author: MoToBride
Reviews.Content: Paid $180 per night plus taxes on Priceline. Hotel was as expected from other reviews. Pretty much all the rooms face Ground Zero and the construction which was kinda interesting to watch. Room was VERY spacious for any hotel standard forget NYC standards. My #906 was the lowest floor with rooms on it (I asked for this as I heard the wait for elevators was long on the upper floors and I wanted to be lower in case of an emergency). The construction did not bother me, the sound was little more than regular city noise you get anywhere. I did wake up once or twice around 6am cause I think they were moving some big piece of metal around or something, but fell right back asleep. I slept in til around 1030 one day & didnt use the earplugs or need to ask for the noise-reduction machine offered on checkin. There was some noise that came through from the corridor if there were people talking but that was rare as my impression was the hotel was far from full. Had breakfast in the restaurant once, $$ but quite yummy (blueberry pancakes). They were pretty easy about doing substitutions if you wanted. There was also a buffet for $23.95 but it was quite small and no pancakes! Bathroom was great, shampoos etc. were replaced daily. My only annoyance was somehow my phone would only ring in the bathroom, the cordless in the bedroom was connected to some other line which I could use to call out but no incoming calls. Free 800 calls were appreciated. You have to pay for internet use, not sure how much as I had my blackberry. Employee service was excellent, fast checkin. I had some packages delivered and one of the security people worked very hard to locate them as they were initially missing. I also had a bit of a problem locking my door (my fault) and a security person was there within seconds. Someone also came right away to look at the phone issue, although they were not able to fix it and I didnt have time to bother calling again. Accessibility was excellent with the E train being right outside and virtually all other subway lines within blocks. I also walked to the Brooklyn Bridge. Century 21 is right next door too. Cab from Laguardia cost about $30-40 depending on the route & direction as this hotel is further downtown that the midtown hotels. I would recommend Woodbury Common Premium Outlets (you can drive there, about 1h, or take the bus from Port Authority $40 rtn which I did), much better deals than in Manhattan despite July 4 weekend sales. I did not use the pool or any other amenities so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: First of all, the top line of this review is that, while the hotel quotes its rates between $400 and $500, I was able to snag it for $175 on Priceline. And I'm sure people have gotten it for less before. Amazing deal at that price. At $500, I probably wouldn't have been as happy. I think the reviews about the World Trade Center construction are exaggerated. I had a room facing ground zero and was not disrupted at all. If I turned off the TV and the air conditioner, I was only barely able to hear construction, but not at all if anything in the room was on. The room had a 42" plasma TV which was nice, however there was no HD programming, which I find quite annoying. What's the purpose of having such a great TV if it has a crappy picture? The bath linens and bed were very comfortable. I would have liked a few more outlets, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great servie”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. It is alittle off the beaten track but has great rooms. Subways are accessible but you need to know where they are. We found the service to be great as well and based on our priceline deal it was affordable. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HILTON: NEVER EVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Kfox914
Reviews.Content: THE FOLLOWING IS MY LETTER TO HILTON DESCRIBING OUR ISSUESSS! Hopefully this reaches someone of importance, as my wife and I had the worst hotel experience. Today is our anniversary and we booked a room at the Millenium Hilton with the Romance Package. While booking, I asked online, the 800#, and this hotel directly, to confirm if Guest Certificates were accepted. All three assured they were honored. Trying to check-in at 2:15 pm, the reception desk employee took the Certificates and put a Smoking Room on hold. Since we purchased to the Romance Package, which provides early check-in amongst other amenities, we were disappointed the room was not ready 45 minutes prior to normal check-in. But this wasn’t the main issue. We dropped bags and couldn’t freshen up after our trip. When using the hotel bathroom, I waited a while, realizing the street vendors used them to bath in. But even this wasn’t the main issue. Trying to check-in later that day, the Assistant Front Office Manager, Jacqueline Concepcion, told us they wouldn’t accept the Guest Certificates. After a long unfruitful conversation, she left to talk with “The Director.” Returning she said they still wouldn’t honor them, adding a Smoking Room was not available, supposedly put on hold, ruining our carefully planned, reconfirmed “Romantic” Anniversary getaway. My wife and I are extremely disappointed with Millenium and Hilton in general. We are both avid business/personal travelers, taking two vacations a year and often traveling to family out of state. I am disappointed that unless Hilton makes retribution for our poor experience, lack of respect and understanding, and lying to us, we will not stay at nor recommend Hilton. It will be a experience that my wife and I will certainly tell our friends and blogs about, and will be a chain I’ll have my business and wife’s business decline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Vincent989
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Hilton for one night in June 2008. Mainly because the hotel we really wanted had no availability on that particular day. We have no complaints whatsoever about our stay at the Hilton, it was a great stay, nice rooms, extremely comfortable bed! We did pay USD 320 ex tax which is quite expensive so that will be the downside. For this amount breakfast was not even included. We were on the 28th floor with bird's eye view on Ground Zero (not that interesting by the way, one huge construction site - see photos). Outside office hours there is really not much going on in the Financial District but one cannot hold that against the hotel. Probably a good location for business travellers. Nextdoor Century 21 was nice to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice NY Option”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver1
Reviews.Content: Walking into a hotel room and seeing earplugs offered by the management, with an apology letter is not usually a good start, but this is New York and any room near the street has some noise issues. The 24-hour cacaphony is part of NYC. Asking for the highest room available is wise if you have problems with noise. The rooms all seem to overlook Ground Zero, which is undergoing massive construction, but the contruction is presently at street level. Thus, a birds eye view of Ground Zero and a good view of the East River. The rooms are brand spanking new (newly renovated). They are large for NYC. The beds are wonderful. There is Internet access (I guess for a fee, since I use WAN). I found staff helpful and efficient. Various subway routes are within very easy walking distance. The terminus of the E train is here, but others pass through. Because this is Wall Street area, there is not a lot going on at night. Best options seem to be to walk east along the south side of Ground Zero and across the pedestrian overpass. Along the river, there are various options. The better bet in the evening is to take the subway north to Union Square, Times Square, etc., where there are more options. In the morning, you will see the Wall Street workers streaming from the subway like lemmings, all headed the same way. The gym appeared decent, with various machines. I did not eat in the building. Overall, this hotel is ideal for a businessperson who will be doing business in the Wall Street area. Though it is out of the way for most tourism, the subway makes everything proximal in NYC. This area is a bit far from airports. You could take the A train from Kennedy and be very close by. From LaGuardia, you would ideally take the E train, but you have to get to the train stop by taxi ($15) or bus. From Newark, you would need to go to Penn Station, then a subway south.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: teepeesydney
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms for 6 nights. The noise from the construction site at Ground Zero is not the hotels fault, but while the website has warnings (as we discovered later and too late), the hotel booking line did not warn us. The worse thing about the hotel is the inconsistent housekeeping and the slow lifts. Nothing was as good as it should have been for a 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMurphy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and in a great part of town. We only stayed for one night (not really even 24 hours) but we had a wonderful stay. We certainly got what we paid for. Our view was magnificient if not a little sad. When we looked out of our window we saw a magnificient view of the Hudson but if we looked down we saw ground zero. God bless the victims of 9/11.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton”
Reviews.Author: lolola8604
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Hilton for two nights. Nothing but great things. First off the price was great. Using priceline I got a double, corner room with views of the city and the Hudson for under $300 a night. Next the rooms are modern, updated and sharp. The bathroom is very well updated. The beds are heavenly and the room sizes are pretty big fro New York standards. Location is great. Literally located above a subway line. Is located directly across the World Trade Center so there is some construction at stret level. However this wasn't really a problem. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy elevators”
Reviews.Author: willw
Reviews.Content: i was given a room on the 47th floor looking out over the East River and Brooklyn Bridge. on the first night there was a fantastic firework display to celebrate 125 years of the brooklyn bridge and i got an awesome view from my room. the room was large, great flat screen tv, and kept perfectly clean by the twice daily housekeeping. an ice bucket, bottled water and chocolates was provided daily although i didnt touch the mini-bar because there were warnings everywhere saying it would start to charge you automatically for things if you moved them, whether or not you actually consumed anything. beware! bell staff and front desk staff were very pleasant and efficient. my only problem was my room backed on to one of the elevators (they are high-power and high-speed for reaching the upper floors quickly) and the elevator machinery was quite noisy. but luckily i'm a sound sleeper. the location of the hotel was great, easy to find (at the bottom of the E line of the subway) and easy to get around to other places, battery park for the statue of liberty and ellis island is just a few blocks away, and a short walk in the subway interchange takes you to chambers street for the direct subway (A line) to the AirTrain and kennedy airport. i would recommend this hotel to anyone except if you are on a tight budget, but it was still better value than some other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: traveldc2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and it is still great - corner room on 47th floor with views of Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge and City Hall. Overlooked construction on ground zero but no discernable construction noise for us. Front desk did a great job at check in, found a jr suite and city view room for us to upgrade to! Rate included room service breakfast great stay. Too short

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: skhMontreal_Quebec
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just came back from a 4 night stay at the Hilton and thought it was a beautiful hotel. We had a very spacious room with 2 double beds on the 37th floor facing the city, not the construction. No problems with construction noise at all. The only down side to this area is the amount of construction going on, but the hotel is located right across the street from the subway (or right down the street depending upon your entrance or exit). The dept store Century 21 is located next door, we walked to Battery Park to take a view of the Statue of Liberty and passed other shops on the way. You would think for the price charged, a free breakfast would be included, but I gather that's not the norm in expensive New York. The hotel booked the hop on/hop off bus tour for us, where the pickup was a block away from the hotel. Soho/China Town/Greenwich/Times Square was a mere 10-15 min subway ride or if you kept walking up Broadway, you would eventually walk right into these districts. Very close to Tribeca restaurants. It takes about 2 days to orient yourself on how the subway runs and where the streets are located, but all in all, we were very pleased with this hotel where we were able to use accumulated points (otherwise, no way could we have afforded this).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: caseyfla
Reviews.Content: Super-fast check in, large room, and the best view I've ever gotten. Ask for a room above the 30th floor, you won't be disappointed. I keep hearing complaints about construction, but I never heard a thing. It might have been because I was so high up, but I wouldn't be too concerned. Housekeeping comes by twice a day, and it's close to everything. About 200 steps away is the Chambers St. station, which takes you everywhere. Very safe, very secure. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but be aware of the construction....”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson for business and followed up with the Millenium for pleasure as I stayed the weekend. The Millenium is pretty far. It's in "Soho" (although, it was very south of Houston Street.). in fact, it's literally beside the World Trade Centre. I could see the construction taking place from my hotel room - interesting but yet sad... There is a lot of construction going on in the area. Contruction at the WTC seemed to be 24/7 and you could hear it (and I believe there was a notice in my room indicating that - no wonder, I got such a good deal on a 4 star hotel in "Soho"). The room was a very good size (especially, compared to the Hudson). Modern decor (large flat screen) and a good view (WTC, water, etc.). Hotel lobby was decent as was the hotel bar. There is a Century 21 store across the street if you're into cheap shopping with brand names. Not sure if I would stay that far south next time, especially given the construction noise but it was reasonably priced for a 4 star in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreBankermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first weekend in May for a family wedding that was taking place close by. The gentleman at the front desk was very courteous. In fact, everyone was very nice and made a point to say hello, can I help you? We ate at the Church & Dey restaurant for lunch waiting for the rest of the family to arrive. Lunch was good, but quite expensive, but we were prepared because THIS is New York City! We stayed on the 19th floor and our room was great, roomy and beds were quite comfortable. We had an issue with the room being a bit chilly, but after placing a call to guest services, within a half hour it was corrected and I could thaw! You can see and hear the construction below at the WTC site however, the noise was not a bother at all. Century 21 is next door and OMG it is a shoppers paradise!!! Lots of bargains!! Took the double decker bus for the city tour and it was really great to be able to see everything we normally wouldn't be able to since we usually just take day trips to the city to catch a show. We really enjoyed our stay here and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: run2thesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the May Day Bank Holiday. Our room on the 37th floor had a great view out towards the Hudson River with Ground Zero just below. The sun sets with the building in front of you is amazing. We were not disturbed by the building work, although you could sometimes hear it, but it wasn't noisy. Rooms were good, breakfasts as you can imagine were good too. Staff were really nice. The only down side was the lack of local night life, although Pier 17 isn't too far, it wasn't bustling. A good hotel, but I'd probably stay further uptown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: czsherman
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast, staff polite and the rooms clean. The hotel is very modern and was in an ideal location close to many attractions. Although there was construction going on nearby, the stay was not effected and I had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, could be worse”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGatorFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton this past weekend for the first time. We don't spend much time downtown, but picked the hotel because it was close to an event we were attending. Overall, our stay was pleasant, although it could have been better in some areas. The construction going on at the WTC site makes getting to the hotel a little bit of a challenge, but the signs they've put up are fairly clear. We dropped off the car in the garage, where the garage attendant stood by watching as we unpacked our bags ourselves, without offering to help. Granted, the garage isn't owned or run by the hotel, but for a hotel of this caliper, it was surprising that they didn't have bell staff there to assist visitors. Check in was a snap, and a quick one at that. The woman who helped us was very pleasant, as was the one who answered questions we had later in the afternoon. Our room, on the 41st floor overlooking the WTC site, was very nice. Although we'd been warned about possible construction noise, from that height we didn't have any at all. The room was extremely quiet during our whole stay. My only complaint about the room was that the A/C didn't work well at all. It wasn't hot out by any means, but even with the thermostat set at 65 (the lowest it would go) we were all way too warm all night long. Had we stayed longer we would have asked to have our room changed. The pool was lovely, and the public areas of the hotel were very well maintained. Aside from the A/C issues in our room, the only other area where the hotel was disappointing was in the area of the staff. Granted, we usually stay at the Sofitel in midtown, where the staff are incredibly professional and courteous. But when you're spending almost $400 for a hotel room, you expect exemplary service, and the Millenium Hilton was definitely a let-down in that area. With the exception of the front desk staff, the employees we ran into were OK at best. Not outright rude, but definitely lacking the polish and professionalism I'd expect at a hotel like this. So as I said, overall our experience here was OK. I don't know that I'd stay here again, though, mostly because for what the room cost, I don't think the service was quite up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good the second time”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the weekend of April 18-20. This was my second visit. My previous stay was in March 2008 when I paid $169, and I was a bit shocked that the rate was double this time -- but I guess this is not out-of-line for other similar hotels in Manhattan. Last time the construction noise wasn't a problem ( I was on a high floor), but this time they put me on a lower floor (26) and I could hear the droning all night long. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. For example, I was looking for a newspaper at 7 AM Saturday morning: the gift shop hadn't opened yet, so the bellman went on a crusade and brought me back a paper. One small criticism of the restaurant: I am very picky when it comes to my morning coffee and the coffee there isn't very good -- it tastes like it is made in one of those huge steel containers you see in cafeterias. As others have noted, there should be free wireless internet in the rooms given the high room charge. I like the location of the hotel, as the financial district is quiet on the weekends and I enjoyed going for a jog at nearby Battery Park. All in all, I would recommend the Millenium.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Carr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in February for a work trip. The hotel is located right by Ground Zero and although fairly nice, the biggest problem is the construction noise! They work until 11pm and start again 5 am in the morning. It's impossible to sleep through! Rooms are small but there's nothing wrong with them. The bed was comfy and you have all necessities in the room; desk, chair, large TV etc. You know what you get when you book with Hilton. I had breakfast at the restaurant one morning, it was OK but fairly basic. I had room service a few times and never really liked my meal. Eat out! The lobby bar is quite lively but drinks are fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: KEECHAS
Reviews.Content: My biggest concern about this hotel was the noise complaints. I'd read more than a few reviews about the construction noise due to the WTC location. IT WAS NEVER AN ISSUE!!! One review stated that it was non-stop noise. That was not the case. There was never a disturbance. The location was great. There were several subway locations around the hotel. We bought day passes and used the subway to go everywhere! There were an abundance of stores and eateries. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with Millenium”
Reviews.Author: FlipFlopGalNYC
Reviews.Content: I will continue the review in a later day.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend base”
Reviews.Author: badwaiter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline but it was a very good find. We were facing the construction site at the WTC but the noise was never noticeable. From the 51st floor we could see Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. The room itself was quite comfortable and had a great bed. Anytime we used the guest services, we were met with a quick and friendly response. The hotel was very convenient to the East Village and Lower East Side thanks to the subway and even walking if you like to pound the pavement. I wouldn't pay rack rate here but with priceline or another sale site it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! And what a view!”
Reviews.Author: mikehwrites
Reviews.Content: STAY HERE! But choose the river view, not the twin towers view.

Reviews.Title: “MMmmmm Millenium”
Reviews.Author: DCSteveTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you've got Hilton Honors points to burn or can get a good deal, this is a great option for staying in the WTC/Financial District. They treat HH customers well here, especially the front desk staff. Not sure if all of the rooms are "suite" like but the one I've had twice had a separate small living room/desk area separated from the sleeping room by the bathroom in the middle. So fairly roomy by Manhattan standards. Pretty basic hotel with an OK restaurant and small bar. Great view of the WTC site (and how little has been done) as well as NJ and the river. It's "new" (since renovation after 9-11) and very close (one block) to several subway lines. It's pretty easy (and cheap) to take a train uptown to see the typical NYC stuff. Not a lot of restaurants or night life around the hotel, but be sure to check out the "Century 21" discount department store nextdoor. Also walkable is the Brooklyn Bridge and the Southstreet Seaport TKTS half price theater tickets booth. Walk around, there's lots of less touristy (not Times Square) stuff to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is NOT a charm”
Reviews.Author: trubador
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the hotel and I like it less and less each time. I'll start with the good and get to the bad: good: - close to subway stops (the E which takes you too and from JFK is right outside and you can catch other blue, green and red lines train in very close proximity) - large tv in rooms (I think it is a must for hotels to have a flat screen tv, especially for over $300 a night) - very clean (housekeeping was awesome and didn't bug us once) now the bad: - I had booked two rooms on check-in. One for me and my girlfriend and the second for my two buddies. When we checked in we requested a king for myself and girlfriend and two beds for my buddies. they said I had called and requested a single bed for both rooms. This never happened. My problem is they lied about me calling instead of telling me they ran out of single beds - they were doing construction inside the hotel and it was a mess. Plus the noise was absolutely horrible from 9 to 6. Unbearable to be in the room, couldn't hear the tv loud. And that was from the floor below us. - out of our 3 visits we have never gotten a king bed even though we request every time and they only show king as on option on the website. - the air conditioner did not work well and stayed around 70 degrees which was hard for me to sleep in. - no GOOD food around the hotel I really want to like this hotel more, but there are much better options to staying in New York. I would probably pick this hotel as a last resort, but I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice junior suite”
Reviews.Author: Kelobie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in a junior suite, 32nd floor, quite impressed. I will be brief on this one but will post a few photos for you to set expectation. A few additional points that cannot be explained by the photos: (1) I am a light sleeper but the construction noise was very bearable (I guess if you stay anywhere above 25th floor, you will be safe) (2) Compared to the 2 places that I stayed before (Waldorf Astoria & Intercontinental the Barclays) I would prefer the Millennium Hilton mainly because it's relatively new & modern and its closer to interesting chilled out places like Soho, TriBeCa, West Village (this is personal preference though, you are in Manhattan so pretty easy & quick to get around by the underground or taxi anyway) (3) The Lavazza coffee maker can make nice coffees (4) The standard room rate for those weekdays were almost USD400 a night + tax. I used HHonors points and got this upgrade with my status but would be happy to pay that rather than the rates at other Hiltons in Manhanttan given the value you get for not being in midtown or time square area

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are the only nice thing about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: krae10
Reviews.Content: Staff is unfriendly, I was never greeted once leaving or entering the hotel. No Bellman present to flag cabs, or help opening the heaviest door possible. The hotel is out of line for charging for internet in the rooms, the lobby wireless and even the business centre!!! You cannot use the computers in the business centre until you swipe your credit card. I found this very pathetic of the hotel, not to provide your guests with computer access. I booked this hotel on hotwire as well, claiming it was in the SoHo area. Do not trust hotwire, so far from soho. It's in the finnancial district.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience - see New York at its best !”
Reviews.Author: wolvespremier
Reviews.Content: I went to New York for a trip in December 2005 and had a great time at the Millenium Hilton. We stopped on the 39th floor and had a breathtaking view of Ground Zero. The hotel was the closest hotel to the Twin Towers and the staff are always keen to tell you stories. There is even a rescued flag framed in the reception area from the building that was salvaged on the terrible attacks in September 2001. Make sure that you ask for a front facing room as the views are simply stunning. The views from the rear will encompass Brooklyn Bridge. We didnt get chance to use the swimming pool facility but did enjoy the breakfast everyday which had the most delicious muffins I have tasted . . . ever! and you can eat as many as you want :) Nearby there is a underground station which is accessible to most places with ease, the hotel is situated just a short walk to the harbour front where you can see the Statue of Liberty. There are several restaurants nearby but dont make the mistake of ordering a starter as you wont eat the main . . . food was fab, but there was just too much of it - even for a strapping 6ft 5 lad like me. The staff in the hotel were all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble, when I ordered Champagne to the room it was there within minutes and there was never any fuss. If you are a shopaholic be sure to check out the Department Store next to the hotel 'Century 21' I think the name was - loads of bargains to be grabbed, fantastic prices and lots of choice. The hotel was also a short walk from Wall Street as it is situated in the heart of the financial district so there tends to be an after-work crowd in the hotel bar at night and that is where you can really soak up the atmosphere and mingle with the locals. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable trip - lovely hotel - the only thing I wouldnt recommend is spending New Years Eve in Times Square, although its nice to say you have done it you cant see much and you need to start queuing at 3 - 4pm in the afternoon in the freezing cold . . and if you need the toilet, well you lose your place! Still I cant complain, an unforgettable experience which has left me with fantastic memories . . enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the price, hated the noise”
Reviews.Author: TripKlipsdotcom
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel if you're a light sleeper (unless you get it for 100/night like we did on Priceline). Construction at the Ground Zero site is constant and noisy, although my husband kept saying "what noise, I don't hear anything."

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location, Rooms, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NY_Shopping_Chic
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I flew in for a short business trip & to see the parade. To start off, the doormen begin your stay with a warm greeting. The front desk staff are friendly & helpful. The room was amazing. Spacious, clean, beautifully equipped. They do warn you at the desk if you pull something out of the fridge, that you will be charged. If you put it back, they'll credit you. There isn't anything they won't do to make your stay pleasent. It's just too bad we weren't in the hotel, but to sleep. We ordered room-service, which was extremely good. I hate reading reviews, cause it's hard to chose a hotel in NYC. I always wait a month to write a review, incase I had a bad experience. Most people don't. It's easiest to blame the hotel. I'm there every month and try to stay in a different location. This hotel is a hop on the subway to everything. Subway is right across the street. It's right next to Century 21. My Favorite store. The view from our room was amazing. We could see every part of Ground Zero. It was important for me to have my son see the devastion that was caused. Everything was amazing: the bedding, cleanliness, staff, location, all of it. With the exception of the conceierge. He would rather help the business men, then a lady & her teenage son. Don't worry about the construction noise. They put you on a high floor and we didn't even hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: NatBriKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Hilton for only one night, February 2. Booked directly through Hilton by phone. Easy 7-10 minute taxi ride from Penn Station, or there is a subway stop next to the hotel. This hotel is directly across the street from the Path Station and Ground Zero. Also, across the side street from St. Paul's Church (built in 1766. This church was where George Washington went to pray after his inauguration. It is also the church who's amazing stained glass windows didn't even crack as the towers-across the street-collpased. It was a relief/aide station during the months following the attacks. There is also an old cemetary in front dating back to the Revolutionary War). Trinity Church, South Street Seaport & Museum, Battery Park, Tribecca, City Hall, Chinatown, etc. are also nearby. My 8 year old daughter and I had a Corner King on the 37th floor. I have to say, from check in to check out, we were both treated with great respect and courtousy. We were offered ear plugs or a sound machine if the noise from ground zero became too loud. We didn't need either of these things; however, there was a pounding noise from the site which ended at midnight and began again at 6 am. (just in time for us to see the awsome sun rise over the statue of liberty!) The view from our room was amazing. The windows are almost floor to ceiling. Out one window we could see the Brooklyn Bridge and Dumbo. Out the other window we could see Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. We watched the ferries go by and the circle line, as well as some cruise ships on their way back home. The beds were very comfortable. The room had a large flat screen plasma TV, alarm clock radio, two phones (one in the bathroom), a Lavazza Coffee Maker with tea set up as well, and internet access (for a fee). There is not fan in the bathroom but it was very nice and the name brand toiletries were top qualitiy. The ceiling in this room was large by current standards. Don't open the minibar unless you want something...it is on sensors and if you touch it the computer thinks you bought it. One wonderful thing that this hotel has that many others in Manhattan don't, is a pool. It is located on the 5th floor next to the fitness room and the spa (where you can opt for a massage after walking around downtown all day!) The decor of the restaurant and bar area were modern but not large. Windows overlook ground zero on one side and St. Paul's Church on the other. My daughter liked watching the cars and people go by outside below us while we ate dinner. She was waving at people who actually waved back at her. That made her day. Be advised that they do have a children's menu but they do not offer substitutions. Also, if you don't want your burger rare, say so! The menu had a lot to choose from. Something for almost all tastes. I would definately stay here again if I needed to be downtown. The reception was wonderful, room beautiful, pool fun and food good. There is also a starbucks downstairs and a real hot dog vendor around the corner. There is a lot to do downtown so take advantage of this wonderful area of Manhattan. Check it out and stay at the Millenium Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “OK Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgio L
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this sitting at the desk in my room on the 54th floor. The view is awesome! I just wanted to speak about "the noise from the WTC construction site": it's not thàt bad! As a matter of fact, it hasn't bothered me at all and I suppose some guests are more sensible than others. If you live in a city -as I do-, it's the same "noise" as you have at home. It's called city noise... Overall the hotel is OK, staff is friendly, rooms are OK (a bit tired, though...), swimming pool is nice (not comparable to the Peninsula where I usually stay) and the food is good. I choose this hotel to get rid of my miles on my airline card... Location is ideal for people coming here for business. For "compulsive shoppers" (counting myself in...) it's far from the places where you can flex the plastic (not counting Century21 next door if you like this kind of shop, but worth seeing it and if you have the patience, buying stuff...), or from the West End. So, good hotel, but no comparison with the Millenium Hilton from Bangkok, which is WAY better...

Reviews.Title: “Great views and beds!”
Reviews.Author: purplevicki
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a twin room on the corner of floor 39 with great views although we were overlooking ground zero which was noisy but fine with ear plugs. Beds v comfy, great shower and tea and coffee making. No fan in the bathroom which was very steamy, but overall, great especially with star bucks just downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: RainQueen
Reviews.Content: Room overlooked ground zero. Asked for and received sound machine to cover the construction noise immediately after check in. That combined with the comfy beds gave me the best nights sleep Ive had in a long time. The room and contents were agreeable although the dust behind dressers and above showers might be a problem for those with allergies. You can do allot in one day in New York without going far. We walked a few blocks to Battery Park and took a boat to Ellis Island. On the way back to the hotel we toured the American Indian Museum and shopped the stores at the Century 21 building next door. Overall its convenient to the sites and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is lucky to have Angie and Vivian...”
Reviews.Author: margaritasur
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium Hilton on two other occasions, and both were good experiences except for the front desk and some of the noise from the WTC construction. I didn't mean to select the neighborhood when I was putting my bid in on Priceline, and I also didn't mean to put in the dollar amount I did — I'd been working way too much for a month before so I guess I needed a break more than I thought. Anyway, I wound up with the Millenium Hilton accepting my bid. I immediately called asking to be on the non-WTC-facing side. However when I got there I was confirmed for WTC-facing. Angie explained that the king beds are all WTC-facing. She offered a queen bed on the opposite side, but I needed a king for this trip. She moved us to floor 49 — and she was so friendly, patient, and informative, we just loved her. We ordered room service that night and the burgers were amazing. Salad not so great, but the burgers had filled us up anyway (we ordered way too much for two people). It was expensive, but typical of room service and very tasty. Easy checkout via the internet tv.

Reviews.Title: “The views are simply out of this world!!”
Reviews.Author: nififer
Reviews.Content: The standards in this hotel are simply superb. We had a corner mini suite on the 50th floor looking out on to the Hudson River and with the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island in plain view as well. The room was immaculately clean, with tea & coffee making facilities and two huge TV's. The check-in was super with a real eagerness to help. Everyone was very apologetic about the construction noise (the hotel is opposite 'ground zero') but the views and service more than outweighed the limited noise we experienced. However noise will become more and more of an issue as the rebuilding work continues. This hotel has a super location downtown - you are next door to Century 21 only a few minutes walk to Battery Park (and the Liberty/Ellis Island ferries) a few minutes to South Street Seaport and the subway is right at the hotel door for midtown and uptown trains. My only criticism - and I stress only, is the concierge arranging transfers back to the airport - ours was a yellow cab with no meter running so the journey back to the airport cost far more than the journey from the airport. Insist on a metered taxi at all times. A wonderful stay and a hotel I would definately return to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat, updated”
Reviews.Author: traveller5678072
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - we booked a special weekend deal that included parking. Accomodations were excellent. Very clean and neat. Helpful staff. Best location in financial district!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but A LOT OF NOICE and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton is An OK hotel with VERY sleek and clean rooms and great views of NYC if you get a room high enough. However, please note the following: There is A LOT of noice due to the construction at ground zero - so make sure you get a room on a high floor away from the construction. If you can not get this guaranteed then stay away - even earplugs will not stop the noice which starts at 05:00 and stops at about midnight. And do expect typical NYC rudeness - also from the front desk and staff. I got the impression that they would rather not have us there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in Lower Manhattan - Top Marks!!”
Reviews.Author: LemanandAngieHarris
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Millenium Hilton on Church Street in Lower Manhattan NYC for a 3 night long weekend (7th to 10th December 2007) to celebrate my 40th birthday. The hotel is out of the hustle and bustle of the main attractions such as Times Square so the traffic & pedestrian noise levels are non-existent from the hotel rooms. We were welcomed by very polite and cheerful hotel staff and found our room to have an incredible view over Ground Zero on Floor 53 (of 54) ... we could also see the Statue of Liberty from our room - east facing rooms look over the East River towards the Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg Bridges. Construction of the Freedom Tower which is to stand in the place of the former Twin Towers is to be ready in 2010. Although friends who had visited several weeks before us had told us that construction noise could only be heard from 8am to 9pm we found this to be different on our visit. Extended hours are being worked in order that the Freedom Tower is finished on time. We could hear construction noise (even on the 53rd floor) from 5:30am to 11:30pm. A letter of apology from the hotel management was on our room desk the following day and to be honest the noise was not really a problem so do not be put off - just be aware of it if you are travelling here. We bought the "hop on hop off" bus pass (All Loops Tour) but only used it once as the subway and the taxis were very cheap and easy to use. Also the top of an open-top bus in December is VERY cold so you don't want to spend too much time up there! The subway station starts and ends directly opposite the hotel. The fare is $2 per person per trip and this will get you to 42nd Street (A, C and E Trains) and a block away from Times Square and all it's entertainment & shopping in less than 15 minutes. Don't take with you any preconceived ideas about the subway - it is cheap, clean, roomy, quick and VERY safe. We will use this method of transport around New York on every future trip now. The hotel concierge are superb so make sure you use them and their vast knowledge of the area. We were advised on transport, restaurants, bars, shopping and local sites. If you stay at the Hilton Millenium you MUST go into St Paul's Chapel next door where memorials and tributes are made to those brave people who lost their lives and loved ones in the 9/11 attacks. It is a very humbling, moving and peaceful place - we were very touched by this experience and were priveleged to have spent time here. There is a GREAT deli around the corner on Vesey Street. Breakfast and lunch are delicious and very cheap. Try the hot pastrami with mustard & pickle on rye - simply delicious. Please look at the photographs on the walls in the deli too - again some very moving pictures taken from 9/11 in the deli sheltering fire and police crews - very thought provoking. You can also find a superb French restaurant on the east side of the hotel - from memory I think it was on John Street but I can't remember the restaurant name - you'll know it when you see it. We had a bottle of wine and butcher's cut steaks which were divine all for $80 - quality! In summary the Hilton Millenium is outstanding. Rooms are very comfortable, clean and have all the requirements expected from visitors including entertainment system (huge Plasma TV / Playstation / WiFi / Tea & Coffee / Ice / Mini-Bar, etc.). Room service was superb & delicious as well as very reasonably priced for a hotel. I have read many reviews on this site and find it a little fickle that people mark this hotel down because they see Ground Zero as a construction site or that they were kept awake by people arguing in the hallway - this is no contribution to the rating of this hotel. We rate the hotel as very highly recommended. We would definitely stay here again without hesitation and hope that our review helps you make your decison as to where to stay in this wonderful city! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: casey+jenny
Reviews.Content: we travelled to new york for my 21st birthday and stayed in the millenium hilton as soon as we got there the hotel staff couldnt do enough for you. we were taken upstairs by the bell boy on the 52nd floor the view was amazing!!! massive plasma t.v big comfortable room with the best bed you will ever sleep in!! we didnt eat in the hotel but looked nice on the 5th floor. we thought that we may be looked down upon as we are younger and have in other nice hotels but there was non of this from any staff in this hotel which was nice! there is a outlet called centry 21 next to the hotel in you are from ebgland and like tk max then you will like that but no my sort of thing so didnt buy anything. the subway is next to the hotel but is not as nice as the london tube but is handy to get into the centre. and get a taxi back. the only thing with this hotel is the work that is going on outside the front of the hotel on ground zero but we had a letter in our room on arrival from the manager apoligising for the noise and offering ear plugs if needed but me and my partner dont struggle to sleep and we were high up believe me when you are walking for miles around new york and get back to your big bed the noise is not a problem you could sllep through anything!! we loved this hotel and would personaly give it 5*!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but beware of hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: shersy
Reviews.Content: They were very accomodating! We arrived in New York at 7am Saturday morning, and they allowed us to check in early. We stayed in a smoking deluxe King bedroom on the 55th floor. The view was spectacular of the Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge... etc. Both my husband and I smoke, so it was nice to find an upscale hotel in the dead of winter that allows you to smoke in the room. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for anyone who hasn't seen NYC before and needs to recover from some long distance travel before exploring New York. It's in lower Manhattan, literally across the street from Ground Zero. It's a very quiet neighborhood, (by quiet I mean that you need to walk several blocks to find a restaurant open on a Saturday night,) but it's about 100 feet from a subway station, and there are some shops nearby that sell some good deli sandwiches and a huge cheap breakfast for $3. Big Tip: Don't use the inroom fridges to store your own leftovers. We removed soda cans from the top shelf to put our take-away food in, and upon check out we were billed over $100 for "amenities." Apparently there is a sensor in the fridge that automatically charges the room when it feels weight being moved. The front desk cleared up the false charges quickly, but I wish we had some warning. Oh yes, and they do not have wireless internet available at the hotel. They have internet plugs at a charge of $12.95/day. All in all it was a great place to stay for our first night in NY. It's a nice quiet place(when construction is not occuring, or you get a room on a very high floor.) I liked it, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but do not stay here whilst WTC construction is still in process”
Reviews.Author: Kelly&Tony
Reviews.Content: I searched many a website to find the perfect hotel for our 5 night stay in New York and I eventually settled on the Millenium Hilton. The photos on the website looked very nice and the value for money was good given our 5 night stay included New Years Eve. I had no doubts really that the hotel would be fine given the Hilton name. The hotel itself is very nice, clean and with stylish decor and first impressions are very good. Ours problems however started at check in. I had pre-booked a king room with a city view only to be told there were none currently available, so we had 2 choices, wait for a room to become available later in the afternoon (it was 4pm when we tried to check in) or take a lower room. We decided to wait for our room with a view that we wanted. We were pretty tired after the very long journey but sat patiently in the hotel bar for our room. After an hour we went back to the desk and were allocated our room on the 48th floor. The room was very nice with a view right over what was the WTC and the Statue of Liberty in the distance. I was perfectly aware that there was construction works going on prior to booking the hotel but presumed the works would stop in the evening and continue in the morning and as I am someone who sleeps well I did not think it would pose a problem – how wrong could I be? I decided to have a quick kip before heading out for something to eat on the 1st evening, I laid on the bed for 2 hours between 5 and 7 and didn’t sleep a wink due to the very loud construction noises. On our way out for something to eat we asked at reception what time the works would stop, we were told maybe 11pm sometimes earlier sometimes later (not very helpful) we asked for some ear plugs which they appeared to have plenty of. The long and short of it is that the construction went on ALL night and we did not sleep a wink, even with the ear plugs and a pillow on my head. We phoned down to reception in the morning and asked to be moved to a quieter room or alternatively to relocate us to another hotel and we had no intention of staying where we were and having 5 sleepless nights. We took our luggage down to reception and went out for the day. We were told we would be allocated another room. We returned to the hotel at 8pm to find we had not yet been allocated a room, after about ½ an hour they found us a new room. It had twin beds and no city view but the room was quiet and we were too tired to argue the difference and the receptionists did not seem too bothered anyway. I intend to take this further with Hilton now we have returned home. On the positive side as before the actual hotel is very nice. Ideally located for down town Manhattan with subways on the doorstep costing $2 for a single journey anywhere in Manhattan. New York is a fantastic place, everything you think it will be and a place you have to visit at least once. The shopping is amazing and very cheap in comparison to the UK, there are many bargains to be had. The food is also fantastic, we ate in Fish in Greenwich Village and had whole lobster for £15. New York at this time of year was very very busy, I would definitely return again although probably at a quieter time of year. If you go when its busy expect to queue for everything. With regards to the hotel I would definitely not stay here again until after the construction has finished and would not recommend to anyone to stay there at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the noise and elevators!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel50
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at end of Dec 07. The location of the hotel was great - I much preferred being here to Midtown. I had a view of the water and Statue of Liberty, plus the construction site at WTC. This was one of the only downsides - I was on the 48th floor, and the noise from the site went on 24 hours and you could hear it at that level so this hotel is no good if you are a light sleeper. The room was pleasant, clean and comfortable. The staff were ok - not rude nor overly polite. The best thing was the proximity to all of the subway systems which take you anywhere in Manhattan, plus you could walk up to Tribeca and SoHo for restaurants, bars and shopping, which were way cooler than anything Midtown has to offer. Only other downside - the elevators get very crowded between 9-10am when all of the tourists are trying to get out and about, to the point of being dangerously overloaded with people trying to squeeze in having waited for 20 mins, the management should supervise this....

Reviews.Title: “new york,millenium hilton”
Reviews.Author: sarah2607
Reviews.Content: Arrived at millenium hilton early hours of morning 29th dec after being on a bus for 2 hours, get the subway much quicker,we did going back to airport at end of stay, checked in and we had booked a city view above 30th floor, we were given level 25! i said to the guy behind desk that we had booked city view above level 30, he said one momment and about 10min later said we were now on 49th floor,which was much better, thou the guy wasn,t sorry, bit rude really and no smile! got to the room and that was great, lovely view. thou we would get a decent nights sleep ready for a day of shopping! WTC works very noisy and did not stop till new years eve, they worked 24 hours a day and even being on 49th floor could still hear, very loud. they are a month behind on finishing. went to woodbury outlet, not great, some bargins but mostly last years stock and not many sizes! busy too and 2 half hours on the bus coming back! Went to empire state building and that was another 2 half hours wait and every one pushes in, finely got to the top and great view but all the standing around waiting to get up top take the edge of it, one good thing when we got up there it was snowing. could,t really find places to eat and had mexican twice, which was nice, times square was just mad and it really is a city that doesn,t sleep. we had booked a new years eve party with JOONBUG a cruise on the half moon, well it states cocktail/semi formal men attire. i brought a lovely cocktail dress and my partner wore a suit, i could have gone in jeans and t-shirt! food was rubbish and drinks were in plastic cups and 8$ each! music was good to start and then some right rubbish was played and was really loud too! another thing tickets said be there at 8 don,t be late, we did,t move from marine till nearly 11pm and then going down river towards fire works for new year he was going to fast that the boat was going forward across river so unless u were out front on deck you could,t see fire works! not what i thou it be. another thing don,t touch the food or drink in mini bar because you will be charged for it and its not cheap, food is expenses too, but if do fancy some food there is 24 hour service which is good, this is also a none smoking hotel, but there,s warm heaters outside. this was 1 of my dreams to come to new york and i,ve done it now, but i would,t do again and would,t come back to this hotel untill WTC works are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jeannebutcher
Reviews.Content: Last year - Oct 2006 my family and I stayed at the Hilton Millenium, the visit was really good, I would have given it a 9/10. But our second visit December 21st - 27th 2007; sorry Hilton, but you have let your sides down. I would give you a 3/10 on this visit. For starters, I had booked the room almost a year in advance, I requested the 53rd floor with a city view. I got the 53rd floor but no city view. After a few phone calls, I got the 45th w/city view. I thought a year in advance and with a request like that - easy to plan. My children were with me (21,19,16) and I wanted them to see the breathtaking skylines over Christmas. We did have a king sized junior suite, nice size, shower worked, maid service good, bed made, clean towels and room kept tidy. One thing that really got me.. I must be honest here too, the bar staff in particular (main bar and resturant bar 3rd floor) were not friendly (anyone with an ice pic?) - more so on the rude side. I have travelled with Hilton for business throughout Europe, service was better, staff approachable and friendly. But overall... Would I go back? No. I like to feel a bit more of a welcome. I suggest Hilton management to get the bar staff on a customer relationship course. And teach them how to serve with a smile.....

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression.”
Reviews.Author: Larry1962
Reviews.Content: My partner had secretly arranged with the staff to have a bottle of champagne, champagne glasses that were sent over from Bloomingdales, and two tux's to be in the room when we arrived. He even told them what time we were to arrive. Upon check in we were told our room "might be ready", and I told them that's ok, we can check our bags, walk around and come back later. Instead, we were sent up to our room. This was simple...the front desk could have stalled by asking us to have a seat in the bar, but didn't. We got to our room & it wasn't 30 seconds when the champagne arrived. The glasses & tux's arrived some time later...seperatly... mind you, they had been sitting downstairs at the concierge all morning. We were given a verbal appology by the manager, but you can't undo something like that and expect it to be enough. They could have comped the champagne, but we didn't pursue it. I had high hopes for this property by reading all of the postings, but the hotel blew it for me big time.

Reviews.Title: “It needs to be closed 1”
Reviews.Author: michirsc
