Reviews.Content: The hotel is uninhabitable. The 24 hour a day construction noise at Ground Zero is so bad, one will not be able to sleep without drugs. THE hotel web page talks about neighborhood construction, but says nothing about the nonstop noise. The hotel should be closed until the work is done.

Reviews.Title: “I want to buy the pillows! So comfy/modern/nice!”
Reviews.Author: tangerine240
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in June 07 and this hotel was wonderful! Very fancy, clean, modern, and spacious. I loved how I could plug in my iPod to the alarm clock so I could listen to my own music. The flat panel TV is nice, furniture is modern. The best part were the pillows! I actually looked up online and saw that you could buy them. Expensive pillows - but I want a couple still!! I only would complain about the construction at Ground Zero so there was noise all night but I could still sleep. I felt very safe here but at 3am there isn't anything to eat unless you want to walk a few blocks (which I wouldn't, as a small female). The subway that is very close didn't take me to my friend's place in ChinaTown/Little Italy so that was kind of a pain sometimes, but we took taxis. This is an excellent hotel for the financial district and ground zero visitations.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Wins Again”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan101
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in the financial district and were somewhat hesitant of the location since most of NYC's attractions are Midtown. However, we were so impressed by the Millenium Hilton and the convenience of public transportation in the area, that the notion quickly dissipated. Our room (#1813) was beautiful and lived up to the 4-star billing. We also had a great view of the work being performed on WTC site. Please see attached photos. If you are a shopper, Century 21 is right around the corner and Soho is very accessible. My wife and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sparky6798
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to NYC and stayed the last 3 days at the Millenium Hilton, and we overly pleased with the stay. We had stayed in Times Square for the first 2 nights of our stay and were a little worried about leaving that area for another hotel. But we were more than pleased with our choice. The hotel is a Hilton, and that speaks for itself. Very modern , clean and staff very more than willing to help on any occasion. We booked a room through Hotwire for $244/night and felt that was a great price for that hotel in NYC at that time of the year. We had a deluxe room with a king bed ( as promised) and had no complaints whatsoever about the room. It did overlook ground zero, and it was a bit noisy on some mornings but we were on the 21st floor and what we heard at that level was nothing to complain about. Yes there was some noise, but nothing that you may even notice. We didn't eat at the restaurant but we heard that it was very good. They have a great pool, and fitness center. The business center had all the amenities , but charged for use of the internet, (perhaps in my opinion the only negative thing about the hotel). FOr such a hotel for this price, I think internet access should be available at no extra charge. Staff were great and answered all of our many questions about NYC and tried to help in whatever way they could. The location of the hotel is in the downtown area, which was not a concern for us, as the subway was very convenient and got us to where we needed to be in 10 minutes. Overall a fabulous time in NYC and at this hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel, and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “ok, but a bit noisy with the construction....”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel overlooks Ground Zero, where the World Trade Center Towers used to be, and in your room you hear the construction noise from the work that is going on to build something new there. It starts early, even on the weekends. This was the first time that I had been back to the hotel since 9/11. The hotel rooms were renovated after it and are well designed and equipped, especially for the business traveller which I guess due its location are the main guests. The desk for working at has a proper work chair which makes a huge difference. There is a great, modern coffee making machine (which I wish more hotels had) and a really huge flat screen TV. The bed is large but not as comfortable as those at the Sheraton or Westin. There is a surprising lack of choice of places to eat or drink. There is only a very small bar in the lobby and one restaurant on the 3rd floor (which did a satisfactory but not stunning buffet). There is a fitness centre but I did not get to it on this trip. The hotel is right next to the famous Century 21 discount label department store and an easy 10 minute walk to South Street Sea Port area with its shops and museums and the major drop off and pick up for the round Manhattan bus tours. But overall, it is not a very handy destination for tourists as far from the shopping areas and Central Park etc. Overall, I liked the room a lot but the noise of construction did wake me up earlier than I would have liked so was glad my stay was so short. When the World Trade Center was across the road there was much better eating and shopping etc, and sure there will be again. You can often get good deals at the hotel as the construction puts a lot of people off. It is not massively troublesome but more of a minor distraction in reality.

Reviews.Title: “exceedingly average”
Reviews.Author: craigse22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is opposite Ground zero, so great location for looking around Manhattan. Unfortunately there is a lot of building work near the hotel, the noise of which could be heard in our hotel room despite being on a high floor. We were also woken up in the middle of the night by a couple arguing in the hallway! The hotel food is also very expensive, with a chocolate bar from the mini bar costing about $6! Staff not too friendly either. Not what I expected from a Hilton hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good altenative if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: We needed to go to NYC for what we now realize is major tourist season. We tried all means possible to get a nice hotel for under $500-600/night for a weekend in between Thanksgiving and Xmas to no avail. We decided to blow our entire hotel point account on 2 nights at a different hotel which was not ideal but it got us there. I continued to search however, for some break though or last minute deal. Hotwire was listing a 4 star hotel in Soho for $249. Bingo! I examined the description (which mentioned a pool) and searched to find that the only 4* hotel in Soho with a pool was the uber-hip Gansevoort. I jumped at the chance and booked it, only find, out after committing, that the reservation was for the Millennium Hilton. We were quite disappointed (I'd even say a bit mad) since although this hotel is South of Houston....it is no way Soho.We have had many opportunities to stay here in the past but declined. But....we sucked it up and checked in and wrote it off to "it's only a place to sleep and shower". I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised. The proximity to the subway and path trains made it an incredibly convenient location. Since we are Gold members, we were upgraded to a room with a fantastic view of all downtown and the river. Sunset was spectacular. It was fascinating to watch the activity going on in the rebuilding of the WTC across the street. We checked in to a decent sized, modern and clean room with nothing really to complain about. The staff was helpful and friendly. While we did just sleep and shower here on our busy weekend, I would consider staying here again if the price was prohibitive at some of our more favorite locations.

Reviews.Title: “nothing less than superb!”
Reviews.Author: MP1Dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 40th birthday and it was nothing less than superb! I was our second trip to NYC. We'd previously stayed in the equally excellent Fitzpatricks on lexington in June '06 but their December rates could not match the value we got at the Millenium - five nights for €700, less than $200/night! Worth every penny! Victor, the extremely efficient guy who took our reservation ensured we got one of the few (14) smoking rooms of all of which are on the 54th floor and ours had a excellent view over Jersey with an eerie eagle eyed perspective over the WTC site. The location in Downtown NY is close to Wall street, right next door to Century 21 and two mins walk from Abecrombie & Fitch which made shopping so easy and cab fairs up town are cheap. Check in was instant! The door men are first class, everyone of them friendly and funny but the numerous concergie's vary. One guy, Joe, was condescending and rude and managed to mess up our dinner reservation for my big four oh but another guy who's name slips my mind gave us excellent advice on where to catch the Arsenal V Chelsea match - Nevada Smiths on 3rd ave between 11th & 12th which had an absolutley brillaint atmoshpere - packed with chanting fans of both persuasions, half of them expats and amazingly, many avid new york soccer fans! We ate breafast and dinner in the hotel both of which were excellent with super service. The bar staff are great, especially the retired cop guy who didnt fail to set us up a freebie after several rounds and tips. They talk freely about the horendous events of 9/11 when incredibly the hotel survived any serious structural damge despite being directly opposite the WTC. (on our first nitght we watched the movie WTC in our room and it was weird to be looking down on the site at the same time - God bless America!) Nonetheless the Millenium closed for two years following those disasterous events and required substantial superficial rennovations which contribute to its pritine appearance today. The public areas are excellent, the rooms/bathrooms superb. The leisure cetnre is small but adequate with a nice pool which is a rarity in Manhattan but sadly there was no jacuzzi! The view from the upper floors are stunnning! On our final morning we awoke with a start to find a guy cleaning the windows which momentarily scared the cr*p out of us as it is the last thing you'd expect to see at that height! Check out was completely hassle free, the bill had been settled automaticaly and a reciept posted under our door on the moring of departure and the hotel stored our bags untill we left for the airport at 4pm. We had to nip into Century 21 to buy an extra suitcase to transport our purchases! All in all, this is an absolutley superb hotel at the price! Cant wait to go back! MP1

Reviews.Title: “A great choice if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: illtryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium over the long Thanksgiving weekend (arriving after the parade!) while visiting our daughter who lives in Brooklyn. Having previously stayed at hotels in Times Square, we opted for something different this time around. I saw a really good nightly rate online and called the hotel directly and got the same rate. I asked for a "City View" King room and was thrilled when I walked in to a very large room, extremely clean, the bed was so comfortable with lavish linens (lots of pillows!). We were on the 51st floor, looking directly west (over the WTC site) and out over New Jersey. We could see south to the Statue of Liberty and north up Broadway. The window in the 51st floor elevator lobby afforded a terrific view of the Brooklyn Bridge (and Brooklyn) and the river. The plasma TV on the wall was terrific, very modern desk and dresser. Comfortable chair, large closet - lots of well-placed lamps and reading lights. The bathroom was very clean with lots of counter space (hair dryer, really really nice towels and lots of them, the usual shampoo, etc.). A nice touch was that an umbrella was in the closet for our use (didn't need it) and a safe was provided as well. The lobby was nice (a bit noisy with all the comings and goings) with a lobby bar but when the bar was full, there were no other places to "hang out". The concierge was great, very good recommendations. Bellmen were "johnny on the spot" and apologized for the delay as we were leaving that there were no cabs to be had (we were leaving during Monday rush hour) but did call one specifically for us to get us to the airport on time. We really enjoyed our stay at the Millenium and will again (if the price is right). We were slightly amused that for the price we paid we didn't get free internet (neither in the room or in the business center) while the Burger King down the street (as well as other businesses) did! Even our cheap hotel room in Eau Claire, Wisconsin offers free WiFi!! Also, while the plasma screen TV was really nice and big, the restricted number of cable channels was a disappointment. Couldn't they offer a few more movie channels (only had HBO) or the more popular cable channels? Not that we watched too much TV, but after walking all day it was nice to unwind in the lovely room. Don't hesitate to stay at the Millenium if the price is right for your budget (we paid about $300 inc. taxes per night which we thought was a bargain in NYC).

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: starflyergold
Reviews.Content: I and my partner stayed at the Hilton for four nights for a long weekend in New York. The hotel is in the downtown area but easily accessible with public transport and a taxi ride to midtown is about $ 17. We arrived after a transatlantic flight in the evening and were immediately whisked in with the luggage all taken care of. The receptionist (Angie I think her name was) was extremely helpful as our request were a smoking room and a high floor. She excelled at this and we were given a fantastic room on the 54th floor overlooking ground zero and the Brooklyn Bridge. The room was exceptionally large by New York standards and had all the amnesties you could wish for: good internet connection (for a very reasonable $12/day), LCD TV, mini bar, large bathroom and excellent bed. The service overall was very efficient and friendly. The concierge helped us making restaurant reservations and taxis were flagged down very quickly. The only downside of the stay was the varying service in the bar next to the lobby. The prices for the very same drink orders seem to vary between staff and at one point the bar tender refused to allow us to take the drinks upstairs (his explanation was that they were short of that particular style of glasses, well then order some more). There are limited choices in the area for good food, but we tried Les Halles on 15 John St which was a good basic choice, 2 minutes from the hotel. Other than that you may have to travel a bit to get high quality restaurants. We loved Lever House Restaurant on 390Park Avenue. I can highly recommend the Millenium Hilton (even if the spelling annoys me) and considering the normally ridiculous room rates in New York the Hilton is definitely a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: onewanderer
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for just our first night arriving into NY because of mix ups on our dates and my first choice of hotel wasn’t available for that night. I wanted to leave a straightforward review of my experience of this hotel. I have to say that I was not overwhelmed in any sense – not great, not bad, nothing to write home about. When we arrived, the staff was professional but curt. I booked a high room with a city view. The only rooms they had available when we got there were rooms facing Ground Zero. The view looks straight down at Ground Zero. As other reviewers have said, there is heavy equipment operating and loud noise literally 24 hours a day so don’t expect a quiet night. We were exhausted when we got in so we ordered room service and I felt ill after the meal. In the morning, we ate a very expensive breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. As far as the room, it was just a room, though tidy and clean. For the price and overall ‘experience’, I was completely underwhelmed. All in all, just a very so-so experience combined with disappointment relative to the price (very expensive during marathon time!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: teachers_on_tour
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. It provides everything you would expect from a hotel in this class, and it is a great deal at the weekend when the financial district is quiet. Excellent beds, helpful staff - no problems at all. Century 21, a truly wonderful department store - discount but not tacky - is right next door. However - it is not in Midtown or anywhere near it if you like to walk. We did not find the subway as convenient as it might have been: some stations are closed because of Ground Zero rebuilding and on the long weekend we were there, ticket machines wouldn't take any notes, only coins. Having just arrived, we didn't have many coins - so take some! Buses don't take notes either. You could buy a pass with a credit card, but obviously you need to be travelling a fair bit to make it worth it. None of this is the Millenium's fault - but be aware and come prepared. One other problem with the location is that there are very few restaurants within walking distance. It's a very nice hotel, but be prepared to use public transport a lot. Previously we had stayed in Midtown and were certainly spoilt for choice with restaurants close by, but of course, you pay more. For the money - we paid about $400 Australian per night - it's great.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, great views”
Reviews.Author: laneoCardiff
Reviews.Content: an all round amazing trip, made even more special by this hotel. the millenium hilton was just amazing, ok it was a little bit noisy that is because they are working on the trade centre site. which is a stones through away, id recommend to every1 who wants to see new york to use the subway, a little daunting 1st time but the only way to see new york city, for example we caught a cab to mid town which cost $12 and 35 mins a subway tokk 7 mins and $2. my trip, hotel, experiance was amazing the only let down was the manners of people in new york, might just be me but manners do not cost anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: rachelw77
Reviews.Content: NYC is getting more expensive by the month and it's really difficult to find a decently priced business-type hotel in Manhattan these days.....so I was pleased when I found the Millennium Hilton. I booked directly via hilton.com and paid 200 US dollars, a great price for this location. The rooms are spacious, modern, with fast internet service and are exactly what you would expect from a Hilton hotel. The hotel is definitely designed for business travellers....there is very little lobby space, few extra amenities and not much of a concierge service. Wall St is just a short walk away, and the hotel is on top of a subway station so it's easy to get around. Bargain hunters will be pleased to know that Century 21 is right next door too. Yes people may moan about the view, but what do they expect?! Look beyond the ground zero construction site and there is a perfectly nice view of the river, all the way across to the statue of liberty....

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton Very Nice......”
Reviews.Author: linguica
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Millenium Hilton and liked it very much. We went to NY to see Grease which we did not end up seeing because of the strike. They upgraded us to a suite because we are Hilton Gold Card members. The suite was very nice, the people who worked in the hotel were always very nice and attentive. We ate lunch and breakfast in the restuarant on the 3rd floor and that was also very good, but very expensive. It is located a bit far from Times Square - we took a cab which was about $16 each way. It is a nice walk to the Seaport/Waterfront area and Century 21 is right around the corner. We would stay at this property again as it was very nice all around. Linguica

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downown Location”
Reviews.Author: Neilzonwheelz
Reviews.Content: I gave the hotel average only because I stayed at the Hilton New York the week before. This hotel is very good in many, ways, all the fixtures, comfort of bed, quality of ammentites were of a high standard. Just didn't seem as plush. It is a business hotel though, the lobby is small compact and the staff serve vry efficiently, don't expect huge smiles and pampering - they have job to do - get you into your room ASAP. The porters were nice blokes, Concierge was very helpful - especially hen my Blue Shuttle didn't arrive & I had to grab a cab. The hotel is directly opposite Ground Zero but I barely heard any noise - if any and there were no major inconveniences. Close - healthy 15 minute walk to Southport shops & restaurants and just down from Wall street. Downside was no bars at night over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I got a free night certificate as a result of a bad experience at the Hilton Toronto Airport, and decided to use it here. Requested a dry room because of my age (20) and got it. I had a room on the 46th floor with a great view of ground zero. Room was very clean, although just as I had expected, it was small. The elevators were VERY fast; it took about 20 seconds to go up to the 46th floor. The only one thing I didn't like was the way they did towels; they were like sandpaper. I'd definitely stay here again if I were given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: krubtap
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 1st to 5th November and in total had 3 rooms. We needed to make a change to one of the rooms, which was completed with complete assistance by the staff. The room decor and layout was excellent with spacious bathroom, extremely comfortable beds and of course the large plasma TV. The location is very much downtown and for this reason you have to depend on Taxi's or subway. The E line is located pretty much outside the front door and will have you at the Port Authority or 5th Avenue in minutes. We didn't have an opportunity to eat in the hotel, prices where quiet high and with the availability of food on your doorstep you will never be stuck. We found staff to be very helpful with great recommendations from the concierge. Overall our stay was extremely relaxing and we would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreekTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed staying in this hotel. When we arrived we asked for a different type of room and hotel staff made the change with a very positive attitude. All members of the hotel staff were polite and friendly. The room was wonderful, tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds, and a great view of Ground Zero. One day I was not feeling well and decided to stay in my room with the "no disturb" sign outside my door. Later that day I got a polite call from housekeeping services asking if everything was ok and offering to bring to the room anything I might need. We travel to New York at least once a year and this has been the best hotel experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “All round winner”
Reviews.Author: susanderek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights - 10th through 14th October. The hotel is in a great location for exploring the downtown area, and a very short walk to subways on a number of different lines. We walked along to the South Street Seaport on two mornings for a relaxing coffee on the deck as the boats passed along the East River. The rooms were a mixed bag. We had a double for the first night which turned out to be two queen beds – certainly not enough room for three to sleep comfortably. The beds themselves were incredibly comfortable – just not big enough. Luckily we had booked a Junior Suite for the next four. What a difference. On the 29th floor, it was very spacious, and had three huge plate windows looking down towards the Battery, and out to the construction site that is Ground Zero, with the bustling traffic on the Hudson a lovely way to greet each morning. I didn't find it off-putting at all – it's just a hive of activity and a symbol of a people determined to recover. The iconic 'cross' section of the original building stands in front of the church just a little way up Church Street, and that is still moving. We loved our big 42” plasma screen, but it didn't improve the quality of the programmes! That's not what we went for of course. The rooms had internet access for $12.95 per 24 hours. Yes it is noisy – they work from early morning to late (and I mean late) at night, except for Saturday night. So I bought earplugs, which worked a treat. $4.99 and you have hundreds of Duane Reades to choose from! We ate in a few places nearby. Go to the Stage Door Deli across the way for great breakfasts and real theatre courtesy of the staff. Have you ever seen a bagel fly? Well, you can here. We also ate in the Woolworth Building Kitchen which was excellent value. The hotel's restaurant serves up similar fare but is more expensive and less atmospheric than either of these. Being right next door to Century 21 is another plus – even if only for getting in early morning or late evening before it gets far too busy. Staff were courteous and helpful, and ensured that our pick-up to the airport was on time. I'd go back tomorrow. In fact I wish I could...

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: rachime
Reviews.Content: The Millenium Hilton met our expectations. Fab price for the location and amenities- walking distance to Battery Park/ Statue of Liberty departures, multiple subway stops nearby. Most of the areas around the hotel have walkways for pedestrians now, so we didn't have any trouble getting around. Be aware of construction noise, but it didn't keep me from having a good night's sleep in the super-comfy bed. We had a view from the 27th floor overlooking the WTC site, but we found it more interesting than sad- good to see progress. Refrigerator and snack drawer are on the weighted system, so don't plan on storing food or beverages of your own. This hotel IS in New York City- parking is limited and expensive if you have to use it, and there are only two single bathrooms off the lobby. (A woman behind me in line was very rude with complaints about this fact.)

Reviews.Title: “Thank Goodness for the Hilton !!”
Reviews.Author: tpbel
Reviews.Content: When I was planning the trip to NYC as my daughter's 18th birthday present, I asked her if we should get a good hotel, or not bother, as we wouldn't be doing anything other than sleep in it. Well, thank goodness as any precocious 17 year old would, she wanted to spend the extra for a good hotel. So I chose the Millenium Hilton from the City & Show website, and actually got a pretty good deal. As it turned out, my daughter was EXTREMELY ill for the trip, for all of the 5 days we spent there. It started when she fainted on the plane out there (a BIG BIG thank you to the wonderful guys on Continental Airlines who helped her out with oxygen). So we got to Newark, got our taxi to the hotel, and my daughter didn't leave after that (except for an hour in Bloomingdales and a pre-booked helicopter trip). She couldn't walk one block so didn't even see Ground Zero. So we were stuck in our fantastic hotel room on the 44th floor, with our excellent view up towards the Empire State. As a busy working mum, I actually found the enforced stay very relaxing - we caught up on all of our movies on the big flat screen! The staff was very helpful, and the beds extremely comfortable. This hotel made what could have been an utterly miserable trip, bearable. I had a meal in the restaurant one evening which was very pleasant. Also, the hotel is right next to Century 21, which is ideal for cut-price shopping. And the World Financial Centre is also worth a look, as well as the church across the road which at that time still held the memorabilia for the lost loved ones of the 9/11 tragedy. The only problem (and why I'm not giving it a 5 rating) is that there were no instructions by the phone on how to ring an international call back home to Ireland, and I inadvertently dialled various numbers (including to Africa apparently!) and I had to work hard with the reception staff not to be charged an exorbitant amount. I think I'd like somewhere more central next time, but if you want to be downtown, this is the place. My daughter recovered when we got back home of course, and we know someday we'll be able to laugh about it (just not yet!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dab82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to Ground Zero..therefore it is a bit noisy, especially through the night! However, we stayed in a Junior Suite on the 23 floor and the room was very clean, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were not unecessarily bothered by them, and the rooms are of a good size and standard. We particuarly liked the Lavazza coffee maker in the room. We would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Will go back...”
Reviews.Author: Karen12Belgium
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to NY and we had a fantastic time. Hotel room was 4111 junior suite which had three huge windows all with fantastic views. Looking down over the WTC site and across to the Statue of Liberty, looking up Broadway towards the Empire State Bldg and across towards the Brooklyn Bridge. Found hotel staff very helpful and friendly, no complaints there. We did find the room a little noisy from work going on below at the WTC , sometimes work would start very early in the morning (even Sunday) and end quite late. That said the views from the room made up for it. We ate in the hotel and found the food to be ok although the dining room has no character. Good deli across the road, The Stage Door. Had carry outs and breakfast there, hightly recommended. Great location though and would stay here again. Worth taking the helicopter trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Millennium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bethke14
Reviews.Content: My mom and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean and very comfortable. We didn't hear any street/construction noise from our room on the 12th floor. The hotel was very accommodating, and gave us a room with 2 double beds even though we had booked a king through priceline. The room was quite large by NYC standards. It's very accessible by public transportation, and very easy to get to via train from Newark Airport. Also, you are able to print your boarding pass from the lobby, which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service in NY!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca416
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at and held meetings at over 25 hotels in NYC and I have to say that this hotel was by FAR the worst experience I ever had. I can't understand how this hotel was given 4 stars. With Ground Zero right below, even getting to the hotel is a nightmare, nevermind the $90 parking, rude hotel staff from the front desk all the way up to the F&B Manager and less than sparkling rooms! Everyone seems to have a chip on their shoulder and act as if I should be LUCKY to be staying here. I am very understanding of slight issues at a hotel and would never give a "terrible" rating unless it was very well deserved. The prices are cheap for a reason people- Look elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPElkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 14 - 17 September 2007. The hotel's has a new modern feel to it but lacks character. The 42" plasma is a nice touch but they are cheap 42" plasmas and therefore the quality of the picture is not great, however, that's really not that important unless you are considering spending the whole time wathcing TV in your bedroom. The hotel staff were average/above average i.e. some good, some crap! The Church & Dey restaurant is like a morgue, basically nobody seems to go in there for some reason, maybe it was the bread (like chewing a brick). The waiters/esses were looking for something to do (have never seen to waiters fight over who to take the empty plates to the kitchen before!). Small, crowded reception area, extremely noisy outside with the WTC construction. +'s were next to Century 21 and opposite train station. If you are looking for a suite stay in Embassy Suites down in Battery Park, similar price + free buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sgeddie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and wonderful location. We booked online through Expedia and got a fantastic deal for a Jr. Suite. The room was large and very clean. The staff in general were very nice, giving the bar staff the biggest kudoos. Our only complaint is that when my husband miss placed his key, the front desk would not give him another one, because the room was not booked in his name. However, at check in they asked for the name of anyone else staying in the room. If I hadn't been there (in the shower at the time) he would hvae been loked out until I returned. When I went downstairs to ask why his name hadn't been added to the guest list, I recieved a blank stare and asked if I wanted to get another key. Other than that we had a great stay and since Centry 21 is right next door we will be returning sooner than my husband thinks! LOL

Reviews.Title: “The Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Fotogo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five day break at the Millenium Hilton NYC and can't wait to return. If you are looking for a fantastic hotel with breathtaking views and great comfort look no further. We had a junior suite on the fifteenth floor which was ample space for a family of four. It consisted of two rooms connected by a small hallway and a bathroom. I have read some negative comments about the staff so I was prepared for some attitude, but I would like to say that every staff member we came into contact with was polite, friendly and couldn't do enough for us. If you like to shop Century 21 is next door with a Starbucks in between. I can highly recommend breakfast at the Stage Door Deli in the next block. Room service was fabulous with huge portions and a very quick service. I really didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: loriglenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton Sept 14 to Sept 17. We got an excellent price of $249.00 per night on the Hotel website. We arrived at 8:00 am on the 14th and were given a room despite the fact that check in is at 3:00 pm. The hotel lobby although not impressive was clean and functional. The hallways were well lit and clean. The room was excellent. I generally do not feel comfortable in hotel rooms however this was not the case here. I did not notice any dirt or spots on the carpet. The bed was great. The room was well appointed and had a flat secreen television. All of the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. As for the negatives, there is loud construction at the WTC site and this hotel is right across the street from Ground Zero. The only issue we had was being awoken at 6:30 am on Saturday morning by the noise. It is also located in the financial district and not conveiniently located to Times Square. We did not really have a problem with these things though. We did not try the restaurant or bar at this hotel. This hotel is definity worthy of a four star rating unlike many "four star" hotels is NYC. The best Hotel I have stayed at in NYC in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “you have to stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: psrumball
Reviews.Content: As you can tell by the title we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel...everything went amazingly smooth while we were there...the room was fantastic...a view you couldnt believe...overlooking the WTC site...and so clean with lots of room to spread out and relax...the staff was excellent with any questions we had...the concierge was a great resource and we asked them so many questions and they had an answer for everyone of them...from where to eat to what to do...the only thing that I wasnt too crazy about was the distance from Times Square and all the main attractions...taxi cab ride was about 15-20 dollars but if you dont mind manning the subway than that would be a cheaper way of going around the city...we really cant say enough good things about the hotel...it was everything we were hoping for and more and will be staying there again when we visit NYC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sp5ive
Reviews.Content: In town for a family wedding. Excellent accomodations. Room was super clean. Bed was comfortable to the max. I did not use pool, but it sure looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malby
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good access to Battery Park and Statue of Liberty. Downside is it is a little far from midtown so could end up costing a fair bit in taxis. We paid $20 to get to times square out of rushhour.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic New Year City Break”
Reviews.Author: HRich
Reviews.Content: My now-husband but then-boyfriend and I visited New York for the first time at New Year and chose this hotel due to it's down-town Manhattan location and star rating. Upon arrival, reception was very busy, and we were a little dissapointed by the staff, who were perfectly professional and efficient, but as a result - not overly friendly. That aside, the service was excellent, if not with a smile. The room was a comfortable size, with full length ceiling to floor windows on one side, a wide screen tv with cable and plenty of storage as well as a lovely bathroom. We had a room on the 29th floor (I think) which had spectacular views overlooking the ground zero site. One of the first things we did was go and visit the site, an emotional experience, having wached those awful events live on the news all day when they unfolded. We were only in the city for a few days, over the New Year period, and found the hotel an excellent home from home after travelling around the city seeing the sights. Century 21 is right next door and full of great bargains, and as soon as you get used to the subway system, the city is very easy to navigate from here. We walked to Wall Street, and over to the Statton Island ferry port (were you get the ferry to go to the Statue of Liberty) as well. This was not a 5 minute walk, more like 20 - 30, but enjoyable, even in December. New Year's eve was a greatly anticipated event for us, and we chose to do it the traditional NY way and go to Time Sq. We had received advice to get there very early, and we thought 6pm would be early enough. Boy we were wrong. We finally made it into a pen about 10 blocks back from Time Sq, where we were unable to get out for food, drink or toilet breaks. We stood for 6 hours with little idea of what was happening in the centre, and by the time the ball dropped, we were ready to drop ourselves! The party atmosphere was a little jaded by this point, but we still cheered, hugged the poeple we'd met in the crowd, and then my husband proposed. This made it all a lot more bearable, of course! If I was to recommend a NY New Year to anyone, I would say they should book into a hotel off Time Sq, or book at a restaurant nearby, as this will make for a much more pleasant experience! If not, you probably need to arrive at about mid day to get a spot in the centre, which I'm sure would be worthwhile. All was made more wonderful when we returned to the hotel, hungry and cold to find that NY truly is the city that never sleeps. Through room service we were able to order a pizza from the parlour down the road. It was delivered to our room at about 1 am and must have been the best pizza I have ever eaten! All other meals we bought outside of the hotel, so I'm afraid this was our only experience of room service, which I must say was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite up to the price”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBennett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after a cross country flight, before sailing from NY the following day. The staff were all very competent and friendly and the property was nice looking and clean. The restaurant was fine, but not stellar. Our room was very small, much more like a London hotel room than a high priced NY property. Overall, perfectly fine, but for the cost we were expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJIL
Reviews.Content: Staying directly across the street from the World Trade Center site can be a bit sobering (and noisy certain times of the day since the Site is now an active construction zone) but the hotel's services and amenities make it a very pleasurable stay. You can get anywhere in NYC via the subway from this location with mid-town being only a 10 minute subway ride away. Taxi's are plentifull given it's downtown location. Good dining in Tribeca, Soho, and the Village is a 15 - 30 minute walk away or 5 minutes by taxi or subway. Battery Park and the Ferries to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island are just a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_stack
Reviews.Content: When: Thurs Aug 9 – Mon Aug 13 Price: Priceline $150/nt ($178/nt after taxes). Rack rate $202+tax The Hotel: Fully renovated after 2001. The hotel was very new looking, very clean and the staff were excellent. Bed and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Each room has a 42” plasma TV but I did not see any HD tv channels so you can’t really take advantage of it. There is a small bar fridge but you can’t use it because it is full of their items and if you move anything the electronic sensors will bill you. There was a ice container we would fill up to keep our leftover cheesecake good until the next day. Elevators were crazy fast, we were on the 50th floor and never had to wait longer than 20 seconds for an elevator and the full trip was under 30 seconds. Pool and fitness room were quite reasonable. Check in time is 3pm but we there is quite a rush at that time. We arrived at 11am and simply dropped off our luggage and pre-reserved a room (ask for one on the side away from Church St. for lovely views on the Brooklyn st bridge and to avoid the near 24 hr construction at the WTC site. Parking is super expensive at the hotel so we just dropped off our luggage and parked at a parking lot under the FDR drive by the Brooklyn Bridge (take Frankfort St toward South St) and you can’t miss it. $21/day taxes included for parking in a fully insured and monitored car lot. Location/Activities: The hotel is on Church street in SOHO Financial district right across from the big hole in the ground that was the world trade center. Metro entrances 2 min walk from the hotel but another 5-6 min underground to get to the line. ~15-20 min by metro to Times Square and other great areas. 10 min walk to the Staten Island ferry which is a faster and cheaper (free) to take a boat past the statue of Liberty. The financial district is much quieter at night than midtown but my wife and I never felt unsafe walking the streets to the hotel at midnight after a broadway show. There are cheap ways to eat in the area. Our favorite nearby was a 24hr buffet ($5.74/lb of food) at about Fulton St and William St. Also a nice bistro and grocery store at about Liberty St and William St. We brought our own cereal and bowls and simply bought a liter of milk from the pharmacy on Fulton just east of Broadway each morning on our way to the TKTS booth for a super cheap breakfast. The TKTS booth is at the corner of John St and Front St about 10 min walk from the hotel. This TKTS booth opens at 11am for that evenings and the next days matinees shows. Be aware that the tickets are pretty much all $60 for Broadway shows (they only really discount the most expensive seats) and they tend not to have the most popular shows (Hairspray, Rent, Legally Blond, Mary Poppins, ect.). Also note there are really no Broadway shows on Sunday nights. We did however see Chorus line, Curtains, Phantom of the Opera and The Drowsy Chaperone. The TKTS booth in Times square sells that days matinees and evening shows and tends to have a better selection but longer lines. It also opens later (2pm) so it wrecks your day more. Food before broadway shows can be had cheaply on Eighth ave between 44th – 45 th st (Subway, burger and pizza joints, ect) but I highly recommend “Juniors” on 45th St just west of Broadway. $10 sandwiches and burgers and the best cheesecake in the world ($6.50) – I recommend the devils foodcake or the chocolate mousse cheesecake. They have a takeout counter but if you want to sit down show up early. Over all: Excellent hotel. Worth the 4 stars and in a great location for those who don’t mind being a little further from the hustle and bustle of Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: fdwt994
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in mid-August 2007. We had a corner room suite on the 52nd floor (room 5201) facing New York Harbor to the south and the Brooklyn Bridge to the east. What a spectacular view! We had a clear view of the Statue of Liberty and the rebirth of ground zero. We arrived around 11am and were told that no rooms were available. Of course, this was not a problem since we were not promised an early check in; we just figured we'd try just in case something was available. So, we had our luggage held by concierge for free while we explored Manhattan. We forgot to take something out of our bags before leaving them and the Busboy that helped us retrieve the item was extremely nice and helpful. The front desk provided us with an umbrella since it was raining. When we returned later around 6pm we checked in very quickly and proceeded to our room. There are express elevators that serve only the 31st floor and up so we never had to wait very long. Our room was typical Hilton quality with newer furniture and as always an extremely comfortable bed. An ironing board and iron were in the closet along with a safe. There was a coffee maker in the room with complimentary coffee. A cash mini bar and snack drawer were also available. We also checked out the fitness room and found it to be fairly spacious; the swimming pool looked clean and well kept. The hotel is located next door to the blue-line subway station, and the orange lines are only a block away. We will certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel, but with a very rude welcome”
Reviews.Author: Joffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last two nights in New York which signalled the end of a trip around the world. We arrived at the hotel an hour before check-in was available and were informed that our room was not ready, fair enough. However, the bell-man who was called to take our luggage into storage just looked at us and pointed towards the corner and said "Go and stand over there, GO!" we were both shocked at his behaviour and he then said "over there, NOW". We may only be 18 but we were paying customers and even if we had been someone’s children or something, it is no way to speak to customers in any hotel let along one which is 4*. After having a word with reception a half-hearted apology was given...oh well. Anyway, we went out and walked around for an hour before returning where we were greeted by a new man at the reception desk who was again rude, as I went to get my photo ID from my bag he just said "come on, I need to see this ID now". Our bedroom was on the 8th floor and had a view of ground zero, the room was amazing. Very nicely furnished and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in, without a doubt. The room was an excellent size by New York standards and had lots of features; the 42" plasma TV was excellent. The bathroom was also a good size. On the first evening the turndown service attended to both the beds and provided glasses of water and mints, however on the second night only one bed was seen to and there was no water in the room which was a little annoying but easily solved. The swimming pool was very nice, with friendly staff and a nice relaxing atmosphere. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant where we received great service from the waiting staff and the food was very good, however I was a little shocked at how small the buffet was considering the number of guests in the hotel. The reception staff that we dealt with after check-in were all very pleasant and incredibly helpful, if only some of their colleagues could follow suit! When we checked out we booked a town car to take us to the airport, this was arranged quickly and easily by the concierge and our bags were taken to the car. We were also escorted with umbrellas due to the heavy rain at the time which was very nice. All-in-all we had an excellent stay at the Millennium Hilton and I would recommend it, however the bell staff and reception team were very rude on arrival. I get the feeling that this would not have been an issue had we been older than 18.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: piper23
Reviews.Content: great price, great hotel, great staff, great location away from the craziness that is times square. just wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: I did not want to leave the Millenium Hilton, as I felt right at home. Though I arrived several hours before check-in I was given a room right away with an absolutely breathtaking view on the 47th floor. I booked a special weekend rate through Travelzoo for $211/night. This is easily THE BEST hotel I've stayed in while in NYC and I've stayed in several hotels in the city. The staff was extremely kind and accommodating, especially the bellmen who had kind greetings for everyone walking through the door. I especially liked the turndown service they had every evening with chocolates, fresh bottled water and a bucket of ice. The only things I did not like about the Hotel Millenium was the room service food was incredibly expensive, but not good at all (I ordered the combination appetizer platter and the food tasted like it was microwaved and not freshly cooked). The mini bar prices are also ridiculous, similar to many high end hotels in the city. Finally, I think the hotel needs to have wireless internet for all customers. This is the first Hilton I've stayed at where wireless internet was NOT available in the room (only in public spaces), nor was the internet free for Hilton Honors members, though it was a relatively reasonable price of $5.95/24 hours (I've seen much worse). Overall, I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and I was sad to leave the breathtaking view of NYC at the end of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJSSJM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton for two nights and have zero complaints about our stay. Staff were nothing but helpful, the hotel room was spacious & clean. The bed is more than comfortable and the flat screen television is a nice touch. We had originally wanted to stay in midtown but quickly realized that downtown is only a subway ride away. (which is right next to the Hilton!) I will definitely stay at the Millenium Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tdestef21
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - easy access to public transportation and a decent location even though it's in the financial district. Our room was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable. The only con: expensive mini-bar and no vending machines in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a nice stay. I really only have one small complaint. I got a great deal on Priceline and would definitely stay again if I could get a good deal. Pros: Room was plenty big enough, air conditioner worked fine and offered range of temps, bed was comfortable and the curtains let the room get pretty dark. We had a high floor so noise wasn't really an issue. Elevators were fast and you never had to wait for more than a couple seconds for one to come. Plenty of cabs outside and subway right across the street. Bathroom was very big and roomy. Nice soft towels and lots of counter space. I didn't need internet access while I was there so I don't know how that service was but my cell phone reception was great throughout the hotel. I didn't use the fitness center - I ran on the streets while I was there and I ran alone and felt completely safe. I also didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. Cons: Checkin was a little slow - they only had 2 people behind the desk and I'll never understand why hotels don't put up a queue line. Although there was an informal line of people waiting to check in, some rude guests were just walkin in and going right up to the counter in front of everyone who was waiting. THey really need to get their check in process straightened out! Other than this one little complaint, I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service at the Millenium Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalT0urist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated an anniversary in Manhattan and stayed for one night at the Millenium Hilton. We were delighted with our elegant, comfortable room on the 16th floor and the prompt, friendly service we received at the front desk. But the great quality of service at the hotel did not become fully apparent until after I returned home, only to realize that I had left my much-loved robe on the hook mounted on the backside of the bathroom door. I called the hotel security department the next morning and spoke with two courteous, efficient staff members--"Manny" and "T"-- who quickly located my robe and mailed it to my home. We definitely would stay again at the Millenium on our next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible place - matches the Hilton chain”
Reviews.Author: HotelJunky84
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been by far one of my worst hotel experiences ever - rude staff, lazy staff, dirty room, etc. The list goes on and on. Hmmm... I had several billing issues with the front desk over charging me for items that I had not purchased and had nothing to do with. I was basically told that if I did not want to experience these problems then I should not have stayed at their property --- and this was by the front desk manager. How horrible! Be very careful with this property....

Reviews.Title: “A different perspective”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Had I just dropped into this hotel without having seen the nearby competition, I'm sure the review would be move favorable. However, for the dollars, there is a SUBSTANTIALLY better alternative just two blocks away. We stayed just one night (having been unsuccessful in extending our stay at the Embassy Suites due to a triathlon). We found the room to be clean, comfortable, and the view almost incomparable. The front desk personnel were professional and pleasant, although seemingly somewhat detached. We had a room on the 48th floor facing the WTC site. It was quite small, with scant extra room for anything other than the bed, desk and chairs. We ultimately ended up putting some of our luggage on the air-conditioner in front of the window. This hotel does NOT offer complimentary internet access to it's Diamond members, does NOT have a complimentary breakfast or happy hour, and certainly does not have an all-suite layout. Compared to the Embassy Suites (which, coincidentally was $18 less per night) there is no way this property could earn the highest marks. Perhaps most alarmingly, we received a call in our room (although we were out and it was on voicemail) in which we were requested BY NAME to return a call to someone's NYC cell phone number. This was shocking since we knew NO ONE in NYC, and furthermore, we had told no one that we were moving to the Millenium. When we called the number, we were told that the call had been a "mistake". There are some positives: The subway station is literally right outside the door, and the views are phenomenal. Overall, I would return ONLY if my hotel of choice were unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: shreddah
Reviews.Content: We used priceline and were a little worried about getting stuck with a bad room, but they gave us a great room on a high floor. The front desk staff was very friendly (from my experience, this is usually not the case at hotels in new york city). If you are lucky Oscar will help, he was especially nice and left a great impression of both the hotel and the city on me and my new wife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you can take the view”
Reviews.Author: sb444
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, large rooms for New York, great beds, if you can stand the depressing view of the World Trade Center site. Mysterious construction goes on at all times making for some noise, but really not too bad. Good location for financial district or Tribeca, would stay in again if I needed to (just wouldn't look out the window!).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Rooms, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LaVida
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. We had a corner room with an absolutely magnificent view. The room was completely new with a large flat screen TV that the children loved. Everything was clean. The service at the front desk was great. This hotel overlooks the new construction site where the twin towers once stood. We were glad to have a room facing away from the site and our view of the NY skyline was superb. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: BoldlyGO
Reviews.Content: We had three days in NY and wanted somewhere quieter than mid town, so booked this after reading reviews. We booked a corner suite on the 27th floor overlooking the WTC. We did not want higher (i don't like heights) and took a gamble on the views. They were great! The suite was lovely, clean, great bed, and free bathrobes as Hilton points people. Excellent shower too. Son, 13 had bed in suite so that was good too. The reception staff not that welcoming on arrival, friendly on departure. The doorman was excellent and the bar friendly. Would not really recommend the restaurant - we were tired so tried it first lunch, but there is far far better locally. Was a tad disappointed too with lack lustre service and ok breakfast - I contrasted it with the cheery waiters in Chicago in April! So, we only had breakfast in as it was part of the package (good value) but otherwise eat out! Taxis were plentiful and we indulged tho there are plenty of tubes too. It is noisy first thing, true with the construction, but then the air con is really loud and why are you lying in in NY? The views made up for it. Worst thing was room service, who took three times to get the order right, and told us the barman did not know how to make a White Lady. Is this a really unusual cocktail? The pool , which was one of the reasons we booked, was lovely and had views! So, on balance a good stay at a good price but they could do even better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent But Be Cautious!”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of time, only because Priceline.com has given me the opportunity at a low rate. The hotel is sleek, modern, and high rise; as a result of being rebuilt after 9/11. It is directly across the street from the construction site for the rebuilding of the 9/11 complex. Thus, it can be noisy and the main entrance, Church Street, is often closed. Consequently, the price is low because of these inconveniences, but you can reap the benefits of a beautiful hotel by requesting a high floor facing the Brooklyn Bridge and the east side of lower Manhattan. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and this would be my first choice if view is important. I have stayed on the 9/11 side of the hotel at a high floor and generally you can avoid the noise while enjoying a truly marvelous view of the Hudson River, New Jersey, 9/11 site, and the Statue of Liberty. If you want to stay in lower Manhattan, stay here. You can walk to South Street seaport, Wall Street, Battery Park, City Hall, the Brooklyn Bridge, etc. Just remember to be smart and request a room on a high floor. Staff are accommodating and the amenities are first class. Once the new World Trade Center site has been completed, the prices at this hotel will skyrocket !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leeannegraeme
Reviews.Content: Although I am late in writing this review, I thought I had to get something on here as I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel.. The location for my partner and myself was great, we were not in hustle a bustle with all the noise that comes with it, but only a stones throw from the subway so we could be there within minutes if we wanted to. Tribeca has some nice places to eat particularly the Tribeca bar and grill, which I would recommend although we were very jetlagged, so did not enjoy the food as much as we could have done, as we were so tired. The stage door over the road is a great place for a cheap breakfast. We did not eat in the hotel, as we were always out and about. Whilst in New York my partner proposed to me so as a celebration we managed to get a table at the nearby restaurant Nobu which was my most favourite place to eat whilst in New York….if you can get a table do go although more pricey than other restaurants it was delicious! We managed to squeeze in all of the usual touristy things to do whilst stopping five nights in New York my favourite things being the Sex and the City tour…a must if you are a fan we also loved wandering round Greenwich village, it was such a lovely place to visit with great shops and the views from the TOTR were brilliant. Our one disappointment was the Helicopter ride as this was bought at a Christmas present off my mam…it was a complete rip off we were not even in the sky anymore than five mins and we had paid for the 9 minute ride, there was also no commentary. The rooms at the hotel were well presented and cleaned daily with nice toiletries in the bathroom and an excellent power shower. The beds were so comfortable, which is just what you need after a long day walking round the city. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful particularly when asking for advice and directions and were not always hanging around for tips. Overall a great hotel that I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazakie
Reviews.Content: Generally when visiting NYC we use points to stay at the Waldorf-Astria, but since they've changed to seasonal rewards and the Millenium Hilton had really reasonable weekend rates we thought we'd give it a whirl. We were upgraded to a corner suite (Diamond status), were issued breakfast coupons on checkin (the breakfast here is 10x better than the Waldorf's) and there are several subway lines there that makes it very easy to go through the city - and oh yea, there aren't 101 tourist walking all around like times square (but the tourist aren't too bad by the Waldorf either). The hotel is much nicer than I thought and pretty up-to-date including large flat-panel TV's (but I hope you didn't come to NYC to watch the tele) - I think it was fully refurbished after Sept 11. The elevators to the high-floors are super-fast. This is a compounding effect. Because the elevators are so fast you get to your room quicker, which means it can make more "runs" therefore less people per elevator ride, which means less stops on your way to your room, which means you get to your room even quicker. We're independent travelers, so don't use services from the hotel staff much, but we experiences some wonderfully positive and knowledgeable people, and some staff that we're so keen either of those qualities. The only other would be that there is no free wireless in the lobby and no wireless (paid or otherwise) in the room - they do have a LAN line. ...next time we stay in NYC, we might just stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if you request the right rooms!”
Reviews.Author: parcha58
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the old World Trade Center site, and boy, was it noisy from construction. Even with ear plugs, my husband and I had trouble sleeping. We learned that the noise bounces up, so it doesn't matter how high you are, you'll still hear it. After two nights, we requested a room facing the opposite direction, and what a difference that made! The new room was quiet and had a beautiful view. The staff aims to please, and the rooms are well appointed. Everything seems brand new and spotless. I would stay there again, but be sure to ask for a room facing away from the WTC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mmspurge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May and absolutely loved it!! It's kinda crazy though because if the wind is blowing really hard the hotel sways a little because it is so thin!! People there were very nice except the concierge at one point because we asked about great shoe stores and we were led on a scary adventure!! Anyways I love the city and you can just hop on the subway right smack into Times Square! Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: DB120163
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great it is well worth the five stars it was given.We stayed on the 44th floor with fantastic views over the city and grand central. The food was great but the staff wern't all that polite. the rooms were fabulous all rooms had large screen tv's. The shopping is great macy's is a must do.

Reviews.Title: “Love Loe Love Wow Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmarriner
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, it was great! We put in for $150 on priceline, and with fees and taxes came to $188. The Valet is expensive ($50.00) but if you go around the corner is another parking garage, charging (7.00) The other thing is that when you get to the room ask to have your room upgraded at no additional charge if possible, in the end we got an suite! The hotel rocks, such a fresh modern look, thats cool and comfy while high class. Also check out Century 21 located next door, our favorite place to shop in nyc for low designer clothes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsp3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used our HHonors points to book a room here one night before a friend's wedding in NJ. I'm a HH Gold member, but even with the free room, I was upgraded to their corner king (junior suite) on a high floor. The room was large and well outfitted with a separate small living room. Our view was of Ground Zero (see photo), which always puts things in perspective. We had a nice big flat TV, but with no HD programming and so much to do in NYC, we didn't watch it. Our room came with breakfast certificates for the restaurant which had a nice buffet. All the staff we interacted with were very pleasant and helpful. The PATH station is directly across the street and the doorman recommended we go there for our trip to NJ instead of a cab. He was right. My one small complaint is about the gym which had several aerobic machines but not much in terms of weights. If you need to be in other parts of Manhattan, the north south subway lines are within walking distance. It's not in the heart of 42nd St action, but it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location: Some of the previous comments mentioned that the location of this hotel is deserted at night. I had some hesitations when making the reservation. I searched and wanted to change to another hotel almost up to my arrival date due to those comments. Luckily, I didn’t. I actually liked the location as many of the subway line end up at this location. I can see that some people might not like this part of town at night as it is not hopping as other places such as Times Square. Night time was indeed less crowded than during the day time. At night, I would still see people around. Furthermore, this place is not so far from China Town and Little Italy and at night, there are lots of people in the area to eat etc. I actually liked this location lots as I have an affinity for Asian food. In addition, Century 21, an outlet shop is right next door. Hotel: Initially, I requested room with a king sized bed. They honored my request. When I got up to the room, it was a bit small. I came down and asked for an upgrade. They told me that there was no upgrade available. They gave me a corner room with a queen sized bed instead, which was way more spacious. Ask for a corner room, if you can. I did not find too many negatives to write about. The one thing that sort of irked me a bit was the hot water; it took about a minute to have hot water in the shower. The bathroom amenities were what one would expect at a hotel of this category. Toiletries were of Crabtree and Evelyn. Plenty of towels in the bathroom. There were no slippers or bathrobes, something I never really use. The bed, pillows, and sheets were all good. More importantly, there were all white. No motel styled/ flower sheets. There was a nice and big flat screen with cable channels. There was no Wifi in the room. High speed internet can be had for $5.95 a day, which I think was not too bad. I have seen high speed internet rate at $ 15/day. However, there was free Wifi in the lobby. There were ice bucket and wine glasses in the room . There was also a mini bar, which I did not use. Everything was clean and worked well. The pool was really nice. I used it everyday during my stay. I (we) stayed there for 3 nights. Service: Checking in and checking out were a breeze. They were all very efficient and gracious. Housing keeping was efficient. There was downtown service as well. Recommendation: I definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. I would stay here again in the future. I find that for the price of $260/night (including tax) I paid for, it offered a really good value. The same hotel category in Midtown probably will cost twice as much, if not more. I booked my through Hilton website. I remember that some other previous post mentioned that it costs lots. I think I lucked out by booking early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gazorniplatz
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York city to attend a wedding and I spent weeks researching online and agonizing where to stay as I read all sorts of horror stories about bad hotel experiences in NY City. Because I noted that the Millenium Hilton got consistently high ratings from most guests I decided to take the advice of the TripAdvisor Members and book my Memorial Weekend stay there even though it's location was quite far from where the rehearsal dinner and wedding were to take place. I am glad that I did!! The hotel and rooms are as gorgeous as the pictures in Trip Advisor and Travelocity! The location one of the quietest spots in NY. Hardly any traffic noise could be heard from my room. I don't know if it being Memorial Day weekend had anything to do with the low noise as there were workmen at the ground zero site and plenty of people in the streets but at any rate, the low noise level worked out fine for me. The hotel decor was modern and the entire facility looked very well kept. The carpeting was plush and all the brass and glass surfaces sparkled. The hotel also has its own garage for guest parking . My room was a little bit bigger in size than my home's master bedroom which I understand from some of the reviews I've read here is big by NY standards. It boasted a very large (Queen I think) and extremely comfortable bed with lots and lots of fluffy pillows and a long "sausage" pillow which is perfect for folks that like to wrap themselves around a pillow for support. The room and carpet were clean. There was also a large flat screenss stereo tv that was equipped with both a wireless keyboard (for internet surfing) and game controls for playing video games. The tv system would also allow the viewing and purchase of movies but I don't know the prices because I did not choose to use any of those features but I'm sure that you could run up quite a bill. There was a well stocked mini bar with beer, soda and snacks but because they're notoriously expensive I didn't dare consume any of them. There was also a dresser with two empty drawers for storing your stuff. There were two telephones. One in the bathroom and a cordless two line model next to the bed. There were two separate reading lamps on each side of the bed and a very simple to use alarm/clock radio with your choice of sounds to wake up to. There was also a writing desk that was equipped with two jacks for internet access for laptop computers. One jack was for a regular phone line modem and the second one was for DSL access. Next to the desk was a table that held an ice bucket, a wine bottle opener and glasses and an coffeemaker with cups and coffee supplies. There were also two comfy chairs, an ottoman a small table and new issues of two NY entertainment guide magazines. Next to the bed inside the night stand's drawer was a free paperback copy of Conrad HIlton's autobiography which I'm still reading. The room had it's own climate control for the a/c heat system and it worked flawlessly at keeping the room at the temperature that I set it to. There are no keys for the doors of the suites, instead you get a credit sized electronic "key" that unlocks the door for you. In my "standard" room there was also a full length mirror and plenty of lighting and seating. Two features of my room impressed me. The well appointed closet and bathroom. The well appointed closet held, a folding suitcase stand, a large umbrella with the Hilton logo and around 4 or 10 thick wooden hangers. A couple had clips for holding skirts, a couple had trouser bars and two were thickly padded ones of the type for holding evening dresses. There was also an iron and ironing board in the closet and on the top shelf your very own electronically controlled combination safe for your valuables. The bathroom was very well lit. It had a very large mirror and an illuminated magnifying makeup mirror that swiveled. There was also a hair dryer. The faux marble counter ran the entire length of the bathroom so you had lots of room for your toiletries. It also included a nicely appointed bathroom set which included facial tissue, drinking glasses and Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries (mouthwash, shampoo, hair conditioner, a shower cap, bubble bath and body lotion and bar soap) and lots and lots of fluffy towels. The shower/ tub had a swiveling shower head that you could adjust to deliver either a full stream of water or a pulsating shower massage. The water was plentiful as either ice cold or scalding hot and the water pressure was just fine. The toilet was one of the quietest flushing models I've ever heard and worked flawlessly. From my window I had a great view of ground zero and the window curtains could be adjusted to let in either a lot of light or shut it out completely. I was on the 17th floor and could hardly hear any of the traffic below. The downtown location is excellent. Hilton provided in each room a folded pocket sized map of NY city with indicators for different businesses in the immediate area as well as the locations and routes of the subway system. This little jewel of a map was my lifeline and guide during my entire stay in NYC. Meals in the hotel (like in any hotel) are expensive ($22.00 for breakfast) but there are lots of inexpensive diners in the area. Right in the next block was the "Stage Door Deli" (open 7 days) where I got one of the biggest and best breakfasts I've ever had (2 scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast and coffee) for only $7.00 and their sandwiches are excellent! There are also the ever present hot dog carts on almost every corner where you can get really delicious hot dogs, shishkebabs or pretzels for a very reasonable price. Next to the hotel is a large discount dept store (21st Century) so if you forgot to pack something like a shirt or tie or socks or shoes you could shop there for designer brands at discount prices. The subway was less than a 1/2 block away and easy to navigate. A one way fare is only $2.00 but you can buy a "fun pass" for $7.00 which gives you unlimited rides all day. However, if you choose to take a taxi to where the action is (Central Park area) I found that it will set you back around $22.00 plus tip because remember, the Millenium is waaaayyyyy downtown in the financial district. A taxi ride to the airports - I was told- can cost you as much as $55.00 plus tolls, plus tax plus tip so I chose to ride in and out of Newark Airport on the super shuttle van service which costs only $17.00 plus tax and tip. BTW you can make reservations with Super Shuttle airport van service by toll free phone or online. Their only drawback is that because the shuttle goes around picking up passengers in other hotels besides you they will require that you be ready to check out quite a few hours before your flight. For example, my flight departed at 11:00 am but their pickup time for me by the shuttle was 7:30 But, it was a reasonable trade off for the savings. And their service was really, really good. They even telephoned a "reminder" of my reservation to my cellphone and their cancellation policy is reasonable if your travel plans change. The Millenium Hilton hotel lobby is very nicely decorated in modern style and had a small but well appointed gift shop. They looked as good as in the pictures shown on line. The lobby also had a bar at the other end but I didn't patronize it so I can't critique it. The hotel also had a gym, a restaurant and I think that it also had a pool but I didn't check them out. Overnight shoe shine service was also available. One lobby feature that I liked was a touch screen kiosk where you could punch in your flight information and a printed boarding pass would pop out for your convenience. On the back end of the block from the hotel were a Dunkin Donuts, several small diners and a big CVS pharmacy. Around two blocks down from the hotel was a Barney's Men's clothing store (another NY institution). Chinatown and Little Italy neighborhoods were a brisk walking distance away and in those areas I encountered loud traffic and massive flocks of people spilling from the sidewalks walking cheek & jowl making me glad that I didn't pick a hotel in those areas! I wanted quiet and I got it at the Millenium. A short walk to the other side of ground zero across from the hotel and you were walking by the bay and I could see the statue of Liberty at a distance. Water taxi and sightseeing services are available in the area. I read a lot of horror stories about NY hotels trying to stick its guests with padded bills for minibar snacks that were not consumed or treating a customer poorly because they booked their room thru a discount service like travelocity but that didn't happen to me at the Millenium. When I telephoned ahead from my room to advise the front desk that I was checking out a very nice lady at the the other end told me that I had incurred no additional charges and that the prepaid travelocity bill had covered everything in my stay. All I had to do at checkout was to drop off my electronic room key at the front desk and just and walk out the door (didn't even had to sign anything) to my waiting ride never encountering any pushy doormen or bellboys. They were all very pleasant, courteous and helpful.
