The concierges Justin and Mark bent over backwards in giving me directions to my travel and shopping destinations and the bellhops and front desk personnel were just as attentive, pleasant and polite. There are other Hilton hotels in NY and I can't honestly say that all of them treat their guests the same way or have the same amenities but I did enjoy my stay in the big apple at the Millenium Hilton and I definitely recommend them and I would stay there again on my next visit to NYC. 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ou_chot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this locale over Memorial Weekend. Very helpful staff. Was a litte concerned about the location, but found it to be ok. Right next to a subway stop, which is great. Room was 1 king bed w/ a 40+inch flat screen, which was a nice touch. Room was well decorated and decent size. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: caughtthetravelbug
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic short break in New York at stayed at the Millenium Hilton, while it was quite expensive, you definately get your money's worth. We had a junior suite which was immaculate, the maid service was excellent. I found the staff to be very helpful and polite and nothing appeared to be too much trouble for them. The pool and sauna were lovely, although the water was very cold! The restaurant was lovely, although I struggled to find something I wanted on the menu, ended up with a salad which was very nice. Location was excellent, the subway was right nearby and taxis from Times Square (for when we were feeling lazy in the evening) were reasonably cheap. It was a great base to explore New York from and I totally enjoyed my stay there. I'd definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_2002uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton for a long weekend last April for my birthday. The hotel is as you would expect from Hilton - an excellent standard of cleanliness and great service. I particularly liked the 42" plasma tv on the wall and the floor to ceiling windows which overlooked the World Trade Center site. Our room was on the 43rd floor, and at first I didn't enjoy the lift rides up and down and didn't think I could settle knowing we were so high from the ground but you soon get used to it! The drinks from the mini bar were so expensive we kept well clear but if you did touch anything, it would automatically charge to your room. We didn't use the pool or gym as we ran out of time but we had a look around and it looked fantastic. With regard to the location of this hotel, it is right in the heart of the financial district, overlooking the World Trade Center, and with subway stops nearby, it is so easy to get to anywhere in midtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly as it is the place I got engaged!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and View”
Reviews.Author: citychicky
Reviews.Content: I tried Priceline for the first time as we were going to the city for my birthday and wanted to stay somewhere for one night. I won a room here (4 star downtown in Priceline terms) for 200.00 per night. I used to work 2 blocks away so never really thought of staying here for a night out since it wouldnt seem like a "get away" necessarily but we were pleasantly surprised by our experience. The front desk was very friendly and our check in and out experience couldnt have been faster. We had a room on the 35th floor that overlooked the WTC site and the Hudson. The beds was incredibly comfortable, the tv was large and new with a good selection of channels and the bathroom was large and very clean. I do have two small negatives that I would point out. The first is that we were at the end of the hallway and there are three doors at the end of the hallway plus the staff work room so it was quite noisy with people coming and going. I could hear the noise from the hall a lot while inside the room so I ended up putting a towel under the door to try to muffle outside noise a bit. The second negative is that the mini bar refrigerator has sensors in it and so if you even move something to fit in your leftovers (as we did) they know and you will be charged for it. Luckily I saw the note that tells you this and so called to remove the charges from the bill before we left. However, if i hadnt, i would have been charged for two drinks (over 15 dollars) that we didnt take. I understand the technology makes it easy for them but future occupants should be aware of this. A note to those considering this hotel: there is very little "late night" activity in the area. We were going to the film festival which ended after midnight and had to cab north to find somewhere to go after the movie had ended. That said, my husband continues to rave about the hotel and called it an A+ several times during the weekend. It is a lovely and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Millenium!”
Reviews.Author: stephr721
Reviews.Content: I got a wonderful deal on the Millenium Hilton through Priceline. I only had 30 hours in the city and I'm so glad I stayed here. The concierge staff was wonderful and very helpful. The front desk, bell and doormen staff were all very friendly as well. The rooms were clean, stylish and stocked with all the right amenities, including a very cool plasma TV. Stayed on the 22nd floor with a birds-eye view of Ground Zero. The hotel is right across from the PATH station and right near the subway which was very convenient. Its location right off Broadway was also convenient for walking to where I needed to go. I'm heading back again next month and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: magi2379
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights the end of March and beginning of April for vacation in the city I love. I work in the industry and am very familiar with the ins and outs of hotels, and I found nothing lacking here. It's a beautiful hotel in a great downtown location. The rooms are well equipped, nicely furnished and spacious. The bathrooms are also very nice room enough for two while using the sink vanity area. There are also safes in the room to keep your items in should you need it. But the best are the beds, the new line the Hiltons are using by Serta i swear are the nicest i have ever slept on. Convenient walking to the South Street Seaport, Chinatown, Little Italy, but you don't have the traffic at night like staying in Midtown or the Times Square area. The Subway is pretty accessible as well, depends on the line and the construction that is going on right now like another person said, read the signs they have posted! We were able to check in early as our flight arrived early afternoon and stored our luggage at the end of our stay until we were ready to go to the airport. Staff was very kind and helpful as well, dont be afraid to ask for help. And to top it off the views are wonderful, i have stayed in midtown and looked at the direct side of another high rise, so comming in to our room and looking directly at the river and ground zero was awesome. Like I said it was a fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rickard
Reviews.Content: Obviously this hotel have a problem with the front desk staff, me and my family stayed here for one night the 21 April and we where really disappointed how the front desk staff treated us and the other guys who tried to check in. But if we forget that little problem then we must say that this hotel is still one of the best we have stayed at in the US. The rooms are really clean and comfortable and we liked that we had a corner room with a great view. We like that it’s possible to open a small window to hear all the sounds that New York have to offer. We stayed here last year and then we also had a really great stay. Take the train from Newark airport to WTC instead of using the really expensive and crazy driving taxi cars and save 50$ one way, there are service personnel at the ticketing machines at the airport who can help you to get the right tickets.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: Alain71268
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Millenium Hilton for 3 nights (paying with the Hilton Honors Rewards plan). I got a huge corner room on the 49th floor, well equiped with a large TV (flat screen) & offering a level of confort that was above my expectations. Not saying the stunning view I had on the Brooklyn / Manhanttan Bridges and ground Zero. Breakfast was included in the reward (but would not have paid the extra 20 USD it costs). You have a Starbucks Coffee on the corner of the street/ opposite to Century 21. Outstanding service, staff always paid a lot of attention to my requests... I liked the location as well. Much less crowded than in Middtown/ Times Square. Very convenient as well for those who wish to have an easy access to SOHO, West/East Village. Be aware that Line E is sometimes not operating from the WTC subway station during the weekend due to reconstruction work. However, lot of alternatives remains available. Thumbs up for the Millenium Hilton Hotel that I would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendylynn68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for 3 nights. We thought it was a great place. Staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and new. Our bed was exceptionally comfortable. We had a 38th floor view directly down on the World Trade Center site. This was quite sobering, but also gave us the opportunity to appreciate the magnitiude more than looking at it from ground level. As others have said, this is definitely a quieter part of the city. If you are looking for lots of action around you, this is not the part of town to stay in. However, there are several close subway stops and we found that almost any part of town could be reached within a 15 minute subway ride. We definitely would recommend the Millenium Hotel to anyone looking for top-notch accomodations in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week on business. The room had everything one would expect plus a large flat screen television. Room overlooked Ground Zero....I think most do. If you are interested in exercise you are close to Battery Park and the exercise path near the west side highway. I got 4 or 5 miles of jogging in without feeling stressed about dodging traffic. Lower Manhattan is still not "right" and certainly lacks the evening options of midtown. But if you must stay in the area this hotel works.

Reviews.Title: “Turned my wife away with hotels.com reservation”
Reviews.Author: davidlsharpe
Reviews.Content: The hotel front desk turned my wife away although she had a valid and paid hotels.com reservation. I have never had a problem with hotels.com before. Nice work, Hilton. : (

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great area.”
Reviews.Author: LSelway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Mar 31 - April 4th 2007. The hotel is of excellent quality. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are even nicer. The bathroom is roomy and comes equipped with Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. The room I stayed in had 2 beds, as my party had 4 people. The beds are a bit too small for 2 people to sleep in, so we added a roll-away bed to give us more space. Requesting 2 rollaways was of no success, as they said it is a fire hazard. Understandable. The extra bed was 25 dollars a nite, but we were not charged due to my mother being a Hilton employee (at another Hilton). The room had internet access at 5 dollars a day. I did not find that unreasonable, at all, as the internet helped us get directions for where we were going each day. We had a view of ground zero out our window on the 29th floor. The first evening we were there we ate at the hotel restaurant, Church & Dey. The food was good, but expensive. I would not eat there again, but like I said - the food was good. The area the hotel is in is a quiet one - the financial district. It was nice to return to a quiet area after a long day of crowds.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in NY”
Reviews.Author: MistyLaw2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend sightseeing in New York. Firstly, it is downtown, near Wall Street and overlooks Ground Zero. It is away from the buzz of midtown which I liked. There is a subway stop directly outside the hotel main entrance which takes about 10 mins to get to Times Square. It is a skyscraper so rooms on the upper floors have fantastic views. Rooms are what I'd expect of a Hilton, clean, fairly spacious and modern with a massive flatscreen, not that I watched much TV. I didn't eat at the hotel other than one night I ordered room service which was prompt but expensive. I ate breakfast at the Panini deli just round the corner, try the pancakes! I would definitely stay here again as after a busy day uptown it was nice to come back to a quietish area.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton - Great rooms! Great views! Grumpy Front desk people”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I've been flying to New York for business every few weeks. I'm trying to hit several different hotels in different areas I need to be in. This time I had several meetings in the Financial District so I booked this hotel. I knew the view would be great but maybe a little strange since the World Trade Center is no longer in front of it. You see, this hotel is located right behind where the World Trade Center used to be. I fly from Buenos Aires so it's a LONG 10+ hour flight. Even flying in Business Class to JFK is no comfort and after a long flight I like to go right to the room. I arrived very early around 6:30 am. I encountered a very grumpy middle aged man that didn't even offer a "good morning". I gave him my name and reservation number and I also showed him my Hilton HHonors Gold VIP card. I have spent a LOT of money with Hilton hotels around the world but this didn't seem to matter to this guy. He didn't even look at it. I inquired about checking in early and he said "no it's impossible". He didn't say anything like "I'm sorry Mr. X all the rooms are occupied". Or any other explanation. He simply said that check-in is at 2 PM and that was that. It was only 6:30 am and I was exhausted since I didn't sleep on the long flight. I was going to wait in the lounge but the chairs are not comfortable and the lounge area really isn't that nice. I checked my bag and decided to go have breakfast and do some shopping. I stayed out until about 1 PM. I was a few blocks away but usually not in this area and I didn't know it well. I called the hotel to ask for directions and said "I know I'm only a few blocks away...can you help". The guy that answered the phone said that he couldn't help and transferred me to what I'm assuming is the concierge desk and no one answered the phone. I was furious. I asked a police officer and he kindly pointed me in the right direction. I get to the hotel and it's 2 PM now. I see there is still no one at the concierge desk. It's very rude when a guest is calling to get directions and you simply transfer it to an empty desk. It would have taken him all of 10 seconds to explain where the hotel was. So I get to the front desk and they give me my key. I go to get my checked bag and I had a big bag plus all the bags I had from shopping (and I did a LOT of shopping). The bellboy (or I should say middle aged man) just handed me my suitcase and didn't even offer to help me take it to my room. This is extremely unprofessional. So this was 3 things now all before I even got to my room that I was not happy about. Someone definitely needs to do a customer service seminar for these employees. This is not a way to treat a customer that frequents their many hotels around the world. I get to my room and my bad mood goes away once I see the view. They put me on the 49th floor and I have an amazing view! It's very very strange to see the big hole where the World Trade Center was. I snapped some photos that I don't know if they will allow me to post on Trip Advisor since it's not the hotel but of the view. The room size is extremely big for a New York City hotel. I guess for the u$s 350+/night range you get mostly small hotel rooms here in NYC but this was very spacous with a King size bed. The room had a 42'inch Plasma/LCD TV which was a great touch. I do the same thing in my properties that I have for rent and people really appreciate these things. The bathroom was a good size as well. Nothing luxurious but it was at least spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable with great pillows as well. I stayed a few nights and used the room service and each time they were very quick. I'd say the food was delivered in less than 30 minutes each time. The food quality was ok as well. The prices on the menu don't seem too expensive but then remember they add on like $4 service fee + 15% tip which is also fairly common these days. I'm here getting ready to check-out. I must have just gotten a grumpy check-in guy. I just called down to let them know that I didn't use anything in my mini-bar and there were at least 4 things on my bill. The nice guy that answered (said his name was Robert) was very friendly and explained that the refrigerators have motion sensors that detect if you take something out. I did move some things around to put in some water that I had but put them back in. I thought that was interesting and never heard of that before so make sure you check your bills at the check-out. I asked Robert if I could have a late check-out and he said "sure, no problem. What time did you want to check-out. I told him I just needed a few extra hours. 2 PM would be fine and he said not a problem. Now that is good customer service and very friendly. He sounded younger and was much friendlier than the grumpy old guy at the check-in. All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel. If they got rid of the grumpy ole guy at the check-in and trained their staff to be a little friendlier than I'd say it's highly recommended. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: ckarp73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night but were impressed immediately upon entering the establishment. The staff was friendly and although we arrived a few hours earlier than check-in time, we were able to go straight to our room on the 24th floor. The view was absolutely breathtakingly beautiful yet sad (WTC) at the same time. The bed was so comfy and the bathroom was spacious and immaculate. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_needed_now
Reviews.Content: I used tripadvisor reviews to help chose this hotel for our stay in New York and was very pleased with the choice. The hotel is very comfortable, with everything you need for a great stay. The rooms were very modern with comfy beds, good coffee makers and marble bathrooms. The decor is modern and pleasant. We enjoyed a couple of early morning swims in the pool. When full of children (Saturday afternoon) the pool was bit less enjoyable, as it's really quite small. Once we'd worked out how to navigate the subway we found the hotel's location was excellent. It is easy to get to several subway lines, including the express which took us to Bloomingdales in only minutes. We only ate a couple of times at the hotel. Breakfast was much better and cheaper at the nearby Stage door deli. We had a very enjoyable dinner at the hotel restaurant, but it was comparatively expensive. The hotel staff were very helpful from the concierge who recommended a great restaurant one night and helped with directions and queries, to the front desk who helped me check in on line for our return flight. I would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some negative points”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on the 48th floor, overlooking the WTC site. Fantastic views and the room was a very generous size, including a small lounge area with a second TV, sofa and desk. The 42" plasma is certainly the largest screen I've seen in a hotel room but there is no inroom WiFi, just an ethernet cable connection that you pay for. You can detect over a dozen WiFi networks but you can't connect to them! The bathroom wasn't small either although the fittings looked a little dated. The bed was wide and very comfortable, with good pillows too. There's also a free safe which is always one of the main items I look for. The breakfast buffet was of a good standard but they have a la carte too. Dinner was slightly disappointing although that may have been due to my choice of dish. Costs aren't too high either. Negatives: the air-con system made a lot of noise, even when switched off. This may be a one-off and as I will probably stay here again for work, I shall update my review next time. The lack of WiFi, even if I could pay for it, was annoying, considering the typical guest is most likely a business traveller, judging by the occupants at breakfast. My final gripe is aimed at this and many other hotels; they all leave cards indicating their commitment to protecting the environment, asking you to reuse towels and save water etc. However, even if you don't leave towels in the bathtub, they still change everything every day! And it smacks of hypocrisy when they use 8 lightbulbs in the bathroom, although I did detect energy saving bulbs elsewhere in the room. The surrounding area is a bit shabby so take a taxi or the metro for your shopping and dining needs. Overall, it's a good hotel that could improve on a couple of areas but it's best suited to business travellers. Tourists are better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “reliable, comfortable, classy”
Reviews.Author: enaj47
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at this hotel in 2 years. Every room has a great view and a great tv (and we don't watch much tv)! The lower Manhattan location is not a liability. There is great subway service or taxi's to midtown or beyond. From the hotel, you can easily walk to Chinatown ( we love NY Noodle Town, Bowery at Bayard). Strolling along the Hudson in Battery Park is wonderful and safe. NY is a great city and will not disappoint! To save money, park at the Gateway Hilton in Newark and take the PATH to NYC for $1.50 You will be right across the street from the Milennium..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndreLisbon
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to NY and my 1st stay at The Millenium Hilton. I went to a congress in Westchester on March, 2 and 3 and my wife joined me after that for a whole week in the city. Wow, we had fun and the hotel was one of the reasons why we're still missing our week at The Big Apple. I had the warmest check in welcome of my life! Rooms, Housekeeping, Room Service, Front Desk, Staff in general, they're all fabulous! Liquis Assets Bar was also great for drinks before dinner. But, most of all, location seems to be the huge secret of the place. There are a few subway lines (some of them express lines) nearby which take you midtown or uptown in a few minutes (Lines 4 & 5 express trains). Anyway, the Financial Distric is very close to great spots like South Seaport, Soho, Lower East Side and even East and Greenwich Village. These are the places to go with their trendy restaurants and bars, nightlife and fun. But if you prefer the traditional touristic spots in Midtown and fancy the Upper East side...well, just take the 4 or 5 subway lines! There's a 4 storey shop just round the corner where you can buy almost everything to wear. Battery Park's also very close and there are some museums, bars and shops if you must stay downtown. Breakfast's very expensive though, but you can have it at so many places nearby. My wife and I will surely be back to this hotel next time we come to NY. Definately! Anna and Andre, Lisbon, Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Groupworker
Reviews.Content: This hotel, directly across from Ground Zero and in the financial district, surpassed our expectations on all levels. The staff is obviously well trained and always went beyond our requests (except for a few mistakes on subway directions). The hotel looks recently remodeled (great contemporary colors), the room was the largest I've ever stayed in NYC, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom nice, etc. I would highly recommend the Hilton Millenium if your price range is under $300.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cricri7
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a stay at the Millenium Hilton and everything was almost perfect. I booked our stay through Hotwire. I booked a room for myself and one for my parents. We each got our rooms at 149$ and 153$ respectively. You cannot beat that price for the Millenium Hilton. We arrived by car and were really well received by the valet parking agent. A doorman helped us immediately with our luggage. I was anxious to see how the staff would act with us because our stay was booked through hotwire and that we had such a low price. There was nothing under 230$ if we booked through their website. The person at the front desk was professional and courteous and did not give us any attitude about the fact that we had not booked through them. We arrived at noon and we each got our rooms immediately. The rooms are spotless! We were located on the 31st and 33rd floors and had a view of Ground zero. Even my mother who is afraid of heights enjoyed the view! The rooms were always made up and bath products were replenished immediately. The only glitch I can find is that I had turn down service, with chocolates on the pillow and bottles of water, but my parents did not get it. The toilet made a dripping noise sometimes, but I just had to close the door and I did not hear it. I would recommand this hotel to everyone because with the subway and the buses, and walking also, you can get to anywhere in a short period of time. Book through Hotwire and you will save lots of money!

Reviews.Title: “To Much Attitude and Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Zacharymia
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly for business. The attitude from the employees seems to get worse and worse each time. You would think you were staying in a posh boutique hotel in SOHO. The hotel itself is nice and rooms are great, but beware of the hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Stay at the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: erinlee
Reviews.Content: We loved the Millenium Hilton. It's right across the street from Ground Zero which is very humbling but Americans need to be humbled every now and then right? Anyways, the hotel rooms are very nice and comfortable. The service is lacking. I'm sure its just the New Yorker way of life but they are always hurrying you and making you rush through, check in, check out, on the phone, etc. I wouldn't say they are rude but very in a hurry as all of New York is. We got tired waiting on the ball to drop on New Years so we just went back to the hotel and watched on TV and there were fireworks outside our window. It was great. The elevators are REALLY fast. Just a warning!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: lolo51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for four nights in February. The employees couldn't have been more helpful (with the exception of the restaurant staff). Upon arrival, the front desk was friendly, courteous and informative. My husband's a diamond member, so we were upgraded to a Junior Suite, with complementary breakfast vouchers. The room was wonderful - actually two rooms, with a plasma tv, luxurious king bed with soft, quality linens and a housekeeping staff that couldn't have been more efficient. The room had a view of Ground Zero - this didn't bother us at all. It is quite sobering but also uplifting in seeing the way New Yorkers seem to be able to handle anything they're given. My respect and admiration truly goes out to the people of this city - it is truly the greatest city on earth! The consierge couldn't have been more helpful - any question you presented him with he answered, or at least tried. Elevators were prompt - rarely had to wait at all, going up or down. Yes, the lobby is small and the lounge could be a bit larger, but if this is the only thing wrong - please. The location of this hotel is just fine - a subway station 100 feet from the entrance. The subways are quite safe and a great way to get around, but if you're subway-shy, taxi's are abundant all around this hotel. However, we found it difficult getting one - we were there when the weather was quite cold and they all seemed to be occupied! So the subway it was, with no problems at all. Being downtown, I agree with a previous review wholeheartedly - it is quiet down here and away from the craziness of Times Square - you couldn't pay me to stay there! My only complaint towards this hotel is the miserable, bored, unhappy, unpleasant wait staff in the restaurant. And the breakfast ...... if we had to pay for that food....something like $29/person for a breakfast buffet that was as cold as ice coming directly from the kitchen! The eggs were stone cold, as was the bacon, sausage, potatoes, etc. My advice - go somewhere else - anywhere else - for breakfast. Never gave lunch or dinner a chance - too many other great restaurants in this city. We are planning another trip this April and we already have reservations to return here. This is a great hotel in a great city and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: balesbrowne
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel at the beginning of February for two nights. We loved it the first time and when we booked to go back to new York we didn't even think twice of another hotel. Upon arrival were given a room on the 42nd floor overlooking ground zero with fantastic views over the river and skyline of new york. Rooms were very comfortable, not at all small compared to alot of new york hotels, with a very large comfortable bed and lots of bathroom toiletries. Check out was at 12 but unfortunately my husband was ill so after letting the conceirge know, they very kindly said we could stay in the hotel at no further cost until he was well enough to leave which was much appreciated. Overall fantastic hotel, great views and very accomodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: brokerchick
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are large and nice, and the views are remarkable but not nearly enough to make up for the awful service I received 2/15-2/17/07. Upon arrival the doorman did not come to the curb to assist me with my luggage - normally this wouldn't be a big deal to me but with the wind gusting and snow on the ground, it irked me this time. My room was large, clean and well-appointed. All was well until I attempted to open the mini-bar, which was stuck. A call downstairs informed me that they "had problems with that particular room and would send someone right up." Maintenance arrived within 10 min but it's annoying not to be told of the problem in advance when management knows about it. On my second evening I had trouble establishing an internet connection; again, a call downstairs informed "that particular room doesn't have internet connectivity" and they offered to move me to another room. At this point I spoke to the manager who denied that anyone had any prior knowledge of the lack of internet connection in that particular room - whatever - I went ahead and moved rooms. I checked out Saturday morning at 6:30am and asked the desk clerk whether I would be able to hail a cab at that hour or if I was better off calling for one. I was told that the doorman (who was nowhere to be seen at that moment) could hail a cab for me. It's 6:30am on a SATURDAY, there is NO ONE else in the lobby, yet the desk clerk seems to feel it's beneath his station to accommodate my request for help in getting a cab. I will never stay here again - the service and attention to detail is minimal at best, and the staff is barely apologetic when their lack of attention causes disruption to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious (for downtown NY) room with a view”
Reviews.Author: JRZ_GYRL
Reviews.Content: New York is one of the few cities where I consistently book my hotels through Hotwire, or a similar service, simply because I get value for my dollar in a city where hotel prices are exorbitant. I have yet to be disappointed. The staff were wonderfully friendly, and the room was clean and attractively furnished. In fact, it was unusually spacious for its location. It had a huge flat-screen TV, nice amenities, and a sweeping but sobering view of Ground Zero. A friend who visited commented that she would find it difficult to look down at that view every day. I, however, was moved by what I saw and was thankful for being able to see the entire vista of where the Towers once stood, from high above the ground. The downside, as a tourist, is that a downtown location like this can seem remote at times. I would definitely return to the hotel, especially if I had to conduct business downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Can't lose with this one”
Reviews.Author: rtravels
Reviews.Content: I'm adding to the chorus of accolades. We've stayed in Times Square before and won't do it again after staying downtown. The Millenium Hilton was like an oasis after busy days and nights on the town. You are close to SOHO and a fairly short subway ride to midtown. The subway station could not be more convenient. At first, it's a little strange being neighbors to the World Trade Center site...it will fill up your view out the window. But I certainly wouldn't let that fact discourage anyone from staying here. The rooms are huge by NYC standards and we loved the enormous plasma screen tv and the no-attitude friendly service. By the way, we got this on Priceline for what we considered a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Declining but still OK for NYC.”
Reviews.Author: genevatraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Hilton in NYC five times between 2003 and 2006 and still appreciate this hotel even if it used to be better a couple of years ago. First I like the modern and original architecture of the hotel; then the location in the financial district and on walking distance to the seaport is convenient; the rooms are well-decorated, modern and big enough; the service at front desk is good and the concierge very helpfull. But during my last stays I noticed that the room-prices went up quite a bit and that the value-for-money is not so good anymore as it used to be. Plus their were some anoying works in the lobby and the main entrance was closed. The lobby is indeed very small for this huge hotel and seems now a bit outdated - a renovation would be welcome. Finally I was disapointed by the breakfast which used to be good but now the waiters simply don't care about you at all and I have been waiting at the bar 15 minutes before a table was ready (even if their were plenty of empty uncleaned tables) ... Millenium Hilton is still OK if you need to stay in the financial district but you should find as good or even better elsewere in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: CTtravelerFFldCounty
Reviews.Content: I loved the Millenium Hilton. The rates were great and the hotel was beautiful and clean. Great rates for weekend getaway. Located in the financial district but only a cabride away from main attractions. This location was great because you don't hear the busy NYC streets and sirens. Staff was great. Beware of roomservice and breakfast it was very pricey. I would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Minted”
Reviews.Author: mallabev
Reviews.Content: quick simply a total dream from day 1. i apsolutely loved this place. me and my girlfriend stayed from 30th dec to 4th jan and dont have 1 negative comment to make. The rooms are spotless and decor is very classy for the price. Our bed was fantastic too :) Overall i recommend this hotel. Only slight drawback is the financial district location. Just grab a C train and your in Uptown in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and despite being downtown easy to get anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: 6andy6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2nd January till the 7th. Lobby has bar and shop, cafe/restaurant on 3rd floor. two enterances, one on Church st and one on Dey st. Corner room with windows on each side - good view uptown over Greenwich Village/Soho to the Empire State Building (gr8 lit up at night) on one side and over to City Hall and the Brooklyn Bridge on the other. Plasma screen tv with all the usual cable channels and a built in internet browser (fee). Very tall (53 levels) but narrow building. Hence only about 15 rooms each level (or so it seemed). Despite previous reviews never heard any construction noise (we were away from ground zero but facing the apartment building which is a little way away). We were however on the 49th level. room furnishings in good condition, bathroom relatively large as was the room. King size bed, desk and seating area with space for more furniture if they put it in...so no problem with size. Room service cost was reasonable and definately cheaper than other hotels..infact cost wise sometimes it was just as cheap to eat in than at a restaurant/cafe. Local area is offices but there are a numbe rof eateries within walking distance and shops/drug stores/Borders. Path station and subway (World Trade Centre and Chambers st) across rd and City Hall subway station a short walk away which covers most destinations (Soho, Greenwich Village, Chelsea, Uptown). Walking distance to Battery Park and ferry to Ellis Island and Statute of Liberty and South Sea seaport. All in all happy with location and price...rather stayed here than the hotels around Times Square which while in the centre of things looked very tacky, convention like and, well nosiy..even the chain ones. Two downsides were the buffet breakfast..prob one of the worse I have come across for variety of any hotel of this class. And no tea/coffee facilities in room ..unheard of in this class anywhere else in the world. Upside were the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: CharlesLondon1
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Style, Space and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mcsimanowith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Millenium for a weekend getaway before Xmas. We chose this based on good reviews and because it was one of the more reasonable accomodations given that we were smack in the middle of the holidays. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. Positives * Our room was quite spacious particularly in NYC where I have stayed in rooms which I could touch all 4 walls. * We had a beautiful view overlooking the WT Center site and across the river. * Plasma TV was great, bathroom clean, and bed quite comfortable. * The front desk staff were professional and efficient which is all I need. Get me in and get me out. * The concierge was attentive to everyone - he offered us advice on how to get to the play we were seeing, sites we were interested in and suggestions on where to eat. All were excellent. Also held our luggage on checkout day so we could do some extra sight seeing. Negatives * There was a bit of "riff raff" that hung around outside the hotel selling junk but it's a city so what do you expect - we never felt threatened. * Parking is outragous. We spent 85 bucks for under 2 days not including tip. * The hotel is about as far downtown as you can go without being in NJ which for some might be a drawback. However, the train and Path are right outside the hotel and fairly easy to navigate - ask someone if you need help. The first time an attendant walked us through the whole ticket process, told us where to go etc. from then on we had no problem. (The train isn't as nice or easy to use as Wash DC Metro but it was fine. I recommend an all day pass its like 7 bucks and after 2 rides you basically make your money) All in all this was a fantastic trip and I would not hesitate to suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great City”
Reviews.Author: Del-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Millenium Hilton from the 29th of December through to the 8th of January. Firstly, the connections to everthing here are excellent, we took the subway to and from the airport, it only takes 45 mins not sure how long a cab takes but it is around $45, the subway is 2. The subway is also excellent for getting uptown with the 'E' dropping you right next to Macys in 34th or times square at 42nd or right up to the rockerfeller on 53rd all for 2 bucks, if your making a couple of trips a day as we did it saves alot of money on 15 - 20 buck cabs. The hotel was excellent we never had to wait long to check in and as I had requested on the hilton website when booking I got a high floor room on the 49th floor. Our room over looked ground zero out to new jersey, the view was excellent, we found that the noise was no problem unless you opened the window, though the air conditioning unit was noisy at night. The pool and sauna were nice though the buisness suite with the internet for hire was expensive, try to find an internet cafe. The only complaint I have is not to do with the hotel as such but the location I found to be a bit of a hassle, though the subway is right outside, if you were shopping up 5th avenue or in around times squre it was a bit of a trek to come back to the hotel for a change of clothes or to drop off bags etc, it was also harder to find pubs and resteraunts within walking distance. Overall though i would definatly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MelbMom3
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Millenium was great! The room was clean and fortunately we were able to stay in one of the larger rooms on our floor. It is quiet on weekend mornings and the noise from Ground Zero was never a problem. The staff was always polite. Very convenient to the subway. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Oh, and when searching for a hotel I had a hard time finding one that didn't have a review stating there were bed bugs. The Millenium Hilton was one of the few-no bed bugs in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Dulce
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton from Thursday (Jan 4th) until Sunday (Jan 8th) and we absolutely loved it!! I asked him to book this hotel after I saw all the reviews on here, and we really didn't feel like staying in Midtown. We arrived in NYC from DC three whole hours before check in time and I convinced my boyfriend to ask the front desk if we could check in early and they let us...we were very grateful for that. We booked a King room with city views (we were on the 50th floor) and our view was AMAZING (especially at night). The hotel room was immaculately clean and very spacious. This was the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in, even on Saturday night it was quiet. Maybe it had something to do with being on the 50th floor. I will say that I think I could hear when people took showers, it sounded like water running in a house. At times that was annoying, but after a while I guess I kind of got used to it. The cleaning service was excellent, our room was just as nice as the first day we checked in whenever we came back. We did eat at the restaurant on the 3rd floor. We actually only got to eat lunch there, and it was mediocre. I expected a little more. But other than the mediocre lunch, the hotel was amazing. Check in was speedy (less than 5 minutes), it was very easy to get a cab, canal street was in walking distance, there are 2 subway stops within very close walking proximity. I really could just go on and on about this hotel, but I won't, lol. I will DEFINITELY stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with city views......”
Reviews.Author: Holly's_Parents
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 7 nights (27th Dec to 3rd Jan) after reading the reviews on trip advisor...... Our room was a King Bed room on the 33rd Floor with City views ( inc. WTC site ) Yes it does get a bit noisy daytime, but NYC is noisy all the time. AirCon fan was noisy, but liveable ( others have said the same ) but the 42" Plasma TV worked fine. Room was always spotlessly cleaned and the service was faultless. It is a bit 'Downtown' for most of NYC's attractions, but the cab rides were on average $15 (inc. tip ), the most we paid was $25 from Times square to the hotel in rush hour. When you've paid about $250 a night.... you can live with that..... Mostly had 'breakfast' in Starbucks, round the corner. Had room service breakfast on our last morning and it was OK. ( $40 all in ) Don't use the hotel phone to ring the UK, about £7.50 for 2-3 mins...!!!! Overall impressed enough to go back again soon........ Times Square NewYearsEve was a one-off experience.......... Easily got a cab back to the hotel at 1am NewYearsDay and it cost.........$12+tip..........only in NYC........ :o)

Reviews.Title: “Way Downtown But Great Nonetheless!”
Reviews.Author: cello700
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with comfortable beds and wide screen TV. It's right opposite Ground Zero so those who lost folks may want to find somewhere else to stay. Right near Chambers Street subway stop. All around great experience and paid only about $218 through Hotwire!! One caveat - the mini-bar is rigged with some sensor so even if you just LIFT an item to look it, it'll be recorded as a taken item.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Staff in Town”
Reviews.Author: mhestes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but the employees, including the managers, were all rude and unhelpful. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and had a wonderful view, but our stay was riddled with constant disappointment caused by the ineffective way this hotel is run. Our concierge told us she was obtaining tickets for us and never made calls on our behalf - we called the venue directly and found out she had never called and we almost lost seats because we were depended on her to follow through. The non-smoking suite was filled with smoke from other rooms (on the non-smoking floor). The place was noisy and check in and out was ridiculously difficult. We visit NY several times a year and will never stay at the Millenium again - stay away if you care about service!

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: arielized
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Millenium Hilton and while it served it's purpose and is well served by many subway lines, I don't think we'd stay again. The staff/service were adequate (not great), and the walls are surprisingly thin (we could hear our neighbours phone conversations/tv) and with construction having begun at the WTC site, it can get pretty noisy quite early. If you plan to stay, definately ask for a room as high up as possible. We found the WTC construction quite loud at times even though we stayed on the 53rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with this Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: southernwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights in mid-November. This was a business meeting/pleasure trip. Two of the nights were a Friday and Saturday . We were located on the 49th floor. I give the location, room and service high marks. I required maintenance on the first day to replace a faulty showerhead. This was done promptly. I would definitely stay again. Some of the external positives include convenient subway stations which get you to Soho and even Times Square in less than 25 minutes. There is a well-known electronics store a couple blocks away as well as a discount retailer across the street. There are plenty of cheap eats down Church Street or Broadway. City Hall is nearby. This is a unique location with the WTC site across the street, the riverviews are great and you get a certain feel that is different from midtown. Overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Honneymooners Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMorad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just left The Millennium Hotel in NYC from our brief Honeymoon and I must say how dissatisfied we were with the service we received at the "Exclusive 4-Star" hotel. Upon our arrival I made arrangements with the gentlemen at the front desk to have a car pick my wife and I up from our Wedding Night Dinner Cruise. This was after upon check-in that the bellhop failed to make the arrangements for us as promised. Time and location were supplied to Arturo and I was assured that there would be a car waiting for us when we docked. When we arrived there was no car. In fact I had to walk approx. 6 blocks in the cold rain to hail a cab back to the hotel, exactly what I wanted to avoid by arranging a car with your hotel. After arriving back to our room we found that there was no heat. Because we were both exhausted and wanting to go to sleep we did not want to make an issue of it because we did not want to change rooms at that time. I believe that our mistakes were having such high expectations from such a prestigious company. That mistake will never be made again, for we will no longer stay at a Hilton affiliated hotel again. I'm afraid that if the disappointing service we experienced at the 4-Star rated Millennium Hilton is the norm I wonder how it is in other not so exclusive facilities under the Hilton Umbrella. Overall they give you a “sorry” and send you on your way without any recourse. At the end of the day we’d rather stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, priced to compete, stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: We chose the Millenium Hilton for our weekend in NYC because our rate, which included two breakfasts AND one night of champagne, was about $150 cheaper than the celestial rates of Times Square / Midtown properties WITHOUT breakfast. We were worried that being so far downtown would make transportation difficult, but with a subway station across the street, we had no problem most of the time; Saturday night cabs were scarce and the hotel only had one doorman on, so we left the long taxi line and hoofed up one block to catch our own - no big deal. We appreciated other TripAdvisor guest photos of the site, as it is across the street from the WTC site - the hotel itself was damaged in the 9/11 attacks and was closed for 18 months. (Now beautifully restored - no issues). The bellman told us a harrowing story of the day of the attack and his subsequent 9 hour walk home to the Bronx. This location, then, becomes a positive - the staff are happy to see you and grateful for your business, and you can walk a few steps out the door to see the moving WTC display or explore St. Paul's chapel, the 18thC church which miraculously survived the collapse of the towers. The room was better appointed than most brands, with a huge, flat-screen TV and glass and wood furniture. Room a little on the small side for two women who spent three days shopping, but then again, what hotel room would have held all the bags? OUTSTANDING bed. Our room overlooked WTC site, and the other side of the hotel overlooks the Brooklyn Bridge. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with a few blips..”
Reviews.Author: pvtryan25
Reviews.Content: When you pay $400 (including taxes) a night at a five-stay hotel like this one, expectations run very high. Generally, our stay at this place was pleasant. The room was well spaced out and well maintained, the plasma TV was a plus. The blips: - breakfast was ok, though the standard (of the food) has dropped since our last stay two years ago. Service was inconsistent - some of the staff greeted guests with smiles and quick directions; others appeared nonchalant and looked away while making greetings (saying "have a pleasant day ahead" with a stoned expression while looking away does not count as service to me). My advice: don't go through the motion if you don't mean what you say. - Lost a spectacle holder the day I checked out (it had apparently fell behind one of the cupboards, according to my friend who stayed with me). Called the housekeeping who couldn't locate it. Went to the front desk a few hours later to check again. Saw front desk person called housekeeping, laughed and shook his head while talking, out down the phone and said "Sorry, they couldn't locate it". Felt insulted that a matter like this was treated lightly. Friend adviced that small items like mine are always "dispensables" in hotels like this - you will never get it back. Didn't accept the reason and felt robbed. Otherwise, the hotel was a pleasant stay with a nice view of the Hudson River skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BeckyC1987
Reviews.Content: I liked our stay at the Hilton because it was beautiful but certainly not because of the staff or rediculous prices. I found one doorman to be very nice, the others would sit and count their tips infront of us, flag us down a cab and then expect a tip and give us dirty looks when he didnt recieve one. I also found that the food their was rediculously expensive if you even touched one on the food items in the dressers it was an automatic charge, which is not right especially since a chocolate bar was $8. We also didnt want to pay for the drinks in our fridge because a can of pop was $4 FOR A CAN OF POP. We purchased our own drinks at a drug store and put them in the fridge after taking the other drinks out. Later that night a employee came to our rooms to tell us that we had to take our drinks out of the fridge and put theirs back where they came from in exact order or we would be charged for every drink in the fridge, Arent we paying enough to stay here as it is,we cant even have a cold drink unless we pay a hugely overpriced amount for one drink! they also told us that we could have a fridge brought up to the room for an additional $100 to store out own drinks in, YA RIGHT. Anyways i was dissappointed with the hotel. Although it was beautiful I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever stay in a hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: The_Lost_Beaver
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the north east corner hotel of the hotel on the 48th floor and with that factor I think the complete package made this hotel the best I have ever stayed in! The staff are brilliant- friendly and informative. The room had a huge flat screen TV (never actually came on as the views were that good!), radio with an attachment for your ipod, king size comfy beds, plenty of nice toiletries, really well cleaned very day, lots of towels, fridge, mini bar, morning newspaper. OK it lacks tea/ coffe making machines but you're in NYC so you're never far from caffeine! The location we actually found as a plus. As I've been lucky enough to stay in mid town before it was brilliant being away from all the hassle. The walks around the South Street Seaport and southern tip of the island gave you another insight to the city and with several subway lines 20 yards from the hotel it took no time to get uptown. The pool was also brilliant after a long plane ride or long day on your feet. The bar was also very nice for a pre dinner drink. Even with different views I would still give this hotel top marks and if you shop around you can get a very good price. Looking forward to coming back as soon as my bank manager lets me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mickd23
Reviews.Content: Booked a king view room and found we were on the 48th floor with stunning views over Brooklyn Bridge in one direction and the SoL and the WTC site though the other window.Very quick check-in.Had a very good meal in the restaurant one night.Subway within 100 yds.Staff very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but a Couple of Negatives”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMember
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 quad-accupancy rooms for a group of us who headed down to NYC for the Labour Day long weekend. The hotel itself has an upscale feel to it and has one of the fastest elevators I have ever experienced. Both rooms were located on the east side of the building, facing town hall and the Brooklyn Bridge, although the later is only visible from the highest floors and were not visible to us (31st and 32nd floors). The rooms were well appointed, spacious and the large-screen plasma TVs made viewing a pleasure. Several of the group has stayed mid-town on previous trips and enjoyed staying "downtown", away from the hordes of tourists congregating in Time Square, Central Park and 5th Av. However, it is a ghost-town after all the white collars head home on Friday, giving it somewhat of a depressing feel when you are the only soul out walking around in the early morning or late evening. Its location across from Ground Zero doesn't really help much either... For all of the compliments, we did have two complaints. First, for a quad-occupancy room, beds were very small, making for an intimate sleeping encounter whether you wanted it or not. If you want the possibility of moving around without falling out of the bed (or accidently knocking your partner out), better upgrade to a junior suite. Secondly, because of flight delays, one of our group arrived at the hotel after our party had already headed uptown. Although the front desk assured us that it would be no problem to provide her access to the room in our absence, it turned out to be a different story. Only after half an hour and three attempts did they finally provide her with an access key. All in all, a wonderful hotel although there were several aspects which kept it from being a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugger3
Reviews.Content: Wanting to get away for the weekend to NYC, we booked this hotel after many positive reviews here on tripadvisor, and I don't think we'll stay at any other NYC hotel. For the price this hotel can't be beat. Interestingly, the only downside to the hotel is its location. It's way down next to the WTC, meaning it's at the tip of southern Manhattan. But that's OK because the hotel is right outside the entranceway to the WTC subway stop on the E train. My wife and I arrived by bus at Penn Station (also on the E line), and a few stops later, was at the door to the Hilton. Plus, all the hotspots in Manhattan are served on the blue (A, C, E) line: Times Square, Columbus Circle/Central Park, Empire State Building, etc. Can't beat the convenience. Service was impeccable. We asked room service to send up toothpaste, and in timely fashion, a gentleman arrived at our door with the goods. A few minutes after that, we got a phone call from Housekeeping asking us if the toothpaste was delivered. Was a nice touch since this was the first time I had ever experienced a follow-up call, and I've stayed at many more upscale hotels. We got a king-size bedroom and as a previous poster noted, the window view was of the WTC construction site. Unlike the previous poster, I couldn't hear a thing outside our window, and we were on the 20th floor, so not too high up. Noise was not a problem. The room was a little on the small side, but that is to be expected in Manhattan. The decor was modern, and the plasma TV was a very nice touch (not to mention space saving!). The bathroom and bedsheets were all clean...no complaints. I can't speak of the restaurant or the hotel food because we didn't eat at the hotel. Why would you when the corner breakfast shop tastes better and is cheaper than any hotel fare? Just spend the day walking up broadway and you'll walk through many shops and restaurants as you pass through all the hotspots in lower Manhattan/midtown. Overall, this hotel was a real find. It was one of the cheapest hotel options in Manhattan, one of the most convenient, and we came away with no complaints about it. It's not the Ritz, the Waldorf, or the Trump, but it doesn't cost it either.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in NYC”
Reviews.Author: voll002
Reviews.Content: This hotel, across from the World Trade Center site, has to be one of the best choices for the money in NYC. Why? 1) The staff. Some of the friendliest, most helpful I've ever encountered (this is saying something, because I average 200 nights/year in hotels for my job) 2) The rooms: many are cut from the same mold, but if you have any status with Hilton (and they are available), you'll be upgraded to a junior suite. 3) The location: not in touristy mid-town/Times Square, but convenient subway access/Path train makes up for this. On the weekend, it's almost nice to escape the busier parts of the city by staying downtown. Relatively safe, though some streets appear to be deserted on weekend nights, so best to not walk alone. I just wish the hotel wasn't a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Smoker Beware”
Reviews.Author: fig414
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying we had another very nice stay at this hotel. The rooms are still small but great and the staff is very friendly and accomodating. If you are a smoker and insist on a smoking room you would be better off trying another hotel. I had reserved my smoking King room 2 months previously. Upon arrival alas there were no smoking rooms. Evidently Hilton removed a bunch of smoking floors and, of course, did not let their smoking guests know about this. There is now 1 floor that is smoking with 14 rooms on it. That means 14 out of 569 rooms are smoking rooms. Even if you book one of these rooms you are not guaranteed to get one as per the Manager of the hotel told me. The odds are pretty bad. Otherwise it's still a fine hotel. This review is just a caution to the 22% of Americans who smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: fastep
Reviews.Content: PROS: Very clean and comfortable rooms, friendly staff, widescreen plasma tv (no high-definition broadcasts though), very comfortable beds/pillows, excellent climate control, great view either side (if you don't mind looking at ground zero on the hudson river side [they refer to over-looking ground zero as "city view"]), pool and excercise room, easy subway access to everywhere. CONS:No king beds facing away from ground zero, only queen (which looked like full size), construction on ground zero 7 days a week from about 6:00 am to 3:00 pm (muffled noise), no coffee in rooms (have to go to restaurant to purchase and coffee was not good and not hot), no in-room refrigerator, charge for high-speed internet access (no wireless in rooms), walls not as sound-proof as other hotels (fine unless you have noisy people next to you or want to sleep in on ground zero side). If this hotel added a few MINOR ammenities like FREE in-room coffee and refrigerator and FREE wireless internet access, I would have felt better about the construction noise and the price. The way they nickel and dime I was surprised that they didn't charge to use the toilet. Penny-wise and pound foolish. Overall a comfortable, somewhat noisy average stay. C+

Reviews.Title: “Amazing..!!!”
Reviews.Author: diegorojas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most spectacular hotels! The view, the service, the room!! overall a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: jrain
Reviews.Content: I went for a week-end in the city. I stayed on the 47 th floor with a spectacular view of the city both day and night the veiw is breath taking. I suggest a jr. suite its not that much $ for what you get. and you can have up to 5 people in the room with out paying extra per person. The front desk staff was amazing ,funny and gave honest advice.The minibar system is this hotel s weak point Dont take the key .The gift shop has an ATM that only despense $100 at a time so just walk to the corner and use that atm if you need MORE cash . here is a great tip parking is around $48-$58 a night at the hotel but if you are there for the week -end you can park on the street FREE. and week days there is a parking garage around the corner for under $15 a day if you get it validated at sysms. Also there is a great pizza shop across the street if you want a bite or on a budget. the indoor pool is pretty small ,but very nice one thing that stuck out to me was that for a hotel in manhattan it was exteremly clean. i will and i am staying here again. also sign up to become a hilton honors member and get specials and deals on rooms even in nyc.you can bring your ipod and play your i tunes on the radio cool i loved it you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Overnight”
Reviews.Author: DeedraF
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed for 1 night I will def. be back the next time I stay in NYC. I only live about 45 mins away but stay often on weekends and this was just perfect. I booked a bounceback weekend rate so the breakfast buffet was included at a rate of $209. A good buffet, typical eggs, french toast, bacon, fruits, cereals, bread, etc. The room and bathroom were a nice size for two people and extremely clean! Everything seemed brand new, including the large plasma tv. The room service was very prompt and accurate and every staff member we encountered was super friendly. I, too, did have a view of where the world Trade Center was. I was just left in awe but didn't feel "depressed" as another review wrote. I am lucky enough to have a family member that survived that terrible ordeal so maybe that is why. There is a ton of construction downtown but didn't hear anything that disupted our night at all. Would def. recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: brianmcstea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July and the room was wonderful with great views, bar in the evening very relaxing, sub way just beside us and as a Hilton Gold member complimetary breakfast keep it up Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton-a great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poundedo
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel constantly since it incredibley convenient to the Finacial District and I find it a terrific busness hotel. All of my needs are met in terms of health club, pool, bar and restaurant plus the rooms are well maintained, very well equipped and imaculatley clean. The best feature of this hotel is the staff who are universally friendly, helpful and willing to assit with any request. An overlooked apsect of this hotel is its proximity to some fine dinning just a few blocks walk or a short cab ride north to Tribecca, etc.; we found the doorman and concierge a wealth of good referrals!

Reviews.Title: “Ground Zero vista”
Reviews.Author: jocelynkeith
Reviews.Content: Nice price for a 4 star. Worth it to get a city view room, which is an extra $40, but puts you at least 38 floors up. Pool is indoors and on the small side. Plasma TV, clean quiet rooms,kind of small have been newly redone. Super comfy bed, friendly staff. Watch out for the minibar sensor which charges $10 to the room if you open it longer than 30 seconds. They took the charges off no problem. 24 hour roomservice is a bonus. No AAA rates, but reasonable. The view of Ground Zero is dramatic, and directly overlooks it as well as the Hudson River and points west. Definately would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: jmalder
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel and was quite excited to be able to stay in Manhattan, at a four-star hotel at a Hilton hotel. Prior to check-in we had requested a king size smoking room both on the internet and by the phone. When we finally moved our way through closed streets and quite a bit of construction and got our car parked ($48.00 a day - no in and out), they did have us in a king size room but it was a non-smoking room. Supposedly they did not have a smoking room available but the gentleman at the front desk left us for a few minutes and voila! A smoking room was suddenly available. We got to our room and my husband and I were really excited to see what type of view we would have. We were able to see the Hudson and some of the skyscrapers on the financial district but the main eye-catching site was that of ground zero. It was quite depressing and bone-chilling to look out our window. Wireless internet is available at the hotel. When using the lounge near the front desk, it's $5.95 AN HOUR. In your room, it ranges from $5.95 to $9.95 for a 24 hour period. I have noticed no difference between the $5.95 and the $9.95 service so don't waste your money on the $9.95 option. The room itself is nice. The beds at their sister hotel, Hampton Inn, are a lot more comfortable. The beds have a duvet that covers it with no duvet cover. The plasma television is nice but not that big of a deal. Breakfast is not provided by the restaurant but you are able to order a continental breakfast for $18.00 plus a 15% gratuity and a $4.00 in-room dining charge. There are also no soda vending machines on any floor but you are able to purchase a fountain drink in the lounge for $3.75. It is in a good subway location. There are two subway entrances right across the street and are easily accessible. Beware of walking up Fulton Street towards Broadway or you'll get accousted by all the street vendors selling knock-off merchandise. Overall, I'm not impressed with this 4-star hotel at all. Give me the 2 1/2 star ones any day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay!”
Reviews.Author: larasweb
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an over night stay at the Millenium Hilton and I have to say that it far exceeded my expectations. I did book through a discount website and so it didnt hurt that the room was 50% off of the regular rate. This was the deal of a lifetime. We scored a very spacious corner room with a great view facing north east. We had a great view. The beds were exceptionally comfortable complete with down comforters and pillows. The huge plasma TV was awesome as well. Travellers should know that the west facing side of the building directly faces ground zero. As a New Yorker who lived here during 9/11 I found the location saddening but also felt really good about staying at the hotel and contributing to the rebirth of lower Manhattan. The indoor pool (surrounded by potted palm trees) was fabulous as was the extremely courteous and helpful staff. Truth be told, I didnt want to leave! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: luigi66
Reviews.Content: It was a very good stay, the room was large, clean and comfortable, the staff did everything to make our stay pleasant. Breakfast was good, and the restaurant as well. We did get an interesting price for our family of four, but we booked that much in advance.

Reviews.Title: “4th july at milennium”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disappointed to begin with, lots of road works going on not only at the hotel but in the area in general. Check-in was quite quick, however when asking to be changed to the romantic package for our 10th anniversary we were told that as it was not the package we booked on the internet they could not change it. Hotel room was very nice. Bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Room was quickly cleaned in the morning however glasses etc removed from our room set outside the door for 2 days!! Breakfast was great really set us up for the day - though they only had fresh strawberries on weekdays - what was that about?? Dinner was also quite good -(but much too expensive) we ended up eating in the restaurant 3 out of 5 nights of our stay as we weren't very well organised and there were very few restaurants opened in the financial district later in the evening and at the weekend. Pool was in general quite good although very small and only really suitable for 3/4 at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Dosen't Get much better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Andrew30Tampa_FL
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and looking at many hotels in the NYC area, i decided to stay at the Millenium Hilton. I arrived to the hotel by subway which is located steps away from the front door of the building. This was great, seeing as the subway transportation takes you to practically everywhere. I then arrived at the hotel an hour before check-in and they did not have my room ready, they then told me they would upgrade my room to a suite at no cost to me. I gladly accepted. I got to the room and it was perfect. Everything from wrap around view of the city and Ground Zero to the 40 inch Plasma television. 20 mins after being in the room the front desk called to make sure everything in the room was ok and see if we needed anything at all. They said when ever we were ready to go to sleep they would come and pull out our pull out couch for us that was in the living room. Everyone at the hotel was extremely NICE and happy and did anything and everything to make our stay more pleasent. I diffently recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay over weekend at the Millenium”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First thing which immediately became obvious was the roadworks outside causing issues with actually getting into the hotel. Once there though I was met by polite reception staff and bag was whisked up to my run. I'd been upgraded to a room on the 48th floor. The Bell boy seemed very excited about the room and said it was his favourite. I suspected he would say that about all the rooms, but when I got there I could see why - The view as amazing a corner room overlooking Brooklyn River and Bridges and out of another window the Statue of Liberty. Room service was ok and efficient. No complaints about the Restaurant (I only had breakfast) but all efficiently served. The door staff were fantastic - polite keen to server helping out with taxis and advice. There is something about the hotel though. I've stayed here on a couple of occasions and I think its the hallways. The doors into the room appear to be made of metal and as you walk down the hallways it looks like you are walking down a row of prison doors. Interior of rooms have certainly been upgraded since last time I came to the millenium. Large plasma screen tv was nice touch. Contemporary furniture beginning to look a little dated already. Small/average size of room for Manhatten. I travel on business to NY frequently and the hotel is respectable but certainly not my first choice for a stay, however it has improved since refurb work

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just completed a stay at the Millenium Hilton down in the Financial District. I have stayed in plenty of hotels and this one was average in comparison. The air was not working very well and when we called an engineer up there he just said it was because the curtains weren't closed and the sun was coming in. So we closed the curtains and went out for the evening, we came back in at 11p and it was still hot even though the temp was set to 65 degrees. The checkout desk didn't even ask how are stay was or thank us for staying there just handed me the bill and that's it. The concierge and doormen were fantastic! Always holding the door and getting us a taxi as needed. For the most part I think there are far better hotels you can find in manhattan this is not one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back. Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jard007
Reviews.Content: Read the other reviews for how great this hotel is. Just look at the views from the room (53rd Floor). The curtains were never closed.......

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Disney Family UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton over Memorial weekend. We chose the hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and the fact that it has a pool. We were not disappointed. We had requested a room on a high floor with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and that's exactly what was offered at check in. Robert checked us in and he was extremely pleasant and efficient. My daughter was given a small handbag/purse which she loved and used the entire stay. All the staff were friendly and professional. Rey, the bellman, also went out of his way to be helpful. The room was very clean and throughout the stay (5 nights) was always cleaned thoroughly with new sheets half way through the stay and towels offered daily. Closet space was a bit small but there were plenty of drawers. Others have commented on the lack of a coffee maker and the signal on the plasma screen. The internet connection worked well and was $6 a day. The in-room safe can hold a laptop. The views were magnificent and there was no noise from other rooms, the corridors or construction around the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel or use room service so cannot comment. The pool was not large but never crowded and given the rarity of a pool in the city we made good use of it. There were always clean towels and seats available. The hotel's location is good for the civic/financial area and for Battery Park and the ferries to the Statue of Liberty or Staten Island. Metro links were plentiful with good connections to mid-town in around 15 minutes. Restaurant and shops were everywhere but closed for most of the holiday weekend - not surprising in the business district - but plan ahead for food!! Overall - highly recommended as a base in the city. A clean and modern hotel with good transportation links to all the attractions. The area around the hotel felt safe even over the quiet weekend. The pool is a definite plus and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Nice Hotel too!”
Reviews.Author: sannicandrob
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday for a weekend stay at the Millenium Hilton. They are doing construction on Church Street, so you are forced to enter through the side entrance on Fulton Street. This particular trip we drove into NYC, and it was POURING rain. I couldn't have asked for a more helpful staff as we arrived. We had our two small children with us, so the bellman immediately came to my car and started grabbing my bags. He was so fast, I had to slow him down, so he didn't bring all the contents of my car into the hotel. It was great service. He encouraged us to get the kids inside and had my car valet parked. I had my room keys within a few minutes and my bags were taken up to my room with us. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but not huge - typical of NYC. Flat screen tv was great for the kids, but reception wasn't that spectacular for some channels. The view from the 28th floor over former WTC site is unreal, even in the rain! The lobby was small, but nice. The gift shop was the size of a closet. Once four people get in there, it gets complicated. Most importantly, all staff members I encountered at this hotel were friendly. The concierge was very helpful in recommending nearby eateries that would suit our budget, and accomodate two small kids. He knew everything from local pizzerias and delis to 5 star restaurants. The subway was right across the street, and also a block away (depending on what line you were looking for) so we were able to access all of NYC very easily. The rates at this hotel tend to be pretty high whenver I check them, but because of its location, it tends to be much less expensive on the weekends. Give it a shot! My one negative of the visit was when I picked up my car from the valet. It's a Hilton garage right behind the hotel, but it's operated by a parking lot company. You have to call a number from your room to tell them you want your car, as it takes up to 1/2 hour for them to get your car. We were never told of that, until after the bellman came up to get our bags. We were told to wait in the lobby and ended up doing so for quite some time. Then our car was brought out and nobody told us it was ready. It was pretty confusing. Other than that minor mishap, I'd say this hotel was worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bethgz
