How could I forget, Century 21 (discount name brand/designer) shopping store was practicully next door and the location is convenient for walking around and site seeing. Cabs and limos were not too bad for the cost. The bellhop (very cute) got us a limo to our Broadway play for $45/roundtrip. It is a short drive to Times Square and the sites there are unbelievable. Street vendors crowd the sidewalks on the weekend so be aware of your surrondings. I will definitely have to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great..”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller2
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Millenium Hilton from the 4-7June... very busy weekend at the hotel...unfortunately we were checked in by the guy with attitude... so any request was too much for him... but the other front desk staff were fantastic... concierge was so so, too busy checking his emails to give me his attention.. the porters were always wanting to hail down a cab-don't know if they make money on the side??? we declined their offers and took the subway-very convenient. I do agree with the comment about the turndown service, they must only do it when the have time(as it was done the first night only)... We returned late one night after being out all day and our bed linen was filthy, changed but not clean... so at about 2330 we called to have it changed.. This was my first visit to NYC, next time I would stay somewhere in midtown or uptown... a smaller hotel maybe...but we did get great rates here when most hotels were booked out. p.s we used a cab from JFK to the hotel and they charged the standard US45 + US10 for tolls and tip.. Because i really can't stand getting cabs we took the subway from the hotel back to JFK very easy...Take the A line to Howard Beach and change to the AIRTRAIN to your terminal...US7 ea in total.. The other option is booking a car to and from the airport i think their standard rate is US55 + US10 for tolls and tips..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a good location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and we were very happy with the room. Our room was spacious (for NY standard) and very clean. The beds were very comfortable and we liked having the plasma TV in our room. The staff were very nice and helpful... The location was very good. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Catch Your Own Cab”
Reviews.Author: InAnIndianaTown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night at the Millenium Hilton. The front desk staff was wonderful; they even gave us a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suite when my husband explained that he had flown my mom in as a birthday surprise to me, so she actually had a pull-out sofa to sleep on. The room was huge by NY standards and very clean. The air conditioning unit was loud, but we got used to it. Nice linens. Concierge was hit or miss - and understaffed. The persistant bellman tried to convince us to take a town car back to the airport and when we said no, he flagged down a cab for us, and the cab driver was sketchy and didn't have a medallion number. He charged us more than $20 over the going rate back to LaGuardia and refused to give us his medallion number when we threatened to report him. The sketchiest part of it all was that the bellman tipped the cabbie when we left the hotel. It was clear that the bellman was paying the unlicensed cabbie to take us on the "scenic" route to the airport. This hotel makes up in ambiance what it lacks in service. We'd stay there again, but call our own cabs! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and facilities”
Reviews.Author: banana0711
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a parlor suite over the Memorial Day weekend for my daughter's 7th birthday. We were on the 53rd floor with a view over the World Trade Center site - would have liked a city view but the parlor suites don't have that view. The parlor suites are made out of 2 regular rooms with one room turned into a living room with a queen sleep sofa. They are nice since there is a full bath in each room - good for families or business travelers who need a meeting room and want to block off the bedroom. The bedroom had a king bed, desk and TV - nice but nothing super. The room was clean and service was good. The plasma TV is nice but nothing new anymore. Being a primarily business hotel, the TV lacked children's channels and there was no way to hook up a DVD player to it so our daughter could watch movies. The bed was fine but one night the sheets were a bit scratchy so it was hard to sleep. We had a good package that included valet parking (at $45/day a good deal if you drive) and we got free breakfast with my husband's gold hilton membership. They had a nice breakfast buffet, but quite expensive unless you plan to really eat a lot. If our breakfast had not been free, we would not have eaten there but the food was good and the selections plentiful. You can also order off the menu. The indoor pool on the 5th floor was very nice - the main reason we chose to stay there since our daughter loves to swim. The fitness facilities were also quite good for a hotel. Transportation was convenient but if you plan to rely on taxis and want to get to mid or up town, it can take a while. It is best to know your way around since the cab drivers were inconsistent and sometimes seemed to be trying to make money out of their trips. Overall, we had a really good experience and our daughter loved the various views from up high. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luuuuckygirl
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel in Downtown, New York. The rooms were really clean, the employees were all very helpful and nice. The view of where The Twin Towers used to be is breathtaking!! Also the view from the rooms of the New York skyline is really nice. It is within walking distance of Tribeca and other areas to explore. If you are looking for somewhere to stay that is close to Times Square....this is no the hotel for you....because Times Square is about 20 blocks or so, which is fine if you are training for a race or are a really good walker.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very proffessional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 26 to 29 with my girlfriend. Had read lots of positive reviews. We weren't disapointed. Room was ready on arrival. Although we had asked for king size and got queen. Went to front desk and had room changed right away. Beautifull views of course. Away from all the action of uptown but only 12 minutes by subway, station is footsteps away. Not even 5 minutes to canal street, Little Italy and Chinatown..... You must visit Little Italy, its worth the trip. Starbucks coffee right around the corner and stage door deli 1 block away, serve amazing breakfest (try the 4 egg western omelet.wow).. The room was spacious, very modern and clean. Bathroom was amazing, lots of space, pressure and hot water. We checked in Thursday at around 7:00pm, checked out Sunday at 12:00 but were only charged 2 days of parking wich was cool cause at 45$/day, it gets expensive. When we checked out, they stored our bags til we left town wich was appreciated. Guys, if your wife likes shopping, Century 21 is a must, just accross the street but a little tip, be patient..The store is huge, full of brand names and really crowded, easy to lose your wife...Ladies, you can very easily spend 3-4 hours in there, mine almost did. All in all, a wonderfull weekend in New York, but then again, how can you not a fun in New York..Soooooooo much to do. If you're looking for a broadway show, BROOKLYN, THE MUSICAL may not be well known but trust me, worth every penny...amazing voices. All of the people we met and talked with, staff, store employees, policemen, were ALL VERY POLITE AND COURTIOUS, I WAS ACTUALLY IMPRESSED. The city has changed lots over the years, very clean and alot safer than expected... I highly recommend the millenium. A few minutes away from all the action A definite 4 star at a 2-3 star price...

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton--great in every respect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While we were anxious to go to NYC, after reading so many horror stories about hotels there, I was feeling a little stressed about finding an affordable, decent place to stay with our daughters and 4-year-old grandson. Since we were going over a long weekend (May 20-23, 2005), someone suggested the Financial District and so we booked ourselves at the Millenium Hilton at 55 Church Street, directly across from Ground Zero. It was wonderful in every respect. Super convenient to the subway--station was directly across the street and we were able to get to Central Park, Natural History Museum, Intrepid Museum and ferry to Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island without having to transfer subway lines. There are several places to get late night/early morning snacks (Starbucks, Burger King, deli, TGIFridays, Caruso's Pizza) within walking distance so you don't have to pay for hotel-rate food. The staff was very helpful, especially the concierge who let us check our luggage upon arrival and also the day we departed. We had a large room with two double beds and a rollaway which easily accomodated the five of us. We were on the 11th floor, overlooking Ground Zero. The room was very upscale, IMMACULATE, wide screen TV...all the amenities. Nice pool and fitness center on 5th floor which we also enjoyed. And the weekend rate was only $215/night as opposed to hotels in midtown Manhatten that raise their rates on Friday and Saturday. Highly, highly recommend for families who come on the weekend for its convenience, quality of service, exceptional value, and 4-star rooms. I can't think of one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ok but is being over-hyped in other reviews”
Reviews.Author: dave_evans
Reviews.Content: People seem to be raving about this hotel...and it was fine, don't get me wrong, no better or worse than other hotels in NY. People have over-hyped the rooms a little..they were on par with most hotels of this type in NY, no better or worse, in fact our one bed room was rather small in size, and are you really bothered about a flat screen TV? It was a novelty for a bit, but after that it was hardly ever switched on as we were out and about so much. This is my first experience of staying in Lower Manhattan for a short break and would not choose this location again. It is too far from all the focus of midtown Manhattan...the theatres, museums, art galleries, shops, Central Park...you are forever on the bus or subway going up and down between the two, despite convenient access to certain subway lines. I thought our weekend rate at this hotel to be only average value, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdcotr
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this hotel. The room was clean, tidy and a reasonable size. There was an iron, hair dryer and a safe in the room but no coffee maker which is only a minor gripe. The 42" plasma screen was very nice and there were a wide variety of channels to choose from including the usual pay movies. There was also internet access through the TV and you can checkout using the TV's interactive features which was useful. Room service always arrived promptly and wasn't overpriced by hotel standards. The food was also very good. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant and this was mainly due to laziness rather than the food or service. You are far better going to one of the many Deli's along Broadway which serve a better variety of food and for a quarter of the cost. Beware if you take travellers cheques as they will only change $250 worth per stay. I would advise using ATM's instead of travellers cheques as there are hundreds nearby. The staff were all polite and they were happy to stow our bags after checkout as our flight wasn't until 20:00. Overall a very enjoyable stay and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sw4524
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms are modern, clean, and a decent size. Elevators are surprising fast. You can control the Thermostat in your room, and you can crack open the window for fresh air. Two things to be aware of. 1: No coffee makers in the rooms. There is a Starbucks 30 feet away from the entrance of the hotel, but coffee makers in the room are always a nice touch. 2: Room service is very, very pricey. After gratuity, tax, tax and more tax, breakfast for one is $35. There is a little store attached to the Starbucks which has cokes, water, snacks etc, and there are good breakfasts to go places within a block of the hotel. Still an overall excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, views and location”
Reviews.Author: JohnFR99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel, after 3 nights in the Doubletree uptown and this was an amazing experience, from our room on the 51st floor. The rooms were very clean, views were exceptional over ground zero and overlooking the West side of New York. This is a definite great hotel and worth every penny. The service is very good and the hotel is really well kept. Staff are very friendly. Next time we are in New York, there is no doubt were we will stay: the Millenium! If, like us, you don't know what hotel to pick afraid to be disappointed, well, choose this one, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: chris1005
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best Hilton I've stayed at within the US. Everything about this hotel was excellent. The junior suite was well equiped and the dining facilities were second to none in nyc. The only downside to the hotel is the location on the weekend. Downtown nyc isn't exactly 'THE' place to be. But I can handle the taxi ride for other advantages of this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: PierreParis_France
Reviews.Content: On a four days week-end in NYC, we had decided to stay 2 nights uptown at the Benjamin and 2 nights downtown at the Millenium, based on TripAdvisor's ranking system. As much as we were disappointed with the first one, we loved staying at the Millenium: low prices for Manhattan, spectacular view, stylish and modern room. The staff was very helpful: the concierge gave us good advice on bikes' rental and transportation back to the airport and they allowed us to check out at 1:30pm at no extra cost. A hotel to recommend and go back to!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Roxi
Reviews.Content: I have listed all the major points below DINING The staff were not welcoming and tried hard to rush you through your meal, it was like their policy. The food was lovely and the fresh fruit was so delicious. ROOMS We were staying on the 33rd floor and the views were so fab. The celings were high and beds were so comfortable, but a little small for a double. The bathroom had black marble surfaces with a large shower/bath and loo! A giant plasma T.V was great! And the fact the room was so big was nice. The only thing that saddened me was the view of ground 0 at night, it was anawful view, but it was nice to see improvements. CONCIERGE During the day the staff were polite and extremly helpful, but at night they are very different. We asked for the nearest sit down pizza place and the lady said erm go down the street and make a left. So we did and found that it was shut! Then we walked about 100 yards further and found a really nice little place! POOL AND EXERCISE ROOM The pool was great, a big size and was nearly always empty, it had fab views out of the window and the changing rooms were very clean. The pool guy was very helpful with tips of where to go and what to do. And the exercise room looked really nice, clean and pretty average. OTHER TIPS Go up to the 55th floor and look out at the view- its so great, but just dont go into the suites! And if your not so adverturous go down onto the 54th floor and take a look from there. The pool is least busyiest at around 6:30 to 7 PM because closing time is 10 most people like to go for a late dip, and going just that bit earlier means that everyone else will be eating their dinner. Take a look at the flag next to the Concierge bit on the ground floor it has an interesting history to it!

Reviews.Title: “Some good suggestions...”
Reviews.Author: ctmarcus
Reviews.Content: The millenium hilton really is a fantastic hotel! We stayed for 3 nights in January and I thought the reviews on this site were quite accurate. The rooms are small, but I hear that is the norm in New York. We had a view of the reconstruction of Ground Zero - I thought it was amazing. However, if this is something that may bother you, you need to request a room on the other side of the building because you are literally right over the site. There is also very easy access to all subway lines and we took the subway all over the city. Be sure and visit Century 21, the discount department store right across the street. I also highly recommend the Stage Door Deli just accross the street for the best sandwitches in the area. We ate there 3 times in 4 days - the portions are huge and prices reasonable. The best meal I have ever had in my life was at "Raouls" in SOHO - a short cab ride from the millenium hilton (be sure and make a reservation because the host is quite rude - but it is worth it). It is fantastic and not terribly expensive. A friend who is a local recommended it to us and I assure you it will not disappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: WashDCFlyer
Reviews.Content: I chose the Millenium Hilton for a two night stay in early April 2005 on the strength of the reviews on this site. I was not disappointed. I will definitely stay here again. I would highly recommend this property for the following reasons: 1) Excellent subway access, a critical feature in a NYC hotel. Cortlandt Street station (R and W trains) is literally at the entrance stairs to the hotel. Many other subway lines (2,3,E,4,5,6) are within a couple of blocks. 2) The 42 inch plasma TVs are a fun novelty for those of us who would never spend the money to own one ourselves. 3) Views - I was on the 41st floor and had a fantastic view of the city. 4) Very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium for 6 nights March/April 2005 to celebrate wedding anniversary. Used Tripadvisor to help select hotel and reviews helped us to choose. We were able to gain access to our room without any problems as soon as we checked in at midday. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Advice from the Concierge made for a successful trip. Our room was clean and well appointed-our tv at home seems very small! Views at night with twinkling lights were lovely but obviously one needs to be aware of the hotel location. The church next door has a moving exhibition for 9/11 events. Although the hotel is downtown Manhattan this is still convenient for Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, Battery Park (bus tour) and downtown heliport all within 10 minutes walk. Subway was opposite and a NY yellow cab uptown averaged $10-12. Hotel restaurant was ok and you were able to fill up on the buffet breakfast. Starbucks around the corner from Century 21 was a good alternative. Various restaurants on the ground floor of the Financial Centres opposite were useful for quiet evening meals-good walks along the River Hudson too. A busy but enjoyable holiday. I will have a lasting memory of swimming in the hotel pool at 5.30am-adjusting to time difference on first morning! watching the sunrise over the Manhattan buildings, unmistakeably New York!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 40th floor in the end apartment! We had 2 huge windows, one facing the city view, the other of ground zero and the Statue of Liberty! We were overwelmed by such a view. We stayed February 28th-March 2nd. The staff was pleasant and the beds very comfy. I loved the location of this hotel, kind of away from the hussle and bustle of midtown, but right next to the subway station and Century 21, which is like a huge discount store which came in handy for extra scarves and ear muffs for the unexpected snow storm we encountered. The room service was pricey, but isnt everything in New York! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: Miro586
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel four and a half stars. It is very much as described on the tin. It is a large modern skyscraper hotel. Its USP is the terrific views from the higher floors. My room on the 50th floor on the North West corner had a wonderful view uptown including both the Hudson and East river. Apart from the view, the rooms are spacious, well furnished and with good bathrooms. The beds are very comfortable. The plasma TV can be used to access the internet (for $10 per day). The staff are efficient and very helpful. The hotel is close to subway stations for five of the North-South subway lines, so it is easy to get to points uptown. My only reservation is food. The quality is entirely adequate but it is not outstanding. It is also not cheap. I paid a rate of $242 ($212 plus tax). In my experience this is good value for this level of hotel. I would certainly use the Millenium Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JessieWillow
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this hotel, I was worried that my expectations would be too high but luckily I wasn't disappointed! My husband and I spent 3 nights here from 3rd to 6th March 2005 and found the hotel to be superb in every way. We were originally given a room on the 15th floor but after we spoke to the reception staff about getting a room on a higher floor, we were given one on the 52nd floor! The views day and night were amazing especially as the weather was very clear and fine. The location is great. After my last trip to New York, when I stayed in a grubby hotel in Midtown, I was keen to experience a different area. So many interesting places are walking distance away, such as Chinatown, Little Italy, South Street Seaport and Greenwich Village. Even when we occasionally ventured uptown, the subway station was right outside. The room was immaculate and very clean although it did get quite warm at night. One evening I opened the little window and couldn't shut it again but a member of staff arrived in minutes to assist us! In all, the staff were very helpful, especially the bellboys who always had a smile on their faces! I would DEFINITELY stay here again, particularly when compared to the over-priced dives in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Dumbstruck”
Reviews.Author: family_travel_04
Reviews.Content: Nothing but kudos for this place from check in to check out...the room, the staff nothing short of excellent. The view from the room overlooking the trade center and the river beyond, incredible. Here for a weekend and its the kind of quiet you want. Skip all the restaurant recommendations...Church and Day is first rate..you won't be dissapointed. Traveller who's spends 80 nights a year in hotels. This place is a four star rating. Not above...but a solid four. Loved having Starbucksa next door as the only complaint is the lack of coffee maker in the room. And thats the only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could not find fault with it. The best hotel I have stayed in for a long long time. After reading many reviews here we finally decided on the millenium hilton. Just go for it. You wont regret it. The only thing that you should be aware of: If your room is on the front side of the building, it will be overlooking the WTC site. (I mean directly overlooking). It might put some people off. It is very sad to see it. On the other hand though it made us reflect about it and realise how brave the families of the victims and the people of new york are. SO in that respect it was a positive experience. If you have the chance get room service. It was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the millenium Hilton, and I have to say I would recommend it to anyone. Staff were freindly and helpful, the standard of the room was very good (42" plasma screen, say no more !), clean with nice bathroom and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. There's a nice bar/restaurant on the third floor that we often called in for a couple of drinks to watch the sun go down, and prices were ok as well. I noticed some reviewers had a downer on the restaurant, but hey you are in New York, if you are going to complain about hotel breakfast/food prices etc. then you should really be out getting some real NY food! There are loads of diners etc. nearby which are just the job. Location is good, the subway is literally right outside of the main entrance and you are in easy walking distance of Soho / Battery Park / South Street Seaport and various others. If you don't mind walking past the twin towers memorial every day (and all the toursists grinning and posing for photos in front of it - missing the point totally!!???) it's pretty good overall. The bell staff had no problem looking after our bags, as we checked out at 12.00 but didn't fly until 8pm, so we had another full day in NY without worrying about our bags. When I come back to NY, I will definately stay here again !.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Wylex
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the millenium Hilton,we found the hotel to be very coveniently situated in lower Manhattan out of the main tourist throng but with access to Times Suare in under 7 minutes on the subway.We found the hotel facilities to be superb,swimming pool and sauna at no extra charge,fitness room (if req!) and both the lobby bar and the 3rd floor bar attached to the restaurant gave great service in pleasant surroundings.Our room was on the 33rd floor with great views over lower Manhattan and the Hudson River it was clean,modern very spacious and well maintained by the maid.All in all we had a fantastic stay and the hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “BEST TRIP TO DATE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: The_travel_bugs
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just returned from a six day break at the Millenium Hilton. It is our best trip to date. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Good location for subway links, loved the 42" plasma TV, and the views of the city. Never used the Hotels Restaurant, as there was plenty of good all night delis and starbucks near by. DEF will return!!!!! 10 out of 10!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelismymiddename
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property Feb 18-20th in rm 3410. It was my husband's birthday so we requested a high floor with a nice view. The room overlooked ground zero and was a decent size for NY standards. There wasn't anything special about the decor, but it was nice and the room was very clean upon arrival. Nice plasma tv, heat controllable by thermostat (no problems) and the bathroom was very clean with Neutrogena amenities. The bell staff was very good and friendly as was the concierge. My only complaint is that on day two, the maid did a very poor job of cleaning the room. I think she just made up the bed. (BTW, the bed was quite comfy with nice linens). I wrote to the Hilton upon my return and they have been extremely responsive regarding my complaint. Also, the turn down service was just that, "turn down of the bed only". We have stayed at many hotels in NYC and their turn down service also included a "tidy-up" of the bath and room. Other than that I enjoyed the hotel and loved the fact that Century 21 is across the street. I would stay here again but would choose someplace else for a special occasion like a birthday or anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New York for Valentine's weekend and stayed here for 2 nights. Could not believe how quickly the lifts took you to each floor- we were on the 37th floor and our ears popped the lifts were so fast. The room had a fantastic view over Ground Zero. An added advantage was being next door to Century 21 - a must for bargain hunters. Quite a few nice restaurnants close by. Can walk to ferry for Statue of Liberty and also walk to China Town and Little Italy. Staff very friendly and helpful at all times. We ate in restaurant which was very good - they do a great buffet breakfast! Excellent value for money for New York!

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook or underestimate this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dp_visser
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Millenium Hilton. Although a bit apprehensive at first about the location, we were more than happy here. Just about every subway line stopped either in front of or near the hotel (within one block), which meant that Up- and Downtown were just minutes away. We treated ourselved to a junior suite, which was nice as we had a corner overlooking Ground Zero on one side and the Empire State Building on the other! Unfortunately we did not get a room on a very high floor as we arrived a bit late on a holiday weekend in the US, but nonetheless the personnel did their best to accomodate our wishes. Very helpful and friendly, even at 2:00 am when you can't get into your room!!! Only downfall is that the rooms are not completely soundproof, so you will hear the jackhammers at or around Ground Zero. The construction there goes on 24 hrs a day, 365 days a year, so no getting around it! But then again, if you are tired enough you will sleep! As for breakfast, the hotel has its standard buffet breakfast, which we did not go for as down the road to the left of the hotel (next to the Brooks Brothers building) you have a small diner called Panini & Co., where you can have a full breakfast for $ 3 to $ 4. Pretty much all the people we ran into there were from the hotel! Also, if you just want a good cup of coffee, there is a Starbucks next to the hotel plus a baguette shoppe (not all too cheap, but cheaper than the Hilton)! And if you go to Broadway (parallel to Church Street and behind the hotel, you have a myriad of restaurants: TGI Fridays, McDonald's, etc. And all are cheaper than their counterparts in and around Times Square! All-in-all a great stay and we will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for the weekend to celebrate Valentine's and our experience was GREAT. We stayed on the 52nd floor and the view was amazing and very romantic. The staff was very polite and prompt. Although the area is busy during the daytime, when we took a walk in the evening it was very quite and pleasent. The plasma tv was a nice touch and the bed was very comfortable. We were very pleased during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Tracey_Watford
Reviews.Content: Visited this great city 3 - 7 Feb 2005. What a great hotel... excellent base for easy access to all new york boroughs, multiple choice of subway routes right on the door step, made it easy to cover a vast area of new york within several days. Hotel staff are really friendly and helpful, lots of local information provided. Rooms are excellent with breath taking views, the beds are a joy!... believe me you will appreciate these comfy beds after a day in new york.... will definatley be visiting this hotel again. Thank-you Tripadvisor, your site is the best, and most accurate guide around, dont leave home without checking this site first!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay I have ever had in NY!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel ever!! We stayed two nights in December when it was very cold. First off our heat only worked on high! So we had to crack a window to try and regulate the temperature. When we asked about the thermostat controlling the temperature they just replied our rooms are not sound proof! WHAT??? On our last night we scheduled a 5:30 wake up call, but they never called!! I awoke at 6:00, we missed our flight and had to pay 200.00 in fees for missing our airplane!!! There are too many hotels in the city that are nice. Don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and very cool”
Reviews.Author: excentrus
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! A fifty-five story, sleek black 4 star marvel. The absolute best weekend deal in NYC. Go directly to the Hilton website for information on super weekend web-rates. All the employees were friendly and helpful. Check in was really quick....and it was up to the 23rd floor. The MOST comfortable king size bed possible and a 42 inch plasma TV were waiting. I didn't realize it was Martin Luther King weekend (I'm Canadian)....and there were LOTS of tourists. I loved being downtown...away from the crowds. NYC is a fabulous place but there can be too much frenetic energy, and I liked retreating to lower Manhattan. It was very peaceful. All sorts of subway lines are located within a one block radius of the hotel entrance....so NYC is at your doorstep. I think that this hotel is geared towards the business traveller and the prices probably rise dramatically during the week. One word of caution : If a bird's eye view of Ground Zero will bother you...you might want to pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: monicafern
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Hilton in December of 2004. It was the weekend before Christmas and I had a very hard time finding a hotel. The Millenium was great and I found a good deal (for New York) after shopping around on the web. The rooms are spacious (for New York) and modern. I was there for fun, but the hotel would be great for a business traveler. The only down side was that it is so far downtown (across from Ground Zero) that you end up on the subway quite a bit, but it's easy because many lines service this location. If you don't mind having a view of Ground Zero, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “55th Floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShaunTheSheep2
Reviews.Content: I am just back from two night in the Millenium Hilton at the start of January. I had booked a city view room (paid a little extra) and we good a room overlooking ground zero. I had also requested a room as 'high up' as poosible as I have never stayed in a sky scraper. We we checked in (no delays) we found out that we were on the 55th (top) floor!! The room also had a Jacuzzi bath which was a lovely surprise - and great for relaxing in after a long days sight seeing. Staff were OK, but a little bit brisk even though they weren't all that busy. They were not at all helpful when we were trying to arrange transpost back to JFK. We were given one phone number & were told it would cost 70 dollars. Eventually found a company that only charged 42 dollars. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “what's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was Terrific.. stayed friday left sunday... time in between was perfect ... great , spacious bedroom and bathroom .. great huge plasma tv, plenty of space, wonderful views of the city if requested.... only thing is that it got a bit warm in the room... otherwise location is great too as you have several subway lines just steps from your front door or a block away..what could be better? Access to the east or west side subway lines in an instant! A,C, N,R, 4,5,and some others I can't remember anymore!... Was the Perfect choice for comfort and style! You won't regret it...promise!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet memories”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during 22 - 29 November. We arrived around 2.30pm and were checked in and taken to our room. We were on the 39th floor overlooking Ground Zero. This was our first time to New York and we loved our stay here. The room was spacious with a huge 42” plasma screen (not that we had much time to watch it). The bathroom was very clean and fresh towel everyday. We stopped B+B and the concierge was very helpful and friendly. We never encountered any unfriendly staff during our stay. The Buffet was hot and cold choices, for example bacon, eggs, toast, bagels, fruit etc. We thought the hotel was ideally situated, the subway right outside the hotel. Another bonus this hotel was great to get away from all the hustle and bustle to grab some peace and quiet. Loved New York, loved our stay in the Millenium Hilton. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday base”
Reviews.Author: Tricia31
Reviews.Content: Just back from 8 days at this hotel . The staff were excellent as were the rooms . The concierge was very helpful and never phased by our requests . We were a party of twelve and we all felt that this hotel was excellent. Room service was prompt, taxis readily available . Plenty of places to walk to . I have stayed in other hotels but this was my fourth visit and I was gald to see that since 9/11 it had lost none of its charm on reopening

Reviews.Title: “Great Xmas Stay”
Reviews.Author: thechinesecockney
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Dec 26th for 3 nights, they checked us in early which was a bonus. Booked the city view room directly overlooking Ground Zero, for $150 per night from the Hilton website. Room was clean and a good size, especially for NY hotels. 42" plasma tv screen was great and the "Hilton Heavenly Bed" is the most comfortable at any hotel I have stayed at. Very quiet room and ideal for getting away from the busy streets further uptown. Century 21 is right next door for those who are looking for shopping bargains. We had breakfast once at the restaurant, had good choice in the hot and cold buffet, which cost $16 each. However, on the other days we went to the numerous cheap delis and cafes around the hotel, you'll never be short of choice. The tube stops are right on the doorstep, and is only a 10-15 min metro ride to Times Square, very convenient, and only costs $2 for a single trip. Taxi from airport is $45 flat fee (metered in other direction), but suggest you get the metro from/to Howard's Beach ($2) and the AirTran ($5), takes about about 40 mins. Would agree with some of the other reviews that not all the staff are friendly, however would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “had a fantastic time at the Millenium Hilton”
Reviews.Author: wjash
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Millenium Hilton from 18 Dec to 23 Dec, had a fantastic time staying there and had no problems checking in. The room was small but clean, the bathroom had everything you needed and the plasma TV was a bonus. It was great to use the pool every morning and the gym is more than adequate. We didn't eat at the hotel during our stay as we thought it was a little expensive but with the Stage Door Deli around the corner and plenty of small restaurants in the vicinity, especially Yori's Japanese on Fulton Street, we didn't see the point of paying out in the hotel. If you want to stay in NYC but want to be able to return to a quieter area away from the crowds the Millenium Hilton would be perfect for you. the only complaints we'd have would be the staff seem a little cold and disinterested when enquiries were made and we were charged for using the mini bar when we hadn't, they quickly reimbursed us the over payment on check out though. all in all our stay in NYC was near perfect and the Millenium Hilton was a big part of it!

Reviews.Title: “Xmas Treat”
Reviews.Author: SandalsPrincess
Reviews.Content: Hi all Just returned from the Millenium from Sunday 19th - Wednesday 22nd December. Stayed in room 4206 overlooking ground zero. The hotel was amazing and the room was first class we paid extra for the city view and it was well worth it. The bed was so comfortable, the plasma tv was great, the bathroom was spotless. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom. With Sham We never ate at the hotel, but shopped at Century 21 right next door! Bought a Metro Subway card which we used all the time, it was nice to come back to the hotel at night away from all the hussle of the city. We asked the conceige about a transfer back to JFK we said it would cost $72 one way! so we used the underground from fulton street to howard beach and then got the air train, $5 each for the air train, so if we want to save some $$$ use the underground back to JFK. We ate at Buba Gump (from the film Forest Gump), Hard Rock Cafe & Planet Hollywood. We also seen the Knicks at Madisson Square Garden you can book online from ticketmaster. We loved our time in New York, it also snowed on Sunday night which made our trip even more special. Thank you Hilton for making our visit so special. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good..but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: Owen999
Reviews.Content: We were a little dissappointed to say the least. The Hotel itself overlooks 'Ground Zero'. Transport links are superb with the subway on 1 x minutes walk from the hotel. If your booking independently CHECK what your getting for your money. Ask about the special deals or rates which are available. 'Bounceback Rate' was $219+tax per night for 2x adults and 1 x child and included a self-sevice buffet breakfast. If you like your 'breckie' hot I would avoid the buffet. Kids are charged for breakfast depending on who your Waiter is! Hotels is immaculate and has leisure facilities inc. a small pool & sauna. We were lucky and recieved a FREE upgrade on our late arrival to a 'Junior Suite' a saving of $100 for 4 x nights( $400 in total)! Biggest Bed I've ever seen & 42 inch plasma screen TV, seperate living area with fold out double bed with TV mini bar and all the usual you would expect from the Hilton Group. Bathroom was immaculate. Athough I could find nothing to complain about the place felt cold! Staff were curteous but were unable to interact with Guests - I had visions of the 'Stepford Wives???' - Having stayed in other Hotels in the Hilton Group I can say that this Hotel was good - but it should have been GREAT! Can't fault anything but the 'coldness' of the Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 21st and 29th November and find it difficult to be critical. We were checked in immediately as there were no queues (although that may have been because it was a Sunday) and within a few minutes were headed towards our 54th floor room in the fastest lifts I've ever been in. It wasn't the largest hotel room I've ever been in, but it was more than adequate. It's been said in previous reviews, but the bed was very, very comfortable and the views from the floor to ceiling windows (especially at night) across the Hudson river to New Jersey were spectacular. The room itself was very clean with Nuetrogena toiletries being replenished every day, nice fluffy white towels and a fairly decent bath/shower. My only gripe about the room would be the TV. I'm not clear on the logic of having a 42" plasma screen with only an analogue input?!? A fair few of the available channels showed poor reception but, really, who comes to New York to sit in the hotel room and watch TV? The only other thing of note was that the internet access via the TV and wireless keyboard, although a bit of a novelty and not too expensive, wasn't the most complete internet browsing experience. It's based on a bespoke web browser at a very low resolution so not too many websites I visited actually displayed properly (like my web based email!!!) Having read previous reviews I knew to avoid the hotel's restaurant on reasons of cost and try the many local deli's, so I can't comment on the quality of the food. There really are LOADS of places within a couple of blocks radius to pick up food and drink so no need to break the bank in the inhouse restaurant if you don't want to. It's true, the New York subway may not be as intuitive as, say, London's underground but we bought a week long pass (available from the machines in the subway) and used it every day to get from practically outside the hotel door to midtown. If you've never been before, perhaps best to download a subway map before you go and spend 10 minutes or so working out how it all works. We were jumping on and off trains like locals by the time we left! In terms of shopping and attractions in the local vicinity, you're right across the street from Century 21 which, although not really to my taste, certainly has bargains (the missus was able to pick up a Samsonite suitcase cheaper there than it was available in a so called Samsonite discount outlet store). If you're willing to rake through stuff, you'll probably unearth something. About a 5-10 minute walk South and you'll be in Battery Park where you get on the ferry over to the Statue of Liberty (try dodging the vendors offering 'real' rolex watches and 'genuine' LV handbags if you can). J&R is a pretty large computer/gadget shop a couple of blocks North East of the hotel and had some pretty reasonably priced kit. About 7 or 8 blocks West of the hotel at South Street Seaport is what appears to be NYC's only Abercrombie and Fitch store, and very swanky it is too (I spent far too much money in here), with Guess is just over the road and the downtown TCKTS shop just around the corner (speaking of which, try getting there an hour before it opens to be at the head of the queue and best choice of theatre tickets). It's a bit of a trek, but SOHO and NOHO (just head north on Broadway) has some pretty decent shopping too (well, better than the tourist-trap midtown, I reckon). Finally, on checking out (no queues again) there weren't any nasty surprises on the bill, just what I expected (although, again, after reading previous reviews I knew not to fiddle with the contents of the in-room minibar). The concierge, thankfully, was more than happy to look after our luggage for the day while we were out spending our last few hours and last few dollars. A godsend when you have an evening flight home but checkout is at midday. I have absolutely no reservation in recommending this hotel, it's certainly where I'll be staying next time I'm in NYC. PS. Not that it has any relation to the Millenium Hilton, but I'd pre-booked a Super Shuttle van to and from the hotel/airport. The driver taking us to the hotel couldn't have been much more rude, and the driver taking us back to the airport turned up nearly an hour late, literally a few minutes before I was going to abandon hope and just get a taxi rather than risk missing the flight. If my experience is typical, you'll want to avoid this particular outfit.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielvicki
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for our first visit to New York from 26th November until 1st December after having read the reviews posted on this site. We had a room on the 24th Floor overlooking Ground Zero, check-in was hassel free and we were in the room before 3pm, the bed was indeed very comfortable and the plasma screen tv "big", my only complaints with the room are that you could hear toilets and showers being used in the other rooms, and the chairs were not very comfortable. We had breakfast the first morning in the hotel restaurant and I would not advise anyone to do this as there are many cheaper places around the hotel ($46 for two buffet-breakfasts), such as Andrews coffee shop on pearl and john street. The staff were very helpful with the exception of the concierge who on a number of occasions got into the lift before us whilst we were waiting and did not ask which floor we would like. Whilst I agree with other reviewers that this is an excellent hotel I wouldn't reccomend it, as it really is out of the way and whilst there is a subway station opposite, the system is not very "outsider" friendly, such as knowing the direction of the train or the next stop indeed if the train even makes a stop at your required station as the notices advising of the stops are small if non existent. Nonetheless anyone spending a few days in New York would not be dissappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: BSW1958
Reviews.Content: Second visit to NYC this year, second time I have selected a hotel on the basis of the recommendations on this site (Sofitel Hotel being my earlier visit) and the second time I have been very pleased - read the reports, they say it all! The only point of caution is price, I booked through the Hilton website two months ago for $199.00/night for a four night stay, although I noted in some places it was quoted as high as $384.00/night (Plaza prices)! I would also like to offer my praise for this site. Having been introduced to this service twelve months ago I have made several bookings in both US and the UK and the general overview from the reports listed have proven to be pretty accurate and now form the basis of all my hotel selections.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to NYC to propose and so a NICE hotel was in order. We're used to backpackping and staying in hostels or budget hotels but THIS weekend was special. So after reading the stellar reviews here I booked it and crossed my fingers. AND...it was perfect. The room was great. It is just like the pictures they provide. The bed WAS very comfy and the HUGE TV was a big plus. A nice room is #1 on the list for me, then service, location and of course price. This hotel was great in all these areas so I DO recomend it. The view was dominated by ground zero which may be a consideration for some. Kyle Dunlevy

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A pretty good hotel with reasonable service. We stayed in a king sized double on the 11th floor with a view over Ground Zero. The room was fine, though a little small. The room service trolley wouldn't fit past the bed! As for location, it's ok. It's not in the heart of things (e.g. Times Square) but it's an easy subway ride to pretty much anywhere. Century 21 is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hilton,Church Street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton opposite ground zero.On arrival the staff were helpful and friendly.We checked in quickly and the the room was clean and seemed very airy.There was plenty of storage space and a safe in the room which had no charge for usage. The location was near the statue of liberty and ground zero,and right next to century 21 shopping (a shoppers paradise of heavily discounted designer names ). We were quite a distance from midtown and central park but surrounded by subway stations which made reaching them easier.We only stayed 2 nights and did not try the restaurant because we had a list of places to visit and eat at. The concierge was particulary helpful and knowledgeable and gave us helpful information on how to get about and what to see and when. In common with most hotels the mini bar was very expensive so we bought drinks and sweets in the deli just around the corner . Would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day stay at the Millenium Hilton. I agree with all the positive comments posted here. My travelling partner has visited NY 5 times and agreed that this had been the best hotel that she had stayed in. The location was perfect as everything was very accessible either by walking or public transport. We were given a room on the 45th floor which had a great corner view of The Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing to wake to the sun rising over that every day and at night the lights bringing the city to life. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a 2 night stay at the Millenium Hilton and had a great time. The room was clean and large and we had a wonderful view of the Statue of Liberty from our window. The hotel is directly across the street from Ground Zero which is quite a place to see and remember. If this bothers you you probably should make sure before you check in that your room isn't in the front of the hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. The subway station is right across the street and will take you uptown to Times Square,Rockefeller Center,etc.,but make sure that you know exactly which stop you need to get off at or you could get lost easily if you don't live in Manhattan. It may be hard to use the subway if you have very young children(we were with 9 and 12 year olds that complained alot about it!). There is a great deli,Starbucks,and a Dunkin Donuts all within easy walking distance from the hotel which is really nice. We also walked to Battery Park and took the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. We thought the location was a nice retreat for us after long days of walking around in the city and we had no problems with noise at all. If you can get a good rate,this is a great place to stay while visiting NY and I'd give it an A!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, but Overwhelmed staff”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Manhattan, we chose one night at the Millenium Hilton. The room was modern, clean, and roomy (I was concerned given reviews about small hotel rooms in NYC). Bathroom was large, bright, and very clean. We had made reservations for a king bed (the only thing available on the Hilton reservation site), but they let us change to 2 double beds at check in (no extra charge). We had a partial view of Ground Zero. The room was very quiet during the night despite the fact that the hotel was either at or near capacity. When we checked in at 9 AM, we left our bags---the front desk was very quiet and the person behind the desk very helpful. When I returned at 4 PM to actually pick up my keys, it was a different story---with 6 people behind the desk they seemed really overwhelmed and there was a line that seemed to last longer than it should have. Getting someone to help with my bags up to the room seemed impossible, so I took my own stuff up, which was OK, except for the fact that when I got to the room, neither of the two keys that they gave me worked. Called down with the phone in the hall and a security person came right up, confirmed my ID, and gave me a key that did work. I have never had this happen in all my personal and business travel, and I can only attribute it to the overwhelmed front desk. We did not eat at the hotel, but had breakfast at the Stage Door Deli right next door---it was fabulous. There is a Starbucks around the corner too. Besides the front desk, the only thing not so great about this hotel is the location. As my first time to Manhattan, I had no idea as to distances, where things are, etc. Next time I would stay closer to Central Park and the shopping district. Although it was raining when we left, the hotel staff were able to get us a car immediately to the airport at a reasonable price. Despite the check-in issues, I would stay here again if I needed to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very modern, nicely appointed hotel. The room was very spacious with stylish furnishings and comfortable linens. The location is great if you plan to spend time in lower Manhattan with easy access to the World Trade Site and the Statue of Liberty. The hotel was not very close to the trendy restaurants, shops and nightlife in Soho and the Village, which are a long walk or short cab ride away. Joggers will love the access to Battery Park and nice paths along the river. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SDCMaryland
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous! From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally well by the staff. There was no line at check-in and our room was upgraded without even asking. We had a corner room on the 39th floor and the view was amazing. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing with soothing music playing while you swim. Our vacation here was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alboogie415
Reviews.Content: Arrived in NY at 6:30am, check-in wasn't until 3pm, but the front desk was kind enough to let us check in our bags and call us on our cell phones as soon as an available room was ready. The people there were really helpfull, kind and considerate. Even the bell guys helped us find places to go for the meantime until check in. We finally got a call an hour and a half before 3pm, which they gave us the choice on the 21st or 12th floors. The room was kinda small but more than enough room for 2 people. It had an amazing 48" flat screen TV, marble bathroom counter, an executive desk, and views over the late WTC and Hudson River from a far. As stated in most of the other reviews, Ground Zero was across the street of the hotel, Century 21 shopping was on one side, while the oldest church in NY was on the other. During the day, the streets are jam packed with people going to work, or visitors paying their respects to Ground Zero, at night... empty. It was so convenient to have the subway just a couple steps from the hotel to bring you wherever you wanted to go in the city, plus taxi comming around every second to look for passengers. If you got the legs and pretty fit to walk a long distance, you can always walk 5-10 min north to Canal St, Chinatown, shops in broadway, and SoHo's. Another 5-10 min south to battery park to catch a cruise ship to see the statue. Overall, the stay was wonderfull. Ive visited NY 7 times with friends but usually staying close to busy Time Square where most of the other places were equal to run down roach hotels that need renovations. Millenium is the perfect place to stay with your significant other, where its busy during the day, slow and relaxing at night, and convenient for any method of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: caroleherb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a one-day visit with an old friend. Had a delightful time. The room was big with a great view of the city. The staff were pleasant, and they gave us an extra 2 hours in the room when we asked for late checkout. Breakfast in their restaurant was nothing special and pricey. Walking around ground zero was sobering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views/Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton from 30th Sept to 3 Oct for a joint birthday/anniversary do' and we loved it! Our king corner room was on the 53rd floor and we had such fabulous city views, I found myself waking up in the wee hours of the morning just to see the spectacular sunrises. Watching the sleepy city come to life was one of the high points of our trip. The evening views were wonderful as well, with the buildings all sophisticated shimmer. Probably to the shock of a few dedicated office workers, we slept with the curtains wide open, just to revel in the wonderful glittery magic. I often use Trip Advisor and I'm pleased the reviews were spot on. We stayed at the Regency on Park Avenue earlier on our trip and did not like it at all! Overpriced, snooty and the room was dull in comparison. I would have liked a coffee pot, but we had a Starbucks right around the corner. It really is taking over the world! The room was very clean, room service efficient and we enjoyed the plasma television. My husband had a hard time saying his goodbyes. I agree with other reviewers that ground zero was a sobering experience. I was a bit apprehensive before we visited as I wasn't sure what to expect - but people paying their respects seem to bear this in mind and it makes it a lot less of a circus affair and more of a quiet, respectful memorial. Still difficult to take in though... The staff at the hotel were cheerful and helpful. We read about the electronic fridges so didn't even attempt to open it to gaze at the forbidden goodies. There is a giftstore downstairs with (still) expensive and limited snacks, but a lot cheaper than the minibar. Around the corner from the hotel you will find a few shops that sell ciggies, beverages and sweets - stockup for midnight munchies. The hotel has icebuckets and ice for your sodas. We had breakfast only once in the hotel and found it expensive and so-so. There is a Stage deli near the church half a block away, or wander around until you hit a diner type serving breakfast. The area is very rushed during weekdays (especially lunch!) with all the workers milling around. The weekend can be a little bit of a let down with some restaurants only catering to the Mon-Fri crowd, but this is an excellent time to get some shopping done or visit some of the other places on your list like Chinatown. Speaking of shopping - Century 21 is right next door - Their motto is 'New York's best kept secret', but we joked that the secret was out because EVERYONE seems to know about it. We foolishly attempted to shop on Friday at 5:30 PM - we could barely walk through the store. We returned on Sunday afternoon and it was slightly less crowded. South Seaport is a short walk away - a nice surprise and a twist on the usual mall scene with good seafood to be had. It is relaxing just to walk around and look at the boats and water with benches for you to gaze and take in the tranquility. Greenwich, Soho etc/ all a subway away for more trendy shopping - and Times Square is dead easy to get to for more hectic fun. From our hotel window we could see the Statue of Liberty and the fabulous Brooklyn Bridge. We enjoyed Ellis island and the boat ride provided some good photo opportunities. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gave away our room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked room through priceline for a weekend of sightseeing and shopping with family from out of town. The rates were reasonable, around $175.00/ night (non-holiday weekend), but was dissappointed to find that they do not have any double occupancy rooms. We were forced to reserve 3 rooms to accomodate everyone. The rooms are decently-sized and clean. Each room has a large flat screen tv and a king sized bed. The location is excellent, very close to canal street (Chinatown, Little Italy) and directly across the street from the World Trade Center/ Ground Zero. We had a dead on view of what used to be a modern marvel; 2 110-story office buildings which were cities within themselves. I spent a lot of time staring out the window reflecting on 9-11, it was a humbling experience. Ok, here are my biggest gripes with this hotel: 1) There is NO lobby, and the small foyer in which you check in and out is so crowded and you will be waiting a while so I would suggest you stay somewhere else if you are at all claustrophobic. Also, this means there is no where to sit and relax or hang out. 2) The breakfast buffet. The bill was over $80 for 4 of us to eat at the buffet at the hotel's restaurant Church & Dey. The buffet was small, poorly stocked and WAY over-priced. There was hardly any food left when we ate at 10:00 a.m. on Sunday. 3) The parking staff is hurrendous. We called ahead as they advised us to in order to avoid a wait. We packed and made our way down to the garage 45 minutes later to get our car only to wait another 45 minutes. No one would even look at us or ask us if we were being helped and finally after 25 minutes the attendant asked for our voucher. It was only then that he told us we had to have the voucher validated at the front desk first. We had to go back to the front desk and wait on the long line of guests checking out to get the stamp. Mind you, we had already waited on the line to check out, so I was very irritated to have to do it again. The parking staff was rude and unapologetic. 5) Examine your final bill carefully, they charged us for items in the minibar that were not taken. Seems they will charge you if you move an item to a different spot in the fridge even if it's unopened. 6) Last but not least, we had reserved 3 rooms, however the third room would not be occupied until the second night. We realized this glitch in our schedule too late to change our reservations so we decided to check all 3 rooms in upon arrival and leave the 3rd empty for the 1st night. We asked them to hold the keys at the front desk for our 3rd party until their arrival. All 3 rooms were to be adjacent to eachother on the same floor. When it came time for our 3rd party to get their key, the front desk informed us that they had given the room away. The room we had ALREADY PAID FOR! Turns out they, LUCKILY, had ONE room unoccupied that night due to an early check-out. We had no other choice, so we took the room which was on another floor. The front desk staff handled this situation terribly. They never apologized or seemed to realize what an inconvenience they had caused us. Had there been no more rooms in the hotel, what would we have done? PLUS this room was already paid for AND checked in! How could they have given it away? Bottom line, I wouldn't stay there again. Got a room at the Waldorf for $200 on Priceline for a holiday weekend and it was well worth the extra $25!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome views”
Reviews.Author: Neillos
Reviews.Content: We stayed Fri and Sat nights on a 45th floor room. The hotel is across the street from the WTC site, so we had a lot to think about. Aside from ground zero, we had beautiful views of the city and the Hudson, and could even see mountains/hills in the distance. We got a deeply discounted rate by paying in advance (non-refundable). The hotel is across from the PATH train station to New Jersey, so this is a great location if you are coming in from Newark Airport. There are subway stations all over the place, so you can go anywhere from here, but be advised that the downtown area itself is pretty dead on the weekends. Many restaurants actually close up Sat and Sun, but you can take the subway to where you want. Chinatown is a moderate walk. For discounted theater tickets, the TKTS booth is nearby. (They have another booth in the Times Square area, but it has longer lines.) Of course, you can also walk down Wall St. or take a boat over to the Statue of Liberty, and I really enjoyed the South Street Seaport. The rooms are very nicely furnished, although a bit smallish. The plasma screen TVs are obscene overkill - who is going to sit around watching TV in NYC? The staff was courteous and helpful. I was disappointed that there wasn't a coffee machine in the room - I've gotten used to that as standard feature. There is coffee off the lobby for $1.75+ a cup. The way my wife guzzles, this can get a bit pricy. Oh yeah, don't touch anything in the mini-bar. It's computerized, so when I took something out to put my own soda in the fridge, it automatically registed as a change of $4.85 per soda. (Do some people really get that thirsty??) I had $30 of charges on my bill. They were nice about it and took them off, but it did take about 20 extra minutes at check out. I learned that this is not a fridge, it's a booby trap. Aside from that gripe, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building & rooms, spotless, wonderful view, friendly & helpful staff and a great location. Oh! Those down & feather pillows and the plama tv's! You almost want to just stay in your room! Can't wait to visit the Millenium Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for the US Open and was very happy with the service I received. Although I had a few glitches with the bill, (being charged for the mini-bar that I never used) the front desk was extremely helpful and attentive. As was the concierge with tips on where to go for dinner, etc. One note though, the walls between the rooms are a tad thin and I was awakened at 3am by a couple arguing quite loudley. Otherwise great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at the Millenium Hilton and I recommed it for both business travelers and for tourists. The hotel is across the street from the World Trade Center site, so that fact may deter or disturb some visitors, but I found it okay and even visited the memorial more than once. Also, the hotel is within easy walking distance to the Financial District, Battery Park and the waterfront so if you want to see some of NYC while on business, the location helps. I found the hotel staff helpful. The standard room was nice with high speed internet access and a great flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and well-appointed. Food from room service was quite good, and the bill was not cluttered with padded fees and charges. Overall, in a city of hundreds of hotels this one would not be a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend value in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Millenium twice. It's just our favorite hotel in NYC. The weekend rate of about 135USD/night is outstanding. I find the reception staff efficient and friendly. A big smile and a polite request scored us a suite! It was simply beautiful! The furnitures were sleek and of high quality. The towels and bathrobes were great. The toileteries were average. I had my best sleep in NYC on the Hilton Millenium bed. The location is great. It's just above a subway station. It's my personal NYC hotel of choice for a weekend. I understand during the week, the rate goes up quite a bit due to its proximity to Wall st. I hope you enjoy the hotel as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The location is convenient to just about anything you'd want to do in mid-town and Lower Manhattan. The lobby is well appointed making for a nice place to have a cocktail in the adjoining bar. The elevators are very fast and accessible (important since our room was on the 49th floor). The room was nice (bed EXTREMELY comfortable) with an awe-inspiriting view of Ground Zero. The ONLY criticism would be the concierge. She was friendly and helpful the first night of our stay, then a bit dismissive the second. Oh well, I would love to stay there again and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Dhmoon1
Reviews.Content: For what we paid, I was very pleased with the hotel. There were some minor things that could be improved upon, but overall, I felt like I got a great deal. One thing that bothered me was the way the bellman snap counted the bills when he was tipped and basically asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cHIRON
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed here twice. The hotel represents good value for NYC and has an excellent health centre and pool. Other public areas are also impressive. Its location is spot on for sightseeing and accessing the subway. Rooms are average in size yet well appointed and are spotlessly clean. A solid choice!

Reviews.Title: “can't rave enough”
Reviews.Author: MrDobelina
Reviews.Content: For a hundred bucks (Priceline) I got a large super-appointed room on the 47th floor with a spectacular view, plasma tv, gorgeous linens, lush bathroom, tasteful modern sleek furniture. I couldn't believe it. It's next door to fashion bargain heaven, Century 21, and because they don't let you try anything on, you can do so back at your room and return accordingly. Staff was very freindly knowledgable and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: jad376
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favorites in New York! I rate it above the Ritz-Carlton, W hotels, Tribeca Grand, and other 4- and 5-stars I've frequented. Our most recent stay was on a whim at the end of June; we were going into the city to see one of the Fahrenheit premieres, and decided to stay over because we love New York so much. Our cityview king room on the 51st floor had a breathtaking view of the Hudson River, ground zero, and to the north, the West Village and the Midtown skyline. When you reserve, make sure to request a room above the 45th floor. You will be above it all - especially if you stay before they construct the new world trade center. I sincerely recommend the King Corner rooms - when they're available, they're my favorite hotel rooms in New York, save for, maybe, the suites at The Donald's place... :) The bed was awesome...not quite a Heavenly Bed, but we slept wonderfully. The best features of the room always are the huge plasma screen TV with web access, and the big, comfy ergonomic leather chair at the desk. Room service was surprisingly good for the Hilton, but if you must eat their food, go downstairs to the Church & Dey dining room and have a proper dinner. For breakfast, there's a starbucks right next door and around the corner on Dey street. This hotel is convenient to the Tribeca/Soho party scene; the Tribeca Grand hotel is directly up Church st.. We enjoyed being in close proximity to the World Financial Center shops and the very cool Irish Hunger Memorial (located on the river across the street from ground zero), which we were able to see from our room. Now, about the staff. I've read people's complaints about rude or short employees that did not come off as overtly friendly...well...the truth of the matter is, the Millenium Hilton is a very large hotel, and the staff does seem rather stressed at times. However, if you take it all with a grain of salt and don't expect to be treated like absolute royalty (that's what $500/night places uptown are expected to be for), you will see that they're just simple hard working folks in the hotel business who are trying to run a first class operation. Oh - I almost forgot. The health club and indoor pool are fantastic, especially very early in the morning when they're empty. They also have a business center where you can print documents from the internet. If you can score a rate of under $199 per night, you'll love this hotel even more. Hilton, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in May with a friend and we loved the hotel. It was very modern looking. The hospitality desk was excellent, great service. We had a view of ground zero from our room. The subway was located directly across from the hotel, which was very convient. Also, right next door was Century 21 department store, which was outstanding. Great deals for those who love to shop! The hotel was clean, bed was comfortable, bathrooms were clean and had a beautiful sink. Room service was good. I am eagerly anticipating a return stay in New York and would definitky stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorta average”
Reviews.Author: manoftroy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days - June 25-27 - and had high expectations based on the reviews. Our first impression was not particularly good. We arrived very late into the evening around midnight due to massive airline delays. Upon hitting the hotel's front desk, there was no one to be found. The bellman had to go search for the front desk clerk who finally arrived after about 5 minutes. No apology (yet no attitude either). While waiting, we picked up a strong odor of insecticide throughout the lobby and when we inquired we were notified the hotel just got sprayed - mmm yummy! Anyway, checked into the room which was decorated nicely tho a bit small but hey it's NYC. Next, wanted to check out the piece of equipment that brought me here in the first place...the plasma. Big dissapointment. Not hi-def and in fact, most programs had horrible reception. Other points to note, bathroom very nicely done. We asked for but didn't get a corner room b/c the hotel was sold out for the weekend. We did get the requested city (non-WTC) view. Would I stay here again? Probably given the decent rates but would temper my expectations a tad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view from our room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for one night on July 4th. Our room overlooked the world trade center site. The corner stone was just delivered when we got there. Very touching view. Had a king size bed with the plasma tv. Very quiet room. Not one bit of noise all night. Saw Macy's fireworks at South Street Seaport, just spectacular! Short walk from our hotel. The heated pool was great! Restaurant a bit pricey for breakfast. We both just had a memorable great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: catmint
Reviews.Content: We chose the Millenium Hilton after having seen it from the outside on a previous visit to New York - it is in our favourite part of the city and the sleek black tower looked impressive. As we were going back for our New York wedding and honeymoon we wanted everything to be just right. I was worried by some of the previous reviews which I had read before I left for New York. Well, I returned from New York yesterday and can honestly say that our stay in the Millenium Hilton was perfect. Other people have reported check in problems. We arrived early (2.10) and they checked us right in without a problem. The girl on the desk was efficient and when I asked if we could have a high floor for the view she allocated us a room on floor 52 which was a dream come true as this hotel has some of the best views in town. The bellhop was friendly and also efficient, escorting us to our room with our luggage. The elevators are amazingly quick and each floor only has eleven rooms (or thereabouts) which reduces noise and traffic in the corridors and means you don't have far to go to reach the elevator. The area outside the elevators on each floor is carpeted, so no footsteps while you are trying to sleep, and has a huge window with views to the rear of the hotel (i.e. the other side to the view from your room) - including the Brooklyn Bridge and the Woolworth building, and City Hall. Whatever floor you are on, you can travel to a high floor to see this. The room is a fair size for a New York room, with a wonderfully comfortable bed, tasteful furnishings and of course that plasma TV. You also get a desk with a reclining leather chair, and comfortable fabric covered chair, a small drinks table (plus glasses and an ice bucket of course), and more storage space than is usual in city hotels. Monday to Friday you get a newspaper at your door. The safe is easy to use and a handy feature. The bathroom is the best hotel bathroom I have seen, spacious and spotless. In fact everything is perfectly clean, and housekeeping are very thorough when they visit each day and also polite and friendly if you happen to meet them. Towels and bedlinen are all spotless and look new. The Neutrogena toiletries are a welcome touch and these are replenished if you use them so there is more than enough for your stay. And I haven't even told you about the best bit yet - the view! Yes, it is dominated by the World Trade Centre crater, but the work there now is preparing for rebuilding rather than tearing down (though one building remains to be dismantled).
