The World Financial Centre is opposite, and the Hudson river beyond where you can see some spectacular sunsets. Words can't do justice to the sight you see each time you draw back the curtains on the floor to ceiling windows but for us it was the highlight of our stay in New York. Each time we returned to our room it was a pleasure to be in this clean, comfortable, cool haven after the busy city streets, and to relax by the window and watch the hustle and bustle below was the best bit of all. The only thing that didn't work was the Interactive check out through the TV but we had nothing to pay on our account (no rogue charges at all, thankfully) and it took only a couple of seconds at the desk to check out. Our luggage was stored free of charge for us to collect later in the day, which took only minutes though they told us to allow 15min. I know where we'll be staying next time we return to New York City... in fact I wonder if they have rooms free for our first wedding anniversary?!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and excellent Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first I was hesitant to stay so far Downtown, away from where all the action is, but half a block away you have subway station, Train"R"-that takes you anywhere you want to go. This is definetally a palce to stay if you want to get away from the noise and hussle of the city when it's time to retire. Being right across the street from ground zero, the msot people you see at night are the curious tourits. The only negative feature of this hotel is that at night most of the restaurants in the area, other than the one at the hotel itself, are closed. The rooms were excellent with a plasma television in the room and a daily newspaper at your door every morning. Will definetally return

Reviews.Title: “good hotel...but noisy elevators !”
Reviews.Author: luxmon
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in June. Rooms are OK, with very nice flat screen Televisions. Swimming pool and business center were great with friendly and helpfull staff. Could also not complain about the quality of breakfast. But the worst is the noise of the elevators. I you wish to stay there, do not forget to ask for a room FAR AWAY from the elevators. I will not come back to the Millenium just because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Ah-Jeung
Reviews.Content: Chosen as a weekend getaway 'downtown' - building looks great - clean and functional. 30 mins wait to check in mostly because there were only 2 Receptionists. Room was on-par for US$179 a night - love the plasma TV in the room - clean lines and neutrogena amenities in the bathroom. Charged for mini-bar items that weren't touched..(someone checked it whilst we were out at 1030pm?!) One of the few hotels in NYC to have a pool - basic gym. Basically a nice little change of scenery from 'uptown'.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems along the way....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights. property is not too bad, stayed in the room with squeaky pipes. not a pleasant thing to be woken up at 6 AM to the sound of pipes squealing cause someone above us was taking a hot shower. they also overcharged us (basically charged us twice - once on my husband's charge card, and for the same stay on mine and then denied it.) Very annoying. We Won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Stewartytosh
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay & would certainly recommend it. Only complaint was my bill - overcharged by $800 for a 5 night stay, but this was rectified very promptly. Rooms are lovely but not tea/coffee making facilities in rooms facing ground zero.

Reviews.Title: “Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a college student and myself and a friend stayed at this Hilton from May 27-31. I pre-paid a "net direct" rate of $169.00 per night for a double non-smoking room prior to my stay. (CHEAP for downtown NYC) We arrived at the hotel on the 27th at about 11 AM. I attempted to check in and was told that check in was 3:30 PM. Not a problem....they took my bags and told me that they would call my cell phone when the room was ready. I spent the rest of the day exploring. They never called my cell phone, and when I returned at about 6 PM I was told that there were no more double rooms left. To compensate, we were upgraded to a king suite. That was quite nice although there was only one real bed, and a sofa bed. The room, however more than made up for this inconvenience. It had amazing views and great amenities. The front desk staff at this hotel can be very slow and not helpful. Make sure that, prior to your stay, you call and check all of the details of your stay. If you are staying in a room that is being paid for by someone other than yourself and that person is not staying in the room, BE SURE to request a credit card authorization form. Without it, you may not stay in the room. The only other gripe that I have is that the sauna was wayyyyyy too small. You could only fit 2 people in it. It also wasn’t hot enough. The pool was really nice, but unfortunately there was no Jacuzzi hot tub. Now for the good…. The concierge was EXTREMELY helpful. They have tons of great ideas about where to go to eat, what to see, and how to get around. The elevators were SOOO fast. There was a really nice workout room. The bellhops are really friendly and helpful. The rooms were incredibly clean, and offer unparalleled views of ground zero and the city. This hotel is really nice. I had a wonderful stay. The hotel itself is incredible, the staff is sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Millenium Hilton after reading numerous favorable reviews. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was efficient and friendly from arrival to departure. Our King/NS room (53rd floor) was very clean and well appointed and exactly what we reserved. We were able to view the Brooklyn Bridge and Statue of Liberty. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and ordered from room service (very fast service). The lobby bar was a nice place to relax in the evening and watch TV. My only criticism was that the elevators could be heard from our corner room. Though not loud enough to move to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, and got the rate through Priceline. The reservation was perfect, non-smoking with King size bed. The room was in excellent condition, very confortable bed, and VERY clean. Everything seemed new. Awesome view (but sad to see Ground zero). I have stayed in several 4-5 star New York hotels and this is one of the best so far. Yes, it is far south, but we would be taking the subway anyway, since we like to see many things in NY, so it doesn't bother us a bit. The service of this hotel was excellent from doormen, luggage guys, etc.. Our only complaint was that at the time of getting our car back from the vaket parking, we waited about 45 minutes (we were told to wait about 25 minutes); when we asked about our car, we were told that it was right next door's parking lot, and it only took then 5 minutes to find/bring the car, so they could have done this the first time we asked for the car.

Reviews.Title: “probably the best value in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay here and am in love with this hotel. Where else in NY can one get such a super view (43rd floor) and really amazingly comfortable bed for under $140 for a night. The rooms are modern and tasteful with marble bathrooms (shower is not too powerful though). Location is fine if one is a fan of local transport (we are), otherwise it could get very expensive by cab. It is however a haven to return to in the evening after the hust´le and bustle of Midtown. Room service is surprisingly affordable with a comprehensive menu and very quick service. Breakfast is pricey however Starbucks is just around the corner and there are also plenty of deli's in the area. I highly recommend this hotel and know where I will be staying on my next visit to NY.
